title: 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed Convertible
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is a nicely optioned example with just under 100k from new and a clean Carfax report. The drivetrain is stock with a number of recent service items addressed and no deferred maintenance. Blue Topaz Metallic paint over gray leather has been nicely maintained, and the car benefits from new brakes, new engine belts, and more detailed below. The seller says this does not look like a 13-year-old BMW, and the photo gallery below showcases the condition well. It is factory equipped with a 6-speed manual, cold weather package, bi-xenon headlights, and Harmon Kardon sound. Good colors, manual gearbox, and recent maintenance make this an attractive E46 M3.

Topaz Blue paint is an attractive color and the body is all original and in excellent condition. The seller says there are not dents and minimal dings, mostly small paint chips as expected on the front spoiler.  The black canvas roof still looks new and the previous owner installed CSL carbon fiber front splitters. Stock 18″ wheels are uncurbed with a clean factory finish and the rears wear new Bridgestone Potenza tires. Headlamp lenses are clear with no clouding.

Dove grey leather is surprisingly clean for the mileage considering that this lighter interior tends to discolor with age. The seats have no tears tight bolsters. The original carpets, dashboard, and trim are in very good condition, and the optional cold weather package with heated seats is nice to have with the top down. Factory accessory M3 floor mats are a fine addition, and sale includes one original key and a newly programmed key from the dealer.

Underhood, the S54 3.2L straight six is unmodified apart from a K&N intake and looks very clean. This is a fantastic powertrain with 333 horsepower and an 8,000 rpm redline. The car has recently benefitted from new brakes, new idle control valve, new belts, and new battery, and the car was serviced last year with full synthetic oil. The onboard computer says the next oil change is due in 10k miles.

The car was purchased out of South Carolina and has been with the seller in Ohio for two years, always garaged in the winter months. The E46 M3 design has aged well and this car appears well preserved for a weekend or daily driver. Prior to the sellers’ purchase he obtained a Carfax and PPI which are both viewable below.

title: 45K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a well-maintained E46 that features an uncommon Imola Red over Imola Red color combo. The car is unmodified and has 45,534 miles from new. The 3.2 liter inline six is said to run strong and has recently received a $3k-service which entailed a newly rebuilt Vanos system as well as new fluids. The car appears clean overall and records from the original BMW dealer in CA show regular service intervals every 7k-10k miles. The seller has provided a recent PPI and the car carries a clean Carfax, clean Autocheck, and clean California title.

Original paint presents well and appears glossy, though the seller reports some crazing on the right side of the rear bumper. The clear coat is starting to peel on the driver’s side roof molding. Exterior rubber appears to be in good condition, aside from passenger side rear window trim, which shows some cracking from UV damage.

The body is appears straight, and no history of accidents or repair work are noted in the provided Carfax. The rear subframe has been inspected by Redline BMW and it is crack-free. There is a small indentation on the lower right of the front bumper. The chrome grille surround and black trim appear to be in good shape.

Stock 19″ alloys are in good condition, with some minor curb rash evident on three of the wheels. The seller notes that although the front tires have a decent amount of tread left, the back tires will need replacement soon.
The interior remains stock and retains its original stereo system. The seller says the brake pad light is on, but all other gauges, lights, and power accessories are functioning properly.

The Imola Red leather upholstery looks great with contrasting black and aluminum trim. The seats are in good condition and show normal wear on the side bolsters. The carpets and floormats look clean, and rear seats appear hardly used.
The 3.2 liter S54 is matched to a 6-speed Getrag transmission, with output numbers advertised at 333 bhp and 262 lb·ft when new.

The car was purchased in California by the seller and was brought to Fort Lauderdale, FL in April. After arrival it received a PPI and a $3,000 service by Redline BMW in Pompano Beach, FL. The Vanos variable valve timing system was completely rebuilt with Beisan systems components, and the engine, transmission, and differential fluids were flushed and replenished.

The original tool kit is complete with a bumper tow hook not pictured above. The seller has the receipts for the recent service, as well as records from the BMW dealership in CA that show service intervals every 7-10,000 miles.
A video of a walk around and test drive is below:

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 SMG
interior_color: Jet Black Over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 has 98k miles and is finished in Titan Silver Metallic over Jet Black leather. The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed Sequential Manual Gearbox (SMG) and is equipped with a VF570 Supercharger Kit. This E46 coupe was well optioned from the factory, and the seller reports $28k in upgrades have been installed over the last 8 years, including a CSL diffuser, Angel Eyes headlights, Borla exhaust, adjustable Koni shocks, upgraded sound, and 18″ wheels with performance tires. This M3 has been with the seller for 2 years and 6k miles, and is described as garage-kept with no mechanical issues. The car is offered with extensive service records, a clean Carfax, and clean Pennsylvania title.

The Titan Silver Metallic (354) paint shows well, with no obvious dings or dents even to the exposed CSL Carbon Fiber diffuser and Predator Chromium CCFL Angel Eyes headlights. Body panels appear straight, and shut lines are tight.
The front bumper was replaced and the front end repainted in 2008 to remedy the results of a gravel spray experienced by a prior owner.

The Jet Black interior (N5SW) surfaces show well, without significant visible marks or cracks. The seats show light wear to side bolsters, typical creasing, and some dimpling to seating surfaces. Interior upgrades include a Kleinn Model HK1 air horn, LeatherZ Alacantra shift and e-brake boots, and a ZHP weighted short-shift knob with BMW M logo fitted to the SMG selector.

Factory options include the Cold Weather package and power moonroof. The seller reports all lighting, controls, and accessories are functioning as intended, while sound has been uprated with JL Audio 8″ Sub Stealth Boxes and a DICE MediaBridge with Bluetooth, smartphone, USB, and satellite radio connectivity.
An aftermarket PLX OBD2 multi-gauge has been added to help monitor the supercharged S54.

Stock wheels were replaced in 2013 with Apex ARC-8 Hypersilver 18×9.5″ items using an APEX 75mm stud conversion kit. The wheels remain clean and unmarked, and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires also added in 2013. The seller reports services in 2016 included a brake fluid flush and replacement of rotors/pads all around.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six has been fitted with a VF570 Supercharger as seen above. The seller reports power measurements taken using a VBOX showed a 9.09 second 60-130 mph time, which is reportedly 4 seconds faster than a stock M3 Coupe. Other modifications include a HFP 255LPH fuel pump and an Elite Engineering oil catch can. In 2015, the stock connecting rod bearings were replaced with a WPC-treated items and ARP rod bolts were added. A new oil pump, motor mounts, and O2 sensors are installed at the same time. This M3 is described as having no current mechanical issues, and 2016 work included replacement of the oil level and pressure sensors, transmission/differential fluid changes, and an engine oil/filer change. The battery was replaced in 2013.

In 2008 this M3 suffered a cracked rear sub-frame, which was replaced under warranty by BMW NA. Repairs included replacement of the entire rear-end with an upgraded/reinforced sub-frame at a cost of ~$12k. This work is documented in a 10-page service report shown in the photo gallery below. In 2014 the rear differential was replaced with a rebuilt unit sourced from Turner Motorsport.

Photos show the undercarriage show newer components and boots throughout. Suspension upgrades include Rogue Engineering RTAB reinforcement shims/limiters and rear shock mounts, adjustable Koni Sport shocks, and an Eibach Pro-Plus sway bar/spring suspension kit. Exhaust improvements include Agency Power V2 headers and section 1 resonated pipe, a Status Gruppe tuning resonated section 2 X-pipe, and a Borla Sport Exhaust.
The car is offered with extensive service records from new, including 10-pages covering the 2008 in-warranty rear sub-frame replacement. Also included are a clean Carfax and clean Pennsylvania title.

title: 2005 BMW M3 6-Speed Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe has 105k miles from new and is a lightly modified example equipped with the factory Competition Package and a 6-speed manual transmission. The car is finished in Interlagos Blue over a black leather interior and was acquired by the seller more than two years ago. The 3.2L S54 inline-six is stock, though the car has been modified with a carbon fiber intake, short shift kit, Ground Control/Koni coilovers, and an aftermarket stereo with navigation. Within the past 5k miles, the car received a full preventative cooling system overhaul and Inspection 2, which included fresh oil, filters, spark plugs, valve adjustment, valve cover gasket, rear differential oil, and gearbox oil, in addition to standard service safety checks. It is sold with a clean Autocheck report and a clear Oregon title in the seller’s name.

The desirable M3 Competition package was a $4,000 option offering both performance and cosmetic upgrades from the standard M3, including 19″ BBS spin-cast alloy wheels, CSL Steering rack featuring a more direct steering ratio, upgraded brakes with painted black calipers, as well as the exclusive color option of Interlagos blue.

The finish appears deep and glossy in photographs with the exception of the front air dam, which received a poor quality repaint from a previous owner. The seller suspects this to be the only non-original on the vehicle, and has also included photos of numerous rock chips, paint peel at the headlight, and lower edge damage. The remainder of the paint and bodywork present well, and panels are believed factory. Minor cosmetic scratches and chips are limited to the back bumper, trunk, rear passenger quarter panel, and hood.

Upgraded OEM 19″ BBS wheels were powder coated in anthracite gray by a previous owner and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sports. Included with the car is an extra set of Apex Arc-8 18″ x 10″ wheels and Dunlop Direzza Z2 tires that have seen three track days.

The interior appears well kept and features Comp Pack upgrades including an Alcantara steering wheel cover with colored stitching and aluminum trim. Upholstery, headliner, and carpets show minimal wear for mileage, and both seats are fully functional with minor scratches and fading on their bolsters. The seller notes that there is an area of minor denting on the aluminum trim above the glove box.

All instruments, gauges, lights, and power accessories are said to function as intended, and the air conditioning reportedly blows cold. A Dynanav stereo/navigation system was installed by the previous owner with steering wheel controls integrated for hands free operation. The Competition Package “M-Track” mode is still operational via windshield wiper stalk end button. All factory trim steering wheel pieces are included to return the steering to factory setup.

The 3.2L S54 is paired to a 6-speed Getrag transmission and was advertised as making of 333 horsepower and 262 lb. ft. of torque when new. A Gruppe M Carbon Fiber Intake and short shift kit from ECS tuning have been added. The steering, brakes, engine, clutch, and transmission are all said to be functioning well.

Other performance upgrades include Ground Control/Koni coilover suspension with camber plates and SS DOT brake lines. The wheel wells and undercarriage look to be in good condition and photos can be seen in the gallery. The seller states that there is no rust and that the rear subframe has been inspected for weak points.

Records are limited from previous owners, though the seller maintains a detailed service folder. The Autocheck report shows no accidents, and all airbag recalls have been completed. Over 120 detailed photos are viewable below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Coupe has 53k miles and is a two-owner car powered by a 3.2 liter inline-six paired to a sequential manual gearbox. The original owner was in the military, and as such the car spent quite a lot of time in storage, contributing to the low mileage. This unmodified example has been with the seller for six years and around 22k miles. It is sold with service records back to new, original window sticker, car cover, a clean Carfax, and clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver Metallic paint is believed to be all original, and both the Carfax and the seller note no past accidents. The factory staggered-width 18″ wheels are fitted with Bridgestone S-04 Pole Position tires mounted in October of last year. The original owner had the door seals replaced in 2006 and a 1/2″ crack is present in the windshield near the wipers, though per the seller it has not worsened in more than a year.

The unmodified interior is optioned with Black Leather, Glass Moonroof, Power front Seats, and a Harman-Kardan Sound System with AUX input. All of the interior features work as they should, including the automatic climate control and cold A/C.
Light wear is present on the leather upholstery, primarily on the driver’s seat. The rear seat and carpets appear to be have held up quite well.

The 3.2 liter inline-six produced 333 horsepower when new and features individual throttle bodies. The hose from the SMG reservoir to the pump was replaced in 2013, and the SMG controller was reprogrammed in 2004 as part of a recall. The service record indicates that both owners changed the oil more regularly than BMW’s recommended 15k mile interval.

Service records are included back to new and the seller has attached a useful summary of the services that can be viewed in the gallery. The original books, manuals, and a BMW car cover are all included, and the window sticker shows a total suggested retail price of $56,190.

The Carfax shows no accidents or reports of damage, though a pair of open recalls are noted for the airbags. The seller’s local dealer is currently out of the parts to deal with the recall, though he is in line for a new shipment in the new year.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Rod Bearing and Airbag Recalls Completed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 has 67k miles and is an unmodified example finished in Laguna Seca Blue. The car is powered by a 3.2 liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission and is optioned with Cold Weather and Luxury Packages. Sold new in Houston, the car saw 14 years of single-owner service before moving to New England, where it was purchased by its third owner after this BaT auction in 2015. It has been driven approximately 14k miles in the ensuing 14 months and a comprehensive inspection and service were commissioned in May 2016 with the results included below. Dealer service receipts indicate regular maintenance as well as completion of recalls for rod bearings and Takata airbags, and the sale includes a clean Carfax and a clear Rhode Island title.

Laguna Seca Blue paint retains an even gloss with occasional light swirls, and few finish flaws are visible in photos aside from occasional stone chips in the nose and a small dent near the driver’s door handle as detailed in the gallery below. Remaining garaged since arriving in New England in 2015, the car has reportedly never seen snow or salt and is said to be free of exterior rust. Factory 18″ satin chrome wheels show varying levels of curb rash and wear Toyo Proxes rubber installed at 56k miles with plenty of remaining tread.

Plastic cladding looks free of distortion, though a small area of touched-up cracking is visible on the rear bumper cover along with scuffs on the underside of the front valance. Optional xenon headlights are equipped with washers and show minimal haze or pitting, and both fog lights were replaced in 2015 but are missing their plastic trim rings. Heated mirrors, washer jets, and door locks are standard items, while an optional glass moonroof and rain-sensing wipers are part of the Luxury Package. All accessories were verified in good condition during the 2016 inspection.

Powered heated Nappa leather front seats feature adjustable-width backrests with wear limited to the bolsters on the driver’s side. Carpets look plush and largely clean under protective mats. Both door panels are free of deformation and the textured dash looks straight and clean, while other plastics show areas of marking and typical fabric separation is present on several pillar trims. The multi-function thumbgrip wheel shows little evidence of use, though peeling is visible on the shift knob.

Switchgear is brightly lettered, while instrumentation includes an odometer showing just under 67k miles and digital displays look free of dead pixels. An optional Harman Kardon sound system includes a six-CD changer and all interior functions were noted as working during the 2016 inspection. Several diagnostic trouble codes were also noted and cleared as described in the invoice below. Common gel failure is visible in the auto-darkening rearview mirror though it does not leak, and the oil level light occasionally illuminates despite being full.

Power is from a stock 3.2 liter S54 straight six with Double VANOS valve timing that was good for 333 horsepower when new. A comprehensive inspection was performed 10k miles ago in May 2016 by Hans Imports of Rhode Island and included in-depth assessment of the drivetrain, braking, and suspension systems as noted in the gallery below. Oil passage expansion plugs were also replaced to alleviate a leak, and a synthetic oil change was performed along with installation of a new air filter and cleaning of the engine bay. A new water pump was installed in 2015 and spark plugs, fuel filter and PCV are due soon according to the inspection report.

The 6-speed manual transmission feeds power rearward to a variable locking differential, and dynamic brake and stability control are also equipped. An earlier inspection noted none of the rear subframe issues common to the model and the underside looks free of notable damage in photos, while superficial corrosion appears limited to the stock exhaust system. Slight residual seepage is described from the transmission bell housing.

Dealer service history is included from new and shows that a rod bearing recall was performed in October of 2004 along with a Takata airbag recall in September 2015. The car also comes with a detailed report from the 2016 inspection as well as original manuals and keys, six quarts of Castrol synthetic oil, and an original window sticker showing a total MSRP of just under $53k.

title: 24K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 has just over 24k miles and is an unmodified California car powered by a 3.2 liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Finished in silver over black, this example was recently acquired by the seller from the original owner. It has been used as an occasional driver throughout its life and has reportedly benefited from regular dealer maintenance as well as completed recalls for engine bearings and its passenger-side Takata airbag. A dealer-performed Inspection II was performed in August 2016, and the car is sold with a clean Carfax report along with a clear California title in the seller’s name.

Titan Silver paint retains a smooth gloss with few finish flaws visible in photos aside from occasional light marks, scuffs on the lower front valance, and road grime aft of the rear wheel wells. Sheet metal looks straight other than a small ding in the roof pictured in the gallery below. Crisp lines and even panel gaps are on display throughout, and no accidents are indicated in the Carfax report.

Plastic cladding looks free of cracks or distortion. Some curbing is visible on each of the factory 18″ wheels along with light oxidation of their satin chrome finish. Bridgestone RE760 Sport rubber is from 2010 and shows a decent amount of tread remaining. Lighting is shown to be working in photos and lenses appear free of haze or cracks throughout, including over the bi-xenon headlamps.

Interior wear appears minimal, with leather surfaces showing occasional marks as well as light abrasion and wrinkling on the driver’s bolsters. Carpets look plush and clean where visible beneath new OEM floor mats. Both door panels are deformation and the textured dash looks straight and clean. The multi-function thumbgrip wheel shows little evidence of use aside from a light shine around its rim, though some bubbling is noted on the the driver’s door pull.

Instrumentation remains clear and digital displays look free of dead pixels. The car was ordered with optional navigation and all switchgear retains bright lettering and functional backlighting. A replacement is included for the auto-dimming mirror, which exhibits typical failure and has leaked onto the ashtray cover below. The driver’s seat belt retraction is said to be sluggish but operational.

The stock 3.2 liter S54 inline-six features Double VANOS valve timing and produced 333 horsepower when new. The 6-speed manual transmission sends power to the rear wheels through a variable locking differential. The absence of a factory strut tower brace identifies the car as an early 2002 example.

Warranty records are included in the gallery and show that recalls were carried out to replace the enigne’s big-end bearings in 2003 and install revised bearing shells in 2005. The car has exhibited no symptoms of bearing-related trouble according to the seller. An additional completed recall is shown for the passenger-side Takata airbag, while a dealer-performed Inspection II in August 2016 revealed none of the rear subframe issues common to the model.

The clean Carfax chronicles dealer visits through 2013, while two additional services were reportedly completed in 2014 and 2016 but are missing from the report. The car passed a California emissions test in December 2016 and is ready for transfer to its new owner. The seller has put 500 miles on the car and is selling to focus on a track-prepped version.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
exterior_color: CSL Body Pieces and Black Trim
listing_details: Prima Plus Supercharger from Active Autowerke
CSL Body Pieces and Black Trim
Squared ARC-8s with Michelin Pilot Sports
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Titanium Silver over Imola Red leather and has been modified with a 9psi supercharger, water/methanol injection, coilover suspension, performance exhaust, CSL body pieces, and more. The seller is an active BMW forum participant who purchased the car stock with 116k miles in 2013, and personally performed the mechanical modifications as well as adding ARC-8 wheels and a host of other cosmetic touches over the last four years. The car’s S54 3.2-liter inline six and SMG automated manual gearbox remain internally stock and it has now traveled 137k miles. Described as fast and meticulously cared for, it is sold with an Autocheck report detailed below as well as a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

An OEM M3 CSL trunk lid was imported from France and installed along with new side skirts and a dual-hole CSL-style front bumper cover with a carbon fiber lip. All were painted in Titanium Silver along with both rear quarter panels and the rear bumper cover, while the finish remains original from the doors forward and retains a high gloss thanks to covered storage out of the Pennsylvania weather. Signs of use up front appear limited to a handful of chips and occasional road marks commensurate with mileage.

Panel gaps look consistent and two accidents indicated by the included Autocheck are noted as minor, although the report omits further details. Weighing in at 18 pounds apiece, anthracite Apex ARC-8 wheels are mounted with a 90mm stud conversion kit and 15mm rear spacers. All four are a “square” 18×9.5″ rather than the factory staggered sizes to allow for easy rotation of their two-year-old Michelin Pilot Super Sport rubber, which shows plenty of tread remaining according to the seller.

“Shadow” window trim is joined by kidneys, grilles and sideview mirrors which have all been repainted in gloss black. Smoked corner markers complement a new set of retrofitted later-model factory LED taillights, xenon headlights with washers and new lenses, new side markers, and E92 LED license plate lights. The windshield cowl and lower rear window gasket have been replaced by the seller.

A similar level of effort has gone into interior cosmetics and includes swapping a low-mileage Imola Red interior in place of the original gray seats and door panels, which are also included in the sale. Leather surfaces show occasional superficial cracks but minimal wrinkling or wear are evident even on driver’s side bolsters. Matching door and rear side panels are free from deformation and show only light signs of use, while common pillar trim separation has been addressed with new covers. Carpets look devoid of major wear where visible in photos.

The textured dash is clean and new Titanium Shadow trim has been installed throughout, while other plastics look devoid of cracks or excessive marking. A ZHP shift knob has been fitted, switchgear retains bright lettering, and the multi-function sport steering wheel rim shows some wear around the rim. The stereo is an updated factory unit from a later car and features an OEM auxiliary input. An armrest delete console features a roll-top “Euro tray” rather than the twin cupholders found in US-market cars, and the car is further optioned with heated seats, a sunroof and Park Distance Control.

Modifications underhood consist of a Prima Plus supercharger kit from Active Autowerke which provides 9 psi of boost to the 3.2-liter inline six. The centrifugal supercharger is supplemented with a trunk-mounted water/methanol injection system along with a tune from Tuning Tech FS, a combination which is claimed by Active Autowerke to make over 500 horsepower at the rear wheels on 93-octane pump fuel.

Shifting is from a stock SMG automated manual gearbox, and the seller suggests that while the clutch does not require immediate attention, it can be expected to have a shorter than typical life due to the forced-induction power. Exhaust is via catless black ceramic-coated headers, a resonated X-pipe, SCZA muffler and stainless tips from Status Gruppe. All combine for an aggressive sound without the rasp typical to other aftermarket E46 M3 systems according to the seller.

Adjustable SRS coilovers from Status Gruppe are mounted with camber plates and use 700kg race springs up with 800kg units in the rear. The seller has driven the car a bit over 5k miles per year during his ownership, stating that it starts quickly whether hot or cold and drives well with the modifications. All modification work was performed personally by the seller, who notes approximately $20k in spending on modification parts alone since April 2013.

Two accidents are reported on the included Autocheck, which also indicates an outstanding Takata airbag recall. An Inspection II was reportedly completed at 124k miles and the most recent oil change was performed at 133k miles, with the seller further noting that only Shell or Sunoco 93-octane fuel and Castrol 10W-60 oil have been used during his ownership. The fixed-back driver’s seat visible in some photos has been removed, but original parts and spares include the full OEM gray interior and 18″ wheels along with an extra set of 12mm wheel spacers.

title: 59K-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
interior_color: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
listing_details: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
Advanced Flow Engineering Cold Air Intake
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Convertible has 59k miles and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Black leather. The car had an MSRP of $62,995 and is optioned with the Cold Weather Package including heated seats, parking back-up sensors, Xenon Headlights, Harmon Kardon stereo, and 19″ wheels. The 3.2 liter S54 inline-six is paired to a 6-speed manual and received a top-end rebuild by BMW in 2011 at 30k miles following damage to the valve train. The seller acquired the car over six years ago and reports that it has never been tracked. Modifications include Active Autowerke custom stainless headers and pipes, AFE intake, Dinan muffler, and an integrated Passport radar detector. A front-end alignment and oil/filer change were completed in November 2016 and the car is said to be running well with no current mechanical needs. This M3 is offered with service records covering the seller’s ownership, an accident-free Carfax, original window sticker, manuals, BMW portfolio, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

Carbon Black Metallic (416) is described as appearing black or very dark blue depending on light conditions. The finish has good shine throughout, and the seller indicates most of the paint is original. In anticipation of the sale, the rear bumper was repainted to address scuffs, and scratches were touched-up in several places on the passenger-side and around the driver-side front wheel. A passenger-side door ding was also professionally repaired and painted in 2014. A paint chip on the edge of the trunk lid above the M3 badge is shown in the gallery below.

The optional 19″ alloys show light curb marks to three wheels and heavier rash on the passenger-side rear item. Vredestein Ultrac Sessanta high performance rubber is fitted all around, with 50% tread life said to remain. A custom padded car cover is included with the sale and pictured in the gallery bellow.

The Black leather (N5SW) interior is in good overall condition, with light creasing but no rips or tears. The driver’s seat shows wear to the left bolster. Hard surfaces appear solid, with no cracks, chips, or missing pieces. Dark carpets appear solid and the driver’s floor mat has worn through in the padded heel area.

A Passport radar detector/laser deflector has been installed, with controls built into the cubby originally housing the ashtray. All four individual window switches function properly. The seller notes an intermittent issue with the switch to operate all windows simultaneously, where all four will lower together but only the rear windows raise up together.

The 3.2 liter S54 inline-six has double-VANOS valve timing and delivered 333 horsepower when new in US-spec. Modifications include a cold air intake from Advanced Flow Engineering and an Active Autowerke performance chip. The seller reports a top-end engine rebuild by BMW at 30k miles, after broken bolts from the Vanos adjustment unit to the intake camshaft caused one broken rocker arm and bent intake valves. An October 2011 service report and a February 2017 summary from BMW are pictured in the gallery and describe the rebuild, which included:
Custom stainless headers and pipes from Active Autowerke were added about 2,700 miles ago and are pictured here next to the original parts. A Dinan muffler was also installed at the same time.

Undercarriage photos show a clean and dry car, with no indications of damage or prior repairs. A sub-frame inspection and installation of new sub-frame mounts were completed March 2011 at a BMW dealership according to the seller. The car is equipped with a Getrag 420G 6-speed manual and is said to run and drive well. Stainless Goodridge brake lines were added less than 5k miles ago, and are reported to provide a firmer and more responsive brake pedal.

The accident-free Carfax includes some gaps in vehicle history and supports the indicated mileage. The seller reports that the open recall item was an airbag part issue, with the service since completed and on record with BMW. The original window sticker can be seen in the gallery below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A0EOq75K23g
The seller has add this video which features the engine revving through the Active Autowerke headers/pipes and Dinan muffler.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_FJvWJupkdc
A second video provides another capture of this M3’s exhaust note.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Coupe has 106k miles and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Gray Nappa leather. The seller recently acquired this unmodified example from the estate of a fellow engineer and friend of 42 years, who bought the car new. It is powered by a 3.2 liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission and was a daily driver that is said to have been garaged in San Diego since first purchased. Recently fitted with new tires and, the car passed California smog and received an inspection and oil change in December 2016. It is sold with a car cover, new battery, complete tool kit, BMW Mobility Kit, owner’s manuals, original window sticker, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Carbon Black Metallic (#416) paint is believed original and presents well for its age. Noted imperfections include an indentation along the roof line edge above the passenger door and a slight scrape in the rocker panel under the passenger door. The seller mentions a slight bulge on the bottom of the front air dam under the passenger side fog light and replacement plastic splash panel in front of the right front wheel.

The included Carfax reports a rear-end collision in 2012 and that the airbags did not deploy. Factory 18” wheels show light curb damage and are wrapped in a new set of Hankook Ventus S1 Noble 255/40ZR rubber.
Inside, the Gray Nappa leather shows wear on the center armrest, passenger seat bolster, and driver’s seat. Door panels are clean and carpeting is protected by factory M floor mats.

The original owner ordered this example to be a non-SMG, no sunroof, manual seat model. According to the seller, all lights, gauges, and interior functions work properly, including the A/C. The dash shows no cracking, and the factory stereo and switchgear show minimal wear for their age.
As seen above, the odometer currently reads 105,634 miles. Currently there are no codes or alarms.

The 3.2 liter S54 inline-six was good for 333 horsepower when new and features Double VANOS valve timing. This E46 is said to track straight and shift smoothly. The seller mentions a squeaking from the brakes when lightly applied, though the pads are said to have plenty of life.

The 6-speed manual transmission feeds power to the rear wheels through a variable locking differential. The underside appears free of notable damage and additional detailed photos can be viewed in the gallery.

The Carfax shows the longterm original ownership and displays the rear-end collision on 7/17/12. The seller was unable to locate service records when the car was obtained from the previous owner’s estate.
The original window sticker lists the MSRP as $50,370, and standard options include remote entry, automatic climate control, on-board computer, rain-sensing wipers, and heated side-view mirrors.

title: 16K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe has just 16,400 miles and is a largely stock example that remained with its original owner until recently. Finished in Titanium Silver over Black, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Factory equipment includes the Premium Package, Cold Weather Package, Bi-Xenon headlamps, a Harman/Kardon stereo, and more. The car is said to be up-to-date on servicing, with the most recent maintenance performed in December 2016. This M3 is offered by a friend of the current owner with a 100+ photo gallery, some service records, an accident-free AutoCheck, and a clear Virginia title.

Titanium Silver paint is said to remain original aside from the front bumper, which was refinished at some point and had its amber markers deleted. The seller states that it looks like some curb damage was repaired as there is some peeling of the clearcoat around the fog lights, small cracks below the fog lights, and a minor run in the clearcoat on the passenger-side. Some dings and scratches on the rocker panels are also noted, and exterior flaws are detailed in the gallery.

18″ alloys are wrapped in Continental Extreme Contact DW tires fitted in December 2016. Three of the wheels show marks, and each corner is highlighted in the photo gallery below. The seller states that the struts/shocks and bushings are tight with no play, and the rear differential does not whine or leak. Rear parking sensors were optioned from the factory.

Inside, the Black leather upholstery looks to be in tidy condition with little discernible wear aside from minor creasing on the driver’s bolsters. The seller notes that the passenger and rear seats look to have been rarely used.

This M3 was optioned with the Premium Package (power seats, adjustable lumbar support, power sunroof, harman/kardon audio) and Cold Weather Package (Bi-Xenon headlights, headlight washers, heated seats, ski bag). The seller states that all features, electronics, lighting, and instrumentation are in good working order. One ding in the aluminum trim above the glove box is highlighted in the photo gallery.

The 3.2-liter inline-six is reportedly up-to-date on servicing. The most recent maintenance was performed in December 2016 at 16k miles by Momentum BMW in Texas consisting of a new battery, oil change, all fluids including brake and power steering, a fuel service, alignment, and recalls for the DME control module and driver/passenger airbags. Service records from West German BMW in Pennsylvania from 2003 to 2007 up to 10k miles will also be included.
The undercarriage is described as free of any known rust with crack-free subframe mounts and no apparent damage throughout.

The AutoCheck report shows this to be a single-owner car, though the original owner recently sold it to the seller. No accidents or issues are shown and the car was registered in Pennsylvania from new until the end of 2016. As per the seller, this low-mile E46 M3 is available for in-person or professional pre-purchase inspections at the buyer’s expense.

title: 2005 BMW M3 SMG Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is equipped with the Competition Package and is a two-owner example that shows 48k miles. Special ordered through BMW Individual in Stratus Grey with no sunroof, the car was also fitted with a CSL rear decklid spoiler when new. It has resided in the Atlanta, Georgia area its whole life and was serviced by a single technician at the local BMW dealer until the seller acquired it in 2014. Powered by an unmodified 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by an SMG sequential manual transmission, the car features an M-Tech Alcantara and leather interior. This E46 is sold with a clean Carfax, records back to new, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The Competition Package bridged the gap between the standard M3 and the M3 CSL, which was not offered in the US. The special order Stratus Grey (440) paintwork shows a small chip near the 3M guards on the hood, and the 3M guards on the mirrors have discolored slightly. No other marks are noted. The stock grilles have been replaced with aftermarket items with carbon fiber surrounds.
This car has been equipped with the CSL rear spoiler from new, and the Competition Package included 19″ wheels.

This car is equipped with an M-Tech partial Alcantara interior with leather bolsters. Apart from an integrated radar detector and jammer, the cabin retains all stock equipment. Some general wear and tear is apparent in higher traffic areas, and all interior features are said to work correctly.
There is wear visible on the driver’s outer bolsters as seen above, and both the front and rear seats are further detailed in the gallery below.

The S54 3.2-liter inline-six is mechanically unmodified, and the car was reportedly maintained by a single tech at one BMW dealership by the original owner. The car was last serviced in late 2015 with a brake job and fluid changes of the engine, differential, and transmission. The only noted performance modification is a Dinan rear strut bar. Other services are documented in a printed maintenance log from Global BMW in Atlanta, Georgia.

The seller has records back to new, including a maintenance log from the BMW dealer that has serviced the car from new. The original books and manuals are also included along with the original window sticker, which shows an MSRP of $62,165 due to nearly $15k in options. The clean Carfax can be viewed in the gallery below.

title: 20K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 shows just 20k miles and is said to be an unmodified example powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. The paint is believed to be original, and the car was ordered with the Cold Weather Package. It was reportedly garaged for a few years by the previous owner and rarely driven. The seller believes he is the third owner, and has added 200 miles since acquiring the car a year ago. This E46 M3 is sold with an accident-free Carfax and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.
All of Titanium Silver paint is said to be original, and the condition is detailed in gallery photographs. Clear turn signal indicators and a power moonroof were optioned at purchase.

Wheels are double spoke alloy items with a Chrome Shadow finish. The Cold Weather package optioned on this car included headlight washers, heated seats, rain-sensing wipers, and a ski bag. Xenon headlights are also equipped.

The black interior has the factory navigation system, heated memory seats, and a Harman-Kardon sound system with 6-disc CD changer. The seller notes that all gauges and interior equipment are functional, though the radio shows a horizontal line on the digital display. 19,567 miles are shown on the odometer, which is said to be accurate and is confirmed by the Carfax.
The seats show some wear on the bolsters and a series of scratches on the driver and passenger cushions. Little wear is seen on the rear bench.

The 3.2-liter S54 DOHC inline-six has VANOS variable valve timing and individual intake runners for each cylinder. The engine was rated at 333 hp and 262 lb-ft in the US configuration when new, and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission in this car. The seller has driven it 200 miles and notes no issues, stating that the rod bearing issue that plagues some E46 M3 cars has been corrected by a previous owner.

The Carfax was recently issued and shows two owners prior to 2013, with no recorded incidents of damage or loss. Maintenance reports are sporadic, with no data for the periods from 2005-2013 and 2014-present. A driver’s airbag recall issued in 2015 remains outstanding.

title: Supercharged 2004 BMW M3 SMG
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 has 71k miles and is a well-documented example that has been modified with numerous Dinan components, including a supercharger kit. A binder of receipts totaling over $80k details all work performed on the vehicle since new and documents the installation of the aftermarket parts. Powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed sequential manual gearbox, this M3 has been outfitted with a Vortech supercharger, intercooler, Dinan radiator, Dinan exhaust and suspension, Brembo brakes, UUC flywheel and clutch, Turner Motorsports subframe reinforcement kit, and more as detailed below. Approximately 6k miles have been added during the seller’s two years of ownership, and this E46 is now being offered with accident-free Carfax and AutoCheck reports, the original window sticker, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Silver Grey Metallic paint shows some minor rock chips on the hood and front of the rear quarter panels. The rear bumper was replaced with an new cover from BMW last year following a minor impact, and a CSL rear trunk was fitted with Dinan badging. A CSL front bumper deletes the fog lights and park distance control and was repainted due to chipping.

Staggered-width factory 19” wheels are wrapped with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measuring 245/35 up front and 265/35 out back. A Brembo GT big brake kit is installed, and the seller notes that the windshield should be replaced at some point with a higher quality item.

Black Nappa leather seats show some creasing and wear on the driver’s bolsters, but no rips or tears are present in photographs. The rear seat and carpeting appears to be well-maintained, and rear headrests are included in the sale.

Carbon fiber interior trim was added to the dash, center console, and steering wheel. The Harmon-Kardon stereo is retained and has been fitted with a D.I.C.E. iPod hook-up. VDO water temperature, oil temp, and voltage gauges have also been installed underneath the climate controls. The car has been hardwired for a Valentine One radar detector, though a V1 is not included. Door speaker covers could use replacement.

Dinan upgrades were installed by BMW of Houston North and include the S3R package, which features an intercooled Vortech supercharger, aluminum radiator with aluminum shroud, high flow individual throttle bodies, and free flow exhaust. According to Dinan specs, the S3R package increases horsepower to 462hp with 328lb. ft of torque. Euro exhaust headers and Status Gruppe 200 cell catalytic converters were also fitted. The 6-speed sequential manual gearbox received a UUC lightweight flywheel and clutch upgrade.
Suspension and underbody modifications include:

A binder of records is said to document the car from new, and shows receipts adding up to over $80k in upgrades and maintenance. An Inspection II was performed on 12/1/15 at 66k miles and included a valve adjustment and fluid flush. While the car last passed smog in California on 2015, it may not presently pass as the supercharger is not CARB certified.
The original window sticker shows the MSRP as $58k when sold new at BMW of Houston North.
The provided Carfax displays no accidents, and the clean AutoCheck is viewable in the gallery below. A few short driving videos and engine rev video are viewable below.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible shows 110k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over grey leather, the car has been modified with Harman Kardon speakers, M3 Competition wheels, a short illuminated shift knob, Angel Eye headlights, Alcantara interior elements, and a number of carbon fiber components. The seller purchased the car two years ago from local owner and has added 14k miles during his ownership. An Inspection II service was performed 7k miles ago in 2016, and the car is now offered with a clean Carfax and clear Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and the front of the car is protected by a 3M clear bra, however the bra on the hood was removed when the hood was repainted. A small rock chip is present on the rear driver-side fender, and a scratch on the driver’s side door is detailed in the gallery. The convertible top appears to fit properly in the included images, and a removable rear-seat wind deflector is included in the sale.

M3 Competition wheels have been fitted with front tires installed in May 2015 at 96k miles and rear tires installed in November 2016 at 108k miles. Curb rash can be seen on the passenger-side wheels. Other exterior modifications include carbon fiber trim pieces on the front spoiler lip and rear diffuser, as well as Angel Eye headlights.

Interior modifications include carbon fiber trim on the dash and steering wheel, an Alcantara steering wheel and shift boot, a short illuminated shift knob, and upgraded Harman Kardon speakers. The factory stereo has been wired for an iPod/iPhone and is equipped with satellite radio.

Grey leather heated front seats show some wear, looseness, and discoloration on the driver bolster as pictured above. Rear seats show little evidence of use, and a scuff is noted on the passenger door panel.

A carbon fiber engine cover was also fitted, though the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to remain mechanically stock. No issues were reportedly found during the Inspection II service performed 7k miles ago in April 2016. The car has been serviced at the same independent BMW shop for the past five years, and included maintenance records document the seller’s two years of ownership.
A provided Carfax displays no accidents with service history in North Carolina, Georgia, Florida, and Ohio.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 shows 98k miles and is finished in black over Cinnamon leather. The seller is reportedly the third owner, and the car has a prior history of New York, New Jersey, and Delaware. Powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, this example has been modified with Avant Garde wheels, a K&N intake, H&R lowering springs, and a CSL trunk. The crankshaft seal and driveshaft input seal were replaced 3k miles ago at the shop where the seller works. It is now being offered with its original wheels, factory intake and fan shroud, carbon fiber splitter, replacement mirror lens, original window sticker, clean Carfax, and a clear Maryland title.

The right front fender was replaced with an OEM unit after an minor accident last year. The hood has been repainted to fix cracking, as has the front bumper. An OEM CSL trunk was installed by the previous owner, and a carbon fiber CSL-style front splitter is included.

Avant Garde wheels and Hankook Ventus Evo 12 tires have seen approximately 4k miles of use. Factory 19” double-spoke alloys show curb rash and are included in the sale wearing a set of Yokohama tires with plenty of tread.
Cinnamon leather is accented by piano black trim and black carpeting. Light wear is noted on the driver’s seat, though the rear seats appear to have seen little use.

The factory AM/FM/Cassette stereo with GPS navigation and on-board computer screen has been retained. No pixelation is displayed in photographs, and the A/C reportedly blows cold. The odometer shows 98,650 miles, with approximately 4k miles added during the seller’s year of ownership. A replacement mirror lens is included as the auto-dim mirror is leaking.

The rod bearing recall was reportedly done by a past owner. Receipts document a cooling system rebuild with stock parts, and the seller replaced the crankshaft seal and driveshaft input seal after hours at the shop in which he works. At this time, the differential was dropped and fluid levels were checked. The temperature sensor was recently replaced, but the oil level sensor is in need of replacement.

While the subframe reinforcement has not been done, the seller had the car inspected at purchase and again recently. He states that it checks out with no cracks noted. Additional photos of the subframe are displayed in the gallery below. This E46 has reportedly not been tracked or driven on salted roads during the seller’s ownership.
No accidents are included on the provided Carfax, and the car passed Maryland emissions in October 2016. A driving and start-up video is provided below.

title: One-Owner 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a single-owner coupe finished in Alpine White over gray leather which is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Purchased new in Fort Lauderdale, Florida by the seller, this stock example has reportedly seen only weekend use for the last six years. Now located in Texas, it has been driven just over 112k miles and is said to have no current issues following a 2016 brake repair. The car features an extensive list of factory options and is sold with a clean Carfax report along with a clear Texas title.

A stock appearance is maintained outside, and Alpine White paint has reportedly been protected by garage storage since new as well as regular waxing with Zymol. A handful of small blemishes are visible in photos along with slight staining of the lower rear valance, though the seller notes the car will be fully cleaned and detailed prior to delivery.

Optional 19″ wheels show minimal rash according to the seller and wear Michelin Pilot Sport rubber. A small factory rear spoiler caps the trunk lid, and a dark aftermarket window tint has been applied.

Finished in grey leather, both powered front sport seats show light cracks and wrinkling on their deep bolsters, as well as slight staining on the passenger backrest. Similar evidence of use is seen on the thick-rimmed factory wheel, leather-wrapped shift knob, and plastic console doors. Standard features include automatic climate control, onboard computer, rain-sensing wipers, and heated sideview mirrors.

Additional options include brushed aluminum trim, an electric glass sunroof, premium Harmon Kardon sound, cruise control, traction control, and Sport Mode for increased throttle response. Gray-faced gauges include a 185 mph speedometer, 9,000 rpm tachometer, and oil pressure gauge. The digital odometer shows just over 112k miles, all of which have been driven by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six had a factory rating of 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and features individual throttle bodies, drive-by-wire throttle control, and Double VANOS valve timing, which is said to exhibit no evidence of typical issues. A 6-speed manual gearbox was equipped on just under half of the E46 M3s produced and feeds power to the rear wheels through a standard variable locking differential. No subframe cracking is present according to the seller.

The included Carfax report verifies single ownership and shows no accidents, thefts, or other issues. Service records are described as as fairly extensive, and the last work performed was a parking brake repair in August 2016, with little mileage added since.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe shows 90,560 miles and is a sunroof-delete example finished in Imola Red over a partial cloth interior. Powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission, the car was was acquired by the seller in May 2014 and has been driven about 19,500 miles since. Modifications consist of preventive rear subframe reinforcement, a 4.10 differential, Fabspeed header, TTFS ECU tune, Supersprint Street muffler and mid-pipe, an E46 ZHP shift knob, and a K&N panel air filter. Service records since 2014 are included, with a recent $4,400 major service detailed below. This E46 M3 is now offered with the stock exhaust manifold, an accident-free Carfax, and a clean New Jersey title.

Outside, the car is finished in Imola Red, with the seller mentioning the driver-side fender, hood area, and door were repainted at some point in the past. Exterior wear and tear commensurate with mileage is noted, along with a light scratch in the driver’s door. The Fabspeed header, Supersprint Street muffler, and Supersprint mid-pipe should provide a nice exhaust note.
The factory 18″ alloy wheels show a few marks, with each rim highlighted in the photo gallery below. They are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Super Sport rubber at all four corners.

Inside, the partial cloth upholstery and sunroof-delete are relatively rare features for an these E46 M3. The manually-adjusted seats show some marks and wear on the bolsters and thigh supports as seen above.
Aside from an E46 ZHP shift knob, the cabin has been left stock and all features are in good working order per the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six made 333 hp when new and has been modified with a TTFS ECU tune. In April 2016, the seller had Northeast Motorsports in Mahwah, New Jersey perform a major service that consisted of reinforcing the rear subframe, rebuilding the rear end with a 4.10 differential, a valve adjustment, new belts, an oil change, replacement trailing arm bushings, and more. The seller also reportedly confirmed with a BMW dealer that the rod bearing recall was performed around the 30k mile mark, though no receipts are included.
The two-page $4,400 receipt from Northeast Motorsports is shown above and in the photo gallery below.
The attached Carfax is free of accidents and displays 23 service records.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe shows just over 65k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Delivered new to Georgia, the car was leased by an executive for eight months and purchased by the second owner in February 2006. He kept it in Florida through late 2011, when it was purchased by Enthusiast Auto Group in Cincinnati, Ohio. EAG serviced this sunroof-delete example with a new constant pressure valve, flex disc, drive belts, rear trailing arm bushings, and more before the seller bought it in March 2012. He has added nearly 18k miles in the last five years and maintained the car with oil/filter changes, new fuel and air filters, brake and ignition service, a new alternator, and new tires. Status Gruppe headers and BC coilovers were also fitted. This E46 M3 is sold with records for the work done by EAG, receipts from the seller, a clean AutoCheck, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The previous owner repainted the hood, front fenders, and rear bumper due to chips, and the seller notes that the color matches well. The Silver Grey Metallic (A08) paint shows two small chips on the edge of the driver’s door and a small scratch on the right corner of the rear bumper being the only notable faults. Having been stored every winter since its been in Michigan, the car is said to have never seen snow and has been professionally detailed twice a year.

A set of BC Racing coilovers were installed by the seller, and the brakes were serviced with an ECS tuning kit that included Textar pads and Meyle rotors in August 2016. The stock 19″ alloys were fitted with Hankook Ventus V12 EVO2 tires last November.

Inside the cabin, the black leather interior appears to be in good condition with normal wear showing on the seat bolsters. The car came from the factory with sunroof delete and manual seats, and the seller has added an OEM lighted ZHP shift knob, 330d shift lever, and Umnitza LED interior lighting. EAG replaced the rear view mirror and the interior A-pillars, though the headliner cloth is said to be slightly sagging near the middle of the rear portion. A Parrot Bluetooth kit was already installed when the seller acquired the car.

All of the gauges, power accessories, stock Business radio, and A/C system are said to function properly, and the odometer reads 65,334 miles. Thinking he would perform the airbag recall himself, the seller removed the airbag fuse from the glove box. After deciding it would be better serviced at a dealership he replaced the fuse and the SRS light has been on ever since.
https://vimeo.com/218836850
The walkaround video above shows the interior and exterior condition of the car.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired to a Getrag 6-speed manual and has been modified with Status Gruppe headers. Service performed in late 2011 by EAG included the replacement of the constant pressure valve, flex disc, accessory drive belts, rear trailing arm bushings, and battery. The seller has performed the following maintenance:

An accident-free AutoCheck shows the ownership history, while the original owner’s manual, keys, and emergency kit in the trunk well are included. No service records from previous owners were passed down, though an invoice for the work done by EAG and receipts for the maintenance and modifications performed by the seller come with the car. The seller purchased the vehicle completely stock and has retained all the original OEM parts for the buyer.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
listing_details: New Rear Brakes,Coils, Plugs, and Oil Pan Gasket
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Convertible shows 93,527 miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual. The car was sold new in Washington and stayed there until being purchased in September 2014 by the seller, who drove it down Highway 1 to Los Angeles before moving to Dallas, Texas in May 2015. This example is equipped with the Cold Weather Package, and the stock 18″ wheels were recently powder coated. The seller has added 20k miles during his ownership and serviced the car every 5k miles with oil changes and an inspection. Maintenance performed 500 miles ago included new rear brakes, coils, plugs, and an oil pan gasket. This E46 M3 is sold with service records back to 2014, a clean Carfax, and a clean Washington title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver Metallic paint shows some normal wear, including a few small chips on the nose. The paint is original with the exception of the front bumper, which was replaced by the seller last year after a parking lot incident cracked the passenger-side corner. Black kidney grills have replaced the original chrome units.
The black soft top is said to be in good shape, with no tears or leaks. The 18″ alloys were recently powder coated and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires with a DOT code of December 2014.

The car is optioned with the Cold Weather Package, which includes heated seats, headlight washers, and a built-in ski bag. All of the lighting, gauges, accessories, and controls are said to work as they should. The original M3 floor mats are included as shown in the gallery, and an iPod AUX plug is built into the factory stereo. The auto dimming rearview mirror is reported to have issues with the dimming fluid.
The leather upholstery on the seats shows some wear on the bolsters, and the leather-wrapped M Sport shift knob is also showing some minor wear.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is coupled with a Getrag 6-speed manual gearbox. The seller has serviced the E46 in consistent intervals at certified BMW service centers with fluid changes and inspections, and a Texas Safety and Emissions test was passed last month. Maintenance performed under current ownership includes the following:

A collection of undercarriage photos have been included in the image gallery below. The seller had a PPI done when he bought the car to check for any VANOS issues or cracking in the rear subframe. The PPI reported no issues were present, and a recent inspection showed no cracking was apparent.

An accident-free Carfax shows ownership history and verifies mileage. The car comes with a binder full of service records from the seller’s three years of ownership. The original trunk mounted toolkit is also included.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe is equipped with the Competition Package and is powered by an unmodified 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by an SMG sequential manual transmission. Cosmetic modifications include CSL front and rear diffusers, angel eyes front lights, Storm Motorwerks SMG paddles, and 15mm wheel spacers. Both the Vanos and cooling systems have been replaced. Documentation history is available from the seller and the previous two owners. The car is offered with two keys, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

The desirable M3 Competition package was a $4,000 option offering both performance and cosmetic upgrades from the standard M3, including 19″ BBS spin-cast alloy wheels, CSL Steering rack featuring a more direct steering ratio, upgraded brakes with painted black calipers, as well as the exclusive color option of Interlagos blue. The seller notes some exterior issues including rock chips on the front, a scratch on the hood near the passenger headlight, and a small touch-up on the rear passenger side.

All paint and panels are believed to be original. Exterior modifications include CSL front and rear diffusers, smoked Depo corner lights and side markers, 4th-gen angel eyes, and LED tail lights. The seller notes that the passenger side front diffuser is cracked.
Black side grills have been added, and the 19″ wheels feature BBS center caps and show curb rash. 15mm spacers provide a more aggressive stance. The ZCP-specific rotors were replaced at 107k miles.

The grey leather interior features Competion Pack upgrades including an Alcantara steering wheel cover and aluminum trim. Aftermarket Storm Motorwerks SMG paddles and navigation knobs have been installed. The seller notes that the navigation display has some dead pixels, and all other gauges, lights, and accessories work as they should. The odometer shows 164k miles.
The seats show some creasing and wear on the bolsters. The Competition Package M Track Mode version of BMW’s Dynamic Stability Control is accessible via the windshield wiper stalk end button.

An aFe drop in filter is the only change to the 3.2L S54, which received a level II inspection at 130k miles. A Dr. Vanos replacement Vanos system was installed in 2012 and the cooling system as replaced in 2014. A new CPV valve has been installed. The SMG clutch is reported to grip well, and a recent subframe inspection did not reveal any cracking.
The seller is the 7th owner and has driven the car 1,000 miles. An accident-free Carfax is shown in the gallery.

title: 34K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Active Autowerke Exhaust and Rasp Pipe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe is a 6-speed manual example with just over 34k miles that is finished in Steel Gray Metallic over Cinnamon leather. Sold new in Florida in December 2001, the car was kept at the original owner’s Miami vacation home in Miami and driven sparingly. The seller purchased this example in 2010 and recently relocated it to his home in Massachusetts. Powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, the car has been modified with ZCP wheels, Eibach Springs, an Active Autowerke Exhaust, and a Rasp Pipe. This E46 M3 is now being offered in Boston with service records from new, a clean Carfax, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The Steel Gray Metallic (400) paint has held up well, with a small scratch on the passenger-side rear fender flare being the only noted fault. The seller reports he had the front bumper repainted due to rock chips from normal driving, and that the car has no history of any accidents. Stored each winter in a climate controlled garage, the M3 is only driven on weekends with nice weather during warmer months.

A set of Eibach Springs were added by the seller, and genuine 19″ ZCP wheels were installed last year. Michelin Super Sports are said to have very few miles on them, and the stock 18″ alloys also come with the car.

Inside, the Cinnamon Nappa leather interior is in good shape, with seats appearing as if they have seen little use. This color interior was an $1,100 option ordered by the original owner that when joined with the Steel Gray exterior makes for a very rare color combination.

All of the gauges, lights, optional Harman-Kardon sound system, and accessories function properly. The odometer shows 34,083 miles and is said to be accurate by the seller based on records and the Carfax.

The S54 3.2-liter inline-six has been modified with an Active Autowerke Exhaust and Rogue Engineering Rasp Pipe. The rod bearing recall was done at 2k miles, the Full Inspection II with valve adjustment was done at ~25k miles, and the car is serviced annually each spring. The most recent service was an oil/filter change in 2017. The seller has not upgraded the VANOS and subframe given the low mileage, and reports no issues with either.
The original boot lid-mounted tool kit can be seen in the clean trunk.

The accident-free Carfax verifies ownership history and mileage. Service records dating back to new are included along with the original owner’s manuals and all four original keys. The car is registered in Florida where it previously spent some time, but is currently located with the seller in Boston.
Videos of a walkaround and of the exhaust have been provided by the seller.
https://vimeo.com/220303672
https://vimeo.com/220304010
https://vimeo.com/221173335
https://vimeo.com/221173475

title: Original Owner 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Convertible is an unmodified one-owner example with 72k miles. Factory equipped with a 3.2 liter S54 inline-six and a 6-speed manual, it features a cold weather package, Xenon headlights, fog lights, and Harmon Kardon sound system. This example is finished in a triple black scheme covering the top, interior leather, and body paint. The M3 has largely been dealer-serviced and in preparation for the sale has had two new rear tires installed, an oil change, 4-wheel alignment, and has passed the California smog test within the past 60 days. The seller is representing the owner, and notes the car can be seen by appointment in San Francisco. This E46 comes with a clean Carfax and a clear California title in owners name.

Delivered in factory Schwarz black, the body is all original and as has a no-accident Carfax status. Overall, paint and body are said to be in good condition with cosmetic blemishes visible on the rear bumper.
The power top with glass rear window is in good condition and works well. The M3 is fitted with Xenon headlights and fog lights.

The Schwarz grey leather upholstery looks clean but shows some wear on both passenger and driver seat outer bolsters, and arm rest. The rear seats look to have had little use. The M-Sport steering wheel and shift knob show no significant wear. Original carpets are present and factory M3 mats which both look to be in good condition.

The car is fitted with the cold weather package including heated seats. It also has the auto-dimmimg rear view mirror and a Harman/Kardon audio system. A/C, gauges and switches are are all said to work correctly.

Underhood, the 3.2 liter S54 inline-six remains unmodified and is paired to a 6-speed manual gearbox. Proper maintenance has been done over the seller’s ownership with many records available by the seller as well as documentation on the included Carfax report. The seller has stated that the M3 has not been affected by the rod bearing issue known to affect some 2001–2003 S54 engines. An oil change was recently conducted and a new battery was installed at 68,459 miles.

Stock 18″ wheels have a factory finish and show curb rash. The front tires are Bridgestone Potenza tires, while the rears are Sumitomo HTR ZII. Two fresh tires were added at 67k miles. No underbody photos are shown, but as a California car since new it should have no significant rust issues.
A current Carfax is viewable below which shows the one-owner status.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
exterior_color: Carbon Black Metallic (reads as dark blue under strong sunlight)
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is a stock final-year E46 coupe with the factory Competition Package, a 6-speed manual gearbox, and 52k miles. The “ZCP” Competition package offered performance and cosmetic upgrades not found on the standard E46 M3 and was available for 2005-2006 only. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over gray leather, this example was leased in North Carolina for its first 5,500 miles and has had one subsequent owner in Virginia prior to its recent acquisition by the seller. It comes with a clean AutoCheck report and a clear Maryland title in the seller’s name.

Carbon Black Metallic paint reads as a dark blue under strong sunlight and is detailed in several close-up photos below. The Competition Package included staggered-width 19″ split-spoke wheels, here wearing Continental ExtremeContact DWS tires from 2010 and 2011. Curb rash is shown in the photos below, though few other blemishes are present according to the seller.

Powered and heated gray sport seats are joined by the ultrasuede-wrapped wheel and checked aluminum trim equipped as part of the Competition Package. Light wear is present on the outer seat bolsters and shift knob, while the seller notes the absence of common issues such as drooping pillar covers or leaks from the rear view mirror.

Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedo and a digital odometer showing just under 52k miles, a handful of which have been added by the seller. A power sunroof is equipped and the factory DVD-based navigation system is retained in the dash, though the ZCP wheel eliminates cruise control from the model.

The 3.2-liter S54 straight six is backed by a 6-speed manual gearbox. ZCP cars featured a quicker steering ratio and track mode for Dynamic Stability Control along with 13.7″ front and 12.9″ rear cross-drilled brake rotors. This one reportedly passed a Virginia state inspection just before the seller’s purchase and a tune-up will be performed prior to the auction’s close. This car has been inspected for common E46 M3 problems such as subframe cracking and VANOS issues, both of which are said to be absent here.

The Autocheck report shows no accidents or thefts. An Inspection 1 is reportedly noted in the owner’s manual and further dealer maintenance is said to be indicated by records procured from BMW by the seller.
A partial factory tool kit and air compressor are included in the sale along with spare keys, period brochures and other literature.

title: 37K-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe has just 36,659 miles and is a 6-speed manual example finished in Carbon Black over black leather. The first owner was from Westbury, New York and had the car serviced at Rallye BMW. The current owner acquired it around one month ago from its second caretaker, who purchased this example in 2009 and kept it in League City, Texas and then Virginia. This E46 has been kept mechanically stock from new, including the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six. Recently, Richmond BMW performed a full inspection and service at a cost of $2,288 as detailed below. This M3 is now offered on behalf of the current owner with clear Carfax and AutoCheck reports, one key and alarm fob, and a clean Virginia title.

As part of the recent work performed at Richmond BMW, the front bumper was repainted, several dings were removed, and all four factory 18″ alloy wheels were refinished. Remaining flaws are listed as dings at the top seam of the passenger door and on the lower driver-side quarter panel in front of the wheel, in addition to a scratch on the passenger’s rear quarter panel near the fuel door, a number of minor scratches on the trunk lid, and a notable scratch on the rear passenger-side bumper trim. All flaws are highlighted in the detailed photo gallery below and the seller notes this M3 would benefit from a professional detail/paint correction.

The newly refinished wheels are highlighted in the photo gallery below and wear Toyo Proxes T1R tires at all four corners. New ABS-DSC sensors were fitted by Richmond BMW, and an aftermarket alarm system has been added.

Inside, the factory black leather upholstery has been well-kept, with the seller noting only minor wear on the driver’s seat bolstering as shown above. Everything has been left stock aside from an LCD touchscreen Alpine stereo head-unit. All equipment is reported to be in good working order, including the heated seats, sunroof, and power accessories.

Two open airbag recalls were recently completed by Richmond BMW. The seller describes interior flaws as some scuffs on the passenger door panel and delaminating A/C-pillar trim, all of which is shown in the photo gallery.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been kept in stock condition from new. The second owner maintained the car at League City BMW. A full mechanical inspection was performed by Richmond BMW on April 29, 2017, and the car received a clean bill of health as shown via the five-page document in the picture gallery. The three-page $2,288 service receipt is also displayed. According to the seller, the engine starts easily and provides smooth power, while the 6-speed manual provides positive shifts in all gears.

Accident-free Carfax and AutoCheck history reports are provided in the photo gallery and show two owners prior to the current owner. 18 service history records are also displayed. Three videos of the E46 are shown below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Aj6VfZPZwpo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bnQTvYLnWmM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Jmsp1_yMPg

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe is equipped with the Competition Package and is powered by an unmodified 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed sequential manual transmission. Cosmetic modifications include CSL front and rear diffusers, angel eyes front lights, Storm Motorwerks SMG paddles, and 15mm wheel spacers. Both the VANOS and cooling systems have been replaced. Documentation history is available from the seller and the previous two owners. The car is offered with two keys, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

This is a re-list after the car previously sold on BaT earlier in June. The sale could not be not completed because the buyer refused to follow through with their commitment to purchase and not due to any fault with the car. That buyer has been banned from any futher participation in BaT Auctions and his buyer fee was not refunded.

The desirable M3 Competition package was a $4,000 option offering both performance and cosmetic upgrades from the standard M3, including 19″ BBS spin-cast alloy wheels, CSL Steering rack featuring a more direct steering ratio, upgraded brakes with painted black calipers, as well as the exclusive color option of Interlagos blue. The seller notes some exterior issues including rock chips on the front, a scratch on the hood near the passenger headlight, and a small touch-up on the rear passenger side.

All paint and panels are believed to be original. Exterior modifications include CSL front and rear diffusers, smoked Depo corner lights and side markers, 4th-gen angel eyes, and LED tail lights. The seller notes that the passenger side front diffuser is cracked.
Black side grills have been added, and the 19″ wheels feature BBS center caps and show curb rash. 15mm spacers provide a more aggressive stance. The ZCP-specific rotors were replaced at 107k miles.

The grey leather interior features Competion Pack upgrades including an Alcantara steering wheel cover and aluminum trim. Aftermarket Storm Motorwerks SMG paddles and navigation knobs have been installed. The seller notes that the navigation display has some dead pixels, and all other gauges, lights, and accessories work as they should. The odometer shows 164k miles.
The seats show some creasing and wear on the bolsters. The Competition Package M Track Mode version of BMW’s Dynamic Stability Control is accessible via the windshield wiper stalk end button.

An aFe drop in filter is the only change to the 3.2L S54, which received a level II inspection at 130k miles. A Dr. Vanos replacement VANOS system was installed in 2012, and the cooling system was replaced in 2014. A new CPV valve has also been installed.
