The SMG clutch is reported to grip well, and a recent subframe inspection did not reveal any cracking.
The seller is the 7th owner and has driven the car 1,000 miles. The accident-free Carfax is shown in the gallery.

title: 30K-Mile 2005 BMW M3 6-Speed
exterior_color: Silver Grey Metallic over Imola Red
listing_details: Silver Grey Metallic over Imola Red
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 shows 29,882 miles and is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over Imola Red leather interior. Featuring a 3.2L S54 inline-six and 6-speed manual transmission, the car was acquired by the seller from the original owner two years ago. The 30k-mile service was completed at the end of 2016, and the original invoice from Rallye Motors is included along with full service records and the owner’s manual. This E46 M3 is now being offered with a clear Carfax and a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

Finished in BMW Silbergrau Metallic, the car has protective 3M film across the entire front and the windows have been tinted to 30%.  There are minor scrapes on the lower edge of the front bumper, but the rest of the paint shows minimal imperfections. A new car cover is included, and the seller notes that the car was stored indoors during the winter months on a trickle charger.

Xenon headlights were equipped from the factory and are complimented by retractable headlight washers from the Cold Weather Package. New tires were fitted onto the 18″ M wheels in late 2016, and the wheels show minor scuffs on the outer edge.

The Imola Red leather interior is accompanied by aluminum trim, and the seats, door panels, and arm rests show well in the provided images. Fitted with the Cold Weather package from the factory, the car features heated front seats alongside the optional Harmon-Kardon sound system and navigation display. The Premium Package was also equipped, adding power seats, a power moonroof, BMW Assist, and the aforementioned Nappa leather.

The factory three spoke steering wheel shows little wear, and the airbag recall has been completed by the dealer. The odometer reads 29,882 miles, with all electronics and gauges reported as functional. A set of carpeted floor mats is included along with the all weather items pictured above.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six made 333 hp when new and sends power rearward through a 6-speed manual gearbox. The 30k-mile service was completed in December 2016, and numerous service records are indicated on the Carfax, with records from both Rallye Motors as well as BMW of Portchester included in the sale.
The original window sticker can be seen above and shows options including the Cold Weather Package, Premium Package, Xenon headlights, navigation, and more.
A clean Carfax is shown in the gallery below alongside some recent service receipts. The trickle charger that was used for winter storage will be included in the sale.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Bottom End Service with New Rod Bearings
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 was originally delivered with an SMG automated manual, but was converted to a conventional 6-speed manual by the seller in 2016. It currently shows 97k miles and has been in California from new according to the attached Carfax. Recent services include new rod bearings, a rebuild of the VANOS system, and numerous other small and associated parts ranging from seals to motor mounts. Modifications include BC racing coilovers, a carbon fiber lip spoiler, and a short shift kit. This E46 M3 is offered with a clean Carfax and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The seller states that this M3 shows no evidence of past body or paintwork, and the bodywork is stock apart from a carbon fiber front lip spoiler. The windows and grille feature black high-gloss shadowline trim, and stock lighting. The suspension has been upgraded with a set of BC Racing fully adjustable coil overs, which feature height adjustment, and front camber adjustment with camber plates.
Several marks are present on the bodywork, which the seller has detailed in the gallery. The stock alloy wheels show significant curbing.

The interior features brushed aluminum shadow trim and the optional navigation system. The 6-speed manual transmission is set up with a short shifter paired to the stock knob. The seller states that all interior features work as they should, including the A/C.
Light wear is apparent on the black leather upholstery, and a new center armrest is included with the sale.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new, and was originally paired to a 6-speed SMG transmission. The seller converted the car from the SMG gearbox to a conventional manual and also performed a full rebuild of the VANOS system. The previous owner completed Inspection I, and the current owner performed a valve adjustment in September, 2016 along with a sub-frame inspection, and the Inspection II service and a second subframe inspection in December, 2016. No cracks are reported in the rear subframe.
The seller has provided summaries of the services involved in the VANOS upgrade, 6-speed manual conversion, and rod bearing upgrade:

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible shows 87k miles and features a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission. The second owner installed a Dinan Stage 4 package in 2009 that included a larger throttle body, upgraded software, and a high-flow mass air meter. The seller bought it from the second owner 5k miles ago in 2016, and other modifications include the installation of a carbon fiber lip spoiler, blacked-out front lenses, and Dinan badging. This E46 is being offered at no reserve with a clean AutoCheck and clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The Mystic Blue finish is believed original by the seller with blemishes limited to some minor chips along the hood and front bumper. Exterior modifications are limited to a blacked-out kidney grill, carbon fiber front spoiler lip, and Dinan badging.

Aside from surface wear to the front seat surfaces, steering wheel and trim pieces, the Gray Nappa leather interior remains well preserved. The odometer reads 87,637 miles, with all electronics and gauges reported as functional.
Provided photos exhibit the condition of the front seat upholstery, displaying noted wear along the side bolsters and thigh supports.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual transmission.  A Dinan Stage 3 package was installed by the original owner at 8k miles in 2007. A Dinan stage 4 upgrade was performed in 2009 and includes a larger throttle body, upgraded software, and a high-flow mass air meter. Service history is limited to work performed by the seller and include a recent oil change.
The AutoCheck report shows three owners from new with no accidents and residency in Florida since new. A recall issued in 2015 for the Takata-equipped airbag remains outstanding.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe is a mildly modified example that came from the factory with the ZCP Competition Package. Finished in Imola Red over a Black leather interior, the car has had four registered owners from new and currently shows 72k miles. The seller acquired it from Enthusiast Auto Group 20k miles ago in June 2013 and had the VANOS system serviced and routine maintenance performed by Coyne Performance. The S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual gearbox, and modifications include a retuned ECU, Euro-spec exhaust, Turner underdrive pulleys, Apex wheels, and more. This E46 M3 is now being offered with service records, a clean AutoCheck report, and a clear Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

18″ Apex ARC Eight wheels measure 9.5″ in width up front and 10″ out back. Pilot Sport tires reportedly showed between 5/32″ and 7/32″ tread depth in April 2017. The original ZCP suspension has been modified with a coilover kit from Ground Control, along with aftermarket rear strut mounts and a set of Powerflex rear trailing arm bushings.

To the seller’s knowledge, the car has not been involved in any prior accidents, though the rear bumper cover has been replaced with a factory unit and refinished to match. Smoked Depo corner lenses have recently been installed, and the original clear units are included with the sale.

Trimmed in black leather, the interior also features aluminum-look trim and an Alcantara-wrapped three-spoke wheel complete with an M Track Mode activation button. A 330D shifter has been added and reportedly provides a shorter throw. The power adjustable seats are heated, and the original navigation and Harmon/Kardon stereo remains fitted.

The S54 inline-six has been fitted with a VANOS repair kit from Beisan Systems, complete with uprated hardware. Further modifications include a reflashed ECU from TTFS, Turner underdrive pulleys, and a Mishimoto electric radiator fan and sensor. The exhaust system includes a BMW Euro-spec header, Euro intermediate pipe, free-flowing catalytic converter, and a CPI mid pipe. The most recent service included a valve adjustment, oil change, and replacement of all six coil packs. The 6-speed manual gearbox has been fitted with Rogue Engineering mounts.

Extensive service records are included with the sale, and a list showing all of the work performed since the seller acquired the car from Enthusiast Auto Group in 2013 is viewable in the gallery below.
The clean AutoCheck corroborates the four-owner history and can be viewed in the gallery. Two videos taken by the seller are included below.
https://youtu.be/dnpa6a_qq8I
https://youtu.be/9SSMiyywWTw

title: 33K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
listing_details: Rod Bearing Recall and Subframe Inspection Performed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe shows 33k miles from new and was recently acquired by the selling dealer from the original owner. Equipped with an S54 3.2L straight-six and an SMG II sequential manual transmission, the car was purchased new at BMW of Seattle and has been dealer-serviced since new. Selected features from new included the Phoenix Yellow Metallic finish, manual seats, xenon headlights, and parking distance control. Regular mechanical service has been performed, including a rod bearing recall in 2004. Rear subframe welds were inspected in 2009 and again in preparation for sale. The Inspection II service with valve adjustment was performed in 2013 at 26k miles. The selling dealer has added 3k miles and reports that it drives smoothly and shows no outstanding issues. This E46 M3 is sold with a clear Carfax and a clean Colorado title.

The Phoenix Yellow Metallic paint was an exclusive M3 color. Additionally, the car was optioned with a sunroof, Xenon lighting, and Parking Distance Sensors. No evidence of repainting is noted, all panels are original, and a paint gauge report is provided with the gallery photographs. The Carfax shows an accident-free history.

Forward surfaces have reportedly been protected by a clear bra covering since new. A couple isolated chips in the clear bra can be seen around the front tow loop socket. 18″ split-spoke M alloys wear Continental Extreme Contact tires measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Side skirts were damaged on a lift during the auction, but the seller has ordered new skirts and they will be painted and installed prior to delivery.

The black interior features Titan Shadow trim, an optional armrest, and an SMG II 6-speed sequential manual transmission. The dash and doors remain free of scuffs and carpets are protected with //M embroidered mats. The seller notes that airbag, and DME and SMG programming recalls have been performed. The odometer shows 32,819 miles.

The car was optioned with manual Black leather sport seats, and the upholstery shows little wear outside of minor creasing at the corners of the driver’s seat cushion bolsters. The storage compartment cover forward of the shifter and the cup holders in the center console also have minor scuffs.

A factory toolkit is equipped beneath the rear deck lid. A lug wrench was not provided on the M3 due to the included Mobility Kit, but the selling dealer has sourced one that will be included in the sale.

The S54 inline-six is backed by an SMG II 6-speed sequential shift transmission with a computer-controlled hydraulic clutch actuation. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. VANOS variable valve timing and individual throttle bodies lead to a factory rating of 333hp and 262 lb-ft of torque. A rod-bearing recall was performed in 2004, and the rear subframe welds were inspected in 2009 and again by the seller prior to sale. The car was serviced at BMW of Seattle and BMW of Palm Springs throughout its life, with fluid changes were performed within recommended intervals. An Inspection II service with a valve adjustment was performed in 2013 at 26k miles, and the oil and filter were changed within the last 100 miles.
A collection of lift shots showing the chassis and suspension components can be found in the gallery below.
Owner’s and sales literature are included with the sale, along with a vial of touch-up paint and three keys.

title: 41K-Mile 2006 BMW M3 ZCP Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: black leather upholstery shows little evidence of wear
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe shows just 41k miles and is equipped with a 6-speed manual and the Competition Package. The car has been fitted with the Dinan S Package, which consists of an intake, exhaust, short shifter, Stage 3 software flash, and a front strut tower bar. Other modifications include 3.91 rear gears, Koni yellow shocks, Eibach springs, and a BMW F10 M5 illuminated shift knob. The seller has owned the car for two years and had it serviced with an Inspection II, valve adjustment, new valve cover gasket, fresh fluids, and a VANOS upgrade with Beisan VANOS oil pump disc, sealing plate repair kit, and rebuilt solenoid coil pack. This E46 M3 is sold with records back to new, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

ZCP cars were fitted with 19″ BBS flow-formed cast alloy wheels measuring 8″ wide at the front and 9.5″ wide at the rear. Larger diameter front brake discs are also part of the package, as are larger rear brake caliper pistons and a quicker-rate steering rack. The seller states that the car retains its original paint.

The seller notes a few scrapes on the rear bumper caused by the previous owner, as well as a scrape on the underside of the right side of the front bumper that was caused by a parking curb. The tips of the Dinan exhaust are visible under the rear valence.

Interior modifications are limited to an illuminated shift knob from an F10 BMW M5, which is fitted to a Dinan short shift kit. The black leather upholstery shows little evidence of wear, and all of the interior features are said to work correctly. The ZCP package included an Alcantara-rimmed steering wheel, Alcantara emergency brake handle, and an “M-Track Mode” button mounted on the steering wheel.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual transmission and a 3.91:1 rear end in place of the original LSD. During the seller’s ownership, the car received the Inspection II service at 39k miles. Other maintenance performed at the same time included a valve adjustment and new valve cover gasket, new CPV O-ring, and a VANOS upgrade with Beisan VANOS oil pump disk, sealing plate repair kit, seal repair kit, and rebuilt solenoid coil pack. The seller has also replaced the brake, power steering, transmission, and differential oil with BMW fluids.

This E46 has been upgraded with numerous Dinan parts and received a Dinan S package serial number as shown above. Modifications include a Dinan exhaust, Dinan intake with MAF, Dinan short shifter, Dinan stage 3 software flash, and a Dinan front strut tower bar. Other upgrades include adjustable Koni yellow shocks and Eibach pro-kit springs.

Records are said to be complete to new, and the original books, manuals, window sticker from the time of re-sale, and invoices for the Dinan upgrades are included in the file. The seller states that the car has been maintained by San Francisco BMW since 2008. Printed records are available from 2008 onwards, and earlier records can be recalled through the BMW dealer system.
The Carfax is attached and shows no issues.

title: 41k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is a largely stock convertible that shows just over 41k miles on its 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and 6-speed manual transmission. Acquired recently by the selling dealer, the car is equipped with the Cold Weather Package and finished in Imola Red over black leather. It is described as unmodified aside from suble exterior cosmetics and received the factory rod bearing recall in 2005. This E46 M3 is sold with a Carfax report, records from new, and a clean Washington, DC title.

The exterior is finished in Imola Red, and a handful of chips are noted in the front end along with nicks on the passenger fender and quarter panel as pictured below. A minor rear-end accident in August 2013 required replacement of the rear bumper and exhaust tips. The damage was documented in photos and body shop receipts, both shown in the gallery below.

Cosmetic updates include Euro clear corner markers and black-painted kidney grilles, and optional 19″ polished split-spokes wear Hankook rubber mounted in 2015. Auto-leveling HID headlamps feature built-in washers as part of the Cold Weather Package. The fabric convertible top is reported to operate correctly and is detailed in the photos below. A wind deflector is also included in its factory storage case.

Black leather seats are heated as part of the Cold Weather Package, which also included rain-sensing wipers. Two tears are noted in the headliner around the hinge mechanisms for the convertible top. Plastics show occasional evidence of use, and typical E46 stickiness is noted on the storage compartment doors ahead of the 6-speed shifter. The arm rest lid remains functional despite a cracked hinge per the seller.

The dash is said to be free of cracks or bubbling and gloss black trim is detailed in several photos. Instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedo and a digital odometer showing just over 41k miles. The factory optional Harmon Kardon stereo system remains mounted in the center stack. A Takata passenger airbag recall was performed in 2015, and the air conditioning system received a new evaporator and recharge soon afterward.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new and received updated rod bearings under warranty in 2005. This car is one of approximately half of E46 M3 convertible which received a 6-speed manual gearbox. A mass air flow meter was replaced in June 2015, and a 45k-mile inspection and oil change were carried out in late July 2017. An M Performance front strut brace was installed by a Maryland dealer in 2013. The selling dealer has driven the car approximately 100 miles.

The Carfax report shows the rear-end incident described above, noting minor damage and no airbag deployment. No further accidents or thefts are indicated, though a second recall for the driver-side airbag remains open.

An organized binder includes a complete service history from new according to the seller, with highlights photographed in the gallery below. Original manuals and other literature are also included along with a BMW flashlight, tool kit, and trunk-mounted air compressor.

title: Original-Owner 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a one-owner example equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, 6-speed manual gearbox, and the ZCP Competition Package. It was sold new at BMW of Fremont, California and has since been driven 87k miles by the seller. Finished in Silver Grey Metallic over a Grey Nappa leather interior, the car has been modified with CSL headers and wider front wheels, along with a number of aftermarket components from Dinan, Turner Motorsports, StopTech, and Evolve Tuning. Work within the past 5k miles included new tires, a four-wheel alignment has been performed, replacement motor mounts, new brakes, and more. This E46 M3 is being offered with records back to new, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

A Stage III suspension package from Dinan has been installed along with a set of Monoball rear-trailing arm bushings from Turner Motorsports. In 2014, the rear subframe was reinforced with a Turner kit, and a four-wheel alignment was recently performed following the installation of new front control arm bushings. A CSL-style trunk lid has also been added.

Earlier this year, the passenger-side was repainted and a replacement door was fitted in response to accident damage. The driver-side rear quarter panel was refinished in 2010 after it made contact with a driveway gate. Some scrapes are evident underneath the front bumper, and some stone chips, commensurate with the mileage are present on the leading surfaces of the fenders, bumper, and hood.

A pair of factory 8.5″ wide CSL European alloys have replaced the original 8″ front ZCP wheels, and some curb rash is present on the outer lips. StopTech brakes have also been installed in place of the original ZCP components. 380mm slotted and vented rotors are used up front in conjunction with a set of alloy six-piston calipers, while the rear is managed by four-piston units on 355mm rotors. Within the past 5k miles. New brake pads have been installed all-around, the rear rotors were replaced, and the system has been flushed.

An Alcantara M Multifunction wheel has been added, which the seller states is the only way to get cruise control on a ZCP. It has recently been rewrapped by Coby Wheel. The Track Mode activation button has been relocated to the center console, and the OEM navigation system and Harmon/Kardon sound system remains installed.

The Grey Nappa leather seats are heated, and the driver’s seat has been partially reupholstered with new leather, as has the center console. A small amount of wear is evident on the passenger’s bolster, and some minor separation has occurred on the seams of the rear seat.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual gearbox. Modifications from Dinan include a cold-air intake, throttle body, and exhaust. The original headers and catalytic converters have been replaced with units from a European CSL, and Evolve Tuning has reflashed the ECU. A BMW Inspection II was performed in November of 2014, and replacement connecting rod bearings, motor mounts, thermostat, pre-cat 02 sensors, MAF sensor have been installed within the past 5k miles. The most recent smog test was performed in July.
The service folder contains records dating back to new, including receipts from professional service and documentation of modifications or services performed by the seller.
The included Carfax corroborates the one-owner history and shows California registrations from new.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
listing_details: Rod Bearing and Airbag Recalls Performed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Convertible is equipped with a 6-speed manual transmission and is said to be unmodified, with available BMW dealer service history is available documenting maintenance back to new. The car was sold new in Pennsylvania and stayed with its first owner until 2005. The second owner kept the car from 2005 until the seller purchased it two months ago and brought it to South Carolina. The S54 inline-six received the rod bearing recall in 2004 at just over 1k miles, and the driver and passenger airbag recalls were completed in the last two years. This E46 is offered with a clean Carfax and a clean South Carolina title in the seller’s name.

Per the attached Warranty Inquiry, this e46 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic. Correct 18″ alloy wheels are fitted, and the car retains stock lighting. The seller notes a few finish issues that are documented in the gallery, including a small concentration of chips at the center of the front bumper, scuffs underneath the fog lights, a dime sized ding on the passenger door, and a small scratch under the driver’s side headlight.
The convertible top appears taut, and features a glass rear window with defroster. The seller notes a few minor wear spots from folding.

The interior is trimmed in Imola Red leather, and retains the correct radio and working interior equipment throughout. The radio was replaced with a re-manufactured unit in 2012 per the attached service history. BMW issued a recall for the driver and passenger airbags, and both units in this example have been replaced. The driver’s airbag was replaced in December, 2016 and the passenger’s airbag in June, 2015.

Light wear and looseness is visible on the driver’s seat, though the passenger and rear seats show less evidence of use. The seller notes a few finish issues with the interior trim, including nicks on the ash tray door and cupholders, and cracks in the painted finish on the interior door handles, both of which are shown in the gallery.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is unmodified, and was rated at 333 horsepower in US market trim. The original owner had the rod bearing recall addressed early in the car’s life, in 2004 at just over 1k miles. A dealer service history is included, and covers services back to new. No modifications are said to be present.
Numerous photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax is attached, and shows a regular record of dealer service, confirming the dealer service report. No accidents or issues are indicated.

title: 2005 BMW M3 6-Speed ZCP Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 M3 Coupe shows 116k miles and is optioned with the ZCP “Competition Package” which included enlarged cross-drilled brake rotors, quicker steering, Track Mode traction control, 19″ wheels, and cosmetic enhancements. Power comes from an S54 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Originally a special order for the Business Manager of BMW South in Miami, Florida, the car has had two owners and was purchased by the seller in August 2006 with 6k miles. 110k miles have been driven since, and the car remains unmodified apart from a Sirius XM satellite radio. Both incidents are noted on the Carfax, which records no other issues. Service records from 2006 to present are included in the sale, and the car received an oil change and inspection in preparation for sale. This Competition Package E46 M3 is sold with service records, a Carfax, and a clean Florida title.

The Interlagos Blue Metallic paint was offered exclusively with ZCP-optioned cars, which were offered only from 2004-2006. Shortly after the seller’s purchase, the car was involved in a minor front-end accident in which airbags did not deploy, and more recently the bumper was replaced after an parking lot curb strike. The body has also received paint repair for clear coat separation on the hood and a garage scrape. Some scratches and chips can be seen around the nose of the car currently. Receipts for bodywork are shown in gallery photographs below.

The seller mentions a few bubbles in the passenger-side window tint. The factory 19″ wheels were borrowed from the Euro-spec M3 CSL, and show some curb damage. Tires are Bridgestone Potenzas, with rears showing 5k Miles of wear, and fronts that will require replacement in the near future. The seller reports that the car has been garage-kept throughout his ownership.

Competition Package interior enhancements include the aluminum trim accents, and an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel that has been covered with an aftermarket item. The three-spoke wheel is equipped with a “Track Mode” button that raises the engagement threshold on the Dynamic Stability Control system. A Harman Kardon sound system was optioned at purchase and a Sirius satellite radio was installed by the seller. Leather sport seats have cloth inserts and show some creasing around the bolsters. The headliner and rear view mirror were replaced in 2016. 116,005 miles are shown on the digital odometer.

The 3.2 Liter S54 inline-six motor is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and the power rating is unchanged from base-spec M3 cars at 333hp. Within the last two years, the control arm bushings have been replaced, a new battery installed, and both airbag recalls performed. In 2017, the VANOS unit was adjusted and valve cover gasket replaced, and the cooling system serviced with a new water pump, expansion tank line, fan clutch, thermostat, drive belts, and idler and tensioner pulleys. The parking brake was adjusted, oil changed, and a general inspection performed in preparation for the sale.
The factory tool kit remains in place beneath the rear deck.

A recent Carfax report records the two instances of bodywork mentioned above, and documents two owners in Florida over the life of the car. Maintenance records cover work performed during the seller’s ownership, documenting a period from 2006 to present.

title: 29K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe is a two-owner example that shows 29k miles and is equipped with a six-speed manual gearbox. The seller acquired it in 2015 and has covered around 1,500 miles with it over the past two and a half years. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a Black leather interior, it has been garage-kept and is said to remain stock aside from a set of WeatherTech mats. The S54 3.2L inline-six was dealer-serviced by the original owner and has been maintained by an independent BMW specialist for the seller. Recent maintenance is limited to fluid changes. This E46 M3 is now being offered with service records, a clear Carfax and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

No prior accidents or damage are indicated on the included Carfax, and to the seller’s knowledge, the Titanium Silver finish remains original. When not being driven, the car has been stored in a climate-controlled garage for the past two and a half years. Cosmetic issues include signs of delamination on the driver’s rearview mirror glass.
No modifications to body, chassis, or suspension have been installed, and the original 18” wheels are currently shod in Michelin Pilot Sport rubber.

Inside, the Black leather interior shows to be well preserved with minimal wear on the leather-wrapped wheel and seat surfaces. It left the factory without BMW’s in-dash navigation system but was optioned with a Harmon/Kardon stereo system, sunroof, heated seats, and more. Two small bubbles are present on the passenger-side armrest.

Recent maintenance performed by German Performance Service in Boston, Massachusetts included a routine fluid change and a BMW Inspection 1. The S54 remains unmodified and has undergone any open recalls according to the seller, including connecting rod bearing replacement.
The original M floor mats, keys, and glove compartment books have been retained.
One previous owner, no accidents, and routine services can be seen on the included Carfax.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
listing_details: HK Sound System, Pioneer Touchscreen Nav
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is equipped with the Competition Package, a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, and a 6-speed manual transmission. Finished in Silver Gray Metallic with a Cinnamon leather interior, the car is optioned with a moonroof, power front seats with memory, Xenon headlights, and Harman Kardon sound system. The seller reports that he purchased the car new but registered it in other people’s names until recently. Now showing 106k miles, this example has been fitted with numerous modifications to the interior, exterior, engine, and suspension, including a preemptive Turner Motorsport subframe reinforcement kit. The seller has completed most maintenance personally, often performing interval services ahead of schedule. This E46 M3 most recently passed a California smog check in July 2016 and is now being offered with an accident-free Carfax report, original window sticker/manuals, receipts for most parts purchases, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Silver Gray Metallic finish (A08) benefits from a front-end respray to address rock chips. The seller reports this M3 has been garaged from new, and has no accident history or prior bodywork. The Euro front bumper has no license plate holes drilled, but does have a dime-sized mark as shown in gallery phots. 19″ Competition Package alloy wheels have BMW center caps and wear Kumho Ecsta PS91 tires all around.

The seller has added BMW front wheel hubs and front/rear wheel bearings, as well as Rogue Engineering wheel spacers (18mm front / 15mm rear) with extended bolts. A four-wheel alignment was recently performed, and a Turner Motorsport E46 Rear Chassis/Subframe Reinforcement Kit has been installed, although an inspection by Performance Technic of Fremont, California showed no subframe cracking issues.

Shortly after buying the car, the seller completed an interior swap from original Black leather (N5SW) to Cinnamon, adding elements of the Cold Weather Package at the same time. A Pioneer AVIC-Z140BH touchscreen navigation system with Bluetooth, reverse camera, and USB connectivity has been installed along with hardwiring for Valentine One radar detector which is not included.
Further interior modifications have included adding the following equipment and trim:
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features 24-valves, double-VANOS variable valve timing, and was rated at 333 hp when new. Maintenance by the seller has included:
Other updates have included adding these parts and equipment:
The exhaust system now includes a BMW Euro cat Section 1 and thermal ceramic coated BMW Euro headers. Other underside updates include:

This window sticker confirms original colors and options. The Competition Package contributed $4,000 to the $58,490 total MSRP and added compound brakes, cross-drilled rotors, light alloy wheels, aluminum interior trim, and an M-sport steering wheel.

This Carfax shows no accidents or damage and includes several gaps in vehicle history. Although the report captures records from three California owners, the seller indicates the car has been with him from new and was registered to other family members for personal reasons.
The four videos above provide these views:

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
listing_details: New Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 Tires
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe shows 60k miles and has had three owners from new. Power comes from a 3.2L S54B32 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission. The original owner purchased it from BMW of Henderson, Nevada and had it until 2010 with 45k miles. The second owner added 6k miles before selling to the current owner in Colorado in 2015. The car has received regular and scheduled maintenance throughout its life, including the S54 rod bearing recall performed in 2004, new driveline fluids, and an SMG programming update. Inspection of the rear subframe revealed no issues. The Inspection II service and 60k-mile valve adjustment were performed prior to the sale. The Carfax shows no accidents and service records date back to new. This E46 M3 SMG is sold on consignment by the selling dealer with a clear Colorado title.

The car has been stored indoors and clear stone guards have been applied to the front air dam and hood. Panels are all said to be original with the factory VIN tag in place. The hood bra has since been removed but the bumper covering remains in place and shows several small scratches. The seller mentions one touchup visible on the trunk trim above the license plate.

All glass and lenses are said to be clear and free of chips and cracks. Nineteen-inch Style 67 alloy wheels show only one spot of curb rash on the left rear wheel, and wear new Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires measuring 225/40 up front, and 265/30 at the rear.

The Black Nappa Leather interior features brushed aluminum accents and includes a Harmon Kardon sound system, power-adjusted memory seats, an electric moon roof, and parking distance control. The seller states that all interior equipment is functional, including the auto-dimming rearview mirror, and digital displays that are free of dead pixels. The digital odometer shows 59,477 miles.

The seller states that a little wear can be found on interior surfaces, though the seats present with minor creasing and bolster flattening, and some wear can be seen on the center console and door handle.

The 3.2-Liter S54B32 inline-six cylinder engine is paired with a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission. Power was rated at 333hp in factory tune, and the car is said to be unmodified in any way. Service receipts and a factory service booklet show a history of regular and scheduled maintenance over the life of the car; the car was serviced exclusively at BMW dealerships until 2010. The S54 rod bearing recall was conducted in 2004 at 17.5k miles, and the SMG has received updated programming. Transmission and differential fluids were recently changed, and an Inspection II service and 60k-mile valve adjustment were performed prior to the auction. The results of a Blackstone oil analysis can be found in the gallery.

The factory tool kit is complete and resides below the rear deck lid. No jack or lug wrench are included due to the inclusion of the Mobility Kit. Subframe welds have been inspected periodically over the life of the car, and the seller states that no issues have developed.

Service records have been preserved from purchase in the binder pictured above, and a recent Carfax reports an accident-free history with three owners in Nevada, Iowa, and Colorado. A full collection of factory and dealer literature is included, along with a VHS cassette and BMW Performance Delivery Center binder. A list of optional equipment selected is as follows:

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 shows 81k miles and is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. The car was purchased new at Elmhurst BMW in Illinois and optioned with the Premium and Cold Weather Packages. It remained in the suburban Chicago area prior to the seller, who purchased the car in 2010 and moved it to Michigan. The car has since been driven 20k miles seasonally, and it has reportedly been stored covered and indoors. Service was performed exclusively at BMW dealerships and marque specialty shops, and the recalls for rod bearings, subframe welds, and airbags have been addressed. The car is described as unmodified apart from 18″ M3 CSL replica wheels, a CSL-style rear splitter, and a Scorza muffler. This E46 M3 is sold with a clean Carfax report, records back to 2007, and a clear Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver paint is the factory color, and a CSL-style rear diffuser has been added. Minimal stone chips are noted, and two touch ups can be seen on the passenger-side front fender. Other blemishes mentioned are a gash on the driver-side rocker molding and evidence of paintless dent removal near the deck lid. The seller reports that the car was garaged and seasonally driven over most of its life. Parking Distance Control sensors can be seen on the rear bumper.

Window and door seals were replaced in 2012, while new OEM taillights and front turn signal lenses were fitted this year. Exterior bulbs has been replaced all around, and European-market side view mirrors were installed. 18″ CSL replica wheels were manufactured by VMR, and Bridgestone Potenzas were installed about 20k miles ago in 2010.

The interior is equipped with black Nappa leather, as well as the Premium and Cold Weather Packages. Features include a power moonroof, heated memory seats, a folding rear bench, and a pass-through ski bag. The center console and window actuators were replaced by the seller, and an OEM MP3 auxiliary jack was added. Bavarian Soundwerks speakers and a lighted OEM M3 shift knob have also been installed. The auto-dimming rearview mirror was rebuilt and interior bulbs were replaced. The A/C is said to blow cold and interior equipment is said to function as-designed, with no dead pixel issues in the digital displays.

The upholstery shows bolster wear and flattening on the driver’s seat, and an airbag recall was completed earlier this year. The sunroof seal was replaced by the previous owner, while the door seals were replaced under the seller. The split rear bench shows little evidence of use.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 hp when new and is paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Shortly after the seller’s purchase, the car received a new driveshaft flex disc, fuel filter, water pump, tensioner unit, and thermostat gasket. A new oil pan was installed by a previous owner. The S54 rod bearing recall was performed in 2008, and a weep was noted at the rear pinion seal following an inspection.
A complete factory tool kit, spare tire, and jack can be found in the trunk.

The seller has provided a collection of photographs detailing the underside, and the rear subframe recall was addressed in 2010. New control arm bushings were installed, as was the Scorza muffler seen above.

Documentation includes factory manuals and sales literature, a list of services performed between 2001-2007, most records covering 2007-present, and a Carfax detailing an accident-free history in suburban Chicago under four prior owners. A walk-around video can be seen below.

title: 28K-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Coupe is a 6-speed manual example that was first sold in April 2001 at Morristown BMW in New Jersey. The original owner reportedly kept this example in a climate controlled garage with a collection of Ferraris, Maseratis, and other M cars and drove it just 24k miles over 15 years of ownership. The car is equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and is optioned with 19″ alloys, Harman Kardon speakers, and Nappa leather sport seats. The seller purchased it in September 2016 and has added 4k miles since. Recently serviced with a new air mass meter, this E46 M3 comes with a service history file, a clean Carfax, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The Titan Silver Metallic (354) is believed to be original, with no history of any paintwork or body damage per the seller. The optional 19″ M Double-Spoke II polished alloys show some curb rash on the passenger side and wear Hankook Ventus V12 tires.

E46 M3s have a thin factory rear spoiler affixed to the boot lid, and this car is fitted with factory Bi-Xenon headlights. This car came equipped with the same MacPherson strut and multi-link suspension setup as the E46 3-Series cars, although it was modified by BMW M GmbH with a wider track, thicker aluminum thrust plate, rear links with steel balljoints, special spring and shock rates, larger anti-roll bars, and more.

Inside, the Black Nappa leather (N5SW) upholstery is accompanied by High-Gloss Black (434) trim. Interior features include powered front sport seats, Harman Kardon speakers, and electric sunroof. A set of OMP aluminum pedals have been installed.

The stock multi-function leather steering wheel remains fitted along with the illuminated M leather shift knob. A button in the dash activates the Dynamic Stability Control function. The power accessories, air conditioning, cruise control, lights, Business CD head unit, and the gray-faced gauges are reported to be working correctly. The digital odometer shows 28,693 miles that are considered accurate by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double VANOS variable valve timing and drive-by-wire throttle control. The Getrag Type D 6-speed manual gearbox sends power to a 3.62:1 final drive rear end with M Variable Differential Lock. The car was serviced in preparation for sale with the replacement of a faulty air mass meter that had caused the check engine light to be illuminated.
An accident free Carfax confirms ownership history and mileage. The included service history file is said to be complete from new, and the car comes with its original owner’s manuals and spare.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Coupe is equipped with a 6-speed manual and is finished in Alpine White over Cinnamon leather. The seller is a BMW CCA member who acquired the car a year and a half ago from its second owner. Now showing 87k miles, this example is said to remain unmodified apart from the application of a 3M clear bra on the front bumper, hood, and mirrors. Service records date to 2004 and indicate dealership maintenance and an Inspection I in 2009. An Inspection II was performed in 2015 and a recent PPI was completed with no reported issues. Approximately 10k miles have been added by the seller and this E46 M3 is being offered for sale in Oregon with an accident-free Carfax and a clean title held by the seller’s bank due to an outstanding loan on the car.

The Alpine White finish is believed to be original with no paint or body repairs per the seller or indicated on the provided Carfax report. A scratch on the side-skirt under the passenger door is detailed in the gallery. A 3M clear bra has been installed on the front bumper, front of the hood, and on the side mirrors.
Optional 19” double-spoke wheels are wrapped in Toyo Proxes rubber.

Inside, the Cinnamon leather shows minimal wear and light creasing on the driver-side bolsters. Optioned with brushed aluminum shadow trim, the interior is said to be unmodified with some evidence of use on the leather-wrapped shift knob and wear on the passenger-side of the center console as detailed in the gallery. A set of factory carpet mats and all-weather floor mats are included in the sale.

Grey-faced gauges include a 185-mph speedometer and show 87,274 miles on the odometer, with 10k added by the seller. An auxiliary input for the factory stereo is fitted in the glovebox. All interior functions are said to work properly.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual gearbox and was equipped with double VANOS variable valve timing and drive-by-wire throttle control, with a factory rating of 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm. A recent compression test showed between 180-190 psi across all six cylinders, with results viewable in the gallery. A small oil leak was discovered during a recent airbag recall service. No cracks are reported in the rear subframe.
Additional images of the undercarriage and subframe can be viewed in the gallery.
Many service records from new are included and indicate dealership servicing and an Inspection I in 2009. An Inspection II was reportedly performed in 2015, although the receipt cannot be located.
An included Carfax report shows no issues and indicates dealership servicing by all three previous owners in California and Oregon.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Convertible is a Canadian-market example that was imported to the US in 2002. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission, and this example has been modified with a carbon fiber intake, FK coilovers and adjustable Koni shocks, Stoptech brakes, AC Schnitzer pedals, ASA wheels, and angel eye LEDs. Now showing 75k miles, this E46 M3 convertible was recently inspected by the selling dealer and is being offered for sale at no reserve with an accident-free Carfax and a clean Minnesota title.

After testing the finish with a paint meter, it was discovered that the passenger-side front fender and rear quarter have been repainted though no accidents are reported on the included Carfax. Small scratches are present on the lower side of the front valance. Angel Eye LED headlights are installed.

Some blemishes are noted on the ASA wheels. Stoptech brakes and Bridgestone Potenza tires are fitted at all four corners, and FK G23 Coilovers feature adjustable Koni shocks. The black soft top shows a clear rear window in photographs. One of the covers for the hinge mechanism is missing but will reportedly be replaced for the sale.

Black leather sport seats are heated and equipped with electric memory functions. Additional options include a multifunction M-Sport steering wheel, headlight cleaning system, on-board computer, hi-fi Harman Kardon audio system with a 6-disc CD changer, and Dynamic Stability Control. All functions are said to function properly with no warning lights presently illuminated.
Instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedometer and a digital odometer that shows 75,735 miles. AC Schnitzer pedals have been installed.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired to a 6-speed manual gearbox and was rated at 333 horsepower when new. It is equipped with a carbon fiber intake, and a recent inspection was completed by the selling dealer. No subframe cracking issues were found. The seller notes that while some 3M clear tape is present on the intake, no cracks are evident.
The Carfax shows importation from Canada to the US in February 2002 and displays no issues.

title: 59K-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
listing_details: Recent Radiator Hoses, VANOS Repair, Brakes
Newer Control Arms, Trailing Arm Bushings
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a largely stock convertible with 59k indicated miles on its 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and 6-speed manual transmission. Finished in Mystic Blue over black leather and equipped with the Cold Weather Package, the car spent its early years in the Southeast and Michigan before coming to West Virginia following the seller’s acquisition in 2014. Work over the last three years included paint correction, new radiator hoses, a VANOS repair, and replacement of suspension components as described below. This E46 convertible is sold with a clean Carfax report and a clear West Virginia title.

Mystic Blue Metallic paint has been extensively polished by the seller to bring it to its current condition. Rock chips are noted on the front end, and a small area of crazing is pointed out in the photos below. Some paintwork has likely been carried out according to the seller, who cites remnants of masking tape on the grilles and a faint line on a rear quarter panel. No accidents are shown on the Carfax report.

Factory 19″ polished split-spokes wear Continental and Michelin tires mixed front to rear, all of which show plenty of tread according to the seller. New lenses has been installed over the xenon headlamps, which feature built-in washers as part of the Cold Weather Package. The fabric convertible top houses a heated glass window and is demonstrated as operable in photos.

Interior condition is described as clean aside from cracking in the powered driver’s leather sport seat. The car was ordered with the Cold Weather Package, which included heated seats as well as rain-sensing wipers. The cabin air filter and power window switches have been replaced by the seller.

Instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedo and the digital odometer reportedly shows 59k miles, nearly 20k of which were added by the seller. The factory optional Harmon Kardon stereo system remains mounted in the center stack. An illuminated dash light is said to indicate malfunction of the tire pressure monitoring system.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower for the US market. Upper and lower radiator hoses were replaced with blue Mishimoto silicone items during the seller’s ownership, and drive belts are also newer. A 2016 VANOS failure was repaired with a used OEM hub and an upgraded oil pump disk from Beisan Systems. All new hardware was used for the project, though no seals or solenoids were replaced. A new evap purge valve should be installed soon according to the seller.

Roughly half of E46 M3 convertibles were fitted with 6-speed manual gearboxes, here featuring a rebuilt shifter. An M Performance front strut brace has been fitted, and both front control arms and ball joints were replaced during the seller’s ownership. Rear trailing arm bushings are also newer, as are brake rotors and pads. The rear subframe mounting points have reportedly been checked at regular intervals.

The Carfax report dates from late 2016 and shows no accidents, thefts, or other issues aside from an open recall for the Takata driver-side airbag. Regular maintenance has been performed for the seller by a mechanic friend, though few records are available. The 60k-mile Inspection II has not yet been completed per the seller. The car is sold with a partial tool kit and other factory accessories.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is a modified example finished in Titanium Silver over a Black and Grey interior that shows 80k miles. It has been with the seller since August 2017 and comes equipped with Ground Control coilovers, a Brembo big brake kit, Volk 18” alloys, CSL trunk lid, and more. The S54 3.2-liter inline-six underwent a rod bearing recall at 35k miles and the six-speed manual gearbox was replaced under warranty less than 40k miles ago. Further modifications include ceramic-coated Euro headers, a Supersprint exhaust, and Dinan rear differential. This E46 M3 is now being offered with service records back to 2004, a clean Carfax, original parts, and a clear Kentucky title in the seller’s name.

To the seller’s knowledge, the Titanium Silver finish remains original. The CSL trunk lid and carbon fiber rear diffuser were installed by a previous owner in 2007. Further cosmetic upgrades include blacked-out kidney grilles and side vents. The original windshield seal and rear quarter glass rubber shows signs of deterioration, and the driver’s side rearview mirror has begun to delaminate.

One-piece Forged Volk TE37SL pressed-graphite colored rims in 8.5″ front and 9.5″ rear widths are fitted with Michelin Pilot A/S 3 rubber. Braking has been upgraded with a Brembo big brake kit, comprised of upgraded calipers, drilled rotors, and stainless lines in the front and rear. Suspension modifications include a set of Ground Control coilovers and control arms, along with stiffer Rogue Engineering control arm bushings and shock mounts. No signs of cracking were evident on the rear subframe during the recent PPI.

Black Nappa Leather seats are heated and power adjustable with optional 4-way lumbar support. ZHP black cubed aluminum trim, black leather door cards, F-series M3 shift knob, and custom shift boot have also been installed. The rearview mirror shows signs of delamination around the edges. Piano black rear-armrests are currently installed, although a set of matching cubed-aluminum ones are included with the sale. 80K miles are shown on the odometer and believed accurate.

The S54 inline-six has been modified with a set of Euro headers, which have been custom-finished in a blue ceramic coating from Jet-Hot. Further exhaust modifications include a Euro section tied into a SuperSprint section II and rear silencer. Drivetrain modifications include a Dinan 3.91 rear differential and Rogue Engineering short shifter and transmission mount.

The included service records dating back to 2004 show that the rod bearing recall was performed at 35k miles and that under warranty, a replacement transmission was installed at 41k miles. Regular maintenance is reported to have been performed at or before the suggested intervals, including oil, transmission, and differential fluid changes. The Vanos system received a clean bill of health during the most recent valve adjustment and a diagram showing valve clearances prior to adjustment is shown in the gallery below, along with the results from the recent PPI.
Photos of the undercarriage can be seen in the gallery below.

The included Carfax shows five previous owners and no prior accidents or damage. The original trunk lid, original suspension components, brake calipers, original door cards, and a BMW car cover are all included in the sale.
https://vimeo.com/239362676

title: 2004 BMW M3 SMG
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 shows 87k miles and is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with an SMG-II sequential transmission. The seller has driven 7k miles since purchasing the car one year ago. The car was optioned with Xenon headlights, a sunroof, hi-fi audio, and an Imola Red leather interior. Around $13k in service receipts document maintenance performed since the car’s warranty terms expired. Modifications include the installation of a CSL-style front air valance. Work included the rear subframe repair, replacement of driveline seals, a new SMG pump, and a $1200 Inspection II service. This 2004 E46 M3 SMG is sold with service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

The Silver Gray Metallic paint is said to show no notable blemishes apart from a few rock chips pictured in gallery closeups below. A recent Carfax describes an accident-free history. The seller recently had the car polished, and notes that is has been garaged and was exclusively street-driven to their knowledge. Parking distance control sensors were optioned at purchase.

The front bumper cover has been replaced with a CSL style piece. 19″ Style 135 paired-spoke alloys show a few areas of light curb wear and wear Goodyear Eagle F1 tires measuring 245/35 up front and 275/30 out back. The optional Lighting Package includes Xenon headlights and washers, which were deleted with the installation of the new bumper cover.

The interior is finished in Imola Red leather with a black dash and carpeting. Light creasing and bolster flattening is visible on both front seats. Interior options include a center armrest, a tinted power moonroof, and hi-fi audio with a 6-disc CD changer. A recall on the driver’s airbag is outstanding. Around 87k miles are shown on the digital odometer.
The rear bench seat shows little evidence of use.

The S54 3.2 Liter inline-six is paired with a SMG II sequential manual gearbox. A $7k service in 2014 included an Inspection II at 70k miles, a subframe inspection and repair, a VANOS rebuild, some driveline seals, and a new oil pump disk. Other highlights provided by the seller include the replacement of the timing chain, spark plugs, valve cover gasket, pinion replacement, and a power steering pressure line at 70k miles; an SMG pump replaced under warranty at 40k miles; and a tire replacement. The brake rotors and pads have recently been replaced by the seller, who states that service receipts for work performed since the end of the warranty period total around $13k.

The seller has included a collection of photographs documenting the underside condition. The 2014 work invoice shown in the gallery notes a crack found in a rear subframe mount that was resolved with a Turner motorsports kit.

Reciepts for work conducted since the expiration of the warranty period are said to total around $13k. A recent Carfax describes an accident-free history under previous owners in Maryland, Kentucky, and Ohio.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is finished in Steel Gray over a grey interior and shows 73k miles. Power comes from an 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual, and modifications include a set of aftermarket black alloy wheels, blacked-out trim, and a short shifter. Around 6,500 miles have been added by the seller during his two years of ownership, and recent maintenance included a dealership maintenance inspection and oil change. This E46 M3 is now being offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax and a clear Oregon title in the seller’s name.

Cosmetic modifications include a set of gloss black aftermarket wheels and blacked-out trim. The seller notes that some small scratches are present in the paint, along with the typical road chips on the leading surfaces.

The driver’s seat shows some wear and the original stereo/navigation system remains installed, though dead pixels are present on the screen. Interior modifications are reportedly limited to an aftermarket billet aluminum short shifter, and 73k miles are shown on the odometer.

The 3.2-liter S54 3.2 inline-six is backed by a six-speed manual gearbox. Prior service records were lost when the seller acquired the car, though work performed at the local BMW dealership earlier this year included a maintenance inspection and oil change in May.
The included Carfax does not report any prior accidents or damage and shows three previous owners.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe shows 49,950 miles and is finished in Silver Grey metallic over a grey interior. Power comes from a 3.2L S54B32 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission. The car is reportedly unmodified and was optioned with electrically adjustable heated seats, Xenon lights, a Harmon Kardon sound system, 19″ Style 67 wheels, and more as described below. This E46 M3 had four previous owners before the seller acquired it in September. It is now offered with the owner’s manual and factory books, a clean Carfax, and a clear North Carolina title.

Finished in Silver Grey Metallic, some imperfections are shown in the provided photos. The seller reports that the front bumper has been drilled for a license plate. The 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels show only one spot of curb rash on the left front wheel, and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires.

The Nappa gray interior includes electrically adjustable and heated seats, park distance control, navigation, and the Harmon Kardon sound system. The seller notes creasing on the driver’s seat bolsters, the leather on the center armrest exhibits some cracking, and the A-pillar fabric is sagging.

All-weather floor mats have been added, and the remainder of the interior is reportedly unmodified. The seller states that all interior equipment is functional, including the auto-dimming rearview mirror. The head unit is said to show some dead pixels, and the digital odometer shows 49,950 miles.
This M3 is powered by a 3.2L S54B32 inline-six that was rated at 333 hp when new and is paired to a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission.
Photos are provided of two common rear subframe failure areas. Decoding the VIN shows the following optional equipment:

The Carfax report verifies four previous owners and steady accumulation of mileage. No accidents or thefts are indicated and there is an outstanding recall for a front airbag replacement. A cold-start video is shown below.

title: 9K-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package SMG
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 shows just 9,158 miles and is equipped with the Competition Package, a 3.2L S54 inline-six, and a 6-speed SMG sequential manual transmission. This final-year E46 coupe remains unmodified and is optioned with the premium package, rear park distance control, dynamic stability control, a power glass roof, Xenon headlights, a navigation system, and a Harmon Kardon sound system with a 6-CD changer. It has reportedly had two owners, with California history listed on the Carfax report through 2015. This E46 M3 is now being offered by the selling dealer with an accident-free Carfax, some records, and a clean Missouri title.

The seller reports that the car has not had any repainting or body repairs, and no accidents are shown on the included Carfax report. 19” Competition Package alloy wheels are wrapped in Continental ContiSportContact tires.
Interior components remain unmodified, and the black leather seats present well in photographs.

An Alcantara-wrapped ZCP wheel and checked aluminum trim are part of the Competition Package. The digital display shows no pixel-related issues and indicates just 9,158 miles from new. The functional factory navigation system is pictured in the gallery.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is equipped with 24 valves and double-VANOS variable valve timing, producing 333 horsepower when new. Some service records are included in the sale, and car was recently inspected by the seller. A service in February 2017 at The BMW Store of Cincinnati, Ohio included an inspection, fluid check, and airbag replacements.
No subframe issues are present per the seller. Additional undercarriage images are viewable in the gallery.
A provided Carfax report shows no issues and lists two owners, with mileage consistent of the current odometer reading.

title: 43K-Mile 2001 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is a stock coupe with 43k indicated miles on its 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and 6-speed manual transmission. The car spent its time in California and Georgia until recently being acquired by the seller from its second owner of 11 years. It has since undergone a dealer inspection that reportedly included the performance or verification of several TSBs and recalls as detailed below. This E46 M3 is described as almost entirely unmodified, and it is sold with a clean Carfax report, original literature, and a clear North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

Sheet metal is finished in Stahlgrau (steel grey) Metallic paint, which is shown up close in photos along with glass, badging, and lighting. Blemishes are reportedly limited to chips in the nose and a minor ding in the driver-side rear wheel arch as detailed in the gallery below. No accidents or paintwork are noted on the included Carfax report.

Factory 18″ split-spoke wheels were recently refinished in factory Hyper Silver and mounted with their second set of staggered-width Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. Original side marker lights have given way to amber LED units but are included in the sale. All other trim and accessories remain stock according to the seller.

Powered front sport seats show condition commensurate with the mileage, with light entry and egress wear on driver-side bolsters and a scuff on the passenger-side lower cushion. The seller replaced peeling A and C-pillar fabric with new material from BMW, as well as installing a new auto-dimming rearview mirror due to typical distortion in the original. The car was ordered with a sunroof but without heated seats or navigation.

Instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedo and a digital odometer showing just over 43k miles, approximately 1,000 of which have been added by the seller. A factory CD player remains in place and interior lighting is shown to work in photos, including backlit pixels on the driver information and HVAC displays. A Takata passenger-side airbag recall was recently carried out. The seller notes that the tire pressure monitoring system light illuminates intermittently.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower for the US market and is paired here with a 6-speed manual transmission. A synthetic oil change was carried out in October 2017 along with replacement of the front struts with OEM Bilsteins. No rear subframe reinforcement has been required according to the seller. A handful of underbody photos are shown below.

The Carfax report shows a steady progression of mileage over three owners including the seller and indicates no accidents, thefts, or other issues. A recent inspection performed by a Raleigh-area BMW dealer reportedly determined the car to be in good working order, including the VANOS variable valve timing system and rod bearings. The rear differential TSB was addressed with updated fluid.

The sale includes original manuals along with a factory audio demonstration CD, two keys with remote fobs, a valet key, and a plastic emergency key. The factory air compressor and towing hardware remain present in the trunk. The car was purchased with the intention of longterm ownership, but a change of plans reportedly forces the sale. The seller encourages questions and is able to help arrange shipping details for the winning bidder.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over Black Nappa leather and shows 83k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed SMG transmission, and modifications include Status Gruppe coil overs, 19″ Apex wheels, an AFE intake, angel eyes, and tinted windows. Recent work included an Inspection II service, a new water pump and thermostat, reinforcing the rear subframe, and installing polyurethane subframe and differential bushings. The seller is the fifth owner and has added 1,200 miles over the past eight months. This E46 M3 is now offered with some service records, the owner’s manual and booklets, a clean Carfax, and a clear Tennessee title.
The Silver Grey Metallic (A08) finish is believed to be original and blemishes on the front bumper are shown in the gallery. Aftermarket Angel Eyes lights were installed by the previous owner.
The suspension has been modified with adjustable Status Gruppe coilovers and the car rides on 19″ Apex wheels wearing Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires with less than 2k miles.

The Black Nappa leather interior was optioned with electrically adjustable and heated front seats, a center armrest, park distance control, and hi-fi audio with a CD player. Wear is noted on the seat bolsters.

Interior changes include tinted windows, a carbon fiber shifter, and aftermarket shift paddles, and the original items are included. All interior equipment is reported to function correctly, though the front windows are noisy during operation. The digital odometer shows 83k miles.

The S54 3.2 Liter inline-six is paired with an SMG II sequential manual gearbox, and the VANOS was inspected by a dealer and reported to be in good condition. Modifications include an AFE intake and polyurethane differential bushings and mounts, and the original intake and a second set of differential mounts are also included. Recent service consisted of a new water pump, new thermostat, an oil change, and engine and transmission mounts.

The rear subframe was recently reinforced with a kit from Reddish Motorsports that was installed by German Motorworks of Nashville, Tennesee. The seller notes a periodic clunking sound, and attributes it to the rear differential.

The accident-free AutoCheck report shows four previous owners and that the car has spent time in Georgia, Alabama, and Tennessee. The seller reports that the airbag recall was completed in April 2017.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is a largely stock coupe with 67k miles and a 3.2L inline-six and 6-speed manual transmission. Finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather and equipped with the Premium and Cold Weather packages, the car spent its time in Illinois and Texas before its recent acquisition by the seller. This E46 M3 is sold with a clean AutoCheck report, factory literature, its original window sticker, and a Maryland title in the seller’s name.

Sheet metal is finished in Jet Black paint, which is shown up close in photos below. No accidents are noted on the included AutoCheck report. Chrome kidney grille surrounds and M3 badging have been refinished from chrome to black.

Factory 18″ staggered split-spoke wheels are mounted with high-performance rubber from 2014. Bi-xenon headlights feature built-in washers as part of the Cold Weather Package, while stock taillights and front turn signals have been swapped for aftermarket LED versions.

The car was ordered with the Premium and Cold Weather packages which together include powered and heated seats, an electric moonroof, rain-sensing wipers, automatic headlights, and Nappa leather upholstery. Front sport seats show bolster wear and light creasing commensurate with the mileage. Original titanium shadow trim pieces were recently replaced with brushed aluminum by the seller. The Harman-Kardon sound system is equipped.

Gray-faced gauges include a 185 mph speedometer and a backlit digital odometer showing just over 67k miles. An upgraded aftermarket stereo gives a near factory appearance while providing modern connectivity and navigation. A warning light for the tire pressure monitoring system occasionally illuminates according to the seller. Photos show none of the distortion typical to the auto-dimming rearview mirror, and other accessories are said to be in good working order.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower for the US market and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The rear subframe has not been reinforced per the seller, who is unaware of any cracking issues present. The seller has driven the car approximately 1,500 miles over the past six months.

The AutoCheck reports shows no accidents or thefts over five owners in Illinois and Texas. Open recalls are shown for both driver- and passenger-side Takata airbags, while prior service records are unavailable.
The sale includes an original case of owner’s literature as well as a window sticker detailing options and a 2002 MSRP just shy of $53k.

title: 2K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 has just 2k miles and is equipped with a 6-speed manual gearbox. Finished in Jet Black over a Black leather interior, the most recent service performed by Euro Motorcars BMW in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania included a multi-point inspection, oil/filter change, and closing out any outstanding recalls. Factory options include black leather, heated power seats with driver memory and lumbar, a power moonroof, bi-xenon headlights, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. This E46 M3 is now being offered by the selling dealer with receipts dating back to new, a clean Carfax, books and both keys, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The Jet Black (668) remains original according to the seller, who also reports that there has been no paintwork or body repairs. All the VIN tags are said to be intact, and the Carfax report indicates no accident damage.
The exterior features bi-xenon headlights and 18″ M-double spoke style 65 wheels wearing staggered size Continental tires replaced in 2016.

The interior remains original and factory options include heated leather seats with driver memory and lumbar support, along with a Harmon Kardon stereo and power glass moonroof. No navigation screen lends a good look and according to the seller all interior functions are in working order.

The 3.2L DOHC S54 inline-six benefits from a recent oil/filter change and multi-point inspection. Features include double VANOS variable valve timing and drive-by-wire throttle control, with a factory rating of 333 hp when new.
Several photos of the underbody can be seen in the gallery below detailing the condition of the exhaust, chassis, suspension, and drivetrain.
The original window sticker shows a manufacturer suggested retail price of $52,770.

The Carfax report shows an open airbag recall that was recently closed by Euro Motorcars BMW in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania. Receipts for this service will be included with the sale, along with the service history file shown in the gallery below.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is a modified example equipped with a supercharged 3.2-liter inline-six and a 6-speed manual transmission. The S54 engine is set up for E85 and has been fitted with a Vortech V2 supercharger, a 2.87″ supercharger pulley, VF intercooler, VF V1 intake manifold, E85-compatible fuel pump, 550cc injectors, Supersprint V1 header, and a cat-less exhaust. This example is finished in Jet Black over red leather, and maintenance during the seller’s four years of ownership included Inspection I and II services, a new OEM clutch, fresh transmission and differential oil, NGK spark plugs, and more. Numerous spare parts come with the car, ranging from a complete OEM exhaust system to aftermarket parts that can reportedly increase output beyond 600 horsepower. This E46 M3 is now being offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black and has been fitted with 20% tinted windows, as well as ECS matte black front and side grilles. The 19″ VMR V718 wheels measure 8.5″ wide at the front and 9.5″ wide at the rear. A set of 12.5mm spacers are fitted at the front. The seller installed a set of Continental DWS tires shortly after purchasing the car.

Suspension modifications include Turner Motorsports adjustable sway bars and end links, TMS adjustable rear camber arms and rod ends, VAC diff mount bushings, and VAC subframe mount bushings, along with Powerflex polyurethane rear trailing arm and front control arm bushings.

The interior is trimmed in red leather and has been fitted with a set of Turner Motorsports aluminum pedal pads. Standard equipment includes aluminum trim, as well as the Cold Weather and Premium Packages. Other interior modifications include an OEM ZHP illuminated shift knob, Autosolutions 40% throw reduction shift kit, a UUC V3 clutch pedal stop, and a set of Weathertech floor mats. A Dynavin nav/infotainment system is installed and includes an iPod hookup in the glovebox.

A pair of AEM gauges is mounted on the steering column as shown above. A boost gauge is at the right and an AFR gauge is on the left. 116k miles are indicated on the odometer, around 3k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission and has been fitted with a Vortech V2 T-trim supercharger, 2.87″ pulley, Gates Racing micro-v blue belt, modified VF V1 intake manifold, VF V1 intercooler, custom-bored Tial-Q blow-off valve with black spring, and a custom oil catch-can. A Supersprint V1 stepped header was also added and feeds a Supersprint straight section one, resonated section two, and a Top Speed muffler. The fuel system includes Bosch 550cc injectors and an AEM E85 320 LPH fuel pump. Vorshlag polyurethane motor mounts and RE polyurethane transmission mounts are fitted. Most of the modifications were performed by the previous owner, who now owns Coyne Performance in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania.

A dyno chart is included and represents an earlier build with a smaller supercharger pulley, the stock exhaust, and 8 psi of boost. In that configuration, the car produced 430 horsepower at the wheels. The car is currently set up for E85 and is running 12 psi of boost. Additional parts are included to increase output to a reported 650 horsepower.

Within the last 500 miles the car has received an oil change with Castrol Edge TWS oil and an OEM filter, NGK DCPR9E spark plugs, an OEM A/C belt, and a new OEM power steering line. Per the seller the new plugs are two steps colder than stock, and are gapped to 0.28.” Within the last 3k miles the seller has fitted a new OEM clutch and flywheel, refilled the gearbox with Royal Purple transmission fluid, and refilled the differential with Mobil 1 synthetic fluid. The Inspection I and II services were performed in 2014 and 2016 respectively. Other known services from the last 13k miles include the following:
The rear subframe mounts have been reinforced with Turner Motorsports’ reinforcement plates. Numerous photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
Spares and extras included with the sale include the following:
The Carfax is included and shows history in Maryland, New York, and Pennsylvania from new. No accidents are shown, though the seller states that the Takata airbag recall is still outstanding.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe is equipped with the Competition Package, Cold Weather package, a 3.2L S54 inline-six, and a 6-speed manual transmission. The car spent time in South Carolina and Florida before being acquired by the seller and brought to Maryland six months ago. Approximately 2k miles have been added since, and the vehicle was recently detailed and serviced with a tune-up and new brake pads. Thought to be unmodified apart from a weighted ZHP shift knob and an adjusted clutch engagement, this example shows 82k miles and was reportedly maintained at a dealership throughout its warranty period. This E46 M3 is now being offered for sale with a list of dealership services, some maintenance records, a clean Autocheck report, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.
