The Titanium Silver paint is believed original with no accidents listed on the included Autocheck report. The car was recently detailed and a few marks are noted in the finish.

Competition Package 19” staggered-width cross-spoke alloy wheels show some discoloration and would benefit from refinishing per the seller. The car sits on Michelin tires and is equipped with new brake pads.

Inside, the powered and heated black leather sport seats show some light creasing on the outer bolsters. Competition Package amenities include aluminum trim and an Alcantara-wrapped three-spoke steering wheel with a “Track Mode” button that raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control. A weighted ZHP shift knob was added and the clutch pedal was reportedly adjusted for earlier engagement. The digital display indicates 82,297 miles and is said to show no pixelation issues.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual transmission and produced 333 horsepower when new. A tune-up was recently performed and a list of services completed at the dealership are included with the vehicle.
Additional undercarriage photos are viewable in the gallery below. The seller does not believe there to be any subframe cracking.
A provided Autocheck report lists no issues and shows South Carolina, Florida, and Maryland history since new.

title: 36K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Active Autowerke Exhaust and Rasp Pipe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Steel Grey Metallic over Cinnamon leather and shows just 36k miles. The seller purchased the car on BaT in June 2017 and recently took a new job overseas, which is forcing the sale. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a six-speed manual gearbox, and modifications include a set of 19” ZCP alloys, Eibach springs, Active Autowerke exhaust, and a Rasp pipe. Factory options include a rear spoiler delete, Bi-Xenon headlamps, and a Harmon/Kardon stereo. This E46 M3 is now being offered with numerous service records from new, the original window sticker, a clean Carfax, and a clear Virginia title in the seller’s name.

No history of prior accidents or damage are shown on the included Carfax, and the Steel Grey Metallic finish presents well in photos. The front bumper has been refinished by a previous owner in response to stone chips, although new chips from highway driving are present, and a small scratch is visible on the passenger-side rear fender.
Ride height has been lowered with a set of Eibach springs, and the genuine 19″ ZCP alloys were installed in 2016.

The interior features Cinnamon leather upholstery, and all gauges, lights, and the optional Harmon/Kardon sound system are reported to work as intended. Per the seller, the fore and aft adjustment on the driver seat is currently sticking and the headliner is beginning to sag slightly around the pillars.

The S54 3.2-liter inline-six has been modified with an Active Autowerke Exhaust and Rogue Engineering Rasp Pipe. A Full Inspection II was performed along with a valve adjustment at 25k miles, and the rod bearing recall was addressed at 2k miles. Servicing under the previous owner was performed each spring annually. In June 2017 just prior to the seller’s acquisition the local BMW dealer performed a multi-point inspection, as well as an oil and filter change, brake fluid flush, front airbag recall replacement, power steering fluid flush, headlight adjustment, windshield wiper fluid pump replacement, and four-wheel alignment.

The included Carfax can be viewed in the gallery below, along with the original window sticker, and various receipts. Two factory keys and the original exhaust are included with the sale. There is a failed inspection noted on the Carfax, and this was due to the painted front reflectors not passing the safety inspection. OEM amber reflectors are included with the sale, though the black painted ones are currently installed.

title: 20K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Alpine White over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Alpine White over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe shows just under 20k miles and was sold new at Rick Hill BMW in Kingsport, Tennessee. Finished in Alpine White over a black Nappa leather interior with aluminum trim, this car was optioned from the factory with the Premium and Cold Weather packages, Xenon headlights, Harmon-Kardon sound, 19″ light alloy wheels, and more. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual transmission, and AC Schnitzer aluminum pedal covers have been fitted. The seller acquired the car in January 2018 from the second owner and has since added 300 miles. The fuel sending unit, rear pinion seal, and right rear axle seal were recently replaced, and this E46 M3 is now being offered with service records, the owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax, and a clear South Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White, and no accident or other damage are noted on the included Carfax. The seller states that rock chips on the passenger side of the hood were previously retouched, and exterior imperfections are shown in the gallery. A complete clay bar and two-stage wax process has been preformed by the seller.

All brake rotors and pads were replaced in 2015, and a brake fluid flush was performed at the same time. The seller notes some oxidation on the center of the optional 19″ Light Alloy wheels, and Continental ContiSportContact tires are fitted at all four corners.
The interior is finished in black Nappa leather with aluminum trim. The heated front seats have lumbar support and adjustable seat width. AC Schnitzer aluminum pedal covers were previously installed.

Optional interior equipment includes a Harmon-Kardon sound system, glass moonroof, and a rear seat ski bag. All lights and accessories are reported to work as they should, and the odometer shows just under 20k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is reportedly unmodified and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. The BMW low mileage service was completed in 2015 at 17,064 miles, along with replacing the power steering pump and completing the Takata passenger airbag recall. Work completed in January 2018 at Hilton Head BMW included replacing the fuel sending unit, rear pinion seal, right rear axle seal, and a general inspection.
Several additional undercarriage images are included in the gallery below.

The accident-free Carfax shows two previous owners and that the car spent time in Tennessee and South Carolina. A inconsistency is shown in 2015 that is believed to be a mileage entry error by the seller. The owner’s manual, booklets, and two keys are included.

title: 40K-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was sold new in Missouri, shows 40k miles, and is equipped with a 6-speed manual. The seller purchased the car new as a retirement present to himself at Joe Self BMW in Wichita, and has kept the car in the Kansas City, Missouri area. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six equipped with individual throttle bodies and backed by a 6-speed manual transmission. Last year, the seller had an inspection performed by a BMW dealer. It was recommended that the drive belts and brake fluid replaced be replaced at that time. This M3 is offered with a clean Carfax, the original sales invoice, and a clean Missouri title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic, and per the seller some small door-dings are present on the driver’s door. The stock alloy wheels were fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires in 2016.

The car is equipped with the Xenon headlight package. The E46 M3 features wider kidney grilles than the standard 3-series along with an aluminum hood. Other cosmetic changes include aerodynamic mirror housings, stainless steel fender vents, and clear turn signal housings.

The cabin is upholstered in black leather, with a leather shift knob and leather-rimmed 3-spoke steering wheel with tri-color stitching. Instrumentation is specific to the M3, and includes grey gauge faces, a 180 mile per hour speedometer, oil temperature gauge, and variable LED redline on the tachometer.

The car is equipped with the power seat package. All interior features are said to work correctly, including the A/C. A small bubble is present in the rear view mirror. 40k miles are shown on the digital odometer.

Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission. The seller has serviced the car at Kansas City area BMW dealerships from new. A recent inspection was performed by a BMW dealer, and it was recommended that the drive belts be replaced and the brake fluid changed. This service has not yet been performed.
The original sales invoice from Joe Self BMW in Wichita is included, and shows the $52,919 purchase price.
The accident-free Carfax shows history in Missouri with the seller, and regular services at the seller’s Missouri, Kansas based BMW dealerships.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
exterior_color: CSL Trunk Lid, Carbon Fiber Trim
listing_details: CSL Trunk Lid, Carbon Fiber Trim
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over Imola Red leather and equipped with a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a paddle-shifted SMG transmission. The car has been in Nevada and California from new and shows just under 101k miles after approximately two years with its third owner. A host of cosmetic and performance modifications are joined by VANOS, cooling, electrical, drivetrain, and suspension maintenance as described below. The sale includes service records, a clean AutoCheck report, and a clear Montana title under the owner’s LLC.

Silver Grey Metallic paint is shown up close in extensive photos below. A double-sided Vorsteiner 2×2 carbon fiber CSL-style trunk lid has been painted to match the body and fitted with an OEM liner. Further exterior modifications include a carbon fiber CSL-style rear diffuser, Hamman-style lip spoiler, and fog light surrounds. A light window tint has been applied throughout.

Matte gunmetal Morr VS7 wheels present cleanly and are 19×8.5″ with 10mm spacers up front and 19×9.5″ without spacers in the rear. Continental ExtremeContact tires were mounted in 2013 and 2016 respectively, with all showing plenty of tread according to the seller. Xenon headlights wear new BMW lenses, corner markers and side grilles have been replaced with new items, and front bumper reflectors have been color-matched to the body.

Imola Red leather sport seats and panel inserts are set off by carbon fiber trim as well as an alcantara wheel, shift boot, and e-brake covers. Other additions and updates include a new SMG shift knob and surround plate, OEM A-pillar covers, a Euro center console tray, and drilled aluminum pedals. Carpeting is protected by BMW all-weather mats. The car was ordered with the Cold Weather Package and Park Distance Control.

Chrome-ringed gray instrumentation includes a 185 mph speedometer and a digital odometer showing just under 101k miles, fewer than 1,000 of which have been added under current ownership. The stock stereo has been replaced with an Xtrons head unit linked to a backup camera. A Takata airbag recall has been completed according to records below.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a paddle-shifted SMG transmission and has been modified with an Evolve ECU tune and a VF Engineering intake. Agency Power headers feed an OEM “section 1” with a 400-cell catalytic converter and a Milltek exhaust system.

Maintenance items include a fresh water pump, alternator, drivetrain mounts, flex disc, and Inspection 1 as well as heater hoses and power steering lines. A new OEM starter was installed to address an intermittent starting issue, at which time the seller also replaced the heater hoses, vent tubes, and power steering lines as well as cleaning the intake box. The VANOS system, timing chain tensioner seals, and constant pressure valve have also been replaced according to the seller, who notes an absence of SMG pump issues or check engine lights.

Underbody photos show the condition of the drivetrain, exhaust, and floors. Suspension upgrades include KW V2 coilovers, an aftermarket strut brace, and a Turner Motorsports rear subframe reinforcement. Bushings have been replaced in the front control arms and rear trailing arms. Stopping power comes from BMW Competition/CSL disc brakes.

The AutoCheck report shows no accidents, thefts, or other issues over a lifetime in California and Nevada. Paperwork will be supplied for recent maintenance and upgrades, with a selection viewable below. The sale also includes a factory air compressor and tire tools.
The seller has added a cold start and walk-around video below:

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: gray with partial-leather upholstery and brushed aluminum accents
listing_details: Replacement Clutch, Water Pump, and Thermostat
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe shows 98k miles and is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over a gray partial leather interior. Power comes from an 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include the Premium Package, heated memory seats, a power moonroof, Xenon headlights, Harmon Kardon audio, and navigation. The car was originally located in the Northeast and moved to North Carolina with a previous owner. Around $3k in service was performed between 2011 and the seller’s purchase in late 2017. Work included a new clutch, water pump, thermostat, drive belts, and trailing arm bushings. An inspection and oil service were recently carried out, and the car carries a current North Carolina emissions certificate. This E46 M3 is sold with an AutoCheck report, a BMW car cover, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (AO8), and noted blemishes include two shallow dings on the hood, a bubble on the driver’s front wheel arch, a small windshield crack, and a scratch on the decklid. The seller believes that the car has been garaged throughout its life. A 2009 incident involving the driver’s front fender is noted and also described in the Autocheck report.

Rain-sensing wipers and Xenon headlights are equipped. 19″ Style 67 alloys show curb marks and flaking in the finish around the rims. 255/35 Continental Extreme Contact DWS 06 tires were installed in May 2016.

The interior is trimmed in grey with brushed aluminum accents and partial-leather upholstery. Power-adjustable seats are heated with memory settings, and other options include Harmon Kardon audio with a 6-disc CD changer and navigation. An Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is the only interior modification. Two outstanding airbag recalls are noted in the AutoCheck report.
The folding rear bench sis further detailed in the gallery along with the trunk, and the odometer shows 98,132 miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission in this car. Service receipts show that work over the past several years included replacement of the water pump and thermostat, clutch pivot pin, rear trailing arm bushings, and drive belts. The seller states that the clutch has been replaced as well. An inspection and an oil service were performed prior to the sale.

A recent AutoCheck report records four previous owners in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and North Carolina. Two outstanding airbag recalls are listed, along with a 2009 accident that damaged the left front of the vehicle. Service receipts date back to 2011 and can be seen in the gallery below.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible shows 47k miles and is a modified example that remained with its original owner until acquired by the selling dealer last month. Finished in Steel Gray Metallic over a Gray Nappa leather interior, this car has been fitted with an Active Autowerke supercharger kit, intercooler, and methanol injection, as well as an Active Autowerke intake plenum and exhaust. Dinan Stage 2 suspension components and 19″ Competition Package wheels have also been added. Modifications were reportedly installed by Winslow BMW in Colorado Springs, Colorado. The S54 rod bearing recall was completed at 8,400 miles, and both airbag recalls were carried out more recently. An Inspection II service has also been performed including the S54 valve adjustment, and the clutch was replaced in preparation for the sale. This E46 M3 is now being offered with an accident-free Carfax and a clean Colorado title.

Steel Gray Metallic is the original shade, and the decklid spoiler and front bumper were repainted by the original owner. The front bumper currently shows a few small blemishes and the underside of the front air dam is scraped, with two holes worn through. Headlamp washers, rain-sensing wipers, and Parking Distance Control were optioned at purchase, and Angel Eye HALO rings were added to the factory Xenon headlights. A supercharger oil cooler and intercooler are mounted behind the front grilles and air dam opening respectively.

The Dinan Stage 2 suspension package consists of slightly shorter springs and Koni shocks, and the shock towers are reinforced with a Dinan strut brace. Rogue Engineering rear trailing arm bushings were also installed. 19″ Style 163 Competition Package wheels are free of glaring marks and wear Continental Extreme Contact tires measuring 245/35 up front and 275/30 in the rear. Custom-finished blue brake calipers can be seen between the spokes, and the black fabric top features a heated glass rear window.

The interior is trimmed in Gray Nappa leather (N5TT) with Titan metal accents and optioned with Harmon Kardon audio and a 6-disc CD changer. A Dinan Stage 2 shifter kit was installed, and a pair of AEM gauges mounted to the steering column monitor boost and air/fuel ratio, though the latter appears to be reading inaccurately. The odometer shows 46,526 miles.

Leather sport seats feature heating, power adjustment, and memory settings. Minor flattening can be seen along the outer driver’s bolster, and the seller notes a couple small scratches on the center console. Both airbag recalls have reportedly been completed.
The rear bench can be seen above with the wind deflector mounted.

A partial toolkit can be found beneath the rear decklid, and the trunk also houses the battery and an M3 trunk mat. The rear subframe has not been reinforced, but was inspected regularly according to the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with an Active Autowerke Generation 6 Stage 1.5 kit, which includes a belt-driven Rotrex Trim supercharger, an Active Autowerke intake plenum, larger fuel injectors, a supercharger oil cooler, methanol injection, and an air-to-air intercooler. The kit provides 7-8 psi of boost and is said to increase output to 480-520 hp with stock internals. An Active Autowerke exhaust system was also installed. The modifications were reportedly performed by Winslow BMW in Colorado Springs, where the car received regular service throughout its life.

The S54 rod bearing recall was completed at 8,400 miles in 2003, and the Inspection I and Inspection II services were performed in 2009 and 2018 respectively. The latter service occurred under the seller’s ownership, and included a valve adjustment, new power steering line, an intercooler boot, and replacement of the clutch.
The seller has provided a collection of lift shots showing the condition of the underside.

A recent Carfax records an accident-free history under one owner in Colorado, with regular service at Winslow BMW. A readout of factory equipment based on the VIN can be found in the gallery below. A video showing a walkaround, interior controls, and an engine start can be viewed below.

title: One-Owner 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller in California and is optioned with the ZCP Competition Package. Finished in Interlagos Blue over a black leather interior, the car was optioned from the factory with a moonroof, rear sunshade, xenon headlights, navigation, and BMW assist with Bluetooth. Power comes from an unmodified 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed sequential transmission, and modifications include Dinan Stage I suspension, window tint, and amber taillight film. Now showing just 47k miles, this E46 M3 is being sold with records from new, the original books and brochures, the owner’s manual in leather pouch, two key fobs, a valet key, an OEM BMW bike rack, a factory service manual, the original window sticker, the original purchase order, a new leather Colgan bra, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

This car is optioned with the $4k ZCP Competition Package, which included enlarged cross-drilled brake rotors, quicker steering, Track Mode traction control, 19″ wheels, and cosmetic enhancements. The right rear fender was repainted by Pine Ridge Coachworks in Naples, Florida in order to address scratches.

Dinan stage I suspension has been fitted and features Dinan springs and Koni shock absorbers. Amber film has also been applied to the rear taillights. The windows are tinted, and the seller notes it is peeling near the upper portion of the back window.

Competition Package interior items include aluminum trim, as well as an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel equipped with a Track Mode button that raises the engagement threshold on the Dynamic Stability Control system. The headliner is sagging near the C-pillars and a Valentine One radar detector is hardwired to the ignition. The odometer shows 47k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed sequential manual gearbox, and the factory output was unchanged from base-spec M3 at 333 horsepower. A folder containing records back to new includes receipts from services, as well as documentation of modifications performed by the seller.
A few underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.
The original window sticker is pictured above, showing the factory colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $61,670.
The Carfax report indicates no accident damage and one owner since new.

title: 37K-Mile Supercharged 2004 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible shows just over 37k miles and is equipped with a 3.2L S54 inline-six that was modified for the original owner with a Dinan performance package featuring a Vortech V2 supercharger, full exhaust, larger injectors, fuel pressure regulator, hoses, and corresponding software. Acquired from the original owner by the selling dealer three months ago, this car is equipped with a 6-speed SMG-II electrohydraulic gearbox. Service is reportedly up to date, and records are said to document consistent maintenance at BMW service centers. This E46 M3 is offered with original sales paperwork, books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Texas title.
The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354), and noted blemishes include small chips along the hood captured in detail in the gallery below.
The black fabric convertible top features a heated glass rear window and is shown both raised and lowered in photos. Factory forged 19″ Style 67 alloys wear Continental tires.

Black Nappa leather is set off by aluminum trim, and the heated front seats feature adjustable lumbar support and bolster width. Creasing and outer bolster wear are detailed in the gallery below. The car is optioned with a Harman Kardon hi-fi system with CD changer.
Factory controls, gray-faced instrumentation, and other equipment are reported to work apart from an inoperable oil temperature gauge. The digital odometer shows just over 37k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a paddle-shifted SMG-II 6-speed transmission and has been modified with Dinan upgrades including a Vortech V2 supercharger, intake, exhaust system, larger injectors, fuel pressure regulator, hoses, and software. A factory front strut brace is also fitted.

The Carfax report displays history in Ohio, Arizona, and Texas and shows no open recalls or accident history. Dealer service entries are noted and printed records are said to document maintenance from new, the most recent of which included inspections I and II within the last 1,500 miles.
The original bill of sale is pictured above, displaying the car’s March 2004 purchase date and sale price just shy of $66k.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: New Michelin Pilot Sport Tires up Front
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 shows just under 59k miles and was acquired by the seller six months ago. Finished in Imola Red over Anthracite leather with aluminum trim, the car was optioned from the factory with the cold weather package, xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, a power sunroof, and 10-way adjustable seats with lumbar support. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox and a service conducted less than 500 miles ago by a BMW master tech included refurbishing the 18″ wheels, a new valve cover gasket, new Michelin Pilot Super Sports up front, and fresh brake pads all around. This E46 M3 is now being offered with a clean Carfax report, the results of a recent PPI, and a clean Washington State title.

Imola Red paint is shown in a number of close-up photos below. No accident damage is noted on the included Carfax report. An exterior and interior detail were performed in anticipation of the sale. The seller states that the rear window seals should be replaced and the front cowl seal is cracking. The seller reports that paint meter readings revealed some paintwork on the right rear quarter panel, though details about why this was done are unknown.

Exterior equipment includes bi-xenon headlights, rain-sensing wipers, and refinished 18″ double-spoke Style 65 wheels. Staggered Michelin Pilot Super Sports are new in the front and from 2012 out back. Clear protective film has been applied to the front bumper, hood, fenders, and quarter panels.

Interior options include leather seats with driver-side memory and lumbar support along with a Harman Kardon stereo and power glass moonroof. The odometer shows just under 59k miles, approximately 500 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L DOHC S54 inline-six features double VANOS variable valve timing and drive-by-wire throttle control for a factory rating of 333 horsepower when new. A PPI was recently conducted and the seller notes that all concerns were addressed, including replacement of the valve cover gasket and installation of fresh OEM brake pads all around.
The accident-free Carfax report shows six owners in Colorado, Arizona, and Washington State as well as open recalls for both Takata front airbags.

title: 24K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible
listing_details: Recent Inspection II and VANOS Replacement
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over grey leather and was originally sold in Ohio. The seller purchased it in 2005 from Premier Motors in St. Louis, Missouri and relocated the car to Arizona and later California. 19k of its 24k indicated miles have been driven by the seller. The car is equipped with a 3.2L S54 inline-six and 6-speed SMG transmission, and 19″ wheels with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires were installed by the seller. Maintenance has been performed by BMW dealerships in Arizona and Southern California, with included records reportedly dating to 2005. A Inspection II was recently completed along with replacement of the VANOS unit and an exhaust cam gear. This E46 is offered in Escondido, California with an accident-free Carfax report, owner’s books, wind deflector, cover, factory wheels, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and optioned with Park Distance Control, xenon headlights with washers, and rain-sensing wipers. A few isolated stone chips can be seen around the kidney grilles, and a shopping cart ding in a front fender was repaired in November 2017. The car has reportedly been stored indoors during the seller’s ownership.

Exterior condition is shown in the walk-around video above. The black soft top features a heated glass rear window and can be seen operating in another video here, which also shows the engine starting. The seller has added a set of 19″ ZCP Competition alloys and Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires have an estimated 4,500 miles of wear. The factory 18″ wheels are included in the sale.

The interior is trimmed in grey leather with Shadow aluminum accents. Equipment includes powered sport seats with adjustable lumbar and memory settings, Harman Kardon audio, a 6-disc CD changer, navigation, and auto-dimming mirrors. A BMW auxiliary input has been added to the sound system, and both airbag recalls have been completed, according to the seller.

The odometer shows just over 24k miles, 19k of which have been driven by the seller. A scuff is noted on the driver’s seat side bolster and pictured in detail in the gallery. A factory tool kit can be found beneath the rear deck lid.

The S54 3.2L inline-six is paired with a 6-speed SMG II transmission and was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 RPM with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 RPM. A transmission service, oil change, and brake flush were performed at a BMW dealer in July 2017. An Inspection II service was completed in April 2018, and the VANOS unit was replaced and updated with Besian seals and components. The exhaust cam gear was also replaced at that time.
A few pictures of the underside can be viewed in the gallery below. The brake fluid has been pressure-flushed and replaced every two years during the seller’s ownership.
A folder of receipts is provided to document maintenance since 2005, with invoices included from BMW dealerships as well as La Jolla Independent BMW Service.

A recent Carfax report documents two owners prior to the seller’s 2005 purchase, and records an accident-free history in Ohio, Arizona and California. The most recent mileage report shows 14k miles in 2012. A readout of factory equipment and options based on the car’s VIN is included in the gallery below.

title: 18K-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
listing_details: Dinan ECU Upgrade, Cold Air Intake
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller in Naples, Florida and shows just under 18k miles. The car is equipped with a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a paddle-shifted SMG transmission as well as features including black leather power front seats with driver memory, xenon headlights, navigation, and 19″ wheels. Modifications consist of stage 3 ECU software, a 3.91:1 limited-slip differential, and a cold air intake from Dinan as well as Bilstein PSS10 coilovers, StopTech brakes, Borla exhaust parts, and more. A fluid flush was carried out in June 2017 and original dealer service records are provided from new. This E46 M3 is sold with its original window sticker, removed original parts, and a clean Florida title.

The body is finished in Alpine White, and the seller notes that black kidney grilles have replaced the stock chrome items. This example was optioned new with xenon headlights and without a sunroof. The front valance appears unmodified for a license plate, and the headlight covers are tinted. Upgraded BMW Competition Package wheels are mounted with 19″ Michelin Pilot Sport rubber.

Suspension modifications include a Bilstein PSS10 coilover kit as well as Turner Motorsport camber plates and sway bars. Brake system revisions include a StopTech ST40 355 front setup with cross-drilled rotors in addition to BMW Motorsport rear discs. A Borla M3 muffler and rasp-terminator center section have been installed, while both the headers and catalytic converter are said to be stock.

The interior features black leather upholstery, power front seats with driver memory, BMW navigation, air conditioning, and more. The electrohydraulically-controlled SMG gearbox can be shifted via steering wheel paddles or the gear knob. Interior surfaces are documented up close in the gallery below.
Chrome-ringed gray instrumentation includes a 185 MPH speedometer and a digital odometer showing just under 18k miles.

Dinan upgrades for the 3.2L S54 inline-six and 6-speed SMG include a cold air intake, a stage 3 ECU tune, and transmission software. A Dinan 3.91:1 limited-slip differential is also equipped. The most recent service noted by the seller was performed in June 2017 and included changes of the engine and transmission oil, coolant, and power steering fluid. Service has been conducted by the original selling dealer Germain BMW in Naples, Florida from new.
A clean Carfax is shown above, indicating one owner, no accidents, and corroborating the mileage given.
The original window sticker shows selected options and a final MSRP of $57,740.
Removed parts for the exhaust, suspension, and braking system are included along with other stock components.
A walk-around video is provided above.

title: 40K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Schwarz 2 over a grey leather interior and is powered by an S54 inline six and 6-speed manual transmission. The seller purchased the car in 2015, and has driven less than 1000 of the 40k miles currently indicated. Optional equipment includes Park Distance Control, Harmon Kardon audio, heated seats, and more. A Dynavin N-7 head unit with integrated navigation and back-up camera is said to be the only modification, and the car recently received an oil service and inspection of the VANOS system and subframe welds. This E46 convertible is now offered with owner’s books, a folding wind deflector, a BMW car cover, the removed original head unit, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Jet Black (Schwarz 2 668), with no damage or bodywork noted in the provided Carfax. Rear Park Distance Control sensors, rain-sensing wipers, and Xenon headlights with washers are equipped, along with an added back-up camera. LED taillights were factory equipment from mid-2003 production until 2006. The black convertible top features a heated glass rear window and can be seen in operation in gallery photographs. The seller states that the car has been driven seasonally and is stored covered in a climate-controlled garage during winters and when not in use.
Optional 19″ slotted-spoke alloys wear Hankook Ventus V12 Evo tires.

The interior is trimmed in grey (N5TT) leather with carbon fiber accents, and equipment includes Harmon Kardon audio, 6-disc CD changer, and a folding rear bench seat with pass-through storage. The factory BMW Business head unit has been replaced with Dynavin N-7 head unit incorporating a CD/DVD player, navigation and a back-up camera. The removed factory head unit is included in the sale.

Heated, power adjustable Sport seats also feature adjustable lumbar support and have held their shape well. A factory folding wind deflector mounted above the rear seats is pictured in the gallery below. Airbag recalls were recently addressed at Bill Jacobs BMW in Naperville, Illinois.
The factory tool kit can be found beneath the rear decklid, and a BMW car cover is included.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and was rated at 333 hp with 286 lb-ft of torque when new with an 8,000 rpm redline. The drivetrain is said to remain stock, and has received an oil service within the last 1k miles. The seller states that the VANOS system and rear subframe welds were recently inspected and found to be satisfactory. The connecting rod bearing recall was addressed in 2005.
Pictures of the rear subframe bushings and underside can be viewed in the gallery below.
Owner’s books and two keys and remotes are included. A readout of factory equipment and options based on the car’s VIN can be seen in the gallery below.
A recent Carfax report records regular dealer maintenance visits up to 28k miles, and an accident-free history under drivers in Connecticut, Arizona, Wisconsin, and Illinois.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was purchased by its original owner at Peake BMW in Kenner, Louisiana and was acquired by the seller from its second owner in 2015. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a grey leather interior, the body is a ‘slicktop’ sunroof-delete car powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a Dinan exhaust, throttle body, and MAF under previous ownership. Further equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, xenon headlights, Harman Kardon audio, heated memory seats, an aftermarket louvered hood, and 19″ Competition Package wheels. This E46 M3 shows 74k indicated miles and is offered with a window sticker, a 2015 Carfax report, and a clean Utah title.

The seller reports that the car has been garage-kept during his ownership, and the body was optioned without a sunroof. Carbon Black Metallic paint wears chips and scrapes around the nose and the forward edges of the GTR-style hood, and . Xenon headlights with washers are equipped, and kidney grilles have been refinished in matte black with a tri-color accent. The driver-side view mirror and rear bumper cover were reportedly damaged in separate low-speed incidents, with both repaired by insurance.

Competition Package wheels measure 19″ in diameter and replace the original components. Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires show 2015 date codes, and tread depth is pictured in the gallery. Dinan exhaust tips exit the rear valance from Borla mufflers.

The cabin is trimmed in grey leather with Aluminum Shadow accents and includes factory navigation, Harman Kardon audio with a 6-disc CD changer, and heated power seats with memory settings and adjustable lumbar. A ZHP shift knob and tri-color stitching accents have been added. The digital odometer reads approximately 74k miles, with just under 10k added by the seller. Airbag recalls were addressed at BMW of Pleasant Grove in Utah.
The trunk floor is protected by BMW all-weather mat, and the compartment includes a tool kit and pass-through storage as pictured above. The trunk floor sheetmetal is pictured below.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower in stock form and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. A Dinan high-flow throttle body and mass air flow meter were reportedly installed prior to 2008 by a previous owner.

Decals relating to the Dinan modifications are pictured above, and a readout of factory equipment and options is included in the gallery. The original window sticker will also be included in the sale.
The Carfax report records history under three owners in Louisiana, Colorado, and Illinois, but stops in 2015 and does not show the insurance claims under the seller’s ownership.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather and shows 71k miles. The car is equipped with a 3.2L S54 straight-six, SMG II sequential manual transmission, and Dinan modifications including suspension, wheels, exhaust, strut bar, intake, and software. A sunroof and cruise control were optioned from the factory, and a K40 radar/laser detector has since been added. An oil and filter change was performed in February 2018. This E46 M3 is offered with records, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

Carbon Black Metallic paint is shown in several close-up photos below. The seller notes that the front bumper has been refinished to correct rock chips, and that additional chips are present on the hood. Kidney grille surrounds have been refinished from chrome to black. The Carfax indicates no reported accidents or other damage.

Dinan suspension modifications include stiffer springs, adjustable shocks and sway bars, front camber plates, and a strut tower brace. The Dinan package also includes larger alloy wheels which on this example are fitted with Hankook Ventus V12 tires.

The cabin features heated black Nappa leather sport seats, Titan Shadow trim, an optional Alcantara steering wheel and handbrake boot, and paddle shifters for the SMG II 6-speed sequential manual transmission.

An aftermarket Kenwood entertainment system incorporates navigation, a back-up camera, hands-free phone connection, and Bluetooth. Carpets are protected with Dinan embroidered mats. Approximately 71k miles are shown on the digital odometer.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six has been modified with Dinan parts including an intake manifold, exhaust system, and reprogrammed engine computer. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential.

The Carfax shows no accidents and indicates an open emissions 2009 recall. The seller reportedly acquired the car from an associate a year ago on a since-expired dealer license, but waited to title it until April 2018.

title: 22K-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows just 21,917 total miles. Factory options consist of bi-xenon headlamps, the Cold Weather Package, a Harman Kardon stereo, the Premium Package, and width-adjustable seats. The seller has owned six E46 M3s including this car, which he acquired around one year ago. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission, and modifications include painted front reflectors along with a set of 19″ Competition Package wheels. The seller has changed the engine oil, transmission fluid, differential fluid, filters, and installed a new battery himself. This low-mile BMW is now offered with recent parts receipts, factory books, both keys, a clear Carfax, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Imola Red, and the seller believes that no past paintwork has occurred based on depth meter readings. The Carfax shows no history of accidents or other damage. The previous owner had the car for nine and a half years and reportedly kept it garaged during that time.
A set of OEM 19″ alloys from an E46 M3 Competition Package have been installed and are fitted with Bridgestone Potenza RE050A tires sized 245/35 up front and 275/30 in the rear.

The black leather interior features dual power and heated seats with memory functions for the driver. A few creases on the driver’s outer bolstering are depicted above. This particular car is fitted with aluminum trim on the door panels, center console, and dashboard.

Additional equipment includes cruise control, automatic climate control, power windows/mirrors/locks, an electric sunroof, a Harman Kardon stereo, bi-xenon headlamps, and more. A driver and passenger airbag recall was completed during the seller’s ownership.
Currently the digital odometer shows just 21,917 miles. The seller has added around 1,500 miles over the past year.

According to BMW, the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The previous owner reportedly performed annual oil changes himself. Likewise, the seller has also maintained the car himself, including changes of the engine oil, transmission fluid, and differential fluid, plus a new fuel filter, engine and cabin air filters, and a new battery. All work was performed in June 2017, and associated parts receipts are pictured in the gallery below.

Per the accident-free Carfax, this M3 was sold new in Ohio and stayed in state until the seller purchased and moved the vehicle to Massachusetts in 2017. Consistent odometer readings and five service history records are also displayed.

title: 35K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in black over red leather and shows just 35,504 miles. The car was previously owned by a BMW sales manager and was reportedly serviced at BMW dealers from new. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The selling dealer states that no modifications have been made, and a general inspection was just completed in preparation for sale. This E46 M3 is now being offered in New York with a clear Carfax and a clean Connecticut title.

The included Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other issues, and the black electric soft top features a defrosted glass rear window. Over 60 exterior pictures are provided in the extensive gallery below.
Factory 18″ alloy wheels wear set of Michelin Pilot Sport tires, measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Each corner is detailed in the gallery.
An exterior walk-around video can be viewed above.
The red leather interior features dual heated seats accented with aluminum trim. Note that this M3 is not equipped with the factory navigation system.
Equipment includes a three-spoke multi-function steering wheel, cruise control, xenon headlamps, power windows/mirrors/locks, a Harman/Kardon sound system, and more.
Currently the digital odometer shows just 35,504 miles, around 200 of which have been added by the seller.

Under the hood is a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. According to BMW, these engines produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A general mechanical inspection was completed by the seller prior to this auction.
A driving video is shown above.
Over 25 undercarriage photos are displayed in the extensive gallery below.
The included Carfax does not report any accidents, and regular BMW dealer servicing is shown along with registration in New York and Connecticut from new.

title: S65B40-Powered 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 has been fitted with an S65B40 V8 engine and a 6-speed manual gearbox from a 2009 M3. The car has been driven approximately 6k miles since the seller’s acquisition four years ago and modifications include a CLS carbon fiber roof, a Ninjaneering performance tune, Dinan Exhaust, a pair of ZCP seats, CSL-style forged wheels, a Motec M150 ECU, an aluminum radiator with electric fans, and more as detailed in the listing below. The car was optioned from the factory with park distance control, a Harmon Kardon sound system, and the premium package. Recent servicing included installing an OEM fuel pump, fuel filter, new spark plugs, and oxygen sensors. This E46 is now being offered with receipts for the build reportedly totaling $75k, a Ninjaneering laptop, a CSL carbon fiber trunk, a clean Carfax, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The exterior features newer taillights, front headlight covers, a windshield cowl, and painted drip-rails. The windows are tinted all around using 3M ceramic film and Opti-Coat Pro ceramic paint protectant is applied to the finish. The seller notes the rear bumper is faded.

The car is lowered over a set of 18″ CSL-style wheels wearing newer Michelin 4S tires measuring 245/40 in front and 275/35 out back. Braking is handled by ZCP cross-drilled rotors all around, with a combination of OEM and Textar Epads. Suspension modifications include racing front lower control arm bushings, and Status Gruppe coilovers.

A pair of ZCP seats with manual adjustments replace the standard units and are said to weigh about 65 pounds less. An adjustable AKG shifter is installed, along with an OEM E46 steering rack and a Bimmerworld bump-steer tie rod assembly. The traction control is inoperable, though the seller notes it can be reprogrammed remotely. The odometer currently shows 179k miles, approximately 6,200 of which have been added by the seller.

The S65B40 V8 and 6-speed manual gearbox were reportedly sourced from a 2009 BMW M3 with 70k miles. The engine is claimed to produce 386 horsepower and 286 lb-ft of torque at the wheels using a Ninjaneering performance tune. Further modifications include a Zionsville radiator with electric fans, a MoTeC M150 ECU with CAN integration, a Macht Schnell intake, VAC-coated rod bearings, a group 48 battery, a Vengeance Customs carbon fiber intake system, and a carbon fiber ECU cover. Per the seller, all eight fuel injectors were bench-flowed and include new seals. The MoTeC ECU is not OBD2 compliant and no catalytic converters are present.

The 6-speed manual gearbox is installed using AKG transmission mounts and power is sent to 3.85 limited slip differential. The subframe was reinforced using new plates, AKG differential mounts and OEM subframe bushings. Additional upgraded components include AKG motor mounts, a Dinan exhaust with custom 2.5″ piping to a Boost logic X-pipe, and AKG rear trailing arm bushings. A UUC front sway bar was fitted in order to clear the oil pan.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=14G9sitwUJA&t=14s

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in Steel Gray Metallic over black leather and was driven approximately 7k miles by its previous owner of nine years. Now showing 72,073 miles, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Factory options include dual power/heated seats with memory, a ski pass-through, clear turn signal lenses, and gloss black interior trim. New subframe bushings were installed in 2018, and BMW replaced the original connecting rod bearings in October 2004. Modifications consist of aftermarket 19″ alloy wheels, black/monotone exterior accents and badging, and a K&N intake system. This E46 M3 is being offered by a dealer at no reserve with service records since 2001, factory books, a clear Carfax, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

Steel Gray Metallic paint is accented with a black power folding convertible top equipped with a defrosted glass rear window. This particular car was factory-optioned with clear front turn signal lenses, and the previous owner added black/monotone grille surrounds, badging, and roundels. A dime-sized ding is present in the right rear quarter panel near the trunk.

Aftermarket 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are now equipped. The left-rear wheel shows curb rash and the seller states that the factory locking differential is noisy during tight, low-speed turns when cold.

The black leather cabin features optional power/memory/heated front seats along with gloss black trim. A monotone steering wheel roundel is the only known interior modification. Per the seller, this M3 has not had the driver/passenger air bag recall completed.

Equipment includes xenon headlights, fog lamps, headlight washers, rain-sensing wipers, an on-board computer, a Harman/Kardon multi-CD sound system, automatic climate control, a rear seat ski bag pass-through, and more. The digital odometer currently shows 72,073 miles.

According to BMW, the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. This M3 features a K&N intake system and is claimed to be stock otherwise. In October 2004, BMW replaced the original connecting rod bearings and updated the computer software. A service was completed at the seller’s facility in fall 2017, and new subframe bushings were installed earlier this year. Maintenance records since 2001 accompany the sale.
The Carfax does not report any accidents or prior damage, and also includes 13 service history records.

title: 45K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver-Grey Metallic over black leather and shows 45k miles. Power comes from a 3.2L S54B32 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and optional equipment includes 19″ wheels, Harman Kardon audio, and xenon headlights. Originally purchased as a corporate vehicle, the car remained in Colorado through two subsequent owners and was acquired by the selling dealer in March 2018. A valve adjustment and replacement of the clutch delay valve were performed at 31k miles, and the selling dealer has carried out an Inspection I and replacement of one door seal. This largely stock E46 M3 is offered with a Carfax report, service records, books and literature, and a clean Colorado title.

The Silver-Gray Metallic (A08) finish was reapplied on the front bumper cover under previous ownership, and the seller believes the balance of the paint to be original based on the chart of depth meter readings provided in the gallery. Clear protective film is applied to the hood, front bumper, and forward sections of the fenders. Pitting is noted on the headlight lenses and windshield, and the underside of the front bumper cover shows vestiges of previous scuffing.

Style 67 19″ wheels were refinished at 25k miles and are said to be free of curb rash. Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measure 225/40 in the front and 255/35 out back. Optional xenon headlights with washers are equipped as well as a power sunroof.

The cabin is trimmed in black leather with Aluminum Shadow accents, and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats. Optional equipment includes Harman Kardon audio, a folding rear bench seat, and rain-sensing wipers. A new OEM door seal was installed by the seller.

The seller states that interior equipment functions properly and has provided close-up photos of the display pixels, rearview mirror, and plastic surfaces. A DICE media bridge enables Bluetooth syncing and auxiliary inputs while retaining use of the factory audio equipment. Wiring for an Escort radar detector with remote control is also present. The digital odometer shows just over 45k miles.

A complete tool kit and mobility package are included in the trunk. The seller notes that the subframe spot welds in the trunk floor have been inspected and found to be satisfactory. Pictures are included in the photo gallery.

The S54B32 3.2L inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7900 rpm when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Cars from the 2004 model year received updated components and were exempt from the rod bearing recall afflicting earlier years. This example was dealer serviced until 2012, with most subsequent work performed by Co’s BMW in Loveland and A&B Import Auto in Fort Collins, Colorado. A service at 31k miles included a valve adjustment, replacement of the clutch delay valve, and Inspection II. The accessory drive belt was replaced in 2017 and an Inspection I was recently completed by the selling dealer.
Lift shots have been provided by the seller and can be viewed in the gallery below.
A collection of sales literature and owner’s books is included in the sale along with partial service records from previous owners and the seller’s receipts.

The recent Carfax report shows an accident-free history under one corporate owner and two private owners in Colorado. Service appointments with dealers and independent shops are reported along with a mileage discrepancy of 2,567 miles in 2005, though mileage reports remain consistent before and after. The selling dealer reports that this error was likely due to the timing of the transfer from the corporate to private owner in Colorado. The Carfax also reports the clutch being replaced at 31,000 miles, but the actual service receipt shows a clutch delay valve delete. A walk-around video can be seen below.

title: 34K-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black Over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black Over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 has just 34k miles from new and is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather. It is equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include the Cold Weather Package, Luxury Package, Harman-Kardon stereo system, and bi-xenon headlamps. The car has been registered in Massachusetts since new, and the seller has added just over 1000 miles during his two-year ownership. A new flywheel, clutch, and a UUC short shifter were installed in March 2017, and further modifications added by the seller include a Bilstein PSS10 coilover kit, a Supersprint exhaust, and wheel spacers. This E46 M3 is now being offered for sale with receipts from new, original window sticker, factory manuals, results from a recent PPI, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

Minor flaws in the Jet Black paint are captured in the gallery. The seller had the front bumper refinished and notes a few minor dings in the rear bumper. No accidents are listed on the included Carfax report.
18” double-spoke alloys were refinished in the OEM shade of Satin Chrome last year. 10mm wheel spacers have been added, and Michelin Pilot Super Sports are date-coded from 2015.

Optional equipment includes heated and powered front seats with driver-side memory, headlamp washers, a power glass moonroof, rain-sensing wipers, and a Harman-Kardon sound system. Black Nappa leather seats are accented with glossy black trim and are pictured up close in the gallery. A toolkit is retained in the trunk, and a new OEM M-Mobility tire inflator is included.

The 3.2L S54 was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A new flywheel, clutch, UUC short shifter, and a Supersprint cat-back exhaust were installed in March 2017, and the original exhaust system is included in the sale and pictured in the gallery.

A Bilstein PSS10 coilover kit was installed last year. A recent PPI completed at South Shore Autoworks of Kingston, Massachusetts reportedly found no subframe cracking issues, and the full report is viewable in the gallery below, along with additional underbody photos, an original window sticker, and copies of receipts.
The Carfax report lists three owners in Massachusetts and shows mileage consistent with the current odometer reading. A walk-around video is viewable below.

title: 16k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Jet Black over black leather and shows just under 16k miles. The car was originally leased from BMW Mountain View in California, remained with its first owner through 2,900 miles, and was acquired two years ago by the seller. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and factory options include the Premium Package, xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, 19″ alloy wheels, and heated seats. Modifications consist of Eibach springs and Koni dampers. A June 2015 service involved upgrading the VANOS unit as well as a valve adjustment, while an oil change was recently performed in anticipation of the sale. This E46 is offered with records dating to 2,800 miles, a clean AutoCheck report, original sales documents and accessories, and a clear California title.
Bodywork is finished in Jet Black, and several paint gauge readings are provided in the gallery below. Clear protective film is applied to the front bumper and the rear glass wears a 35% 3M tint.

The car rides on a set of factory Style 67 19″ wheels wearing Hankook Ventus V12 Evo tires at all four corners. Suspension modifications include Eibach springs and Koni dampers. Optional xenon headlights feature rain sensors and automatic dimming capabilities.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather, and factory options include a power moonroof, heated seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and aluminum interior trim. Seating surfaces, controls, switchgear, and plastics are shown up close in the gallery below. The odometer displays just under 16k miles, approximately 1000 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L DOHC S54 inline-six features double VANOS variable valve timing and drive-by-wire throttle control for a factory rating of 333 horsepower when new. The 2005 model year was exempt from the rod bearing recall afflicting earlier cars. A July 2015 service at 15,600 miles conducted by a BMW mechanic in Southern California included the following items:

The original window sticker is included and shows a total MSRP of $52,920. A collection of sales literature, books, partial service records from previous owners, seller receipts, a BMW flip-phone, and original purchase paperwork will accompany the sale.

The AutoCheck report indicates no accidents and shows lifelong California ownership. The seller operates his collection under a dealer license and the car will come with a California title in his company name.

title: 46K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 shows just over 46k miles and is equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and a paddle-shifted SMG transmission. The car was originally purchased at Chapman BMW in Scottsdale, Arizona by an airline pilot, with whom it remained until being acquired by the current owner two months ago. Finished in Alpine White over cinnamon leather interior, this car was optioned with 19″ wheels, Harman Kardon audio, xenon headlights, the Premium Package, navigation, and aluminum trim. A May 2018 service included replacing a fuel filter, the spark plugs, coil packs, a cabin filter, and more as detailed in the listing below. This E46 M3 is now being offered on behalf of the current owner by his son with the original window sticker, a clear Carfax report, three keys, the original books, receipts back to new, a PPI, and a clean California title.

The body is finished in Alpine White, and the seller notes the car was stored in a climate controlled garage during previous ownership. Receipts for a 2004 incident reportedly show a repainted rear bumper cover.
19″ Style 67 wheels show some curb rash and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measuring 225/40 in front and 255/35 out back.

The interior features cinnamon leather upholstery, power front seats with driver memory, BMW navigation, Karman Kardon sound, rain-sensing wipers, and more. The sequential SMG gearbox can be shifted via steering wheel paddles or the gear knob. The odometer currently displays just over 46k miles, about 1,500 of which have been added by the seller during his time with the car.

The 3.2L S54 was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The rod bearings were replaced under warranty in 2004 at 12k miles, and a PPI conducted by The M Shop in Los Angeles, California is included in the sale. Maintenance records from the previous owner show the following services:
A subframe inspection conducted by The M Shop in Los Angeles, California reportedly showed no issues.
The window sticker above lists factory colors, options, and an MSRP of $58,720.
The Carfax report indicates no accident damage and shows longterm Arizona ownership prior to the car moving to California in 2018. A walk-around video is viewable below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over grey leather and is equipped the Competition Package, heated seats, and a sunroof. The seller has added 94k of the 104k indicated miles since purchasing the vehicle at United BMW of Georgia in 2006. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and the car is said to have been kept stock apart from silver carbon fiber trim. An overhaul of the cooling system and VANOS was performed approximately 5k miles ago, and the car is said to have been regularly serviced at the recommended intervals. Recent maintenance included new lower control arms, an oil change, and an inspection. This E46 M3 is now being offered for sale with service records, an accident-free Carfax, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The Silver Grey Metallic finish is shown up close in a number of images provided in the gallery, and some paint chips on the hood and front bumper are noted by the seller along with a small ding on the driver door. The driver-side rocker panel was replaced due to damage from a jack approximately three years ago, and the rear bumper cover was repainted by the seller. Staggered 19″ Competition Package alloy wheels wear Michelin tires date-coded from 2017.

Inside, the heated grey leather sport seats are complimented with matching carpets and M-branded floor mats. The car retains its factory stereo and navigation system, and Competition Package amenities include an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel with a “Track Mode” button that raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control. Silver carbon fiber trim has been installed, and 104k miles are shown on the digital odometer, 94k of which were added by the seller.

When new, the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Maintenance was performed by United BMW through 75k miles, and the seller reports that all inspections were completed at the recommended intervals. The VANOS variable valve timing system was rebuilt and the cooling system was overhauled at at 99k miles, with applicable receipts provided in the gallery. An inspection was recently performed along with an oil change.
Both lower control arms were replaced in May, and additional undercarriage photos are viewable in the gallery below.
A provided Carfax report shows no accidents and displays Georgia history from new. Mileage inconsistencies on the last two entries in 2017 may be the result of a clerical error.

title: 22K-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows just under 22k miles. Factory options consist of bi-xenon headlamps, the Cold Weather Package, a Harman Kardon stereo, the Premium Package, and width-adjustable seats. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and modifications include painted front reflectors along with a set of 19″ Competition Package wheels. The seller has owned six E46 M3s including this example, which he acquired approximately a year ago. The engine oil, transmission fluid, differential oil, filters, and battery have since been changed. This E46 M3 is offered with recent parts receipts, factory books, both keys, a clear Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

This is a re-list after the car was previously sold on BaT in May 2018 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with his commitment to purchase, though not due to any fault with the vehicle. That buyer has been banned from any further participation in BaT Auctions and his buyer fee was not refunded.

The exterior is finished in Imola Red, and the seller believes that no past paintwork has occurred based on depth meter readings. The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. The previous owner had the car for over nine years, during which it was reportedly kept garaged when not in use.

Bi-xenon headlamps are present and a set of OEM 19″ Competition Package alloys from another E46 has been installed. Bridgestone Potenza RE050A tires are sized 245/35 up front and 275/30 in the rear, with all wearing 2008 and 2009 date codes.

The black leather interior features dual power and heated seats with memory functions for the driver as well as aluminum trim on the door panels, center console, and dashboard. A few creases on the driver’s outer bolstering are depicted above. The seller replaced the fluid filled, auto-dimming rearview mirror glass in April 2018.

Additional equipment includes cruise control, automatic climate control, power windows/mirrors/locks, an electric sunroof, a Harman Kardon stereo, and more. Driver and passenger airbag recalls were completed during the seller’s ownership. The digital odometer is said to remain unchanged at just under 22k miles, around 1,500 of which have been added by the seller over the past year.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Annual oil changes were reportedly performed by the previous owner, while the seller has personally carried out changes of the engine oil, transmission fluid, and differential oil as well as a new fuel filter, engine and cabin air filters, and battery. All work was performed in June 2017, and the associated parts receipts are pictured in the gallery below.
Additional underside images can be viewed in the gallery.
Per the accident-free Carfax report, this M3 was sold new in Ohio and stayed in state until the seller purchased and moved it to Massachusetts in 2017. Five service entries are also displayed.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
listing_details: Inspection II and Clutch Service at 50k Miles
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 features a number of Dinan Performance components and is equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six and a paddle-shifted SMG transmission. The seller acquired the car in 2014 from the second owner and has since added approximately 7k of the 57k indicated miles. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather, this example was optioned with nagivation, a moonroof, Harman Kardon audio, a 6-disc CD-changer, parking sensors, and 19″ wheels. Dinan modifications consist of a high flow intake, exhaust system, throttle bodies, a 4.10 rear differential, engine software, and more as detailed in the listing. A service conducted this month included a mechanical inspection, oil change, and a new battery. This E46 M3 is now being offered with some service receipts, the original window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, and no history of accidents or other damage is are reported by the Carfax report. A pair of xenon fog lights are fitted along with “angel eye” halo rings. Blemishes include a few small paint chips and scratches on the front bumper and hood, as well as a mark on the roof near the driver door and a pair of small scratches on the rear bumper.
A start-up and walk-around video can be seen above.

19″ Style 67 wheels wear Michelin Super Sport tire up front, and the Continental ContiSports rear tires show approximately 50% tread-life according to the seller. A set of Turner Motorsports front camber plates are fitted, and the rear trailing arm bushings were replaced with Power Flex items. Per the seller, an additional pair of OEM rear wheels will be included in the sale.

The interior is trimmed in black leather and features sport seats with manual adjustments, BMW navigation, Karman Kardon sound, a moonroof, and more. Additional equipment includes a BELL laser jammer and a Valentine One detector. The seller notes that the cassette player is inoperable, a line of dead pixels is present on the nagivation screen, and the polarized rear-view mirror leaked fluid onto the aluminum trim, dash, and door handles. 3M DI-NOC vinyl wrap film covers the original trim with close-ups are viewable in the gallery below.

The sequential SMG gearbox can be shifted via a pair of aftermarket carbon fiber steering wheel paddles or the gear shifter. A few scratches are noted on the steering wheel, and the odometer currently displays just over 57k miles, about 7k of which have been added by the seller during his time with the car.

Dinan upgrades for the 3.2L S54 inline-six and 6-speed SMG include a 4.10 rear differential, a high-flow intake, exhaust, larger throttle bodies, software for the engine and transmission, as well as front and rear strut braces. Per the seller, an inspection II was conducted on April 2013 at approximately 50k miles and included replacing the clutch. The subframe was serviced in November 2010, and the seller reports consistent oil changes throughout his ownership, as well as transmission and differential flushes.
The original window sticker shows standard equipment, engine specifications, factory options, and an MSRP of $57,495.
The included Carfax report shows 28 service records, and the seller notes that the Takata airbag recall was completed. A few driving videos can be seen below.

title: 62k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Imola Red over black leather and was originally sold in Massachusetts, where it stayed with its original owner for over ten years. The selling dealer acquired the car from the second owner for personal use two years ago with 60k miles showing, and has since logged 2k behind the wheel. The car is equipped with a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and modifications include 19″ wheels with Nitto Motivo tires. An Inspection II was completed in 2016 along with replacement of the rear springs and trailing arm bushings, differential seals, and more. This E46 is offered with an accident-free Carfax report, recent receipts, and a New Hampshire title in the name of the seller’s dealership.

The body is finished in Imola Red with a black soft top, which houses a heated glass rear window and is shown both raised and lowered in photos. The selling dealer reports that the car has been stored in his personal garage during his ownership.
19″ aftermarket wheels have been added, though the factory alloys are included and wear new tires. New rear springs and trailing arm bushings were installed in 2017.

The interior is trimmed in black leather with metal-look trim and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats with driver-side memory. Just over 62k miles are indicated on the odometer, 2k of which have been driven by the seller. A factory tool kit is located beneath the rear deck lid.

The S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and was originally rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque for the US market. An Inspection II service in 2016 included replacement of the output shaft seal and both differential seals, a power steering pressure line, several filters, and more as detailed in the receipt viewable below.
The Carfax indicates two previous owners and illustrates a steady accumulation of mileage consistent with the odometer reading as well as listing two open airbag recalls.

title: 41k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe is a non-sunroof car equipped with the Competition Package and finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon leather. The seller has owned the car for eight years, and the odometer now shows just under 41k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission. According to the seller, this E46 has been kept stock throughout and is a lightly-optioned example without a factory navigation system. This M3 is now being offered in Missouri with recent service records, factory manuals, three keys, a clear Carfax, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

BMW’s Carbon Black Metallic paint appears very dark blue when exposed to sunlight, and the provided Carfax shows no history of accidents or other damage. One scratch on the passenger-side front fender is pointed out in the photo gallery below.
The 19″ Competition Package alloy wheels are fitted with Continental ExtremeContact tires, and the factory braking system includes cross drilled rotors.
Inside, the Cinnamon leather upholstery is accented with aluminum trim on the door pulls and dashboard. This particular M3 is not fitted with a sunroof or in-dash navigation system.

Competition Package cars came equipped with an Alcantara-rimmed steering wheel as shown above. Manual shifting of the SMG transmission can be performed via paddles attached to the steering wheel or via the gear lever itself. The seller states that he has added approximately 20k miles over the past eight years, and the digital odometer currently shows just under 41k miles.

The S54 3.2-liter inline-six has been kept stock and produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Invoices for dealer-performed 30k-mile and 40k-mile services are included with the sale.
Engine start-up and driving videos can be viewed above.
Additional undercarriage photos are displayed in the gallery below.

The accident-free Carfax was run on June 19, 2018 and shows two owners including the seller. The car appears to have spent the majority of its life in Illinois, and a number of service history records are also provided.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black Nappa leather and shows 66k miles. Power comes from a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and optional equipment includes 19″ wheels, the Premium and Cold Weather packages, Harman Kardon audio, and xenon headlights. The included Carfax report notes dealer maintenance from 2006-2010, and the car was recently serviced with new rear springs and trailing arm bushings as well as a brake fluid flush. This E46 M3 is offered by the selling dealer with an AutoCheck report as well as a window sticker, books, manuals, keys, and a clean New York title.

Sheet metal is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic paint, close-up photos of which are shown in the gallery below. A right front impact in 2016 reportedly involved a trailer in a parking lot and resulted in repair of the front bumper area. Factory Style 67 wheels are mounted with 19″ Continental ExtremeContact tires at all four corners.

A detailed view of the exterior is provided in the video above. A set of new OEM rear springs has been installed during the seller’s ownership along with fresh trailing arm bushings. A brake fluid flush has also been carried out.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather with Aluminum Shadow accents, and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats. Optional equipment includes Harman Kardon audio, xenon headlamps, and rain-sensing wipers. Interior surfaces, switchgear, and controls are shown in detail in the gallery.
A detailed video tour of the interior can be viewed above. The digital odometer shows just under 66k miles. The sunroof shade is stated to be inoperable.

The 3.2L S54B32 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7900 rpm when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Cars from the 2004 model year received updated components and were exempt from the rod bearing recall afflicting earlier years. This example was dealer serviced from 2006-2010 according to the Carfax report, and the VANOS variable valve timing system was recently inspected. Issue noted by the seller include noise from the rear differential when turning sharply.

An inspection by the seller’s local shop noted the beginnings of cracking at the forward passenger-side rear subframe mounting point, though the seller states he has been unable to personally verify the existence of the damage. Several photos of the subframe attachment points are provided in the gallery below.
The original window sticker shows an MSRP of $57,245 as well as detailing factory options and specifications.
Carfax and AutoCheck reports are included, with both noting the 2016 accident as well as open recalls for Takata driver and front passenger airbags.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed paddle-shifted SMG transmission. The car is finished in black over black leather and equipped with a black convertible top as well as back-up sensors, a rear window defroster, and the Cold Weather package with heated seats. An upgraded VANOS unit according to the seller. This E46 is offered with partial records, original books, a Carfax report, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in black, and the top is equipped with an integrated hard-shell top boot. Stock lighting includes clear turn signals and amber front side markers. The seller describes a scratch on the underside of the left front fender and scuffs on the front and rear bumpers.

The black convertible top is equipped with a glass rear window with an electric defroster element. One of the door windows was replaced in 2017 according to the Carfax report. Backup sensors are visible in the rear bumper. Factory 18″ alloy wheels are fitted with Continental ExtremeContact tires.
