The cabin is trimmed in black leather accented by an anthracite grey trim strip across the dash. The car is equipped with a Harman Kardon sound system and the Cold Weather Package with heated seats. The seller notes that the exterior temperature sensor does not read accurately, and the airbag light is illuminated.

Just over 83k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 40k of which were added by the seller during his 3-year ownership. Wear is visible on the leather steering wheel rim and the soft-touch materials on the center stack.

The car is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed SMG automated manual gearbox. Factory output was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new, and the engine features an 8k-rpm redline. Per the seller the car is equipped with an upgraded VANOS variable valve timing unit.
Factory literature is included in a leather-bound portfolio.

The Carfax report shows history in California and Montana from new. No accidents are noted, though two separates instances of other damage are listed in 2011 and 2016 along with an outstanding Takata airbag recall.

title: 2002 BMW M3 SMG
interior_color: Imola Red over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Imola Red over Black Nappa Leather
Uninstalled Dinan Software/aFE Cold Air Intake
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Imola Red over Black Nappa leather and was purchased new by its current owner from Claridge’s BMW in Fremont, California. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission and the car is optioned with the Premium Package, a moonroof, xenon lighting, Harman Kardon audio, and parking sensors. Modifications include a Dinan exhaust, software updates, and M3 CSL brake rotors with stainless lines. An Inspection II was completed at 62k miles, and other dealer maintenance and recalls are reported to be up to date. This E46 M3 shows 66k miles and is offered by the seller on behalf of its owner with records, literature, a Valentine 1 radar detector, a clean Carfax report, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

The Imola Red (405) paint is shown in several close-up photos below, and no accidents or other damage are indicated on the Carfax report and per the seller. The seller notes slight pitting on the headlights, stone chips along the hood and a passenger-side door ding as well as a scrape and crack in the front chin spoiler that has been repaired with pop rivets.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear Yokohama Neova tires at all four corners and display pitting and rash in close-up photos. Cross-drilled M3 CSL floating rotors are accompanied by EBC Yellowstuff pads and stainless steel lines. Suspension modifications include UUC front and rear adjustable sway bars.

The black interior features Black Nappa leather (N5SW) sport seats as well as Titanium trim, an optional armrest, and paddle shifters for the SMG II transmission. The seller notes modest wear to the driver-side floor mat. A Valentine 1 radar detector has been installed along with a GROM Bluetooth adapter, which results in the disconnection of the factory CD changer. Per the seller, the car has never been smoked in.

The digital odometer shows approximately 66k miles. The auto-dimming rear-view mirror exhibits a large bubble in the glass, crazing is noted in the door handle plastics, and the storage compartment cover forward of the shifter also shows several scrapes.

Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six that received Recall SI B110404 to address the rod bearing issue common to the model according to the seller. Underhood modifications include Shark Injector performance software and a Dinan exhaust as well as front and rear aluminum strut braces. An aFe POWER cold air intake is included but uninstalled, and a Dinan Stage 2 software update was recently purchased by the owner but has yet to be implemented. An inspection II was conducted at 62k miles per the seller. The seller reports the car has never been tracked.

Several photos of the underside are included in the gallery. Records are said to document consistent maintenance performed at BMW service centers from new aside from oil changes, which were performed by the owner at 6500-mile intervals with BMW oil. Also accompanying the car are upgrade receipts, the original window sticker, books and manuals, period literature, three sets of keys, and a spare set of headlight surrounds.

The Carfax report shows no history of accidents and verifies the one-owner history. There is an outstanding recall for the Takata-equipped airbag that the seller will have addressed if the part becomes available before the new owner takes delivery.

title: 34K-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
listing_details: Recent Inspection I and II Services
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather and shows 34k miles. The car was purchased new from Circle BMW in Shrewsbury, New Jersey, and recently acquired by the seller from its original owner. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and Inspection I and II services were recently performed in anticipation of the sale. The seller states that receipts for work performed under warranty are included, factory recalls have been addressed, and the rear subframe was recently inspected. This E46 M3 is offered with original purchase documents, partial service records, books and keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Delaware title in the seller’s name.

Carbon Black Metallic (416) paint is photographed up close in the gallery below, which also contains several depth meter readings. The seller points out stone chips and scuffing along the lower edge of the front bumper cover as well as a handful of small scratches. No accidents or other damage are shown in the Carfax report, and the seller states that the car has been garaged and driven seasonally throughout its life.

Factory Style 67 18″ alloy wheels contain small scuffs as detailed in the gallery and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S Plus tires showing 2009 date codes. The black fabric top features a heated glass rear window and is shown both raised and lowered in photos.

The cabin is trimmed in black leather over power-adjusted heated seats and accented with brushed aluminum trim. M3-branded sill plates and floor mats are included, and the condition of the self-dimming rearview mirror is pictured below.

Options include rain-sensing wipers, Harman Kardon audio, and a 6-disc CD changer. The digital odometer shows just under 34k miles, with under 200 added by the seller. Warning lights show a fault with the ABS pressure sensor, and a replacement sensor is included.
A folding wind deflector is stowed in the trunk, and the seller states that the rear subframe welds were inspected during recent service. A factory tool kit and 6-disc CD changer are also included.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and standard limited-slip differential. Inspection I and II services were recently completed by the seller’s mechanic. The car falls within the range for the S54 rod bearing service action, which the included warranty paperwork shows as addressed in 2004.
A collection of owner’s books, brochures, and other literature is included along with a window sticker showing factory options, equipment, and a 2003 MSRP of $58k.

The recent Carfax report shows an accident-free history in New Jersey under the original owner, and more recently in Delaware with the seller. A video of the instrument cluster during a cold start can be viewed below.

title: 48K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Imola Red over Imola Red Leather
listing_details: Imola Red over Imola Red Leather
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in Imola Red over a matching leather interior and was first registered in Arlington, Virginia in November 2004. The car passed through additional owners in Illinois, Missouri, and Pennsylvania before it was acquired by the selling dealer in late 2017. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include a Harman Kardon sound system, heated seats, and xenon headlights. Now showing approximately 48k miles, this E46 M3 is offered by the selling dealer with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished Imola Red, with the paintwork shown up close in the gallery below along with the lighting and other trim. No accidents or other damage are noted on the included Carfax report. The car was reportedly used as a weekend car by its previous owner, who added about 1300 miles since November 2015.

This car was optioned with xenon lights from the factory and features black shadowline trim around the front grille. Factory Style 67 wheels are mounted with a set of Bridgestone Potenza RE970AS tires.

The interior features matching Imola Red heated leather seats in addition to black carpeting and aluminum dash trim. A Harman Kardon stereo system was equipped from new. The odometer shows approximately 48k miles. Factory controls, switchgear, and instrumentation are detailed in the gallery.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Maintenance records from the previous owners are unavailable, though several services are noted on the included Carfax report.
Undercarriage photos have been provided to document the condition of the suspension, chassis, and exhaust. The seller states that the rear subframe mounting points appear to remain stock.
No accidents or body repairs are shown on the Carfax report, the full version of which can be viewed in the gallery below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked to a 6-speed SMG transmission. The car reportedly had three previous owners in California and was acquired by the selling dealer earlier this year. An inspection and fluid service was performed by the dealership five months ago, and modifications include a Dinan exhaust, an aftermarket radio, carbon fiber exterior trim, and a few other cosmetic items. This E46 M3 is now being offered for sale at no reserve in Texas with a clean Carfax report and a clear California title.

Sheet metal wears a Titanium Silver Metallic finish, and no accidents are shown on the included Carfax report. Carbon fiber front and rear spoilers and kidney grilles have been added, along with smoked front corners and side indicator lenses. A vinyl graphic has been applied to the hood, and the seller notes some paint chips on forward facing surfaces as well as a scratch on the right headlight.
19” Style 67 wheels show some curb rash and wear a set of Toyo Proxes rubber. A Dinan exhaust system has been installed out back.

Electrically-adjustable sport seats are trimmed in black leather and feature M logos on the headrests. Carbon fiber trim has been added to the center console, and some wear is noted around the SMG shift knob. An aftermarket head unit features a display screen, navigation, and Bluetooth capabilities. Under 107k miles are shown on the digital odometer.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is equipped with double VANOS variable valve timing and is paired with a 6-speed SMG sequential manual transmission. An inspection and fluid service was reportedly performed by a dealership five months ago.
Additional underside photos are included in the gallery below, as are images of the trunk with the carpets pulled back.

The clean Carfax report lists no issues and shows three California owners from new. Several entries document dealership maintenance throughout the prior two ownerships, and the car most recently passed a California emissions test in 2016.

title: 53k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
interior_color: Interlagos Blue Over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Interlagos Blue Over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is finished in Interlagos Blue over black Nappa leather and is equipped with the Competition, Premium, and Cold Weather packages. Reportedly built during the final day of E46 M3 production, this well-optioned example was leased from new and subsequently purchased as a Certified Pre-Owned Vehicle by the previous owner out of New York. The car has been driven approximately 14k of its 53k indicated miles since it was acquired by the seller and brought to Florida in April 2016. Service records date to new and include a preventative overhaul of the VANOS system 3k miles ago, as well as an Inspection II that was completed at 40k miles. The car benefits from a recent paint correction and ceramic coating, and an oil change was performed less than 1k miles ago. This E46 M3 is now being offered for sale with records from new, a car cover, clean Carfax and AutoCheck reports, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

Interlagos Blue was offered exclusively on M3s equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. Paint correction was performed in March, and a ceramic coating was also applied to the finish. According to the seller, the driver’s door was repainted approximately eight years ago after the vehicle was keyed. No accidents are listed on the included Carfax or AutoCheck reports, and the car was reportedly stored in a climate-controlled garage during winters on Long Island.
Staggered-width 19” cross-spoke alloy wheels are wrapped in Hankook Ventus V12 tires. Larger cross-drilled rotors and an upgraded steering rack came standard as part of the Competition Package.

Black Nappa leather seats are powered and heated and show some light creasing on the driver’s outer bolster. Interior options include aluminum trim, a sunroof, and a navigation system. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with a “Track Mode” button that raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control. The driver and passenger airbag recall was reportedly addressed by the seller.

An illuminated shift knob from an F10 M5 has been added, and the factory stereo and CD changer are retained. 53k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 14k of which have been added during the seller’s two-year ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Recent maintenance included a new valve cover gasket, power steering reservoir O-ring, clutch and brake fluid, and an oil change. Records date to new and are said to cover a preventative overhaul of the VANOS system at 50k miles, an Inspection II at 40k miles, as well as receipts documenting a new chain tensioner guide, cam gear bolts, serpentine belts, and more.
Additional undercarriage photos are viewable in the gallery.

A provided Carfax shows no issues and lists history in New York and Florida. According to the seller, the first and second owners are the same individual, who purchased the car as a CPO vehicle following the conclusion of his lease.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Two Sets of 18" Wheels and Tires
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows just under 100k miles. Originally purchased in Florida, the car has resided in Kansas since 2003. The seller purchased this E46 six years ago and has added 11k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Drivetrain modifications include an aluminum flywheel, ATC clutch, UUC short shifter and an AFE intake kit. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records since 2003, a clean Carfax, and a clear Kansas title in the seller’s name.

The Imola Red finish shows paint chips on the hood and bumper. The seller says he has used the car in one high performance driver education event per year over the course of his ownership. The windshield shows considerable pitting and the seller reports there is a small dent on the passenger door and rear fender.
18″ BBS Motorsport wheels are fitted with Sumitomo HTRZ3 tires from 2009. An extra set of 18″ Apex wheels with Hankook Ventus RS4 tires are included in the sale as shown in the gallery below.

The cabin is upholstered in black leather with a leather shift knob, and leather-wrapped 3-spoke steering wheel. The seller says the power seats work, however the leather shows typical wear. Instrumentation is specific to the M3, which includes gray-faced gauges, a 185 MPH speedometer, and a variable LED redline on the tachometer. The odometer shows 99,578 miles, 11k of which were added by the seller since purchasing the car six years ago.

Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. Modifications include an AFE intake kit, ATC clutch, UUC short shifter, and a lightweight aluminum flywheel. The seller reports that the non-stock flywheel causes transmission gears to rattle at idle, and the RPMs to dip when the A/C compressor turn ons. Recent service in March 2018 included oil changes for the engine, transmission, and differential.

The chassis has been modified with TC Klein single adjustable coil-overs, a Turner strut bar strut bar, and front sway bar from Ground Control. The brakes were recently serviced with new front and rear brake pads.
Several removed OEM parts come with the sale including the coil overs, sway bar, flywheel and clutch.
The accident-free Carfax confirms mileage and shows ownership is Florida, New York, and Kansas.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 was sold new in the Houston, Texas area and remained registered in the state until being acquired by the seller at the beginning of 2018 and moved to California. Finished in Titan Silver Metallic over black leather, the car is equipped with xenon headlights, LED taillights, and piano black interior trim. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and an Inspection II service and valve adjustment were performed within the past 2,000 miles. Now showing approximately 70,700 miles, this E46 M3 is being offered for sale out of San Francisco, California with its factory manuals, a clean Carfax, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s company.

The body is finished in Titan Silver Metallic, and a ~2″ blemish is noted on the passenger-side lower corner of the front bumper as shown in photos. Other wear consistent with age is present, though no history of accidents or other damage is indicated by the attached Carfax report.

This car was ordered with xenon headlights from new and was fitted with LED taillights while with one of the previous owners. The right-rear wheel has some curb rash present. The wheels are currently mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW Tuned tires on the front and ExtremeContact Sport tires on the rear. Both sets of tires are reported to have been driven less than 2,200 miles since they were installed.

The interior seating is trimmed in black leather, with wear and fading visible on both front seats. The center arm rest cover has been removed but is included in the sale, and an aftermarket Alpine radio has been installed. The seller notes that the A-pillar material has begun to sag.

Black trim can be seen around the shifter and on the dashboard, and the 3-spoke steering wheel features BMW Motorsport stitching. The odometer currently shows approximately 70,700 miles, about 700 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission. Service records from the seller and previous owner are included in the sale, with the most recent record being an Inspection II service and valve adjustment. A small oil leak when parked is noted by the seller.
A photo of the recent service can be seen in the gallery. The seller notes that the shop recommended that the right front control arm and brake lines may need replacement due to age.
The provided Carfax report shows no issues and can be viewed in the gallery below. The factory owners manuals, a car cover, and a front end bra are also included in the sale.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in black over a black leather interior and is equipped with Harman Kardon sound, a power sunroof, the Cold Weather Package, and 19″ BMW wheels. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a Getrag 6-speed manual transmission. Now showing just under 98k miles, this E46 M3 was purchased by the seller out of Texas in 2013 and has since been driven 22k miles. It is being offered with service records dating back to 2013, the factory 18″ wheels, a clean Carfax, a recent PPI, and a clear Missouri title in the seller’s name.

The hood was recently been refinished to correct for scratches, and the left door handle was replaced in 2017. Window tint has been added, and the brake calipers were powder coated by a previous owner. The seller notes some fading around the window trim.

19″ Style 67 wheels have been added, and the original 18″ items are included but are in need of refinishing. New Firestone Firehawk Indy 500 tires were installed in October 2017, and a 4-wheel alignment was performed in June of that year.
An interior and exterior walk-around video can be seen above.

The black Nappa leather interior features a power sunroof, factory Harman Kardon sound system, and the Cold Weather Package, which adds heated seats, a headlight cleaning system, and a ski bag. The seller notes that the rearview mirror is loose.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been serviced during the seller’s ownership with new drive belts, spark plugs, an improved constant pressure check valve, and a recent oil change. Warranty history documentation in the gallery reports that the connecting rod bearings and bolts were replaced under warranty at approximately 30k miles. An Inspection Service II was completed personally by the seller, and parts receipts and valve clearance measurement records are included. A cold start video can be seen here.

Additional underbody photos in the gallery display the floorpans, chassis, exhaust, and suspension components. The seller states that the subframe was checked at every oil change and shows no signs of cracking, and the differential input shaft seal has been replaced. An included pre-purchase inspection notes seepage from the transmission and differential.
Manuals and service records dating back to 2013 are included with the vehicle.
The Carfax report shows ownership in Kentucky, Florida, Texas, and Missouri with no records of accidents or other damage. A driving video can be seen below.

title: Laguna Seca Blue 2001 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray leather and shows 49k miles from a life of Southern California ownership. Power is sent from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual gearbox and variable locking differential. The car was optioned new with the Cold Weather and Luxury packages, xenon headlights, Harman Kardon sound, and lumbar adjustment. Modifications include a Dinan exhaust system,  Competition Package brakes and 19″ wheels, and TC Kline double-adjustable coilovers. This E46 is offered with a window sticker, service records, owner’s manuals, a clean AutoCheck, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

Laguna Seca Blue (448) was available on the E46 M3 from 2000 through 2004. Cross-drilled Competition Package brakes have also been fitted. Coilovers from TC Kline were installed in 2012 and are adjustable for rebound and compression.
Factory 19″ BMW Competition Package wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sports measuring 235/40 up front and 255/35 out back.

The interior was optioned in gray leather with the Cold Weather and Luxury packages, offering a power moonroof, powered and heated seats, and a ski bag.  The seller notes slight bolster wear on drivers seat, and additional interior images are provided in the gallery.
A Harman Kardon sound system was optioned from the factory. Just over 49k miles are shown on the odometer, with 1,300 added over the past four years.

The 3.2-liter S54B32 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm in stock form, and this example is equipped with a Dinan exhaust system. An oil change at 48k miles included a new drain plug, while a Level II service was conducted at 36k miles as documented in provided invoices. An aftermarket strut tower brace can be seen above. Annual oil changes by the seller are reported, with the most recent being in June 2018 during a brake fluid flush. A factory rod bearing recall was conducted in 2004 as shown in the gallery, and the seller claims service records from all the previous owners.
The window sticker shows the original equipment, and additional service records are provided in the gallery.
A complete clean AutoCheck report can be viewed in the gallery, and four prior owners are noted. The seller will conduct a California smog check for the next owner.

title: 33k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
interior_color: Alpine White Over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Alpine White Over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller in July 2005 from Habberstad BMW in Huntington Station, New York. Finished in Alpine White over black leather, the car came equipped from the factory with the Competition Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, a moonroof, heated seats, Park Distance Control, and more. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox, while modifications include an AFE intake, UUC short-shifter, and 3.90:1 limited-slip differential. Recent maintenance conducted by the seller’s private mechanic included new OEM brake pads and rotors, radiator hoses, belts, and fluids. Now showing just over 33k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with a clean AutoCheck report, a purchase order and window sticker, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller’s name.
The body is finished in Alpine White, and the paintwork is shown up close in several gallery photos below. No history of accidents or other damage is listed on the AutoCheck report.

Staggered 19″ Competition Package alloy wheels are said to wear their original Michelin Pilot Sport tires all around. Larger cross-drilled rotors and an upgraded steering rack came standard as part of the Competition Package.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather and features heated sport seats as well as a UUC short shift kit. Other equipment includes a Harman Kardon sound system, moonroof, 3-spoke Alcantara-wrapped Motorsport steering wheel, and aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels.

The odometer displays just over 33k miles, all of which have been added by the seller. A BMW Business CD player is fitted rather than the optional in-dash navigation system. Several scratches are visible on the steering wheel.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and driveline upgrades include a high-flow air intake and 3.90:1 Motorsport rear differential. Factory output was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Recent maintenance included fluid changes as well as installation of new radiator hoses and belts.
The AutoCheck report indicates no accident damage and shows history in New York and New Mexico.

title: 176-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe shows 176 miles and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II transmission, and the car is optioned with the Premium Package including a moonroof, xenon lighting, and Harman Kardon sound system. The seller purchased the car three months ago, when it showed approximately 50 miles after 14 years of storage in an outdoor carport with its first owner. Recent service included replacement of the spark plugs along with fresh fluids and filters throughout. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, factory manuals, accident-free Carfax report, and clean Hawaii title in the seller’s name.

The Carbon Black Metallic paint and optional xenon headlights are shown in several close-up photos in the gallery below. No accidents or other damage are indicated on the Carfax report. Photos show small rust spots on both front quarter panels inside the engine bay as well as bubbling on the driver-side mirror.

Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels were optioned for $1,700 and reportedly wear their original Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Pitting can be seen on the face of the driver-side front wheel. Aftermarket blue bulbs have been installed in the front turn signals, and the rear windows have been tinted.

The interior features optional aluminum trim, powered sport seats in black Nappa leather, and a moonroof. A Harman Kardon sound system is fitted as well as Park Distance Control and rain-sensing wipers. The seller reports that the air conditioning system has a leak and the rear area of the interior headliner is falling. Photos also show peeling rubber coating on several interior pieces.
The digital odometer shows only 176 miles, 128 of which were added by the seller in three months of ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels via a 6-speed SMG II transmission. A July 2018 service included replacement of the engine oil and filter as well as the transmission and differential fluids. The brake fluid was flushed, new air and fuel filters were installed, and fresh spark plugs were fitted.
The underbody can be seen in several photos in the gallery below. Rust is noted by the seller on the rear subframe and several suspension parts.

The window sticker shows an MSRP of $58,395 which included options such as the electric moonroof, power seats, Nappa leather interior, xenon headlights, Harman Kardon sound system, aluminum interior trim, 19″ wheels, and SMG transmission.
The accident-free Carfax report shows an oil and filter change in 2008. A gap in registration is shown from 2014 to 2018 when the seller purchased the vehicle.

title: 48k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
listing_details: Carbon Fiber Hood, Trunk, and Ground Effects
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Jet Black over Cinnamon leather and shows 48k miles. Originally purchased in Louisiana, the car moved to Texas following the seller’s acquisition in 2008 and resided there until he relocated to Illinois in 2017. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed sequential transmission, and this example is optioned with the Premium Package and 19″ wheels. Modifications include a carbon fiber hood, trunk, and ground effects, as well as Koni coilovers and a K&N open-element air intake. Recalls and service actions have reportedly been addressed, and this E46 is titled to the seller’s fiancé. It is now being offered in Illinois with service records, factory tools and owner’s books, a clean Carfax, and a clean Texas title.

The body is finished in Jet Black (668), and a VIS carbon fiber hood with color-keyed kidney grilles has been added along with a CSL-style carbon fiber deck lid. Carbon fiber-look roundels and a carbon fiber front spoiler lip and rear diffuser were also installed. The seller notes that the deck lid will require paint correction or refinishing and the front bumper cover was repainted to correct typical stone chips.

Xenon headlights, headlamp washers, and Park Distance Control sensors are among delivery options, though aftermarket headlamps and lenses have been since installed. The car rides lower than stock on Koni coilovers, and 19″ Style 67 wheels wear mixed tires.

The cabin is trimmed in Cinnamon leather, and power front seats features lumbar adjustment and memory settings. Wear can be seen on the driver’s seat, and the seller notes some wear visible on the door panels.

The Premium Package included rain-sensing wipers and an auto-dimming rear view mirror, and Harmon-Kardon audio and an in-dash BMW Business CD player are equipped. The seller notes scratches and crackling finish on center console trim around the SMG sequential shifter. Driver and passenger airbag recalls were addressed in November 2016. 48,345 miles are currently shown, around 18k of which were added by the seller in 10 years of driving.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new and is paired with a 6-speed SMG II electro-hydraulic sequential manual transmission. An open-element K&N cone filter has been added. The seller states that the rod bearing recall has been conducted, and major service in 2016 included an Inspection I service, installation of reinforced rear subframe bushings, and updated DME programming. Spark plugs, coil packs, and the hood latch have also been replaced. December 2017 service included replacement of the pinion shaft seal, and engine and differential oils.

A printout of a BMW dealer record lists build details and equipment, as well as the status of recall campaigns and service actions. Excerpts from the seller’s service records can be seen in the gallery.

A recent Carfax records an accident-free history under two owners in Louisiana, Texas, and Illinois, with regular service visits to Louisiana and Missouri BMW dealerships listed under the first owner.

title: 41k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red leather and was purchased new at Sonnen BMW in San Rafael by the seller on January 6, 2005. The car stayed in California through 2014 when the seller moved to Dallas, Texas, and has reportedly been serviced by BMW dealers and Alpina in Napa, California from new. Power is sent to the rear wheels from a 3.2L S54 inline-six via a 6-speed SMG automated manual transmission. The Takata airbag recall has been addressed and an Inspection I was performed in November 2016. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, manuals, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Texas title.

The exterior is finished in Silver Gray Metallic that is shown up close in several photos below. The bumper surrounds were repainted in October 2015. Lighting includes optional xenon headlamps with washers, clear turn signals, and amber US-market side markers.

Optional 18″ wheels were fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport AS+ tires in 2013 and refinished in August 2017. The black convertible top is equipped with a glass rear window and rear defroster element. The seller describes the top as sealing tightly, and photos show it in both its raised and lowered positions.

The cabin is trimmed in Imola Red leather with aluminum accents and black plastics. Optional equipment includes Harman Kardon sound, navigation, adjustable lumbar support, and the Cold Weather Package with a ski bag as well as heated seats and mirrors. The seller notes that the fluid-filled rearview mirror was replaced about seven years ago, and new airbags were installed during the ongoing Takata recall.

Instrumentation includes a tachometer with an 8k rpm redline, 180 mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant and oil temperature. Approximately 41k miles are shown on the digital odometer. Interior features are said to work correctly, and the navigation system has been updated with 2015 maps. The rechargable glovebox flashlight is missing and the foam backing has been removed from the factory floor mats due to stretching.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque and features an 8k rpm redline. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed SMG automated manual gearbox. Records are said to date from new and show an Inspection II with new spark plugs, coils and a brake flush in October 2013, valve lifter service and adjustment in December 2014, and an Inspection I with flushes of the brakes, coolant, power steering, and differential in November 2016.

Manuals and books are retained in a BMW-branded portfolio. A set of navigation DVDs and a Bentley Publishing repair manual are also included. The window sticker is pictured in the gallery and shows the original options and $66,745 sticker price.

The Carfax report shows history with the seller in California and Texas from new. No accidents or other damage are indicated, and the report shows that the right and left airbags were replaced in 2014 and 2015 respectively.

title: 11k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Individual
interior_color: Japan Red over Back Nappa Leather
listing_details: Japan Red over Back Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 has just 11,599 miles and was ordered from BMW’s Individual program in Japan Red over a black Nappa leather interior. It was purchased new by the current owner, a BMW club member who has reportedly not tracked the car. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, which is paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission and a limited-slip differential. Factory equipment includes 18″ Style 67 wheels, and this E46 M3 is not equipped with a sunroof. It is now being offered on behalf of the original owner with service records, the factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The Japan Red (438) finish is original according to the seller, and the paintwork is shown up close in the gallery below. No history of accidents or other damage is indicated on the recent Carfax report. The current owner reportedly used the car fairly regularly, though only when driving for fun.
Exterior equipment includes rain-sensing wipers, and 18″ double-spoke Style 67 wheels wearing Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires at each corner.

The cabin features black Nappa leather sport seats with manual adjustments, as well as titanium trim and paddle shifters for the SMG transmission. According to the seller, the car is unmodified and interior functions operate as they should.
The digital odometer shows 11,599 miles, while factory controls, switchgear, and instrumentation are detailed up close in the gallery below.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double VANOS variable valve timing and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is routed to the rear wheels through a 6-speed sequential manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller reports the last service and inspection was performed in April of this year.
The Carfax report indicates no accident damage and shows longterm Florida ownership with one owner. Records are said to date back to 2005 and a walk-around video is viewable below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 SMG Individual
listing_details: BMW Individual Paint and Trim Combination
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 was ordered from BMW’s Individual program and is finished in Techno Violet Metallic over an Anthracite M-texture cloth interior. Factory options include navigation, a moonroof, xenon lighting, Harman Kardon audio, and parking sensors, and power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II sequential manual transmission. Since the seller’s purchase, California smog certification and a mechanical service has been completed following a pre-purchase inspection as detailed below. This E46 M3 now shows 75k miles and is being offered at no reserve with a Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

This is reported by the seller to be one of 11 examples finished in this color. Damage to the rear of the car from an incident in 2013 is noted on the Carfax, and the seller believes the damage was limited to the replacement of the passenger-side rear wheel. Paint meter samplings are provided from numerous locations throughout the car and show readings of between 3.6 and 5.6 mils.
19″ BMW Competition Package wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sports in staggered widths and displaying 2013 date codes. A walk-around video is provided above.

The interior was optioned with black leather-bolstered sport seats accented with Anthracite M-texture cloth, and additional features include navigation, Hi-Fi audio, glass moonroof, park distance control, and Xenon headlights. Wear commensurate with the car’s age is shown to the front seat bolsters, and new floor mats replace the worn originals.
The digital odometer is said to show approximately 75k miles. Crazing is noted along the passenger-side door handle.

Paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, the 3.2L S54B32 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7900 rpm when new. Cars from the 2004 model year received updated components and were exempt from the rod bearing recall affecting earlier years. Maintenance performed by the seller following the PPI included an oil service, fuel filter replacement, new constant pressure valve, differential oil change, new muffler mounts, front and rear brakes, and a California Smog Certification in July 2018.
A driving demonstration can be viewed in video clip above.

During the pre-purchase inspection, the beginnings of cracking at the rear driver-side rear subframe mounting point was discovered and is shown in the gallery below. Several photos are included in the gallery to highlight the condition of the underside, and several additional photos can be viewed on the seller’s online photo album.
The Carfax report shows ownership history in Massachusetts, Georgia, Pennsylvania, and California, and displays damage occurring to the rear of the car in July 2013.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over grey and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The car is fitted with Dynamic Stability Control and a Turner subframe reinforcement, along with new rear tires and an Eonon head unit. The seller acquired the car six months ago, and has added 1,500 miles of the 93k shown. This E46 M3 is now offered with books, manuals, tools, a Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354), and the seller reports that the hood, front fenders, and drivers side rocker have been repainted. Blemishes in the finish can be seen in photos below. Options on the car include Xenon headlamps and Park Distance Control.

The seller added the Turner subframe reinforcement, and had a front wheel bearing replaced in March 2018. New Hankook Ventus V12 tires have been fitted to the rear wheels to match the front tires that were installed by a previous owner, and an alignment has been performed. The soft top is said to not have tears or holes, and can be seen in greater detail in the gallery.
This video demonstrates a start-up, window operation, a brief walk around, and top operation.

The M-Sport steering wheel has been rewrapped, and an Eonon touch-screen head unit has been fitted. The seller recently had the driver’s and passenger’s side airbags replaced under warranty due to a recall, and he reports that interior functions operate as intended.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six had factory ratings of 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Per the Carfax report, the car had a maintenance inspection done in 2014, new coils and spark plugs were installed in late 2016, and the oil/filter have been changed. The seller reports that the VANOS operates properly and currently does not exhibit any signs of failure.
The video above provides an in-cabin drive.
Additional undercarriage photos are available in the gallery.
The Carfax indicates a steady accumulation of mileage over the years, and an incident in 2003 involving damage when the car had 15k miles.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a black and grey interior and shows 88k miles, 67k of which were added by the seller during 11 years of ownership. Power comes from an S54 inline-six modified by ESS Tuning with a supercharger, intercooler, low compression forged pistons, and more as described below. The 6-speed sequential transmission features CSL software and an HPF Stage 1 Feramic clutch, and it sends power to the rear wheels through a 4.10 BMW Motorsport differential. Further modifications include rear subframe reinforcements, a CSL-style diffuser, CSL trunk, AST coilover shocks, a Rogue El Diablo exhaust, Recaro Sportster CS front seats with lightweight Macht Schnell mounts, a CSL center console, and an upgraded sound system. This E46 M3 is being offered with a clean Carfax report, a May 2018 California emissions certificate, and a clear California title.

Finished in Carbon Black Metallic, this M3 features a BMW-sourced CSL trunk and a CSL-style diffuser. The CSL trunk was painted to match the rest of the exterior, and the front and side grilles were refinished in black. Predator Orion V4 LED Angel Eye headlights are equipped up front. Cracks are present on rear quarter panel weather stripping, and replacement weather stripping is included in the sale.

19″ wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport XL tires installed in 2014, sized 245/35 in the front and 275/30 at the rear. The suspension features AST 4100 coilover shock absorbers with 550/650 springs and Vorshlag camber plates. PFC Direct Drive brake rotors are fitted at all four corners along with PFC Z-rated pads. The seller is including four rear 18″ BMW wheels with used 245/40 Toyo Proxes RA1 tires in the sale and states that the subframe was reinforced with Turner Motorsport plates and AKG Motorsport bushings.

The cabin features twin heated black Recaro Sportster CS seats with vinyl bolsters and suede inserts. They are mounted with Macht Schnell lightweight competition mounts. Rear seats and door panels still wear their original grey Nappa leather upholstery. This car was originally optioned with the Smoker Package and BMW Park Distance Control (PDC) system, and the rearview mirror features an integrated boost gauge from Radar-Mirror.

The digital odometer shows 88k miles, about 67k of which were added during the seller’s ownership. Interior equipment includes grey-faced gauges, paddle shifters, a Harmon Kardon sound system with CD player, a Stage 1 Audio Upgrade kit from Bavasound featuring a BSW D210 subwoofer, CSL center console, and a DICE Electronics iPod integration kit.

The S54 inline-six was rebuilt by ESS Tuning of Chandler, Arizona in 2014 and now features a slight overbore, 10:1 compression ratio forged pistons, an ESS VT-575 supercharger with intercooler, a high boost pulley setup, and a 7-rib drive belt. New bearings were reportedly installed about 20k miles ago, and a SPAL 16″ electric fan with a 185-degree relay harness was added as part of the engine rebuild. The 6-speed SMG transmission has CSL software and an HPF Stage 1 Feramic clutch, and it sends power to a 4.10 BMW Motorsport differential. A modified exhaust system features Supersprint V2 stepped headers, a Custom Performance Euro 200R section 2 with 200-cell catalytic converters, and a Rogue El Diablo exhaust. The seller describes the clutch as rough at low rpm.

Included invoices from European Auto Source of Anaheim, California and ESS Tuning total over $20k in parts and service. Additional recent service records from Performance Technic of Freemont, California are included in the sale.
The clean Carfax report shows no accidents or damage, a passed California emissions test in May 2018, consistent mileage readings, and previous registration in Pennsylvania and California.
The video above has been provided by the seller.

title: 52k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Jet Black over Cinnamon leather and shows just under 52k miles. Power is supplied by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission and factory options include the Competition and Cold Weather packages, a sunroof, and navigation. The car was purchased by the seller at Transatlantic BMW of Hyannis, Massachusetts in February 2007, and service records from his ownership include a VANOS rebuild at approximately 30k miles. This E46 M3 is offered with receipts beginning in 2007, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Connecticut title in the seller’s name.

Sheet metal wears a Jet Black finish, and minor paint imperfections are pictured in the gallery below. According to the seller, the trunk lid was replaced in July 2007 and the hood, front valance, and right headlamp were replaced in June 2013 by two separate dealerships, though no accidents appear on the Carfax report.

Staggered 19” cross-spoke wheels were recently refinished and are fitted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires showing 2012 date codes. An upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled rotors came standard as part of the Competition Package.

Heated and powered Cinnamon leather sport seats are contrasted by black carpets and aluminum trim. Further amenities include a sunroof, navigation system, Harman Kardon audio, a 6-disc CD changer, and an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel. Just under 52k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 46k of which were added by the seller. The driver and passenger airbag recalls have reportedly been addressed.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The VANOS system was rebuilt under warranty by BMW of Warwick, Rhode Island following a failure at approximately 30k miles according to the seller, and BMW corporate provided oversight on all engine work in June 2009. A more recent inspection by BMW of Bridgeport, Connecticut reportedly found no subframe cracking issues, and the full report is viewable in the gallery below.
The clean Carfax report shows no issues and lists two owners with history in Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut. A start-up video showing the instrument cluster is viewable below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4uJ1rTpac4&authuser=0

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Convertible has 97k miles and is finished in Imola Red over black with a black soft top. Purchased by the seller in May 2017, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Interior equipment includes heated and powered front sport seats with memory, a multi-function leather steering wheel, navigation, auto-dimming interior and exterior mirrors, BMW Assist with Bluetooth, and BMW Park Distance Control (PDC) system. Maintenance performed since May 2017 included new VANOS filter and seals, a new fuel pump, new A/C drive belt, new spark plugs and coils, new battery, and more as described below. This E46 is being sold with partial service records, a Carfax report, and a clear Colorado title.

Finished in Imolarot 2 (405), this M3 features black Plasti Dip front and side grilles. The soft top shows some wear near the fold points but is reportedly functional, and the seller replaced the trunk lid due to holes from a removed spoiler. Both rear quarters, the new lid, and the new lip spoiler were repainted, and the seller notes a panel gap on the passenger side of the new trunk lid. The front bumper, fenders, and hood are described as having been repainted at some point in the past. Damage reported on the Carfax is the reportedly the result of a sandstorm which pitted the leading edges with rock chips, which was not repaired.

The windshield has been replaced, and factory options include xenon headlamps and fog lights. A crack is visible on the underside of the front bumper, which is shown in the gallery along with several scrapes on the underside of the bumper and belly pan. Air hammer marks are noted on the passenger-side rear quarter panel, which the seller believes is the result of a possible collision damage repair.

Both front lower control arm assemblies were replaced in 2017 and the brake calipers have been powder coated red. Some curb rash and minor discoloration are noted on the replacement 18″ BMW Style 67 wheels. Sumitomo HTR A/S P02 tires measure 225/40 up front and 255/35 at the rear. A large ding is noted under the right rear taillamp, which also has six inoperable LEDs and condensation. The seller notes discoloration of the original seals and black trim near the windshield cowl and wiper arms.

The black Nappa leather interior features heated and powered front sports seats with memory, and brushed aluminum trim is found on the door panels, dashboard, and center console. Seams on the outer driver’s bolster are said to be failing and show some discoloration. Discoloration is also noted on the steering wheel leather and the shift knob, which is missing a piece of leather. The electric power windows are reportedly functional, with the auto-up feature occasionally triggering an anti-trap warning. The tint on the driver’s window is scratched and the front passenger-side window is said to rattle when fully rolled up. Side mirror glass is beginning to delaminate.

The digital odometer shows 97k miles, 5,100 of which were added by the seller. This car is equipped with a multi-function leather steering wheel, navigation, auto-dimming interior and exterior mirrors, BMW Assist with Bluetooth, and BMW Park Distance Control (PDC) system. The seller notes that the left front midrange door speaker is blown and that the parking brake is in need of adjustment. A Harmon Kardon audio system with a 6-disc CD changer is equipped, and the seller has added an auxiliary jack and hardwired iPhone charger.

Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and Dynamic Stability Control. The seller claims that he performed Inspection II services during the course of ownership, with the exception of a valve adjustment. A Blackstone oil analysis was performed in March 2018 and a readout of the results is included in the gallery below. Other maintenance items completed since May 2017 included replacement of shifter bushings (apart from those directly above the bell housing), a new VANOS filter and seals, a new fuel pump and relay, a new A/C drive belt, a Time-Sert drain plug repair, new spark plugs and coils, a new lower radiator hose, a new temperature sensor, a new high-pressure expansion tank cap, a new battery, and new cabin and engine air filters. The seller notes that the left valve cover is seeping, and service records covering the seller’s ownership are included with the sale.

The Carfax report shows consistent mileage readings, initial registration in California, and reported damage to the front end of the car in May 2018. Though six owners are shown, the seller claims this is a clerical error as he is reportedly the fifth owner. An active lien is shown, but the seller states that the loan was paid off in April 2018 and that he holds a clear Colorado title in his name. The car is being sold with one key and a partially complete factory tool kit.
A video showing the interior is provided above and additional clips can be found on the seller’s YouTube channel.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Carbon Black over Dove Grey and powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. The seller has owned the car for approximately five months and is responsible for 400 of its 81k indicated miles. Recent service included a passenger airbag replacement and subframe inspection. This E46 is offered with a partial trunk-mounted tool kit, tire inflator, owner’s manual, clean Carfax report, and clear Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Carbon Black Metallic and was originally optioned with a rear spoiler delete. The seller states the front and rear bumpers have been repainted to repair scratches. Dings, scuffs, and other remaining imperfections are shown in gallery close-ups below.
Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels are currently mounted and wear Continental ExtremeContact DWS tires showing 2011 and 2012 date codes.

The cabin is finished in Dove Grey leather and equipment includes powered and heated seats with memory on the driver’s side, a Harman Kardon stereo, and a power-operated sunroof. The passenger airbag was replaced and the air conditioning serviced in 2018. Grey-faced gauges include a digital odometer reading approximately 80k miles. Carpet stains and wear on the control surfaces can be seen in the gallery below.
The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new and is mated to a 6-speed Getrag manual transmission.
The seller states that the subframe was inspected in early 2018 by the dealer that carried out the airbag replacement. Additional underside photos can be seen in the gallery below.
A partial trunk-mounted tool kit, tire inflator and owner’s manual are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows three owners from new and has no records of accidents or other damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over gray Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The seller acquired the car four months ago from its original owner, a close family friend who drove nearly all of its 71k indicated miles. Service under previous ownership reportedly took place at BMW of Nashville, and records are said to date from new. New tires were installed at 67k miles, and an inspection was carried out in April of this year. This E46 M3 is offered with a clean Carfax report and a clear Tennessee title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Silver Gray Metallic, and no accidents or other damage are shown on the Carfax report. The seller describes small chips on the nose along with other general wear. The car is equipped with optional xenon headlamps and oval fog lights.

Factory 19″ wheels were a $1,750 option when new and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires with 4k miles. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control as well as an M Variable Differential Lock. A recent subframe inspection is said is said to have turned up no issues. The front brake rotors and pads were changed 13k miles ago.

Gray Nappa leather front sport seats are heated and power-operated with optional lumbar adjustment. Forward footwells are covered in M3 logo floor mats, and brushed aluminum trims the cabin. Other features include automatic climate control, a moonroof, Harman Kardon audio, and air conditioning. The driver’s airbag was replaced in 2016 due to a recall. Just under 71k miles are reportedly shown on the odometer.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features Double VANOS variable valve timing and was originally rated at 333 horsepower. An inspection was performed upon the seller’s purchase in April 2018, and the resultant work included an oil/filter change, new differential output shaft seal, idler pulley replacement, and more as seen on an invoice below. Records are said to indicate that Inspections I and II were performed by the previous owner.
A copy of the window sticker shows over $8k in options and an MSRP of nearly $58k.
The Carfax indicates a steady accumulation of mileage with two owners and lists no accidents or other damage.

title: 36k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package
listing_details: Recent Valve Adjustment and Inspection II
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a Competition Package coupe finished in Interlagos Blue over black Nappa leather and showing 36k miles. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a 6-speed SMG automated manual gearbox, and additional factory options include the Premium and Cold Weather packages, a sunroof, and navigation. The car spent time in Illinois and Michigan before arriving in North Carolina with its third owner in 2016, and was purchased by the seller less than a year ago. A valve adjustment, oil change, and Inspection II were recently carried out along with replacement of belts and seals. This E46 M3 is offered with service history, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The Interlagos Blue finish was exclusive to the Competition Package M3 and is shown up close in the gallery below. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. Exterior options include headlight washers, rain-sensing wipers, and xenon headlights. Body-colored front reflectors have been fitted, and several other options are included in the sale.

Staggered 19” Style 127 wheels are fitted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires showing 2015 date codes. An upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled front brake rotors from the M3 CSL came standard as part of the Competition Package.

Heated and powered black Nappa leather sport seats are accented by black carpets and titanium-finish trim. Further amenities include a sunroof, navigation system, and a Harman Kardon audio system. Modifications include a Valentine radar detector and a Bluetooth interface from GROM Audio.

The Competition Package (ZCP) included an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel featuring a button to engage M-Track Mode. Approximately 36,500 miles are shown on the digital odometer, of which the seller has added 900.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A K&N cold air intake has been fitted, and the original air box is included. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed automated SMG gearbox, which reportedly received European shift reprogramming three years ago.

Receipts show August 2018 services at at EuroEnvy Autowerks of Concord, North Carolina including a PPI, valve adjustment, new spark plugs, replacement of several seals and belts, oil change, and Inspection II. The rear chassis and transmission were both inspected and the receipt shows that both were found to be in good condition with no issues reported.
The accident-free Carfax lists the seller as the fourth owner and shows history in North Carolina, Michigan and Illinois.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Gray leather and shows 63k miles. It was first purchased in New Jersey and moved to New York shortly thereafter with the original owner, who kept the car until the selling dealer’s recent acquisition. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and the vehicle has reportedly been kept stock aside from a set of Koni shocks. Factory options include fold-down rear seats, the Luxury Package, xenon headlamps, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This E46 M3 is now being offered with 250+ photos, the original window sticker, dealer service records, factory manuals, a clear Carfax, and a clean New York title.
Per the seller this M3 has been kept stock outside, and the included Carfax is both accident and damage-free. Over 110 exterior pictures are provided in the gallery, including paint meter readings.

This BMW is fitted with stock 18″ alloy wheels, which are currently mounted on a set of Michelin Pilot Sport A/S Plus tires. Each corner is also detailed in the gallery. An exterior walk-around video can be seen above.
Inside, the Luxury Package adds Nappa leather, dual power front seats with driver’s memory, a power glass moonroof, and rain-sensing windshield wipers.

Additional standard equipment includes gloss black trim, automatic climate control, power windows/mirrors/locks, aluminum pedal covers, and more. Currently the digital odometer shows 63,141 miles, around 200 of which were recently added by the seller.

Under the hood is a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sending power to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission. No mechanical modifications have been made to the seller’s knowledge, and an oil service was completed prior to this auction.
According to the included electronic dealer service records, this particular M3 had a rod bearing recall performed in October 2004. Additional service record pictures are provided in the gallery.

Per the seller, the rear sub-frame mounts were just inspected and deemed to be in good condition. 30+ undercarriage photos are present in the gallery, some of which show the aforementioned yellow Koni shocks.
According to the original window sticker, this BMW carried a $51,795 total MSRP including all options and fees.

The accident-free Carfax reports one owner with longtime New York ownership, plus consistent odometer readings and a number of service history records throughout the years. A test-drive video can be viewed below:

title: 38k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe was ordered new by the seller in May 2003 from Gebhardt BMW in Boulder, Colorado. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a Cinnamon leather interior, the car now has 38k miles and was optioned from the factory with xenon headlights, the Cold Weather Package, Harman-Kardon stereo, 6-disc CD changer, and Homelink. The car was also ordered without a sunroof, and power comes from an unmodified 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox. Oil changes were reportedly performed annually, and this E46 M3 is now being offered with records from new, the original window sticker, the owner’s manual in a leather pouch, two key fobs, a valet key, the original window sticker, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

Carbon Black Metallic paint was a $475 option, and the finish is shown up close in several gallery photos below. The recent Carfax shows no history of accidents or other damage. The seller reports three areas of rock chips in the front fascia and that the car was stored in a climate-controlled garage throughout his ownership.

18″ M double-spoke alloy wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires, measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Factory equipment includes 4-wheel ventilated disc brakes, Dynamic Stability Control, tire pressure monitoring, retractable headlight washers, and variable-assist power steering.

The interior is trimmed in optional Cinnamon leather and includes a Harman-Kardon sound system, heated seats, and ski bag pass-through between the rear seats. The seller reports the leather seat cushion and back covers were replaced under warranty by BMW to address a manufacturing discoloration issue on the driver’s seat.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox in this car. Factory output was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The seller reports annual oil changes and passing a Colorado smog test in 2017. Per the seller, a recall service addressed the airbags and rod bearing issues.
The factory manuals and keys are included along with records back to new. The original window sticker can be seen in the gallery below, indicating a total retail price of just under $52k.
The Carfax report is attached and confirms one owner history and Colorado registration. No accidents or other issues are noted. A walk-around video is viewable below.

title: 11k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Imola Red over black leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The car was purchased new by the seller’s grand-uncle, who has driven it just over 11k miles in the ensuing 17 years. Factory options include xenon headlamps, heated front seats, Harman Kardon audio, and more. Service records are reportedly included from new through an inspection in 2017. This E46 M3 is offered by the seller on behalf of its owner with an extra boxed wheel, window sticker, original literature, clean Carfax report, and clear New Jersey title in the owner’s name.

The car is reported to have been garaged since new, and the Imola Red (405) finish is photographed in detail in the gallery below. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. A scratch in the finish of the rear bumper is pointed out by the seller. The car is equipped with xenon headlights, fog lamps, headlight washers, and rain-sensing wipers.

Factory M Double Spoke wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The passenger rear wheel shows curb rash, and an additional matching wheel is included in a box as seen below. The soft top is said to be original, and photos of the wind deflector are available in the gallery.

The stock interior features heated and power-adjusted sport seats trimmed in black leather. A blemish on the driver’s bolster is noted by the seller. The tilting and telescoping M-Sport steering wheel has audio and cruise control functions.

The stock 10-speaker Harman Kardon stereo system is prewired for a multi-disc CD changer. Approximately 11k miles are shown on the digital odometer. Accessories are said to operate as intended throughout, and an airbag recall was covered under warranty in 2015.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six carried factory ratings of 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The car received a maintenance inspection in 2017 per the Carfax report.
The window sticker shows an Imola Red M3 convertible delivered to King Cars in Freehold, New Jersey and lists a total MSRP of just over $52k.
The Carfax indicates a one-owner vehicle, a steady accumulation of mileage, and no accidents or other damage.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: New Fluids and Spark Plugs in February 2018
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual, and is finished in Alpine White over Imola Red leather. This M3 was sold new in Florida in 2003 where is stayed through four owners, until the seller purchased it in Georgia in early 2017. The seller replaced the oils, filters, and spark plugs in February 2018 and 144k miles are shown on the digital odometer. The interior features Alcantara and aluminum accents and the powerplant has been modified with an aFe intake, Status Gruppe exhaust header, and an ECU tune. This E46 M3 is now offered with a Carfax report, service records, and a clean Georgia title.

The exterior is finished in Alpine White and features Status Gruppe CSL-style trunk and carbon fiber front diffuser. The included clean Carfax shows no accidents, but does report of damage in 2017 when debris fell from a truck which lead to a repainting of the front bumper. The Xenon headlights have been paired with LED halo lights and fog lights. Seller reports of some rock chips on hood and fenders and a crack can be seen in the Carbon front lip.

19″ Style 67 wheels are mounted via a wheel stud conversion with Continental ContiSportContact tires showing 2012 date codes. BC Racing coilovers have been installed and the rear trailing arms bushings are said to have been replaced by a previous owner in 2016. The steering coupler was recently replaced while the seller reports of a slight power steering hose leak. A recent alignment was commissioned by the seller and in 2017 the brakes were reportedly serviced with StopTech brake rotors and Akebono pads

Powered seats with memory are finished in Imola Red leather. The interior features brushed aluminum trim, a powered sunroof, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. A ZHP shift knob has been fitted and the M steering wheel has been recovered in Alcantara, matching the handbrake and shifter boot. SMG shift lights have been installed and an aftermarket headunit features Bluetooth, USB, and an auxiliary input.
144k miles are shown on the digital odometer, 15k of which were added by the seller in just under two years of ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was reportedly serviced by the seller with new oils, filters, and spark plugs in February 2018. The seller also inspected the engine mounts and checked for coolant leaks. The seller states that valve cover gasket, VANOS seals, and alternator were replaced by a previous owner. Modifications include an aFe intake and Status Gruppe exhaust header. Market Motor Works gave the ECU a burble tune and the EGR and O2 sensors have been removed. The seller reports of a slight valve cover leak.

The 6-speed manual features the BMW short shifter and a UUC double sheer selector rod. During the two years of ownership, the seller has replaced the driveshaft guibo and fitted Rouge Engineering transmission mounts. In February 2018, the seller reportedly performed an inspection of the axle boots and all suspension bushings and ball joints. The seller also checked the brakes, the fluid, and adjusted the parking brakes. A photo in the galley below shows a small crack on the passenger-side front suspension mounting point.

The included Carfax history report shows five owners and no accidents, but does report of damage in 2017. The seller has a loan for this car and the lender would need to be paid in full before the title can be transfered to the next owner.

title: One-Owner 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was ordered new by the seller and received at the BMW Performance Center in Spartanburg, South Carolina prior to its shipment home in San Diego, California. Finished in Silbergrau Metallic over black leather, the car came equipped from the factory with the Competition Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, and Park Distance Control. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox, and modifications include an OEM European market front bumper, OEM CSL trunk lid, and aftermarket CSL rear diffuser. Notable maintenance conducted by the seller included a preventative VANOS system overhaul, consistent oil changes, inspections, and fluid changes. Now showing just over 63k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with the original trunk lid and diffuser, window sticker, original brochure and period literature, clean Carfax and AutoCheck reports, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Silbergrau Metallic and though the Carfax and Autocheck reports shows no accidents or other damage, the car was was backed into while parked in 2007, resulting in damage to the corner of the US-spec OEM front bumper and surface scuffing to the front fender that was corrected without paintwork or panel replacement. Additions include an OEM European-market front bumper fitted after the accident, as well as an OEM CSL trunk lid and Vorsteiner carbon fiber aftermarket CSL rear diffuser. Rock chips are noted on the hood and fenders, and scratches are said to be present along the driver side rocker panel.

Staggered 19″ Competition Package alloy wheels are detailed up close below, and show wear to one wheel prior to its repair. Michelin Pilot Sport tires are fitted up front, while a set of Michelin Pilot Super Sports are mounted at the rear, and display 2015 and 2014 date codes respectively. Per the seller, the car has been garage-kept since new.

The interior is trimmed in black leather over manual seats with matching carpets and silver trim unique to the Competition Package. Optional equipment includes park distance control, Xenon headlamps, and Harmon Kardon sound, and this M3 was ordered by the seller without a sunroof. A new set of OEM floormats replace the original units.

The odometer displays just over 63k miles, all of which have been added by the seller. Recalls for both driver and passenger airbags have been completed by the seller’s local BMW dealership. A new Alcantara steering wheel was fitted under warranty in 2009, and is protected via the frequent use of driving gloves per the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Two valve adjustments have been performed on the car, and a preventative VANOS system overhaul was performed in 2015 by a local M3 specialist using Beisan components.

A coolant flush and oil service was recently conducted in preparation for the sale, and the seller notes oil changes have been consistently performed at 4-6k mile intervals with 10w-60 TWS oil per BMW recommendations.

The undercarriage is shown above and accompanied by additional photos in the gallery below. Per the seller, the subframe mounting points were inspected by an independent M3 specialist in August 2018 and was found to show no signs of defects.
The original window sticker shows all aforementioned factory options along with a total MSRP of $56,295, and is accompanied in the sale by records, original brochure, and period literature.
Both the Carfax and Autocheck reports are included in the gallery below, and does not display record of the 2007 accident.

title: 34k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over a Black Nappa Leather interior and shows 34k miles. Power is from a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and options include the Premium Package, heated seats with adjustable lumbar support, xenon headlights, Harman Kardon sound, and aluminum trim. Modifications consist of a window tint and aftermarket wheels. The car had a single owner from 2003 until its August 2018 acquisition by the seller and his business partner, and was kept in Ohio before relocating to Florida in 2017. A PPI including a VANOS check was performed at a BMW dealer in Tampa, Florida and a video showing the rear subframe condition is included below along with over 500 photos. This E46 is sold with service records, a window sticker, the original wheels, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue, and the condition of the paintwork is shown in a large collection of exterior photos in the gallery below. The car was reportedly kept in a climate-controlled garage in Ohio and used as a weekend driver by the original owner after 2006. Chips are noted on the lower front valance along with four other blemishes.

A window tint was installed in 2005, and the original wheels were put into storage after replacement with the current iForged 19″ twin-spokes, which are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires said to be four years old. The Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage.

The interior features heated black Nappa leather seats with adjustable bolster width and lumbar support, brushed aluminum trim, a powered glass moonroof, and the Premium Package. Carpets are protected with rubber mats installed under previous ownership.

Other options include rain-sensing wipers and a Harman Kardon sound system. Just over 34k miles are shown on the odometer, with all but a handful added by the original owner. A driver’s airbag recall was fulfilled by the seller in August 2018.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six carried factory ratings of 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The car received an PPI, oil change, and repair of a differential seal leak in August 2018 at a BMW dealer in Tampa.

An included service inquiry lists dealer service from 1,037 miles in 2003 through 31k miles in 2015 including a passenger-side airbag replacement, reprogramming of the DME control module, and rod bearing inspection.

The subframe inspection video shown above was taken in August 2018, while the BMW PPI was conducted four days later and included a separate subframe check. Additional underside images are provided in the gallery below.
The original window sticker lists standard and optional equipment as well as an MSRP of $56k. Owner’s materials are shown in the gallery below, with some still sealed in plastic wrappers.
Service records are said to date from new, and the clean Carfax report can be viewed in the gallery.
The original wheels are included in the sale and are further depicted in the gallery below.
A brief demonstration video is provided above.
Walkaround video is provided above.
Driving video is provided above.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Airbag and Rod Bearing Recalls Addressed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Alpine White over Cinnamon leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox.
