The car was delivered new to Rick Hendrick BMW in South Carolina, where it was also serviced before moving to Illinois in 2017. The previous owner was reportedly the proprietor of Autobarn VW/Subaru in Mt. Prospect, Illinois, and the seller has driven the car around 1,200 miles since acquiring it in July 2018. Rod bearing, DME, and airbag recalls were addressed under previous ownership. This 2003.5 E46 M3 shows 66k miles is and offered with a clean Carfax, owner’s books, and a clear Illinois title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Alpine White (Alpinweiss III #300), and the exterior condition is detailed in many close-up gallery pictures below. Both bumper covers were reportedly repainted under prior ownership. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

Factory 18” paired-spoke wheels are wrapped in  Continental ContiSportContact tires from 2011 measuring 225/45 front and255/40 rear. Rain-sensing wipers and automatic xenon headlights with washers are equipped, and mid-year styling updates included LED taillights and a revised deck lid handle. The seller reports that the rear tires will need replacement soon and notes a chip in the windshield.

The interior is trimmed in Cinnamon leather over heated and powered sport seats with driver-side memory. Options include Harman Kardon audio and a 6-disc CD changer, while modifications consist of UUC stainless pedals, a UUC short shifter, and an illuminated F10 shift knob. .
Airbag recalls were reportedly completed under prior ownership. Just under 66,500 miles are indicated on the digital odometer, with 1,200 added by the seller in two months.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. The rod bearings were reportedly replaced under recall at 12k miles during original ownership. The car was serviced in July 2018 by The Autobarn, a BMW dealer Mt. Prospect, Illinois.

An included dyno sheet shows results of 301 peak horsepower and 245 lb-ft of torque at the rear wheels. Owner’s books and a readout of factory options and equipment based on the car’s VIN can be seen in the gallery below.
A printout of BMW dealership service records shown in the gallery documents rod bearing, airbag, and DME recalls.
A collection of lift shots shown in the gallery documents the condition of the underbody. The E46 M3 was equipped with a Mobility kit including tools, an air compressor, and tire sealant.

The recent Carfax shows an accident-free history under owners in South Carolina and Illinois and lists service visits to Rick Hendrick BMW while with the second owner. Cold start and driving videos can be viewed below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon leather and shows approximately 66k miles. Power comes from a stock 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual gearbox. Originally purchased at Herb Chambers BMW in Boston, Massachusetts, the car was resold as a CPO vehicle in 2007, remaining in the state under various owners until 2013 when a previous owner relocated it to Florida. The North Carolina-based seller acquired the car in June 2018 and has driven under 200 miles, performing a mechanical inspection and some minor cosmetic repairs. Airbag and DME programming recalls have been completed, and this particular car was not included in the rod bearing recall campaign. This E46 M3 is now offered with a clean Carfax, a readout of dealership maintenance, owner’s books, receipts for recent service, and a clean North Carolina title.

Factory 19” paired-spoke alloy wheels wear staggered-width Continental ExtremeContact tires. A dent on the right rear quarter was recently remedied with paintless dent removal. A handful of chips and scratches can be seen on the right side rocker moldings and at the rear of the car. Standard M3 equipment includes automatic headlights with washers and rain-sensing wipers. The seller notes that the car has been garage kept during his ownership.

The Cold Weather Package added heated seats and a ski bag with pass-through storage behind the rear bench seat. Harmon Kardon audio with a 6-disc CD changer and navigation is equipped, and a ZHP shift knob was added. The black fabric top features a heated glass rear window and can be seen in gallery photographs. The seller notes that the seals are in good shape and remain watertight.

Heated and power-adjustable seats are upholstered in leather with driver’s memory settings, and the seller notes recent repairs to the driver’s thigh bolster stitching. Both airbag recalls have been addressed according to a BMW dealership service report shown below.

The factory tool kit is accompanied by a Mobility Kit and a folding cockpit wind deflector. The status of rear subframe weld is unknown, though a recent mechanical inspection is said to have revealed no outstanding mechanical issues.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and was rated at 333 horsepower when new. A production date of May 2004 places the car outside the date range of the S54 rod bearing service action campaign.

A BMW dealership service report records factory equipment and production data, and lists service and recall campaigns performed by authorized BMW dealerships over the life of the car, as well as a 2004 MSRP of $63k. A collection of owner’s books and brochures are shown in the gallery.
A recent Carfax report records an accident-free history under owner’s in Massachusetts, Florida, and North Carolina, with dealership service visits detailed from 2015-present.

title: 32k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a 6-speed coupe that shows just 32k miles and was purchased new from Rallye Motors in Westbury, New York. Finished in Silbergrau Metallic over Imolarot leather and equipped with a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, the car was purchased by the seller from its second owner through a July 2017 BaT auction. Service performed since included an Inspection II as well as a valve adjustment, transmission fluid change, and replacement of the cooling fan clutch as well as flushes of the cooling, braking, and power steering systems. Modifications consist of a window tint, BMW satellite radio module, and aftermarket clutch pedal. This E46 M3 is offered with a recent pre-purchase inspection report, records, keys, factory literature, a car cover, a clean Carfax, and a clear Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silbergrau Metallic, and 3M protective film has been applied to the front bumper, fenders, and mirror caps. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. Minor chips and other imperfections on the front bumper and hood are shown in the gallery below.

Factory Style 67 wheels are mounted with 18″ Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires fitted by the previous owner in 2016 and displaying 2014 and 2015 date codes. Xenon headlights with retractable washers were fitted from the factory. 30% window tint was installed by the previous owner.

Trimmed in Imolarot leather with aluminum trim accents, the cabin features factory equipment including navigation, the Premium Package, and the Cold Weather Package with heated front seats. The seller notes wear below the handbrake as well as slight wrinkling at the base of the A-pillar trim as shown in the gallery below.

Additions under current ownership include a BMW satellite radio module, a clutch pedal from Mason Engineering, and WeatherTech mats for the driver, passenger, and trunk. The digital odometer displays just over 32k miles, roughly 2,000 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six made 333 horsepower when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox. Digital copies of dealer service records begin in 2005, and service following the recent PPI included an Inspection II, a valve adjustment, replacement of the cooling fan clutch and oil filter housing gasket, and a transmission fluid change as well as flushes of the cooling, braking, and power steering systems.

The undercarriage is shown above and in additional gallery photos below. The subframe mounting points were inspected during the recent PPI according to the seller, and the full inspection report can be viewed here.
The original window sticker displays options including the Cold Weather Package, Premium Package, xenon headlights, and navigation for an MSRP of $56,696.

The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or open recalls from 2005-2018. Additional items featured in the sale include factory literature, two standard keys, a valet key, and a new packaged BMW car cover.

title: 38k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Carbon Black Over Black Leather Interior
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Carbon Black over black leather and shows 38k miles. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and modifications are reportedly limited to an Alpine touchscreen stereo. The seller has driven the car approximately 1,500 miles since acquiring it on BaT in July 2017 as well as performing an oil and filter change. This E46 M3 is offered with a clean Minnesota title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black, and cosmetic work performed at Richmond BMW in 2017 included dent removal and repainting the front bumper cover. Several remaining dings and scratches were noted in the previous listing. The exterior has been detailed under current ownership.
Refinished 18″ factory wheels are mounted with a set of Toyo Proxes T1R tires, and new ABS-DSC sensors were installed by Richmond BMW under previous ownership.
The interior is trimmed in black and features electrically-adjustable heated seats, automatic climate control, a leather-wrapped Motorsport steering wheel and shift knob, and a sunroof.
Just over 38,100 miles are displayed on the digital odometer. An Alpine LCD touchscreen head unit has replaced the factory stereo.
A cold-start sequence is shown above.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 343 horsepower and is linked to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission. An inspection was performed by Richmond BMW in April 2017.
Several photos are provided to illustrate condition of the chassis, underbody, and suspension components.
The Carfax shows time in New York, Texas, and Virginia before a move to Minnesota in June of last year. No accidents or other damage are reported.

title: 48k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior and shows 48k miles. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six fitted with a Borla exhaust and paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Factory options include the Premium Package, xenon headlights, a sunroof, Harman Kardon sound, heated seats with adjustable backrest width, Park Distance Control, and navigation. The car had a single owner until its April 2017 acquisition by the seller, who reports that it subsequently received oil changes and a rear subframe inspection. This E46 M3 underwent the factory rod bearing recall in 2004 and is sold with a clean Carfax report and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Topaz Blue Metallic (364), and the exterior condition is detailed in the gallery pictures below. The car is equipped with optional xenon headlamps and oval fog lights. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
Factory 18” Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S Plus tires measuring 225/45 front and 255/40 rear.

The heated seats are power adjustable and upholstered in black Nappa leather. The seller reports paint cracking on the interior door handles and wear on the center console and floor mats. A factory navigation system remains mounted in the center stack.
Approximately 48k miles are shown on the digital odometer, 4,400 of which were added by the seller in just over a year and a half of ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features Double VANOS variable valve timing and was originally rated at 333 horsepower. A Borla exhaust has replaced the factory system, which is included in the sale according to the seller. Two oil changes were performed during seller’s ownership using Castrol Edge TWS 10w-60.
According to the included electronic dealer service records, this M3 had its rod bearing shells replaced in December 2004. Additional service records are pictured in the gallery.
Factory manuals and handbooks are included in the sale as well as recent records and an extra set of keys.
The accident-free Carfax report shows original ownership for 15 years as well as listing consistent odometer readings and a number of service entries.

title: 18k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue over Lotus White Nappa leather and shows just over 18k miles. The car was purchased new at Prestige BMW of Ramsey, New Jersey by the current owner’s late husband and relocated to Florida two years later. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six linked to a 6-speed manual transmission, and options include the Competition and Cold Weather packages, Harman Kardon audio, and xenon headlights. Modifications reportedly consist of an aftermarket exhaust, throttle bodies, injectors, and braking components. The headliner was replaced, a new ABS sensor was installed, and ECU software was reprogrammed during a service last month. This E46 M3 is offered by the seller on behalf of its original owner’s widow with records from new, an original window sticker and bill of sale, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Florida title.
Interlagos Blue was offered exclusively on M3s equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. The car is said to have been garage-kept from new, and the Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

Staggered-width 19” cross-spoke wheels wear Continental ContiSport Contact tires up front and older Michelin rubber out back. A formerly mounted Dinan trunk lid was recently removed in lieu of the stock piece according to the seller.

Lotus White Nappa leather is set off by black carpets and aluminum trim. A new OEM headliner was recently installed. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with a “Track Mode” button that raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control.
Further amenities include power front seats with memory settings for the driver, xenon headlights, and a Harman Kardon stereo system. Just over 18k miles are shown on the digital odometer.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Recent maintenance included a new ABS sensor and reprogramming of the ECU.

Aftermarket exhaust and braking components are said to have been installed along with upgraded throttle bodies and injectors. Several removed stock parts are included in the sale along with service records from new.

The Carfax report confirms single ownership in New York and Florida and lists no issues through its most recent entry in 2015. A photo of the factory window sticker is viewable in the gallery, and a number of videos are provided below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is a 3-owner coupe finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over a black leather interior. The car is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission and equipped with 19″ wheels, a sunroof, navigation, HomeLink, Bluetooth, aluminum trim, heated seats, and xenon headlights. Modifications include a VAC Motorsports subframe reinforcement kit, rear end overhaul by TKX Performance, ST Suspensions components, CSL-style front bumper with carbon fiber splitters, carbon fiber rear diffuser, LED tail lights, and Bavsound speakers. This E46 M3 shows 123k miles and is offered with a Carfax report, partial records, and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic paint, which is shown up close in several gallery photos below. Paint correction was recently carried out and ceramic coating was applied according to the seller. The nose was reportedly damaged by the previous owner and replaced with the current CSL-style bumper cover. Paintless dent removal was also carried out on the hood according to the seller.

Additional exterior modifications include carbon fiber splitters from ECS Tuning, a Status Gruppe carbon fiber rear diffuser, and LED tail lights. Factory 19″ wheels are fitted with mixed Michelin, Continental, and Toyo tires showing 2014 and 2016 date codes. The car has been lowered with ST Suspensions components according to the seller.

Interior amenities include heated black leather sport seats, aluminum trim, a sunroof, factory navigation, HomeLink, Bluetooth, and aftermarket Bavsound speakers. The seller mentions that the headliner and pillars have been rewrapped and the window moldings and trim have been replaced.

Just under 123k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 4,500 of which have been driven under current ownership. The air conditioning system was recently recharged according to the seller.
The 3.2L S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual transmission, and has reportedly received service and upgrades including:

A VAC Motorsports subframe reinforcement kit has been installed, and a rear end overhaul was completed by TKX Performance in New York. Polyurethane subframe and rear trailing arm bushings have also been fitted, with photos of the process provided in the gallery below.

The Carfax report shows three owners and two separate damage reports under previous ownership, one of which resulted in the replacement front bumper and paintless dent removal mentioned above. Service records include parts receipts for recent work as shown in the gallery below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Titanium Silver Metallic over Gray Leather
listing_details: Titanium Silver Metallic over Gray Leather
Airbag and Rod Bearing Recalls Addressed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Gray Nappa leather and was optioned from the factory with the Cold Weather Package, Premium Package, bi-xenon headlights, 19″ wheels, Harman-Kardon sound, and more. The car remained with the original owner in Maryland until the seller’s acquisition in August 2009, when it was moved to Washington DC. He has since added 12k of the 50k indicated miles and relocated the car to Los Angeles, Califonia in 2015. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and the rod bearing and airbag recalls were addressed in 2004 and 2016 respectively. This E46 M3 is now being offered with the original window sticker, factory manuals, records from new, a clean Carfax report, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, and the exterior condition is detailed in several closeup gallery pictures below. Chips are noted on the front valance, and the headlight washers have been disconnected. The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

Optional 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires, measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The seller reports various curb marks on the wheels. Factory equipment includes bi-xenon lights, Dynamic Stability Control, tire pressure monitoring, and variable-assist power steering.

The interior is trimmed in Gray Nappa leather and includes a Harman-Kardon sound system, moonroof, heated seats, brushed aluminum trim, and ski bag pass-through between the rear seats. Heat insulation has been added underneath the front seat carpets to reduce cabin heat. The fluid-filled rearview mirror is showing degradation, dead pedal plastic is cracked, and wear is noted on the passenger door armrest. The LED bulbs on the dash, climate control, and stereo control panels are reported to be in working order.
Just over 50k miles are shown on the odometer, 12k of which were added by the seller over the past nine years. A driver’s airbag recall was completed in 2016.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. The car is equipped with a 6-speed manual gearbox and received an oil change and subframe inspection in July 2018 at Superformance Foreign Auto Repair in Los Angeles, California. The connecting rod bearings recall was completed in 2004.
The window sticker itemizes standard features and factory colors, as well as listing $7,500 in options and a $55,045 MSRP.
Service records from new, both factory keys, a valet key, the owner’s manual, and the factory tool kit are included with sale.
The recent Carfax shows an accident-free history under both owners and lists service visits to BMW of Rockville with the first owner.

title: 38k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Alpine White over grey leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a 6-speed sequential manual gearbox. The seller acquired the car two years ago and has added 4k of its 38k indicated miles as well as having an airbag replaced under recall, installing a GROM Audio Bluetooth adapter, and changing the oil and filter. Previous owners reportedly had a rod bearing recall performed and added modifications including a subwoofer. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, partial records, a Carfax, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.
Alpine White paint is accented by a blue power-operated soft top. The exterior mirrors are heated, and parking distance control sensors are located in the rear bumper.
Features include bi-xenon headlamps with washers and valance-mounted fog lamps. Optional 19″ wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact tires showing 2014 date codes.

Grey leather upholstery is complemented by a darker upper dash and lighter carpeting, while M-logo mats cover the forward footwells. Heated front sport seats feature optional lumbar support. Wear is noted on the driver’s outer bolster, the spring-loaded console storage lid, and the center section of the retractable top lid.

A leather-wrapped multi-function sport steering wheel fronts a four-dial cluster of instruments and an odometer showing 38k miles. A GROM Audio Bluetooth streaming kit was added to the stock head unit by the seller, while a carpeted subwoofer enclosure is located in the trunk.

The 3.2-liter S54B32 inline-six is equipped with Double VANOS variable valve timing and was originally rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Getrag 6-speed electrohydraulic automated gearbox. A rod bearing recall was reportedly performed in 2004.
The Carfax lists no accidents or other damage and shows a steady accumulation of mileage with five owners including the seller.

title: 42k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 6-Speed
listing_details: VANOS Bolts and Rod Bearings Replaced
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 was first sold at Burdick BMW in Cicero, New York and remained in the area until relocated to Texas by its previous owner in May 2012 and purchased by the seller in February 2015. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission, while options include the Cold Weather and Luxury packages. The car has been fitted with Ground Control coilover suspension and BBS wheels, and service under current ownership included Inspections I and II as well as recent replacement of the VANOS bolts and rod bearings. This E46 M3 shows 42k miles and is offered with a clean Carfax and a clear title in the seller’s name.

Laguna Seca Blue (448) paint is shown under different lighting conditions in the gallery below. Chips are present on forward-facing surfaces, and the trunk handle cover is reportedly loose. The car is equipped with clear front turn indicators, a green stripe windscreen, xenon headlights, and a headlamp washer system as well as Dynamic Stability Control.

Modifications include Ground Control coilover suspension and staggered BBS wheels wearing Firestone tires. The seller notes that the car was tracked for three different weekends under her ownership, and that the tires were changed after the last event.
A walk around video has been provided by the seller.

The cabin features grey Nappa leather upholstery and is equipped with powered and heated sport seats, a multi-function steering wheel, an illuminated shift knob, and matching floor mats with M3 logos. The door seals and pillar trim were recently replaced.

The digital odometer indicates just over 42k miles, with approximately 8k added by the seller. A factory Harman Kardon sound system with Business CD stereo remains in place, and the switchgear and gauges are shown up close in the gallery below.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. An Inspection II service was completed in 2016, and more recent maintenance included replacement of the VANOS bolts and rod bearings by the seller’s boyfriend, who is a BMW mechanic.
The seller reports that the rear subframe has not been reinforced. Several photographs of the undercarriage and the sheet metal in the trunk can be seen in the gallery below.
The accident-free Carfax documents mileage with 23 odometer readings from March 2001 to May 2014 and shows an open recall for the driver-side airbag.

title: 22K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller and has 22k miles. Finished in Titan Silver over black, power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II transmission. Options include navigation, heated leather seats, and Premium audio. Inspection I and II services and airbag recalls have been performed, and the engine oil was recently changed. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered by its original owner with service records back to new, a fitted car cover, a clean Carfax, a current emissions certificate, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Titan Silver (Titansilber 354), and rain sensing wipers, xenon headlamps, and Park Distance sensors are equipped. No accidents or damage are recorded in the provided Carfax, and the seller states that the car has been garage-kept since new.
The black fabric top features a heated glass rear window, and can be seen stowed and in place in gallery photographs. 18” factory alloy wheels wear Sumitomo tires showing 2009 and 2010 date codes.

Interior equipment includes DVD navigation, Premium audio, and auto dimming mirrors. The SMG electro-hydraulic manual transmission offers sequential shifting with the console lever or steering wheel buttons. 22,174 indicated miles have all been driven by the seller.
Black leather covers heated power seats with driver’s side memory settings. Airbag recalls were addressed in September 2018, according to the seller.
A folding wind deflector is mounted in the trunk, which includes a Mobility kit in place of a spare wheel.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with an SMG II electro-hydraulic manual transmission. Peak output was rated at 333 horsepower when new, and this example is said to remain stock. An oil service recently performed in September 2018. Inspection I and II services were performed prior, the latter in 2008. The April 2004 production date is outside the range of cars included in the rod bearing service action, and a California emissions inspection was passed in May 2018, according to Carfax data. The seller notes that the windshield washer fluid reservoir currently needs a new gasket.

A recent Carfax records an accident-free history under the original owner in California, and lists service visits to Sonnen BMW in San Rafael. Service records are said to cover from purchase to present, but are not pictured. A readout of options and equipment based on the car’s VIN can be seen in the gallery below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Imola Red over Dove Grey Leather
listing_details: Imola Red over Dove Grey Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over Dove Grey leather, and is equipped with Harman Kardon sound, a power sunroof, and 18″ BMW wheels. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. Showing approximately 46k miles, the car was purchased by the seller in 2016 and has since been driven just 4k miles. This E46 M3 is offered with service records from new, a clean Carfax report, and a clear Florida title in the seller’s name.
The Imola Red body features a small trunk lip spoiler. The finish is shown in detail in gallery photos below.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted and wear Goodyear Eagle Sport tires showing 2013 date codes.
The interior is finished in Dove Grey leather with heated seats and a powered sunroof. The seller states the headliner has been replaced, and the digital odometer shows approximately 46k miles.
The 3.2L S54 straight-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The clutch was replaced in 2015 and the seller states a BMW Inspection II service was completed in 2016.
The seller notes there are no known subframe issues, and additional underbody photos can be seen in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows two Florida owners with no reported accidents or other damage. Owner’s booklets and service records from new are included in the sale.
A walk around video with the engine running is shown above.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
listing_details: Bilstein B4 Shocks and Eibach Springs
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was originally sold in California before being relocated to Arizona by the previous owner in 2016. The car was purchased by the seller in early 2018 and has since been modified with a 6-speed manual gearbox conversion, Bilstein B4 shocks, Eibach springs, StopTech rotors, and ceramic brake pads. A black interior was also installed, and subtle exterior alterations included the installation of black trim and clear LED lighting. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six had its VANOS system rebuilt, and the car has been serviced with new pulleys, belts, belt tensioner, fuel filter, coolant expansion tank, and a brake fluid flush. Now showing 105k miles, this E46 M3 is being offered with limited service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Laguna Seca Blue and displays some rock chips on forward facing surfaces, small cracks in the clear coat on the rear bumper, and some scratches that are shown up close in the gallery below. The lower right edge of the hood has been touched up, and the front passenger side was damaged in a parking lot incident in November 2007. The front bumper and the passenger side turn indicator, right fender, right door, and wheel were either repaired, replaced, or repainted at that time.

Factory xenon headlights are accompanied by stock clear front corner lights, clear side markers, and clear LED tail lights. Black fender gills and kidney grilles were added, the wiper arms have been painted black, and the roof is wrapped in gloss black. A new windshield has been installed with new seals, and the side window seals were replaced. The windows have a 30% tint. 18″ Style 67 wheels exhibit some curb rash and are fitted with Yokohama Advan Neova AD08R tires measuring 245/40 in front and 265/40 out back.

The original gray interior has been replaced with a black leather interior from a 2006 M3 with 68k miles. The swap included the installation of the seats, door panels, dash, center console, pillars, and carpets.

An Alcantara steering wheel with M-stitching, ZHP weighted shift knob, and ZCP Alcantara shift boot were also added by the seller, and the interior trim pieces were painted gloss black. The optional Harman Kardon sound system remains in place. The odometer indicates just under 105k miles, and the seller is currently using the car as a daily driver.
Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six that recently had a VANOS system rebuild utilizing the following components:

The seller is a BMW enthusiast and a professional mechanic who has reportedly used only factory parts while servicing the car. The belt tensioner, fuel filter, and coolant expansion tank were replaced, as were the belts and pulleys. Factory recalls have been addressed, and a Blackstone oil report from April 2018 shows very low copper and lead readings.

The original sequential manual gearbox (SMG II) was replaced with a Getrag 6-speed manual at 94k miles. Work included the installation of a new LuK 03-054 clutch kit, LuK DMF050 flywheel, throwout bearing, guibo, clutch fork, master and slave cylinders, and a machined bell housing with new detent pins and springs.

The brake and suspension systems have been refreshed by the seller. New Bilstein B4 shocks and Eibach springs were installed, as were new front control arm bushings and rear trailing arm bushings. Stock brake components were replaced by StopTech slotted brake rotors and ceramic pads, and a brake flush was done using Motiv race fluid.
The Carfax shows no accidents and reports the 2007 parking lot incident mentioned above as other damage.

title: One-Owner 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller and shows just over 79k miles. The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over black leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. Options include the Cold Weather Package, Harman Kardon audio, xenon headlights, and more. This E46 M3 is offered with a Carfax report, service records from new, a window sticker, factory literature, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and optioned with xenon headlights. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. Rust repair and touch-ups are noted in the rear quarter panels.
The seller has provided a video showing operation of the convertible top above. Factory 18” Style 67 wheels wear Continental tires, with the rears replaced in April 2018.

The interior features heated and power-adjusted black leather sport seats, aluminum trim, a Harman Kardon sound system, a smoker’s package, and a ski bag. The seller reports that both front seat cushions were replaced in 2017. The tilting and telescoping M-Sport steering wheel houses audio and cruise control buttons.

Great-faced instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer and a digital odometer which reportedly shows just over 79k miles. The remote locking system does not operate correctly according to the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The seller notes that the car received an inspection in December 2017 and passed an emissions test in June 2018.
The owner’s manual, window sticker, and other factory literature are included in the sale along with two key fobs and a valet key.
The Carfax report confirms single ownership from new and shows no accidents or other issues. Regular mileage updates are listed as well as replacement of at least one airbag in 2014.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Dinan S2 6-Speed
excerpt: This Dinan 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows just over 52k miles. The car was sold new in Montana and acquired by the Northern California-based seller from EAG in March 2015. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked to a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include bi-xenon headlights, a power moonroof, heated seats, and the Premium Package. A BMW dealer in Denver, Colorado reportedly installed the Dinan S2 package, which adds stage 4 engine software, a high-flow intake and exhaust, stage 3 suspension, a 3.91 limited-slip differential, forged 19″ wheels, and more as outlined below. This E46 M3 is now being offered with records since 2014, the factory manuals, a clean AutoCheck report, and a clear California title.

The car is finished in Imola Red, and the exterior is shown up close and from a number of angles in the gallery below. The Dinan stage 3 suspension modifications include Koni adjustable dampers, Dinan lowering springs, camber plates, front and rear strut tower braces, and an adjustable 27mm front sway bar. EAG reportedly performed trunk lid touch up and installed new rear trailing arm urethane bushings at 28k miles.

The Dinan lightweight, 7-spoke forged wheels measure 19×9.5″ up front 19×10″ out back and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sports. The seller commissioned a wheel refinishing in September 2018 for curb rash on three wheels. The tires are reported to have 17k miles of street use with no track time.

The interior features heated black Nappa leather seats with adjustable bolster width and lumbar support, brushed aluminum trim, a powered glass moonroof, and the Premium Package. The seller notes the sunroof seal was replaced by Dinan and that both airbags have been replaced under warranty. Pictures of wear on the driver’s side bolsters are available in the gallery below.

A Dinan short shift kit was installed as part of the S2 package, and an Alpine CDE-HD148BT stereo replaces the stock head unit, which is included with the sale. The odometer currently shows 52k miles, about 17k of which have been added by the seller over the last three and a half years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission in this car. Dinan S2 engine modifications include a high-flow intake box and air mass meter, larger throttle bodies, high-flow exhaust, speed limiter removal, and stage 4 engine software. A 3.91 limited-slip differential replaces the stock 3.62 rear end. EAG performed preventative cam bolt replacement and an Inspection I service in 2014.
A Dinan S2 plaque on the radiator support indicates that this is serial #S20609.
Additional underbody pictures are available in the gallery below along with images of the trunk with the liner removed.
The owner’s manual, factory literature, and service records since 2014 are included with the sale.
The clean Carfax report can be seen above, showing no accidents or other issues. It is reported that the car was acquired by EAG in 2011 and again in 2014.

title: 2002 BMW M3
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a 6-speed electrohydraulic gearbox. Factory options include the Cold Weather Package, Premium Package, bi-xenon headlights, 19″ wheels, Harman Kardon sound, and more. Originally sold new in New Jersey, the car was acquired by the seller’s brother in 2003 and moved to California in 2014 by the seller, who has since added 3k of its 50k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, factory manuals, records dating from 2003, a clean Carfax report, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, and the exterior condition is detailed in several close-up gallery pictures below. The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

Aftermarket multi-spoke 19″ wheels by Maya wear Pirelli P Zero Rosso tires measuring 245/35 up front and 275/30 out back. The seller has provided images showing tire wear and recommends replacement. The suspension is modified with Bilstein PSS9 coilovers.

The interior is trimmed in black leather and includes a Harman Kardon sound system, moonroof, heated front seats, and ski bag pass-through between the rear seats. The seller reports a spilled soda damaged the center console near the SMG gear lever and has provided images in the gallery below.
The digital odometer shows approximately 50k miles. The LED bulbs on the dash, climate control, and stereo control panels are reported to be in working order.

The 3.2L S54 straight-six is paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission. The provided maintenance records show replacement of the rod bearings in 2004, a rebuilt front right brake caliper in 2008, and a new alternator in 2009. An oil change was completed in April 2018.
Additional underbody images are available in the gallery below.  The seller reports the subframe was inspected on two separate occasions, most recently at 50k miles.
Service records from 2003, a window sticker, both factory keys, a valet key, factory literature, a car cover, and owner’s manuals are included in the sale.
The seller has provided a cold start and walk-around video above.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Jet Black over a black leather interior with Titan Shadow trim and remained with its original owner until 2018. The car was ordered without a sunroof, while included equipment consists of heated sport seats, xenon headlights, and 18″ factory wheels. The seller is the second registered owner and has added just 1,750 of its 61k indicated miles since his acquisition earlier this year. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, extra key, a clean Carfax report, and a New Hampshire title.

This example is finished in Jet Black and was ordered without a sunroof. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. The seller points out a chip on the front bumper and a dime-sized rust spot on the driver-side rear wheel arch. Paint depth readings in the gallery below range from 2.0 to 3.0 mils.
Factory 18” wheels are equipped with Goodyear Eagle tires, with each shown up close in the gallery below. Cross-drilled brake rotors are fitted at all four corners.

The cabin features heated seats with adjustable lumbar support and driver-side memory. Factory Titan Shadow interior trim package includes darker elements in place of the brushed aluminum or burl wood pieces seen on other examples. Replacement of the left airbag assembly is noted on the Carfax report in 2017.

A stock stereo remains mounted in the center stack. The odometer reportedly shows just under 61k miles, with approximately 1,750 added by the seller over the past several months. Two remote keys are included and shown in the gallery.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual gearbox. The seller states he personally performed the equivalent of a BWW Inspection II service in September of this year.
The subframe was reportedly checked by Turner Motorsport of Amesbury, Massachussetts, with no issues reported.
The window sticker was laminated by the previous owner and itemizes standard features and factory colors, as well as listing approximately $5k in options and a $52,790 MSRP.
The recent Carfax shows an accident-free history under one owner in Illinois from new until 2018, when the car was acquired by the seller through a dealer.

title: 39k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible was originally purchased from Medford BMW in Oregon and has since traveled 39k indicated miles. The car is finished in Titan Silver Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior and powered by a 3.2L straight-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Factory options include Harman Kardon audio and heated seats, and a MagnaFlow exhaust system has been added. This E46 M3 convertible is offered by the selling dealer with owner’s booklets, a clean Carfax report, and a clear California title.

The body is finished in Titan Silver Metallic, with the paintwork shown up close in several gallery photos below. The seller notes that rear bumper shows signs of previous refinishing. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
A video showing the black soft top in operation is provided above. Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires showing 2016 date codes.

The black interior features heated leather sport seats and a Harman Kardon stereo system. Factory brushed aluminum trim has reportedly been covered with carbon fiber appliqués. The seller notes a flaw in the auto-dimming rearview mirror. The digital odometer shows approximately 39k miles.

The 3.2L S54 straight-six is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. A recommended service was performed by BMW of Encinitas, California in January 2017 at 38,673 miles according to the seller. A California emissions test was passed in January 2018.
A MagnaFlow exhaust system was added under previous ownership. Additional underbody photos can be seen in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows registrations in Oregon and California with no records of accidents or other damage.
A video of the car being driven through the gears is shown above.

title: Titanium Grey 2004 BMW M3 6-Speed
exterior_color: Titanium Grey II Metallic over Black
listing_details: Titanium Grey II Metallic over Black
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in a special-order Titanium Grey II Metallic over black Nappa leather and shows 83k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory equipment includes Harman-Kardon premium sound, an in-dash CD player, the Premium and Cold Weather Packages, Park Distance Control, xenon headlights, navigation, 19″ wheels, and a sunroof. The selling dealer has added about 3k miles since acquiring the car a year ago, and upgraded brakes from ECS Tuning have been installed. This E46 M3 is now being offered in New Jersey with service records dating back to 2011, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title.

This car was special ordered in Titanium Grey II Metallic, and according to the seller it is the only LHD E46 M3 coupe in this exterior color with a black interior and manual gearbox. A repaint was reportedly performed after the car was hit on the left side and the damage was repaired, though the incident does not show up on the Carfax. Black kidney grilles have also been fitted along with a new BMW roundel on the hood.

19″ factory wheels wear 225/40 BF Goodrich G-Force Sport tires from 2012 up front, along with rear 255/35 Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires from 2014. CSL-style brakes from ECS Tuning were installed in 2015 and can be seen with the wheels removed in the gallery below.

The seats are upholstered in back Nappa leather, and new interior pillar covers have been added along with a new rearview mirror. The seller notes that the driver’s seat belt does not currently work, though a replacement has already been sourced and will be installed for the new owner.
This M3 had an MSRP of just under $59k when new, and features include a Harman-Kardon sound system, in-dash CD player, heated seats, sunroof, ski bag, armrest, rain sensing wipers, and navigation.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and produced 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque when new. New components installed since 2011 included the following:
The seller notes a hairline crack in the subframe, which can be seen in the gallery along with additional underside photos.
Records dating back to 2011 come with the car and are displayed in more detail in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows no issues, though an open recall for the DME control module is noted.

title: 33k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: DME Update and TTFS Custom Tune
Die Wethje BMW CSL Airbox and Snorkel
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Coupe was built on September 19, 2003 and was first sold at West German BMW in Fort Washington, Pennsylvania in May 2004. Power is delivered to the rear wheels from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six via 6-speed manual transmission. The seller purchased this example in November 2013 and has added many performance upgrades including SGT suspension, a StopTech big brake kit, CSL airbox and snorkel, DME update, TTFS custom tune, Supersprint headers, and a Supersprint exhaust system. He also swapped the stock interior with Imola Red leather upholstery, and installed 19″ ZCP wheels. Some of the removed equipment will be included in the sale along with the owner’s manual, window sticker, and service records. Now showing just under 33k miles, this E46 M3 is being offered with a clean Carfax and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

Finished in Schwarz II (668), the car has been fitted with an SGT SCZA carbon fiber CSL trunk lid that has been painted to match. The front bumper shows some rock chips, and a curb scuff and some scratches are present on the right side. A new front windshield was recently installed, and the seller notes that the driver’s side headlight occasionally does not work.
The seller has provided a walk around video of the exterior.

The suspension has been modified with SGT SRS coilovers, and the brakes were upgraded with a StopTech Championship Edition Trophy kit with 2-piece floating AeroRotors. 19″ Style 163 wheels were installed in 2015 and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport rubber.

The original black Nappa interior has been replaced with Imola Red leather as seen on the seats and door panels. Some wear is present on the driver’s seat bolster, and there is a scratch on the passenger door upper trim. A video featuring up close views of the interior can be seen here.

Options on this example include a multi-function M Sport steering wheel, power heated seats, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. An Avin Avant 2 head unit has been added, though the stock radio comes with the car. An armrest delete kit and new center console are also featured. Airbag recalls were addressed by BMW of South Orlando in August 2018. The digital odometer indicates 32,750 miles, with 12,880 miles being added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque when new and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. The video above shows the engine idling, and a video of a cold start can be viewed here.

In 2015 a number of performance upgrades were installed including a new Die Wethje BMW CSL airbox and snorkel with working flap as shown above, along with a CSL DME update, TTFS custom tune, Supersprint V1 headers, Supersprint section 1 with resonators and 200 cell cats, and a Supersprint Sport exhaust. The original airbox, headers, and exhaust system are included in the sale.
Work performed since 2013 included the following:
Photographs of the underbody can be seen in the gallery below. The seller notes that there were no subframe cracks upon recent inspection, and the area has not been reinforced.
The original owner’s manual, window sticker, and keys come with the car. A file folder includes service records from the previous owners as well as the seller.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, along with 16 odometer readings from May 2004 to August 2018.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Rod Bearing, DME, & Airbag Recalls Performed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Estoril Blue Metallic over black leather and shows 94k miles. The seller purchased the car from the original owner in 2008 and has added 80k miles since. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and modifications include Umnitza Angel Eye headlamps, and carbon fiber chin spoilers. Inspection I and II services have been performed, along with rod bearing, airbag, and DME recalls. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with an AutoCheck report, service records, 18″ SSR wheels, owner’s books and sales literature, a full set of factory keys, a BMW car cover, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Estoril Blue Metallic and is reportedly one of 81 North American E46 M3s delivered in this color. The right rear of the car was sideswiped in August 2012, and a $5,700 invoice for cosmetic repairs indicates the affected fender was replaced and the right side of the body repainted. The seller notes a subtle difference in shades between old and new paint, and other blemishes include dings on the left rear quarter panel and in front of the right rear wheel. Umnitza Angel Eyes replace the factory head lamps and carbon fiber chin spoilers were added. The body can be seen in gallery photographs, and no other accidents or damage are recorded in the provided AutoCheck report.

Factory equipment includes Park Distance Control sensors, rain-sensing headlights, and auto-dimming mirrors.  Style 67 18″ wheels are currently fitted, and a removed set of SSR alloy wheels are fitted with roundel center caps and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires showing 2015 date codes in front.

Interior options include navigation and Shadow Aluminum accents. A BMW accessory Bluetooth hands-free kit and iPhone adapter have been added, along with aluminum pedals and a ZHP shift knob. The digital odometer shows 94k miles, and 80k miles have been added by the seller over 10 years of driving.

Powered sport seats are clad in Nappa leather and include driver’s memory settings, and the split rear bench folds for increased storage. The trunk houses the navigation DVD player, the battery, and a Mobility kit. Both Takata airbags were replaced under recall in 2016.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm when new, and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. A rod bearing service action was completed in 2007, with the DME reprogrammed in 2009. Inspection I and II services have been performed, the latter in 2014, and an oil service and engine air filter replacement were performed in February 2018.
A collection of lift shots can be seen in the gallery below. The seller states that the rear subframe welds have been inspected for cracks and have not been reinforced.
A binder of service records is said to date back to purchase, and excerpts shown in the gallery below document recall work and scheduled maintenance.

A collection of owner’s literature is included in the sale, along with sales brochures, 2 master keys with remotes, a valet key,  a spare plastic ‘wallet’ key, and a BMW flashlight. A recent AutoCheck report can be seen in the gallery below.
Factory Style 67 alloy wheels are included in the sale, wearing Continental ExtremeContact tires.

title: 39K-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over grey leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox. This E46 M3 shows 39k miles and modifications include a ZHP E46 shift knob and Alcantara shift boot. Factory options include bi-xenon headlights, Harman Kardon sound, heated seats, and more. This E46 is offered with service records, maintenance logbooks, a recent PPI report, custom car cover, rear wind deflector, new factory floor mats, Lloyd’s floor mats, owner’s manuals, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name. Be sure to check out the full gallery excellent photos below!

Laguna Seca Blue (448) was available on the E46 M3 from 2000 through 2004. It is reported this is 1 of 417 E46 M3 cabriolets produced in Laguna Seca Blue. Factory 18” Style 67 wheels are mounted on Sumitomo HTR Z II tires and are date coded 2015.

A handful of stone chips have been touched up by the previous owners, a .5″ paint blemish is noted on the driver’s side rocker panel, and it has been reported the lower front bumper shows wear consistent with mileage and age.
The black soft top features a glass rear window with defroster.
The seller has provided a video showing operation of the convertible top and a cold start.
The cabin is trimmed in grey leather (N5TT) with heated power-adjustable seats with driver’s memory settings. A Harmon Kardon audio plays from a BMW Business head unit including an in-dash CD player.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. A new battery and brake fluid flush were completed prior to the sale.

The owner’s manual and other factory literature are included in the sale along with two key fobs and flashlight. A PPI conducted at Bavarian Workshop in Los Angeles on September 2018 reports no cracks in the subframe or VANOS issues. A copy is available in the gallery below.
The Carfax reports no accidents or issues.

title: 2003 BMW M3 6-Speed Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is a lifelong Southern California coupe finished in Steel Gray Metallic over gray Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox. The car has been with the seller for four years and 9k of its 112k indicated miles. Modifications include Apex wheels, TC Kline double-adjustable coilovers, a Mishimoto radiator, StopTech brakes, a CSF oil cooler, and more. Servicing under the current owner consisted of subframe reinforcement, installation of a Beisan Systems VANOS kit, a valve adjustment, a cooling overhaul, and suspension work. This E46 M3 is offered with service records, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Steel Gray Metallic and features an optional powered glass moonroof, rain sensor, and xenon headlights. Modifications include matte black grille surrounds from ECS Tuning, black fender grilles, and a 40% 3M Crystalline window tint. The seller notes rock chips on the hood and a ding near the left kidney grille.

Apex Arc-8 18″ wheels are finished in Hyper Black, mounted on 5mm front and 12mm rear spacers, and fitted with Falken Azenis tires showing 2016 date codes. Braking is from StopTech Trophy calipers, discs, and pads at all four corners along with stainless steel lines and a Bimmerworld front ducting kit. The factory wheels and brakes are included in the sale.

The interior is finished in gray Nappa leather and features powered seats with driver memory. A Schroth Quickfit Pro seat belt can be seen in the gallery and is included in the sale. The seller notes cracking on the seat driver-side bolster as well as a clicking noise when operating the passenger window.

An added Pioneer MVH-X380BT head unit is connected to the factory optional 6-CD changer and hi-fi speaker system. Approximately 113k miles are shown on the odometer, 9,300 of which were added by the seller in four years of ownership. The cabin filter was recently replaced according to the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54B32 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and received a VANOS kit from Beisan Systems as well as new engine mounts in 2016. The valves were adjusted, the spark plugs were replaced, and a new oil level sensor, fuel filter, and constant pressure valve were installed less than 10k miles ago. Receipts in the gallery show engine and drivetrain work in the last three years including:

Racewerkz Engineering of Burbank, California was commissioned in 2016 to reinforce the body where the rear subframe mounts, reportedly as a preventative measure. Photos taken during the work are provided in the gallery. New subframe bushings were fitted and the front control arm bushings were replaced. A leak is described from the power steering pump, a replacement for which is included in the sale.
Suspension modifications include:
Records in the gallery log service and modifications from the last four years.
The Carfax history report shows four owners, no accidents, and lifelong California registration.

title: 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black Nappa leather. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and optional equipment includes Harman Kardon audio, xenon headlights, and a sunroof. The seller acquired the car two years ago and has driven 22k of the indicated 129k miles. Maintenance conducted by the seller included replacement of the driveshaft flex-disc and center support bearing, along with a rebuild of the VANOS unit, and a cooling system service. Modifications include a Dinan strut-bar, ECS stainless steel brake lines, and upgraded audio components. This E46 is now offered with service records and a clean Mississippi title in the seller’s name.

The body panels are finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic. Per the seller, a tire fell out of the back of a truck onto the hood of the car under previous ownership, resulting in a replacement hood. The incident is not shown on the included Carfax report.

A set of factory 18″ wheels are currently mounted and the aftermarket front lip shown in various photographs is not currently installed. The 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels shown above were soda-blasted, polished, and painted by the seller and will accompany the car. Recent maintenance included replacing the driver-side wheel bearing, and ECS stainless steel brake lines are fitted.

The interior is trimmed in Black Nappa leather, and features a Harman-Kardon sound system, a power moonroof, and brushed aluminum trim. Upgrades consist of Bavsound Stage-1 speakers, a 12″ Rockford Fosgate subwoofer with amplifier, and a later model E46 business radio with auxiliary input. According to the seller, the driver’s door does not unlock remotely, and the passenger-side window is inoperable. The odometer currently displays approximately 129k miles, about 22k of which have been added by the seller over the last two years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The car is equipped with a 6-speed manual gearbox and the rod bearings are said to have replaced at around 70k miles. Recent maintenance included replacement of the driveshaft flex-disc and center support bearing, and an idler pulley, as well as rebuilding the VANOS unit using Beisan parts and replacing various coolant hoses. Per the seller, a faulty yaw sensor triggers dash lights for traction control and low tire pressure, and the throw-out bearing whines while the clutch is engaged and during shifts.
The seller notes the subframe has not been reinforced. Several underbody images are viewable in the gallery.

The Carfax report shows longterm history in Louisiana with its original owner until its purchase by the seller in 2016, with consistent odometer readings from new. The seller has a loan on the vehicle which will need to be repaid before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

title: Original-Owner 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
listing_details: Newer Michelin Pilot Super Sport Tires
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is a black-on-black coupe that was purchased new by the seller at Rasmussen BMW in Portland, Oregon before moving to California, Louisiana, South Carolina, and finally its current home of Maine. Power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and a factory rod bearing recall was performed at Beverly Hills BMW in 2005 according to the seller. This E46 M3 shows 51k miles and is offered with records from new, a window sticker, factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a Maine title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in black (Schwarz 2 668) paint, the condition of which is shown in several close-up gallery pictures below. The seller notes a small mark on the center of the rear bumper, and the lower front spoiler shows chips and dings. The Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels show various scuffs and marks and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires with 2016 and 2017 date codes that were installed 750 miles ago according to the seller.

The cabin is finished in black Nappa leather (N5SW) with Titan Shadow trim on the dash, console, and doors. Factory options include the Premium Package, heated front seats with adjustable bolsters, Harman Kardon audio, and bi-xenon headlights. Recalls have been performed for both front airbags.

Just over 51k miles are shown on the digital odometer. Wear is noted on the driver’s seat bottom and bolster along with cracking on the interior door handle trim and scuffs on the lower portion of the center console.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. The factory VANOS solenoid was replaced with a unit from Beisan Systems in 2014. An Inspection II service 5k miles ago included a valve adjustment as well as replacement of the flex disc, differential cover, seals, and bushings.

A recent service 1,000 miles ago included fitment of the new Michelin tires, front control arm bushings, and a steering coupler. Additional photos are provided to show the floors, driveline, suspension components, and more in the gallery.

The window sticker itemizes standard features and factory colors as well as listing $3,020 in options and a $53,120 MSRP. Two sets of keys, a valet key, factory manuals, and sales literature are included in the sale.
The Carfax report confirms the one-owner history and shows no accidents or damage through fall 2018.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Imola Red Over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Imola Red Over Black Nappa Leather
Cold Weather Package, Harman Kardon Sound
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is a Competition Package coupe finished in Imola Red over black Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox. The car was equipped with a sunroof, navigation, xenon headlights, the Cold Weather package, and Harman Kardon sound from the factory, while modifications include a Remus exhaust system. It was acquired from its fourth owner in 2017 by the seller, who reportedly conducted maintenance including an Inspection I three months ago. This E46 M3 is offered with a clean Carfax report, factory and all-weather floor mats, and a clear Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Imola Red and exterior options include headlight washers, rain-sensing wipers, and xenon headlights. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. The seller notes bubbling under both taillights. A brief walk-around video is viewable here.

Staggered 19” Style 127 wheels are fitted with Continental tires, with close-ups of each corner shown in gallery photos below. An upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled rotors came standard as part of the Competition Package. The right rear shock mount is making noise according to the seller. A matching spare wheel will accompany the car and is said to show some road rash.

Heated and powered black Nappa leather sport seats are accented by matching carpets and textured metallic trim on the dash, center console, and doors. Factory equipment includes the Cold Weather package, a sunroof, navigation, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The odometer displays just under 114k miles, approximately 15k of which have been added by the seller over the last two years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. The seller performs his own maintenance, which reportedly included an Inspection I about three months ago.
Additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below. A Remus exhaust system is fitted in place of the standard setup.
The Carfax report shows four owners prior to the seller and indicates no accidents or other issues through January 2017. Per the seller, the Takata airbag recall was completed.

title: 2002 BMW M3 SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a grey Nappa leather interior and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission. The car has been with the seller for two years, during which an airbag recall was completed and an Inspection I including a valve adjustment and drive belt replacement was performed in December 2017. This E46 M3 shows 87k miles and is offered with an October 2018 California emissions certificate, records for a 2004 rod bearing recall, a clean Carfax, and a clear California title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver Metallic paint is shown up close in several gallery photos below, and the seller points out several scratches and other blemishes. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
A walk-around video can be seen above. Factory 18″ wheels are fitted with Yokohama ADVAN Neova tires showing 2011 date codes.

The interior is trimmed in grey Nappa leather and features heated front seats. The car is equipped with a Harman Kardon sound system, as well as an aftermarket GROM Audio MP3 player in the trunk. The leather on the seats is slightly worn, which can be seen more clearly in the gallery, and the seller notes that the sunroof is currently not working.

The digital odometer shows just under 87k miles. Additional items supplied by the seller include BMW all-weather floor mats, a BMW sun shade with cover, and two used replacement A-pillar trim pieces said to be in good condition.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission and produced 333 horsepower with 262 ft-lb of torque when new. A list of dealer maintenance dating to 2011 is included in the gallery below along with an invoice for the 2017 Inspection I, which included a valve adjustment and replacement of drive belts. The car has also been wired for a battery tender.
A cold start video can be viewed above. Additional work in the last five years included:
The seller states that the rear subframe was last inspected at 85k miles. Additional images of the underbody can be seen in the gallery.
The owner’s manual and other factory literature are included with the car, as well as 2 keys.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists four California owners including the seller.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
listing_details: New Rear End Bushings and Guibo
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Carbonschwarz Metallic over black leather and has 85k miles. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 straight-six mated to a 6-speed sequential manual transmission and the car is optioned with the ZCP Competition Package, which included upgrades to the engine, suspension, wheels, and interior. Acquired by the seller six months ago, this E46 M3 has since received chassis reinforcement plates, as well as new rear end bushings and a new guibo. The sale includes a clean Carfax report and a clear North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

This M3 is finished in Carbonschwarz Metallic (416), and the Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. A clear bra is installed on hood front and mirrors. An upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled rotors came standard as part of the Competition Package.

19″ cross-spoke wheels are also part of the ZCP option, measuring 8″ in width up front and 9.5″ out back. Close-ups of each corner are included in the gallery, and Bridgestone Potenza tires are mounted all around.

According to the Carfax report, interior trim was repaired in 2008. This car has cruise control delete, a part of the ZCP package. Per the seller, the pixels work on the instrument cluster and navigation display. The digital odometer displays just under 85k miles, approximately 1,200 of which have been added by the seller over the last six months.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new.  It is mated to an SMG electro-hydraulic transmission in this car, featuring both automatic and manual shift modes. According to the seller, most maintenance was performed by BMW dealers in Washington, Florida, and Colorado. A valve adjustment and inspection were completed at 72k miles.
Chassis reinforcement plates were installed at 84k miles along with new rear end bushings and a new guibo. Photos of the work are viewable in the gallery below.

The Carfax report shows four total owners and indicates no accidents or other issues through July 2018. Per the report, the Takata airbag recall was completed in May 2015. The seller can deliver within 200 miles at no charge.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over a black leather interior and shows 52k miles. The car was first sold in May 2005 at Habberstad BMW in Huntington Station, New York, and has been registered in that state and New Jersey since. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include the Premium and Cold Weather packages, xenon headlights, Bluetooth, and Harman Kardon sound. The seller purchased the car in September 2017 from its previous owner of eight years and has since adjusted the valves, installed a modified VANOS oil pump disk and seals from Beisan Systems, replaced the serpentine and A/C belts, and changed the fluids as well as installing 19″ ZCP wheels and painting the front reflectors. This E46 M3 underwent an airbag recall in 2017 and is now offered with a clean Carfax report, manuals, and a clear New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Silver Grey Metallic (A08) and features an optional power sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and bi-xenon headlights with washers. The seller had both bumpers repainted, which included removing the license-plate holes on the front. The rest of the paint is said to have received correction and ceramic coating.

The car was recently equipped with Competition Package 19″ wheels, which wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires size 225/40 front and 255/35 rear and dated from 2008. The seller also installed chrome-coated front turn signal bulbs and painted front bumper reflectors.

The black-trimmed cabin features heated power seats with adjustable lumbar support and side bolsters as well as Titan Shadow interior trim, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The auto-dimming rearview mirror was repaired in 2014, and both Takata-supplied front airbags were replaced in 2017 due to a recall.

Just over 52,100 miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 800 of which were added by the seller. In recent weeks the seller replaced the driver-side armrest trim, the center console, the A- and C-pillar trim, and the M door sills. Two remote keys are included and shown in the gallery, along with a leather BMW key pouch.
The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual gearbox.

The seller states that he personally performed the equivalent of a BMW Inspection II service in March of this year, which is documented with additional photos below. A VANOS kit from Beisan Systems was installed during the valve adjustment procedure, with updated BMW cam bolts secured with Loctite and the VANOS solenoid pack cleaned. Other elements of the service are said to have included fresh fluids for the engine, transmission, differential, and power steering as well as the cooling and braking systems. The seller also replaced the engine mounts, spark plugs, serpentine and A/C belts, valve cover gasket and grommets, and windshield wiper assemblies as well as the air, fuel, and cabin filters.

An invoice shows that the control arms and their bushings were replaced at 37k miles by Competition BMW of Smithtown in Saint James, New York. Additional photos of the underside are available in the gallery below, including labeled images of the rear subframe attachment points.
The Carfax report documents no accidents or other damage and shows New York state inspections as well as consistent mileage readings.
The seller is including binders containing service records and photos from his ownership, a flash drive with digital versions of the photos, factory literature, and a spare key.

title: 30k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe is a non-sunroof US-spec model that was purchased new by the sellers through Pentagon Car Sales while they were stationed abroad in Heidelberg, Germany. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather, the car is optioned with a US-spec radio, CD changer, and rear badge delete. It remained in Germany with the sellers until being brought with them to the US in 2016. 30,688 miles are now shown on the odometer, and power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Additions include a K&N air filter, German-made drilled brake rotors, and Coco floor mats. This E46 M3 is now offered with maintenance records from new, keys, factory books, a Noah car cover, and a clean Arizona title in the sellers’ names.

The body is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, and the seller notes the passenger-side mirror was repainted to correct a scratch. A few other exterior scratches are noted, along with a mark on the rear passenger alloy wheel.
Factory 18″ wheels remain equipped, and are currently mounted with a set of Yokohama tires installed in 2017. A spare alloy wheel without a tire is also included.

Inside, the black leather upholstery is accented with aluminum dashboard trim. The seller notes a few marks on the plastic center console and wear on the driver’s seat cushion and outer thigh support as depicted above. A set of Coco floor mats have been installed, and an unused set of factory carpeted mats are included in the sale.
The rear view mirror was recently replaced, and the seller has removed the center-rear seat belt. The digital odometer shows 30,688 miles.

Under the hood is a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six with California emissions controls that has been fitted with a K&N air filter. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission. Per the seller, this M3 has been dealer-maintained in Germany and the US, and the most recent service included an oil change at BMW Scottsdale in November 2018. A new factory air filter and several quarts of Castrol Edge 10W-60 motor oil accompany the car.
The accident-free Carfax dates back to when the car was brought to the US in 2016.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Alpine White over Imola Red Leather
listing_details: Alpine White over Imola Red Leather
Two Sets of Wheels and Tires
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in Alpine White over an Imola Red leather interior and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Modifications include suspension upgrades, rear subframe reinforcement, and a light flywheel, while recent service consisted of a new Sachs OEM clutch, brake rotors and pads, and mass air flow sensor. This E46 M3 shows 94k miles and is offered by the selling dealer with two sets of wheels and tires, a Carfax report, partial records, and a clear Virginia title.

The car is finished in Alpine White and features bi-xenon headlamps with LED tail lights. The previous owner had the front bumper and hood replaced after a driveway incident, while the driver-side rear quarter panel was reportedly refinished after a sideswipe. The seller painted the front reflectors to match the body color. A scratch on the driver’s side window can be seen in the gallery.

The factory wheels are fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport rubber date coded 2015, and an extra set of E92 wheels with Continental and Falken tires will also come with the car. The seller notes that all four factory wheels have been curbed. Suspension upgrades include Bilstein B12 coilovers and Ground Control adjustable rear arms. New Zimmermann brake rotors with Textar and Akebono pads were recently fitted.

The interior is trimmed in Imola Red leather with brushed aluminum and Alcantara accents and equipped with a Harman Kardon sound system, power seats with memory, and an electric sunroof. Updates include a new ZHP shift knob, a flat-bottomed M steering wheel, a replacement rearview mirror, and an integrated auxiliary input for the factory radio.

The digital odometer shows 94k miles. Recalls for the driver- and passenger-side Takata airbags were completed by the previous owner.
