A new windshield wiper fluid pump was recently installed, but the seller states that the corresponding warning light remains illuminated as well as noting that the headliner is beginning to sag.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and produced 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Underhood modifications include a K&N intake and Rogue Engineering strut brace. An Inspection II was performed at 81k miles by Autobahn Motor Works, and the seller recently had a new Sachs OEM clutch with lightweight flywheel installed as well as a new mass air flow sensor.

An invoice is provided to show $3,200 in rear subframe service from Piper Motorsport that included sheet metal reshaping, crack welding, installation of reinforcement plates and box sections, and more. Photos taken during the process can be found in the gallery below. A leak is noted from the differential output shaft.
The Carfax report dates from new through spring 2018 and lists three previous owners, the last two of which were from the same family, according to the seller.

title: 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
interior_color: Carbon Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Carbon Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather and was originally sold in Canada. Imported to the US by the third owner, the car now shows 212k kilometers (~132k miles) and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. About 6k miles have been added by the seller during nine months of ownership, and a Turner Motorsport subframe reinforcement has been installed along with a new clutch and lightweight flywheel, as well as upgraded brakes from StopTech. This E46 M3 is now being offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic, and the seller notes that the driver’s door does not seal properly. There is some rust located on the left rear fender, as well as on the left mirror. According to the seller, the front bumper and side skirt were damaged when the car was shipped from Canada to California, and chips on the front of the car and a crack in the driver-side skirt can be seen in the gallery. The recent Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

Factory wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact tires, and StopTech brake pads and rotors have been installed in addition to stainless steel brake lines, RBF 600 brake fluid, and new front wheel hubs. The seller also had both front lower control arms replaced.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather and came equipped with the Cold Weather Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, a multifunction steering wheel, and a power sunroof. 212k kilometers (~132k miles) are currently showing on the digital odometer, and modifications to the interior include a ZHP shift knob and BimmerWorld pedals. The seller notes that a bad voltage regulator is currently causing a check engine light and battery light to show up on the dash. The problem is reportedly also affecting the oil pressure gauge, which is no longer working despite the replacement of the oil level sensor.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Service records dating back to 2014 are available, and the seller states that the previous owner had the factory rod bearing recall performed. Other maintenance has included:
The seller had a Turner Motorsport subframe reinforcement kit installed, and receipts for this work can be seen in the gallery.

The Carfax shows no accidents or other damage reported, but does indicate a potential odometer rollback in 2008. The seller believes this was a clerical error caused by a kilometers to miles conversion issue. The Carfax also shows the car passed a California smog test in August of 2018. A cold start of this M3 can be viewed below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W4xfvAFZC6k

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Carbon Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Carbon Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather and was purchased by the selling dealer 15 years ago. He has since added 52k of the 53k indicated miles, and factory equipment includes Dynamic Stability Control, a multifunction steering wheel, front armrest, fog lights, and a sunroof. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and a 550i shifter assembly has been added along with an F10 M5 shift knob and black exterior grilles. The subframe was recently inspected, and the rod bearings were replaced at 7k miles in 2004. This E46 M3 is now being offered with a Carfax report, the factory books and manuals, service records, and a clear New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic, and the seller notes that the passenger-side front fender was replaced after an incident with a parked car in 2004. Gloss black kidney and fender grilles were installed by the seller in September 2017.
The 18″ factory wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires, showing 2011 date codes and measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Some curbing can be seen on the wheels in the gallery below.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather, and a 550i shifter assembly has been added along with an F10 M5 illuminated shift knob. The airbag recalls have been performed, the rearview mirror has been replaced, and the seller notes that the driver’s seat is lightly worn.
The multifunction steering wheel was rewrapped by Coby Wheel in 2017 with a red stripe. The odometer shows approximately 53,500 miles, about 52,700 of which have been added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Service records dating back to 2003 are included, and highlights are as follows:
Additional photos of the underbody can be seen in the gallery below.
The seller notes that a subframe inspection in October of this year showed no signs of cracks, and a video of this inspection can be viewed above.
The car comes with an owner’s manual, three keys, and the factory books and manuals.
The Carfax shows the 2004 incident and also lists this car as a one-owner vehicle, as the selling dealer purchased the car from the original owner.
A brief driving video can be seen above, and a walk-around video can be viewed below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 straight-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission and optioned with the ZCP Competition Package, which includes factory upgrades to the engine, suspension, wheels, and interior. The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather and has been modified with a Rogue Engineering short shift kit and hard-wired Passport 9500ix radar detector. Service records date to new and include a preventative overhaul of the VANOS system as well as an Inspection II completed at 91k miles. An oil/filter change with the ECS Tuning Oil Change kit was performed by the seller within the past 100 miles. This E46 M3 now shows 97k miles and is offered with clean Carfax and AutoCheck reports, service records, removed stock parts, and a clear Illinois title in the seller’s name.

This M3 is finished in Carbonschwarz Metallic (416), and the paintwork is shown up close in several gallery photos below. Enthusiast Auto Group of Cincinnati, Ohio resprayed the front bumper, performed paint correction, and added ceramic coating prior to the seller’s purchase in March 2018. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

Modifications include gloss black front grilles, color-matched front bumper reflectors, and tinted windows. Staggered 19″ Competition Package wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact tires all around, and curb rash is noted on the right rear. Cross-drilled brake rotors and an upgraded steering rack also came standard as part of the Competition Package.

The interior is trimmed in black leather with aluminum accents on the dash, center console, and door panels. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as a power moonroof, power seats, and BMW Assist infotainment system, Bluetooth, and auxiliary input. The seller notes that the Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is worn and may need reupholstering.

Modifications include an oval mirror, a Bimmerworld aluminum pedal set, clutch stop, and a Rogue Engineering Octane short shift kit with Alcantara boot and BMW Performance knob. OEM M3 floor and trunk mats were installed by the seller. A “Track Mode” button raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control system. The digital odometer shows 97k miles, 6k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and is linked to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission. An Inspection II and overhaul of the VANOS system were performed by Enthusiast Auto Group in February 2017. Invoices detailing the work performed are viewable in the gallery below.
Additional photos illustrating the condition of the chassis, underbody, suspension components, and rear subframe mounts are also provided in the gallery.

The Carfax shows no accidents or other damage in Virginia, Kansas, Ohio, and Georgia before the seller’s purchase. The seller has a loan for the car, and his financial institution will need to be paid off before the Illinois title is transferred to the new owner. Walk-around and cold start videos are provided below:
https://youtu.be/z4pz0e5yV_Y
https://youtu.be/wewoMl5fvu4

title: 21k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow over a black leather interior and shows just under 21k miles. The car was acquired by the seller earlier this year from the widow of the original owner, who ordered the car for use at a BMW CCA driving school. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and modifications include a cold-air intake, short shifter, Supersprint exhaust system, a set wider front wheels, Bilstein coilovers, race-compound brake pads, and more as outlined below. Approximately 150 miles have been added by the seller, and a $1,990 service was recently performed at a dealership. This E46 M3 is being offered with the stock front wheels, extra parts, a clean Carfax report, service records, and a clear South Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The Phoenix Yellow finish is shown up close from various angles in the gallery below. No prior accidents or damage are indicated on the 2018 Carfax report. Participation stickers from two driving schools with the 2004 Genesse Chapter BMW CCA are present on the windshield.

A set of wider front wheels wrapped in 255/40ZR18 Michelin Pilot Sports were installed by the original owner. The rear wheels remain stock and are fitted with a set of Michelin Pilot Super Sports. The tire pressure monitoring system light is currently on as a result of the larger front wheels and tires, though the system is reportedly working. Upgrades to the brake system include cross-drilled rotors, stainless hoses, and race-compound pads.

Optional equipment includes heated front seats and a power glass moonroof. A short shifter has been added along with provisions for a race harness, though the harness itself has been removed. Just under 21k miles are shown on the odometer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is backed by a 6-speed manual gearbox and has been fitted with a cold-air intake and a Supersprint exhaust system. $1,990 was recently spent at Century BMW in Greenville, South Carolina to inspect and repair a few minor items, as shown on the invoice in the gallery below.

Bilstein coilovers are fitted at each corner. Adjustable suspension linkage from Turner Motorsports has been added to correct the rear camber. Additional photos of the underside have been provided in the gallery.

Records and receipts from the first owner are included with the sale. The original window sticker showing the $51,370 retail price is also included along with the factory keys and glove compartment books.

The stock front wheels accompany the sale and are wrapped in new Michelin tires. Various wheel spacers with the corresponding hardware are also included, along with a set aftermarket front backing plates, a fitted car cover, and two helmets.
The included Carfax shows registration records in New York and South Carolina, as well as service at multiple BMW dealerships. Walk-around and cold-start videos are attached below.

title: 36k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe
interior_color: Silver Grey over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Silver Grey over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was sold new at Medford BMW in Medford, Oregon and was acquired by the seller’s family in 2009. Approximately 16k of the 36k indicated miles have been driven since. The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over a black leather interior, and power comes from a 3.2L straight-six paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission. Factory equipment includes the cold weather package with heated seats and headlight washers, 19″ forged wheels, a power sunroof, and a navigation system. This E46 M3 coupe is offered with booklets, keys, a window sticker, service records from 2009, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The body is finished in Silver Grey Metallic, and the seller points out chips and other blemishes in gallery close-ups below. Xenon headlights are equipped.
Factory polished 19″ wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires showing 2014 date codes.

The black Nappa leather interior features heated and powered seats with memory function on the driver’s side, a sunroof, Harman Kardon stereo system, and brushed aluminum trim. An integrated Passport radar detector has been added, and the seller notes wear on the driver’s seat. The digital odometer shows approximately 36k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new. The seller states that a BMW Inspection I service was completed at 30k miles, and that the car passed a California emissions test in October 2018.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed SMG-II transmission. Additional underbody photos can be seen in the gallery below.
A window sticker, booklets, keys, and service records dating from 2009 are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows Oregon and California registrations with no recorded accidents or other damage.
A cold start and walk-around video is shown above.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: Two Sets of Wheels and Tires
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission. A repaint in metallic orange was performed under previous ownership, and is contrasted by a black roof and two sets of factory wheels with dark finishes and orange accents. The car is equipped with welded-in rear subframe reinforcements, a Billy Boat rear muffler, BSW Stage One speakers, and more. Services performed during the seller’s ownership the installation of new rear suspension bushings, ball joints, shock mounts, and an Inspection I. This M3 is offered with a Carfax report and a clean South Carolina title in the seller’s name.

Originally black, the exterior is now finished in metallic orange contrasted by a black roof panel, a sunroof is not equipped. The repaint was performed under previous ownership. The seller describes the finish imperfections as minimal, and they are shown in the gallery. LED light rings have been added to the factory headlight housings, and the car retains factory taillights with clear turn signal lenses. The attached Carfax shows a side-swipe incident in 2013 involving the right-front of the vehicle.

Two sets of factory 18″ wheels are included. The currently installed set is finished in PlastiDip and equipped with Kumho Ecsta V720 tires with 2016 date codes. The second set have a metallic gloss gunmetal finish with Orange vinyl stripes, and are fitted with Hankook Ventus RS-3 tires with 2014 date codes. Per the seller, the latter set of wheels is in better condition.

The interior is finished in Cinnamon leather contrasted by black carpets and plastics. The car is equipped with manually-adjusted heated sport seats, a factory steering wheel with wheel-mounted controls, ZHP shift knob, and a factory stereo with retrofitted factory AUX input. BSW Stage One speakers have been added in factory locations within the last year.
Instrumentation includes a 180 mph speedometer, tachometer with 8,000 rpm redline, fuel gauge, temperature gauge, and a digital multi-function display. 104k miles are shown on the 6-digit odometer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new, and sends power to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission and BMW M variable-lock differential. A stainless steel Billy Boat rear muffler is fitted. During the seller’s ownership the car has received Inspection I and II services, as well as ball joints, rear suspension bushings, welded-in rear subframe reinforcements, and shock mounts.
The Carfax report shows history in Missouri and Florida before coming to South Carolina in 2014. An entry in 2013 notes a side-swipe accident involving the right-front of the vehicle.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was sold new at Peter Pan BMW in San Mateo, California and has been with the seller since 2014. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather interior and powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Features include powered seats with memory, xenon headlights, a rear spoiler delete, a glass sunroof, and more. Service during the seller’s ownership consisted of a valve adjustment as well as a new rearview mirror, gaskets, belts, and brake fluid. This E46 M3 shows just under 73k miles and is offered with a window sticker, manuals, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

This coupe is finished in Titansilber Metallic (354), with a few blemishes pointed out by the seller in the gallery below. Exterior features include fog lights, a sunroof, xenon headlamps with washers, and omission of a rear spoiler from the factory.
Factory 18″ wheels are equipped with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires dated 2013, with curb scrapes documented at each corner in the gallery.

The cabin is trimmed in black leather with M3 logos on the door sills and floor mats. Interior amenities include heated sport seats with adjustable bolsters and driver-side memory, the Smoker’s Package, a ski bag, and a front arm rest. A replacement rearview mirror was installed in 2016.

An aftermarket touchscreen stereo is installed in place of the stock unit, which is included and shown in the gallery. Fewer than 73k miles are shown on the odometer, with about 3k added by the seller over the past four years.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. A valve adjustment and brake fluid flush were carried out near the beginning of the seller’s ownership as well as replacement of the valve cover gasket, spark plug gaskets, valve shims, and belts for the water pump and alternator. A front strut brace was also installed.
The window sticker itemizes standard equipment and selected options for a total MSRP of $53,795. An owner’s manual and other factory literature are included in the sale and shown below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over a grey Nappa leather interior and was acquired by the seller nine years ago. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and factory equipment includes the Premium Package, 19″ forged wheels, a power sunroof, and xenon headlights. This E46 M3 coupe shows 149k miles and is offered with service records from 2009, several Blackstone oil analyses, vehicle history reports, miscellaneous parts, and a clear Kansas title in the seller’s name.

The Silver Grey Metallic finish is shown up close in the gallery below, and bodywork was performed on the front bumper, hood, left front fender, and left door just prior to the seller’s purchase in 2009. May 2018 work included repair of minor hail damage and a new front bumper cover. Invoices are for both repairs are available in the gallery below. Chips are noted at the front grilles, left fender vent, and left door mirror. Exterior modifications include clear front reflectors and Höen XenonMatch fog light bulbs.

Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires sized 245/35 in front and 275/30 in the rear. The seller notes minor curb damage on the wheels along with a slight bend in one inner bead at the rear. SolarGard HP Supreme window tint measures 35% up front and 20% on the quarter and rear windows.

The interior is upholstered in grey Nappa leather and has been modified with a remanufactured ZHP-style steering wheel, glovebox-mounted iPod/auxiliary cable input, Pro-Fit VSM phone mount, BMW universal garage door opener, and M3 floor mats. Reported flaws include coffee stains on the driver-side carpet, cracking leather on the front seats and door armrest, and a torn seam covered with an adhesive patch on the outer driver’s backrest bolster.

The digital odometer shows just under 149k miles, 70k of which came from the seller’s 9-year ownership. The airbag light is said to illuminate intermittently due to a passenger seat sensor error, replacement parts for which are included in the sale. The seller notes that a column of pixels goes missing from the stereo display in the cold and that the HVAC controls do not dim properly.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission featuring a 330d short shifter. A spreadsheet of service history performed under the seller’s ownership is available in the gallery below and includes:

The seller notes leakage from the right differential output shaft seal and a damp power steering lower hose. Airbag recalls were completed in August 2015 and January 2017, and the rear subframe mounts were inspected by an independent mechanic in November 2018. No subframe reinforcements have been installed, and the condition of the area is shown in the gallery below.
A Bentley service manual, custom Covercraft sunshade, full set of keys, front license plate bracket, and various spare parts are included in the sale.
Detailed service records have been maintained from 2009 to present. Several Blackstone oil analysis reports are pictured in the gallery, the most recent of which took place in October 2018.

The Carfax report indicates no accidents or issues aside from a repossession in 2009, and shows that both driver- and passenger-side airbag recalls have been performed. A similar AutoCheck report is shown in the gallery.
A cold start video is shown above.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated with a 6-speed manual gearbox and has been modified with Hotchkis sway bars, Ground Control camber plates, a Rogue Engineering transmission mount, AKG bushings, and more. the car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather, and factory equipment includes 19″ forged wheels, a power sunroof, and xenon headlights. Rear subframe repairs and fitment of an VANOS oil pump disc from Beisan Systems were reportedly carried out under previous ownership, while an Inspection II was performed in October 2018. This E46 M3 coupe shows 169k miles after two and half years with the seller and is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report, factory literature, partial records, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver Metallic paintwork is shown up close in a number of gallery photos below. Exterior modifications include European-market side mirrors and painted front marker lights. The seller reports several dings acquired since earlier paintless dent removal, with other flaws including damaged right headlight trim, a missing tow hook cover, and marks in the finish. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels wear Hankook Ventus R-S3 tires and are mounted on Apex 75mm bullet-nose studs. An extra set of 18″ factory wheels is included in the sale. Suspension from a 2006 E46 M3 was reportedly installed under previous ownership, with further modifications including Hotchkis sway bars, Ground Control camber plates, AKG bushings, and Bimmerworld front control arm bushings. The seller notes that the car has been used for street and track, and a rear subframe repair was documented on a BMW forum by the previous owner.

The cabin features manually-adjusted black leather sport seats, an anthracite headliner, a sunroof, and Harman Kardon audio. The seller reports the previous owner installed a new passenger door lock actuator, auto-dimming rearview mirror, pillar upholstery, BMW Homelink garage door opener, DICE MediaBridge, and hard wiring for an Escort Passport radar detector.
The digital odometer shows just under 169k miles, 5k of which came from the seller’s two-and-a-half-year ownership. The windshield washer pump is inoperative.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The following items are reported to have been installed or replaced:
Digital service records dating to 2012, paper service records from 2016 to present, and factory literature are included in the sale.
The Carfax shows no accidents or other damage with five owners from 2001 to April 2018.

title: 30k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 shows 30k miles and is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six coupled with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory options include the Luxury Package, xenon headlamps, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Sold new in Concord, California, the car reportedly remained with its original owner until December 2017 and was acquired by the current owner three months later. An Inspection II was performed in March 2018 along with additional work detailed below, and new tires were installed less than 500 miles ago. Said to remain stock apart from window tint and wheel spacers, this E46 M3 is now being offered for sale at no reserve on the current owner’s behalf with maintenance records from current ownership, dealer service history, the original window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

Body panels wear a Jet Black finish, and the included Carfax report lists no history of accidents or other damage. The seller describes a small ding on the rear quarter panel and front bumper as shown in the gallery.

Factory 18” double-spoke alloy wheels wear a Satin Chrome finish and are mounted with new Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires and Turner Motorsports spacers. Ventilated anti-lock disc brakes came as standard, along with Dynamic Brake Control (DBC) and 4-wheel independent sport suspension. Aftermarket tint has been applied to the windows.

Black Nappa leather seats are power-adjustable and feature memory settings for the driver as well as adjustable lumbar support and side bolsters. Additional amenities include rain sensing wipers, a power sunroof, park distance control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. A new set of factory carpet mats are included in the sale.

The auto-dimming rearview mirror was recently repaired, and new door and window seals have been fitted. Over 30k miles are shown on the digital odometer, around 350 of which were added under current ownership. The driver and passenger airbag recalls have been addressed per the included dealership service history.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. An Inspection II and valve adjustment were completed in March 2018, and photos in the gallery document some of the work. An oil analysis report from Blackstone Laboratories is included with the service records.

Additional maintenance performed under current ownership reportedly included a new differential input shaft seal, muffler mount, rear trailing arm bushings, and belt drive pulleys. The seller notes a bent passenger-side jack pad, and additional underbody photos are viewable below.
The factory window sticker lists the optional equipment along with an original list price of $72,358, including the dealer markup.

A provided Carfax report shows no issues and indicates a history of California ownership from new. According to the seller, the first three owners are the same individual, and the car passed a California emissions test in 2018.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Imola Red with a black leather interior and powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed sequential manual gearbox. The car was sold new in Ohio and spent time in Washington State and Nebraska before being acquired in 2013 by the previous owner. The seller is a 25-year BMWCCA member who bought the car nine months ago. This convertible was optioned  the Cold Weather Package featuring heated seats, Harman Kardon sound, xenon headlamps, parking assist, and 19″ wheels. Service in 2018 included new ignition coils, temperature sensors, and power steering hoses as well as brake work and more. Now showing 93k miles, this E46 M3 convertible is offered at no reserve with the seller’s records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Nebraska title in the seller’s name.

This convertible is finished in Imola Red with a black top, and no accidents or other damage are indicated on the Carfax report. Exterior features include bi-xenon headlamps and rear parking assist sensors. Detailed photos of the lenses, grilles, mirrors, door jambs, and more can be reviewed in the gallery below.

Polished 19″ factory wheels are mounted with Continental tires at each corner. The powered black soft top features a heated glass rear window and can be seen lowered in the gallery. Brake service in 2018 included replacing two pressure switches and a fluid flush.

The interior is upholstered in black leather with aluminum trim across the dash and doors. Front seat heaters and a ski pass-through are equipped as part of the Cold Weather Package. A power door lock actuator was replaced in June 2018, and an airbag recall was reportedly performed two years ago.

Paddle shifters for the 6-speed SMG-II automated sequential manual transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel, and a video demonstration is provided above. Grey-faced gauges include a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with an 8000-rpm redline, while the digital odometer shows just under 93k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and peak outputs of 333 horsepower with 262 ft-lb of torque in factory spec. A factory strut tower brace spans the engine bay. The seller states that the VANOS variable cam timing system was inspected in June 2018 and operates as it should. A June 2018 service documented in the gallery included the following items:
The seller reports that the subframe was last inspected in June 2018, and has provided a subframe photo above along with other underside photos in the gallery.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage with four owners in Ohio, Texas, Washington, Oregon, and Nebraska. Previous records were reportedly discarded by the dealer from whom the previous owner purchased the car in 2013.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe shows just under 75k miles and is finished in Alpine White over black Nappa leather. The car reportedly remained in California until recently being acquired by the selling dealer, who moved it to Utah. Power is provided by a 3.2L straight-six paired with a 6-speed SMG transmission. Factory equipment includes a power moonroof, heated seats with lumbar support, xenon lights, navigation, Harman Kardon sound, 19″ wheels, and more. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer in Utah with the original window sticker, books, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Alpine White, and no accidents or other damage are indicated on the Carfax report. Exterior features include xenon headlights, a rear deck lid spoiler, and LED taillights. Close-ups of the body panels, lenses, grilles, mirrors, and trim can be seen in the 150+ photo gallery below.
A walk-around video can be seen above.
Polished 19″ factory wheels are mounted with Continental tires. The seller notes the fronts require replacement.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with contrasting aluminum trim on the dash and door panels. Features include heated and powered seats with memory and lumbar functions, a moonroof, Harman Kardon stereo system, and navigation.
Paddle shifters for the 6-speed SMG transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel. The odometer currently displays just under 74,700 miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A factory strut tower brace can be seen above.
Numerous underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.
The factory window sticker will accompany the sale, along with the original books, two key fobs, a valet key, the original purchase order, and a VHS-tape displaying features and operations.
The Carfax report indicates no accident damage and shows longterm California registration. A video of the car revving is viewable below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was sold new in Florida, where it remained until moving California in 2017 and being acquired by the seller. Power is provided by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed SMG II transmission, and recent maintenance is said to have included a fluid change and an airbag recall. Now showing 50k miles, this E46 M3 convertible is offered by the seller at no reserve with factory books and manuals, a clean AutoCheck report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black, and the Autocheck report shows no accidents or other damage. Paintwork was reportedly performed on the front bumper cover to correct scratches in the finish under the seller’s ownership. Xenon headlights are flanked by aftermarket corner lights and smoked side markers.
19″ Linea Corse Z2S multi-spoke wheels wear Continental tires. The black fabric top features a heated glass rear window, and is displayed from multiple angles in the gallery below.

Black Nappa leather covers powered seats with driver’s side memory settings. Interior equipment includes DVD navigation and Harman Kardon HiFi audio. The SMG electro-hydraulic manual transmission offers sequential shifting with the console lever or steering wheel buttons.
The digital odometer indicates approximately 50k, roughly 3k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with an SMG II electro-hydraulic manual transmission. Peak output was rated at 333 horsepower when new. A fluid service was performed in October 2018, and the seller states an airbag recall was recently performed.
The AutoCheck report displays ownership history in Florida and California, and shows no record of accidents or other damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue over a black Nappa leather interior and is optioned with the ZCP Competition Package. The seller purchased the car 4 years ago and has added approximately 23k miles since. Factory equipment includes heated seats, xenon lights, Harman Kardon audio, and a glass moonroof. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual gearbox. Additions include CSL exhaust manifolds, a Euro exhaust center section, Dinan Stage 1 Springs, and more as detailed in the listing. Now showing 69k miles, this E46 M3 is being offered with 6 years of service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The exterior is finished in Interlagos Blue, and the front and rear bumper covers and hood have been repainted to correct stone chips. A small dent and scratch are visible on the rear bumper, and a pair of matte black side grills from ECS replace the factory items. The Shadowline rubber trim is noted to be deteriorating, and the seller indicates that the door seals are cracking at the top corners. No prior-accidents or damage are indicated on the included Carfax report.

Staggered-width 19” cross-spoke alloy wheels are wrapped in a set of Michelin Pilot Super Sports. Stiffer and lower Stage 1 springs from Dinan have been installed, along with Koni shocks and a set of rear trailing arm bushing limiters. Upgrades to the brake system include a set of stainless braided hoses.

The black Nappa leather seats are manually adjustable and heated. Interior options include aluminum trim, a sunroof, and a Harman Kardon audio system. A factory center console without an armrest has been added, along with a short shift kit, ZHP shift knob, and Alcantara boots for the parking brake and shifter.
The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with a “Track Mode” button. 69k miles are shown on the odometer, approximately 23k of which have been added by the seller over the past 4 years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A set Euro CSL manifolds and a Euro exhaust center section have been fitted. Power is routed through a 6-speed manual gearbox, and the clutch delay valve has been deleted. An Inspection I and II were performed at 45k miles, and the last California Smog test was performed in March 2018.
Two factory keys, glove compartment books, and service records dating back to 2013 accompany the sale.

The included Carfax report from December 2018 lists registration events in Ohio and California, along with several service history records. There is currently a lien on the title through the seller’s credit union, which will need to be settled prior to transfer of the title.
