title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Convertible has spent its life in New Jersey and was purchased by a member of the seller’s family in 2012. The seller acquired it in September 2017 and the odometer now shows 95k miles. The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue with a color-matched hardtop over grey leather upholstery. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to a 6-speed manual transmission. Features include a set of lowering springs and an Alcantara steering wheel rim. This E46 M3 is now offered with service receipts from the previous owner, a hardtop stand, factory manuals, one key, a clear Carfax, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

Laguna Seca Blue was an added-cost option for the E46 M3, and this particular convertible came equipped with a factory hardtop as shown above. Per the seller, cosmetic blemishes include scuffs on the front bumper low corners plus a ding on the driver’s side rear quarter panel, as highlighted in the gallery below. The included Carfax does not list any accidents or other damage.
This M3 sits lower than stock on a set of aftermarket springs. 18″ wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 265/35 rear Falken Azenis RT615K tires. Each corner is detailed up-close in the gallery.

Inside, this M3 is optioned with a Harman Kardon sound system, heated seats, and dark trim on the door pulls, center console, and dashboard face. An aftermarket Alcantara steering wheel rim is equipped as shown above. Per the seller, the hazard light switch and interior door lock switch are both inoperable, though the locks function correctly via the key fob or door handle lock itself.

This M3 is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six, which is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission and developed 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A valve adjustment was completed in 2013 by Maximum PSI in Linden, New Jersey. Several parts receipts and an in-process picture of the valve adjustment are displayed in the gallery. The previous owner was a mechanic, who reportedly completed other maintenance themselves.
The accident-free Carfax lists New Jersey registration from new and a handful of service history records.

title: 21k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller on BaT in February 2018 with just under 20k miles and transported from South Carolina to the San Francisco Bay Area, where it has been driven an additional 1,000 miles. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission and finished in Alpine White over a black Nappa leather interior with aluminum trim. Factory options consist of the Premium and Cold Weather packages, xenon headlights, Harman Kardon sound, and 19″ light alloy wheels. Work over the last year included removal of the clutch delay valve, repairing the auto-dimming mirror, refreshing the Double VANOS system, replacing the differential bolts, and more. This E46 M3 is offered with service records, an owner’s manual, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

This coupe is finished in Alpine White, and no accidents or other damage are noted on the Carfax. The prior owner described correction of rock chips on the passenger side of the hood, and the areas are highlighted by the seller in the gallery below along with the rest of the finish and trim.

The optional 19″ light alloy wheels show occasional oxidation at their centers, and Continental ContiSportContact tires are fitted at all four corners. The brake rotors, pads, and fluid were replaced in 2015.

The interior is finished in black Nappa leather with aluminum trim. The heated front sport seats feature lumbar support and adjustable seat width. AC Schnitzer aluminum pedal covers were installed by a previous owner, while the seller replaced the clutch pedal assembly with a Mason Engineering GSP clutch pedal and had the clutch delay valve removed. The stock pedal is included in the sale.

Optional interior equipment includes a Harman Kardon sound system, glass moonroof, and rear seat ski bag. The digital odometer shows 20,700 miles, with approximately 1,000 added by the seller. A Takata passenger airbag recall was fulfilled in 2015. The seller had the auto-dimming mirror repaired by Radar-Mirror, which is reportedly still under transferrable warranty. A CTEK pigtail for trickle charging have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. A low-mileage dealer service was completed in 2015 at 17k miles along with replacement of the power steering pump. Work at Hilton Head BMW in January 2018 included replacement of the fuel sending unit, rear pinion seal, right rear axle seal, and more. The VANOS unit was sent to Beisan for a preventative overhaul, which included replacement of the gaskets, sealing plates, cam gear bolts, upper chain guide. A new CPV valve and seals were installed at the same time.

The most recent interval service included fluid flushes for the coolant, rear differential, and manual transmission. Photos of the rear subframe mounting points can be seen in the gallery, and the area was inspected for the seller by Performance Technic. The seller had the differential bolts replaced with factory update items, and additional gallery photos show the subframe, suspension, and more.
The window sticker shows standard and select equipment for an MSRP of $55,720 in 2003. The sale includes service records from previous and current ownership, plus two remote keys.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists a California smog check as passed in March 2018. A cold start video is provided below:

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Leather
listing_details: Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Leather
CSL-Style Front Bumper, Trunk, & Rear Diffuser
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red and is powered by a 3.2L straight-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The seller acquired the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 2,500 of the 116k indicated miles. Factory equipment includes a sunroof and a Harman Kardon stereo, and the car has been modified with the fitment of a CSL-style front bumper, trunk lid, and rear diffuser, a Coby steering wheel, KW V2 coilovers, and a rebuilt limited-slip differential. This E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, service records, removed factory parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Silver Gray Metallic. The Carfax shows a 2010 accident involving extensive damage, noting a deer impact to the front right of the car. The seller states that the hood, front fenders, and trunk have been repainted, and the car is fitted with a Status Gruppe CSL-style front bumper, trunk lid, and carbon-fiber rear diffuser. The windows have reportedly been tinted with ceramic film and a clear bra added to the front bumper, hood, headlamps, and mirrors.

The seller has provided the walk-around video shown above, as well as others available on this YouTube playlist. Suspension modifications include KW V2 coilovers, Status Gruppe adjustable sway bar end links, Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts with replacement bushings, replacement rear spring pads, and Delrin rear trailing arm bushings. Forged 19″ M cross-spoke wheels are said to have been refinished and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires showing 2017 and 2018 date codes.

The car was optioned with the Premium Package, which added a power glass moonroof and power-adjustable sport seats in Imola Red Nappa leather. Additional equipment includes a Harman Kardon sound system and Titan Shadow trim. The seller has replaced the door sill plates and added a Euro-style center tray with a deleted armrest. A set of carpeted mats is included the sale.

The shifter was rebuilt and features a 545i shift lever and a ZHP weighted knob. The clutch delay valve has been removed, and the clutch pedal and dead pedal have been replaced. Rogue Engineering Delrin brake and clutch pedal bushings are also equipped. A Coby steering wheel has been padded and refinished in Alcantara with tricolor stitching to match the shifter and parking brake boots. The radio screen and volume knob were recently replaced, and the digital odometer shows approximately 116k miles.
The 3.2L S54 inline-six features replacement Vanos bolts and filter as well as a carbon-fiber valve cover.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual transmission, which has been fitted with a replacement BMW clutch and lines. The limited-slip differential was rebuilt by Performance Gearing out of Tucson, Arizona with a 3.91 gear set, BMW seals, Timken bearings, and new mounting bolts. The subframe was also recently inspected.

The Carfax report shows Georgia, Florida, and Colorado registrations, along with the accident in 2010. A window sticker, owner’s booklets, service records, and removed factory parts are included in the sale.
An engine start-up video is shown above and a video of the engine running can be seen below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: CSL-Style Front Bumper, Diffuser, & Trunk Lid
Dr. VANOS Rebuild and Cam Bolts
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Jet Black over black leather and shows just over 69k miles. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and factory options include xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, and Dynamic Stability Control. Modifications include an E46 CSL front bumper, diffuser, and trunk lid, polyurethane suspension bushings, Bilstein coilovers, a Dr. VANOS rebuild, TMS rear subframe reinforcement plates, and more. This E46 is offered with service records dating to 2010, owner’s manuals, keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car was repainted in its original Jet Black (668) by a previous owner in 2010. The seller replaced the passenger-side fender after it was dented, and added a CSL-style front bumper, diffuser, and trunk lid. Options include a power sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and bi-xenon headlights. The Carfax reports an accident in California from October 2006, but no further information is listed.

The car rides on a set of 18” Satin Black Apex ARC 8 wheels with H&R 15mm spacers up front and 10mm spacers out back. Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires are fitted at all four corners. Suspension and braking modifications include Powerflex polyurethane bushings, Bilstein PSS9 Coilovers, Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts, and Turner Motorsport braided stainless steel brake lines. The rear subframe is reinforced with Turner Motorsport reinforcement plates installed by Performance Technic of Fremont, California.

The black-trimmed cabin features power seats, a multifunction steering wheel, automatic climate control, aluminum shadow trim, an anthracite headliner, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Interior modifications include a Rogue Octane short shifter kit with a weighted selector rod, Hyper white interior LED bulbs, GSP clutch pedal and clutch delay valve delete, and a Dynavin HU head unit. Just over 69k miles are shown on the digital odometer, with approximately 12k added by the seller in over four years of ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual gearbox. The seller states that a BMW Inspection II service was completed in 2017, with receipts documenting the work are included in the sale. Modifications consist of a VANOS kit from Dr. VANOS including upgraded cam bolts and a Cryo exhaust hub, Turner Motorsport pulleys, and Evolve Motorsports Alpha N ECU tune.
Included Carfax report details history from 2005 to 2017 in California and Florida.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Track Car
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 was purchased by the seller five years ago and subsequently converted into a track car by Performance Technic. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is mated to a 6-speed sequential gearbox and has been modified with a carbon-fiber air intake, ECU tune, and an Epic Motorsports exhaust header. A custom livery and #88 adorn the exterior, along with carbon-fiber aero components. The interior has been stripped and fitted with a welded-in cage, Recaro racing seats, and an AiM data display and logging system. The car has taken part in 15-20 track days since completion of the build, and the seller estimates it has approximately 75k miles. Recent service included new fluids and a resealing of the VANOS system. The car is registered as non-operative as it is not legal for street use. This E46 track car is now offered with build records, a pre-purchase inspection, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished with a white, blue, and black patterned livery, with logos promoting Performance Technic and the Alisa Ann Ruch Burn Foundation. BimmerWorld provided the carbon fiber front splitter, riser, canards, and headlight-delete blanks. The driver’s headlight blank doubles as an intake for the engine, and the BimmerWorld brake ducting is fitted in place of the fog lights. Additional downforce comes from the Aero Motions adjustable carbon fiber rear wing.

The door windows were replaced with quick-connect window netting, and plexiglass is installed in place of the rear side windows. The sunroof has been removed and the opening capped with a riveted blank. 18″ BC Forged wheels measure 10″ wide at all four corners and are mounted via studs. The Toyo Proxes RR tires show 2014 date codes, and a set of roller wheels and tires is included in the sale.

The upholstery and carpets have been removed from the interior, including the insulation and adhesive. The air conditioning system and heater core were removed and the plumbing was capped. Both door panels were removed and cable pull straps were installed. A welded-in cage is integrated with the strut towers and features door bars, a dashboard cross bar, A and B-pillar wraps, and reinforcement of the rear subframe. The Recaro driver’s seat is equipped with a Schroth 5-point harness and provisions for a HANS device. The removable Recaro passenger seat is also equipped with a 5-point harness. Additional amenities include a fire suppression system, an extra-wide rearview mirror, and a F.A.S.T. Cool Suit System with an unused shirt.

The factory dashboard was reinstalled on top of the cage, and block-off plates for removed items provides space for added switches. Other features include a tilt-up steering wheel, a push-button start, and an electrical kill switch.

Instrumentation was replaced with an AiM MXG panel with GPS and data logging. An AiM SmartyCam overlays data on the recorded driving video, which can be seen above. Note that the driver lost his left arm and leg in an accident as a child, and thus is only driving with his right hand. The seller states that the electronic gauge sometimes does not display the proper gear, though other instrumentation is correct and the gearbox is not to blame for the error.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is equipped with a carbon fiber air-intake, Epic Motorsport 100 octane ECU tune, and an Epic Motorsports exhaust header. The seller estimates output to be 345 horsepower at the rear wheels via the 6-speed SMG transmission. Cooling has been upgraded with a larger Fluidyne radiator, a larger oil cooler, and a larger electric fan. A BimmerWorld Race muffler and resonator reportedly allow for operation under 104 decibels, but a straight pipe is included in the sale. Service in January 2019 included a Beisan VANOS reseal kit, as well as new fluids for the engine, gearbox, differential, and power steering.

Suspension modifications include Ground Control camber plates, Hotchkis sway bars, and solid bushings throughout. An MCS double remote reservoir strut system is installed. The rear subframe has been reinforced and connects to the welded-in cage.

The rear differential has been swapped with a 4.10:1 gear set. A photo in the gallery shows corner balance measurements of a 51/49 between the front and rear, and a total weight of 3,018 pounds with a half tank of fuel.
Records in the gallery detail the 2014 build, as well as a servicing and a pre-purchase inspection in January 2019.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
exterior_color: Oxford Green Metallic over Light Grey
listing_details: Oxford Green Metallic over Light Grey
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Oxford Green Metallic over light grey Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. The car is equipped with the Cold Weather Package, and modifications include KW V2 coilovers, 18″ Apex wheels, headers, a short shift kit, “angle eye” headlights, a carbon fiber rear diffuser, and an Avin head unit with Bluetooth and navigation. 98k miles are currently showing on the odometer, and the seller has added just under 10k miles since purchasing the car in June 2018. Recent mechanical work included an Inspection II service, new end links, rear control arms, rear shocks, lollipop bushings, RTAB bushings, and arm adjuster bolts. A New Jersey state inspection was passed in June 2018. This E46 M3 is now offered with a spare set of stock wheels, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Oxford Green Metallic II, and is believed to be one of 116 North American-spec E46 M3 coupes in this color. A sunroof is not equipped. The recent Carfax report shows no history of accidents or damage, though some dings and scratches can be seen in the gallery and the seller notes the hood could use some touch-up paint. Factory equipment includes fog lights and bi-xenon headlights, while CCFL “angel eye” headlights have been added along with a CSL-style carbon fiber rear diffuser.

18″ Apex ARC-8 wheels measure 9.5″ in width up front and 10.5″ out back, and the stock 18″ wheels with tires will also be supplied in the sale. The car was equipped from the factory with Dynamic Stability Control and has been fitted with KW Variant 2 coilovers. Service work included replacement of the suspension bushings, rear shock mounts, rear control arms, arm adjuster bolts, front lollipop bushings, and end links. The seller notes the brake pads are due to be replaced.

The interior is trimmed in light grey Nappa leather and is equipped with the Cold Weather Package, which adds power and heat functions to the front seats. Additional factory equipment includes automatic climate control and an M-Sport multifunction steering wheel. An Avin Avant 3 head unit featuring Bluetooth, GPS, and an Apple iPhone charger has been added, along with a Z3M short-shift kit. 98k miles are shown on the odometer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The car is equipped with aftermarket headers and a BMW strut tower bar. Service records dating back to 2002 are provided with the car, and the seller notes the Inspection I service was performed under previous ownership, as were the rod bearing and airbag recalls. The seller recently had the Inspection II service performed, though a valve adjustment is due.

According to the seller, the previous owner had the subframe checked prior to selling the car and found no cracks. The previous owner also mentioned issues with the throttle position sensor, but the seller has not experienced this during his ownership. A minor leak is noted in the differential.
The Carfax report shows registration in Illinois and New Jersey from new through August 2018.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 was sold new at Sonnen BMW of San Rafael, California and is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory equipment includes xenon headlights, navigation, 19″ wheels, and a sunroof. The seller has added approximately 10k miles since acquiring the car three years ago, and service performed in January 2019 included an oil/filter change, drive belt replacement, an Inspection I, and a California smog check. Now showing just over 99k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with recent service records, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354), with the paintwork shown up close in the 150-plus photo gallery below along with the lighting and other trim. The included Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
Exterior features include xenon headlights, fog lights, and a rear deck lid spoiler. The factory Style 67 19″ wheels display curb rash and are mounted with a set of Hankook Ventus S1 Noble 2 tires.

The interior is upholstered in black leather with contrasting aluminum trim on the dash and door panels. Features include heated sport seats, a moonroof, M3-branded floor mats, and a Harman Kardon stereo system.

The 3-spoke multifunction steering wheel is equipped with a “Track Mode” button that raises the threshold of the Dynamic Stability Control system. Approximately 99k miles are shown on the digital odometer, 10k of which were added by the seller in three years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A factory strut tower brace can be seen above. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission. The car was reportedly serviced at Bavarian Professionals of Berkeley, California under current ownership, including an oil and filter change, drive belt replacement, Inspection I, and California smog test January 2019.
The Carfax report shows history in California from October 2003 to March 2018 with no accidents or other damage reported. Open recalls for Takata driver and front passenger airbags are noted.

title: 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a Competition Package coupe finished in Alpine White over Cinnamon leather. Power is from a 3.2L inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission, and additional factory options include the Premium package, xenon headlights, a glass moonroof, heated front seats, a Harmon Kardon sound system, and navigation. The seller purchased the car in January 2018, and has installed a new windshield, battery, front control arms, starter, and more as outlined in the listing below. An oil change and Inspection II were also performed during the seller’s ownership. Now showing 155k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with manuals, keys, recent receipts, the window sticker, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

Sheet metal wears an Alpine White finish, and rust is noted under the right taillight and on the left side of the trunk opening. Both areas are detailed along with other imperfections in the gallery below. The Carfax notes two accidents involving the rear of the car, one in Texas in June 2010, and the other in Louisiana in December 2011. According to the seller, the trunk lid, taillights, and bumper were replaced by a previous owner. There is also evidence of paintwork noted on the hood. During his ownership, the seller installed a new windshield, windshield cowl, side marker lights, and front lower control arms and bushings.

The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option. Hankook Ventus V12 Evo tires sized 225/40 are mounted up front with Dunlop tires sized 265/35 out back. Some curb rash is noted.

Heated and powered Cinnamon leather sport seats are contrasted by black carpets and titanium-finish trim. Options include a sunroof, navigation system, and a Harman Kardon audio system. Interior modifications include a European-market center console, factory BMW weighted shift knob, and an Alcantara shifter boot.

Additional ZCP equipment included an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel featuring a button to engage M-Track Mode. 155k miles are shown on the digital odometer, of which the seller has added approximately 1,200.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. The seller will replace the Throttle Position Sensors, engine temperature sensor, and gas pedal sensor before the sale. Maintenance performed during the seller’s ownership included the following:
The original window sticker is pictured above showing the factory colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $59,970.
The recent Carfax report lists both accidents and shows history in Delaware, Texas, Louisiana, and Florida. Startup and idle videos can be seen below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Convertible was sold new in Las Vegas, Nevada and has had one prior owner according to the selling dealer. The car is finished in Jet Black over Black leather and has 61,803 miles. Factory options consist of rear-side airbags, lumbar support, xenon headlights, and a Harman/Kardon stereo. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired to an SMG 6-speed automated-manual transmission. Modifications include tinted windows, aftermarket 19″ wheels, MGP caliper covers, a lowered ride height, Eonon GM5150 LCD stereo head-unit, and an aFe intake system. This E46 M3 is now offered with the window sticker, factory books, a clear AutoCheck, and a clean Nevada title.

Over 70 exterior images are provided in the 160+ gallery below. The power-folding soft top utilizes a defrosted glass rear window and the OEM rear parking sensors are pictured above. The included AutoCheck is free of accidents or other damage.

The seller estimates that this M3 has been lowered approximately 1″ from stock. A set of aftermarket split-spoke 19″ wheels with M center caps are mounted with 235/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. Pictures of each wheel are included in the gallery along with photos of the suspension and braking systems.

Inside, this E46 is upholstered in black leather with factory aluminum trim on the door pulls, dashboard, and shifter surround. An Eonon GM5150 LCD stereo head-unit and M steering wheel logo are described as the only interior alterations.

Factory equipment includes power windows/mirrors/locks, automatic climate control, automatic xenon headlamps, cruise control, Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and more. The SMG 6-speed transmission can be left in full automatic or shifted manually via the gear lever or paddles behind the steering wheel rim. Shift speed and ferocity can also be toggled via a button below the shifter itself. Around 400 of the 61,803 total miles were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six developed 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new and has been fitted with an aFe intake system. A recent service in Henderson, Nevada reportedly included a comprehensive inspection and new battery.
Additional pictures from underneath this BMW are displayed in the gallery.
The original window sticker lists a $62,355 MSRP including all aforementioned options and fees. A photo of the factory manuals is provided in the gallery.
The accident-free AutoCheck lists one registered owner and registration in Henderson, Nevada from new. A video detailing this M3 including driving characteristics can be viewed below:

title: Original-Owner 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual gearbox. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather, the car features a powered soft top, 19″ alloy wheels, and a Harman Kardon HiFi System. 49k miles are shown on the odometer, and a recent pre-purchase inspection was carried out as described below. The seller is an active duty member of the military, and while deployed overseas kept the car in government auto storage. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve in Laguna Niguel, California with a clean Carfax report, a 2019 California smog certificate, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and the recent Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. Some rock chips can be seen on the leading surfaces, including a small chip on the windscreen. The seller states that the bumper has been touched up in the past. The car is equipped with xenon headlights, and the seller added the “angel eye” daytime running lights. The passenger-side fog light lens is broken.

19″ Style 67 alloy wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 Evo tires, and the January 2019 pre-purchase inspection notes that the rear tires are worn. The black convertible top can be seen raised and lowered in the gallery photos.

The black interior features leather upholstery on the powered sport seats. The factory CD player headunit is retained. A wind deflector sits over the rear seats, and the seller states that the rearview mirror is half dimmed.

The multi-function steering wheel is finished in leather stitched in M colors. The Carfax report states that an airbag recall was completed in 2015 and the driver’s airbag was replaced in January 2019. This car was originally equipped with a Harman Kardon HiFi System and a 6-CD changer. 49,400 miles are shown on the odometer.

The 3.2-liter S54B32 inline-six was rated for 333 horsepower when new and is mated to a 6-speed manual transmission. A pre-purchase inspection provided by the seller notes that oil is seeping from the oil pan gasket. The seller states that the 50k miles service is do soon.
The Carfax shows no accidents or other issues, along with a eight mileage updates and registrations under a single owner in Maryland and California.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Gray Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Gray Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible reportedly remained with its original owner in Colorado until 2015, and was purchased by the seller out of California two and a half years ago. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and an aFe intake has been added. Factory features include the cold weather package, xenon HID headlights, parking sensors, and 19” alloys wheels. Finished in black over gray leather, this E46 shows 63k miles and is now offered with a Carfax report and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Jet Black II (668), and the rear bumper was repainted in 2017 after the car was backed into in a parking lot. Blemishes are shown up close in the photo gallery below, and include a scratch on the driver-side rocker panel, a scratch on the passenger door, and chips on the front bumper and hood.

Factory 19” Style 67 alloys are mounted with Hankook V12 tires. Options include xenon HID headlights and a headlight washing system which was part of the cold weather package. The black, power-operated convertible top is shown in both the raised and lowered positions in the gallery below.

The cabin is trimmed in Gray Nappa leather (N5TT) and equipment includes power-adjusted heated sports seats with lumbar support, a Harman Kardon HiFi system, a navigation system, Park Distance Control sensors, and a ski bag pass-through between the rear seats. Wear and separation is noted on the seat bolsters and is shown in the gallery below.
The digital odometer shows approximately 63k miles, 12k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Shifting is through a Getrag 6-speed manual transmission. The seller says he has completed regular maintenance on the car during ownership, and the Carfax report lists an inspection at BMW of San Diego in 2015 at 49k miles. An aFe air intake has been added.
The Carfax reports lists three owners and notes the parking-lot incident in 2017.

title: 2001 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver metallic over an Imola red interior. The car was purchased by the seller in 2010 from the original owner’s son, and has since been driven 38k of the 85k indicated miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and servicing over the past 15k miles included a VANOS update, replacing the engine oil pressure valve, an Inspection II service, and more as detailed below. Modifications include a window tint, 19″ Forgestar wheels, LED lights, and an iPod connection. This E46 is offered with service records, two remote keys, the plastic valet key, manuals, a complete toolkit, the window sticker, tire-repair kit and compressor, clean Carfax and Autocheck reports, and a clear Michigan title in the seller’s name.

This example is finished in Titansilber metallic (354), and the seller reports that this is one of just 275 manual transmission-equipped examples sold with this color combination in North America. The front bumper was repainted in 2013 by Automark Collisions in Farmington Hills, Michigan to correct stone chips and has since been covered with a clear bra. Remaining stone chips are noted on the rear fender flares. The paintwork is shown in the 160+ photo gallery below, along with the lighting and trim.

19″ Forgestar wheels are installed with 8mm spacers in the front and 15mm spacers in the rear. Tires are Michelin Pilot Super Sports measuring 255/35 up front and 275/30 out back. The brake calipers have been painted red, and a brake fluid flush was conducted at 80k miles. All four rotors are said to be new. The power steering system has received a fluid flush and new hose. Modifications include a 55% window tint, black kidney grilles, and LED lights behind new Bosch headlight lenses. Removed chrome-look grilles are included.

The Imola red leather interior has been regularly conditioned and maintained by the seller with Lexol products, while options include the cold weather package and Harman Kardon sound. Features include piano black trim, a sunroof, power-adjustable heated seats, and an iPod/iPhone line connection installed by the seller. The vehicle comes with 2 keys including the plastic valet key, complete toolkit, tire-repair kit and compressor and all manuals.
The digital odometer indicates approximately 85k miles, 35k of which were driven by the seller over the past nine years. The Takata airbag recall has reportedly been performed.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. An Inspection II was completed in 2012 at 68k miles, and an Inspection I in 2014. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission. Regular oil changes are reported by the seller, along with a VANOS service kit with a new filter and O-rings, and a new engine oil CPV. The following services were performed as follows:

The seller states that the VANOS was specifically inspected every time the vehicle went in for servicing at Erhard BMW of Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. A rod bearing service bulletin repair has reportedly been performed, and the vehicle has been serviced with BMW Castrol 10W60 and BMW filters.
The subframe was most recently inspected by Erhard BMW in 2018.
A driving video is provided above and an enthusiast video segment featuring this car is below.

title: 42k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 was acquired by the seller in September 2006 and shows 42k miles. Power comes from a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and the car features the Cold Weather and Luxury packages as well as xenon headlamps, a power sunroof, heated power seats, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Modifications include a set of aluminum pedals, an ashtray-mounted Sirius radio receiver, and body-colored headlight trim. Maintenance under current ownership has reportedly been performed by the seller’s son, a mechanic who most recently carried out an Inspection I and II in July 2018. This E46 M3 is offered with manuals, a clean Carfax report, a window sticker, and a clean Virginia title.

Body panels wear a Titansilber Metallic (354) finish, and the exterior condition is detailed in several close-up gallery pictures below. The included Carfax report lists no history of accidents or other damage.

Exterior features include a power sunroof as well as xenon headlights with washers and aftermarket body-colored trim. Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear Goodyear Eagle F1 all-season tires with 2017 date codes that were reportedly installed less than 1,000 miles ago.

The cabin features black leather upholstery and features powered and heated sport seats with driver-side memory, a multi-function steering wheel, aftermarket aluminum pedal covers, and a Sirius satellite radio receiver mounted in the ashtray. Options include navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system with 6-disc CD changer, and a collapsible ski bag mounted behind the rear armrest.
The digital odometer shows just under 42k miles, 12k of which came during the seller’s 12 years of ownership. The auto-dimming rearview mirror is noted as malfunctioning.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new and is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox. The seller has reportedly performed maintenance with his son, including Inspection I and II services as well as installation of a new battery in summer 2018.
The window sticker shows the factory colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $54,795. Additional factory literature is pictured in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows ownership in Massachusetts, New Jersey, and Virginia with no records of accidents or other damage through summer 2018.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Imola Red over black and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed sequential gearbox. The car was sold new in Texas and spent time in Florida, New York, Georgia, and Nevada before being acquired in Arizona by the selling dealer. Modifications include a Supersprint exhaust, 19″ wheels, aluminum shift paddles, carbon-fiber trim, front bumper lip, and a GruppeM intake system. Now showing 53k miles, this E46 M3 convertible is offered with recent receipts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Imola Red, and the Carfax report indicates no history of accidents or other damage. A color-matched aftermarket front lip has been added, and the rear bumper was also repainted. Exterior features include bi-xenon headlamps and rear parking assist sensors, as well as aftermarket clear side marker lights and widow tint.

19” Style 67 alloys replace the factory 18″ wheels and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires. The power convertible top is shown in both the raised and lowered positions in the gallery below. The shocks, rear shock mounts, and bump stops were recently replaced according to the seller.

The interior is upholstered in black leather with aftermarket carbon-fiber trim across the dash, doors, steering wheel, and center console. An aftermarket head unit has also been installed, and the shifter surround is painted red.

The digital odometer shows 53k miles, 50 of which were added by the seller. Aluminum shift paddles have been installed behind the steering wheel and control the 6-speed SMG-II automated sequential transmission.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A GruppeM intake system, Supersprint exhaust, and painted valve cover have been added. An engine oil change was performed recently.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other issues and lists fours owners along with some service history.

title: 2002 BMW M3
exterior_color: Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red
listing_details: Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red leather, and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed sequential gearbox. The current owner purchased it in July 2016, and has added approximately 18k of the 92k miles shown. The car features the Cold Weather and Premium packages as well as xenon headlamps, a power sunroof, heated power seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Modifications include gloss black kidney grilles, side grilles, and mirror covers, along with a Status Gruppe rear diffuser and spoiler, and black powder coated E92 M3 Competition wheels. This E46 M3 is now offered on behalf of its current owner with a pre-purchase inspection, BMW WVI report, records since 2003, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Indiana title.

Body panels wear a Titanium Silver Metallic (354) finish, and the exterior is detailed in several close-up gallery pictures below. Exterior modifications include gloss black kidney grilles, side grilles, and mirror covers. A Status Gruppe rear diffuser and trunk lid spoiler are also fitted. A dent is present under the trunk spoiler and rock chips are noted on the front of car. The included Carfax report lists no history of accidents or other damage.

Additional exterior features include a power sunroof as well as xenon headlights and rear parking sensors. Factory wheels have been replaced with black powder coated 19” E92 M3 Competition alloys. The Hakook Ventus V12 evo2 tires are sized 225/40 in front and 255/35 in the rear. A recent pre-purchase inspection noted the front tires to be at 2mm tread depth and the right front tire to have a leak at the outer bead. The inspection also stated the rear brake pads to be at 4mm thickness.

The Imola Red (N5IM) leather interior is optioned with the Cold Weather package and Harman Kardon sound. Features include aluminum trim, a sunroof, and power-adjustable heated seats. The current owner reports the driver’s side seat heater button turns off too quickly. The passenger side front window regulator is noted as noisy in the pre-purchase inspection report.
The digital odometer indicates approximately 92k miles, 18k of which were driven by the current owner since July 2016.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via the 6-speed SMG-II automated sequential transmission. The current owner reports an Inspection II service was performed in 2007. An engine oil leak at the oil pan is noted on the pre-purchase inspection report.
The subframe was most recently inspected when the rear trailing arm bushings were replaced in August 2018. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery below.
A BMW Warranty Vehicle Inquiry is included, along with service records from 2003 and a screenshot of a pre-purchase inspection preformed approximately 200 miles ago.
A Carfax report shows history in Illinois, Wisconsin, Iowa, and Indiana. Two factory keys are included with the car.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 6-speed manual gearbox. title: 41k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller’s mother at Baron BMW of Kansas City and shows 41k miles. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed SMG gearbox, and options include the Cold Weather Package, Parktronic sensors, Harman Kardon audio, and more. The car is finished in Imola Red over black leather and has reportedly been garage-kept and dealer-serviced from new. This E46 is offered by the son of its current owner with a window sticker, service records, a factory wind deflector, a Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The body is finished in Imola Red, and the majority was repainted following impacts to the rear and front in late 2010 and early 2011 respectively. Both incidents occurred while the car was parked according to the seller, and repairs included replacement of both bumper covers, the hood and trunk lid, lighting assemblies, the front radiator support, and the rocker moldings according to receipts shown in the gallery below. Remaining blemishes include two shallow dents on the left quarter panel and scuffs on the underside of the air dam.

The power-actuated black convertible roof features a heated glass rear window, and is photographed both raised and stowed beneath the bodywork. A removable wind deflector is included in the sale. The car is equipped with Parktronic sensors and xenon headlamps with washers. Factory 18″ wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport AS tires showing 2010 date codes.

Black leather trims the heated and power-adjustable seats. Wear is pointed out on a driver’s seat bolster and door handle as well as the right door speaker enclosure. The M3 features a 3-spoke M-sport steering wheel, M-logo door sills, and grey gauge faces.
The digital odometer shows 41k miles. The SMG electrohydraulic gearbox offers an automatic mode as well as sequential manual gear selection using the center console lever or steering wheel paddles.
The trunk houses a tool kit, CD changer, and folding wind diffuser. The rear subframe welds have not been reinforced according to the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new, and features a 8,000 rpm redline. Service has been performed by BMW dealers  according to the Carfax report.
The original window sticker details options and equipment, and shows a 2004 MSRP of $62k.
The Carfax report records the two aforementioned accidents and lists dealer service visits throughout the car’s life. Receipts for the bodywork can be seen in the gallery below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

title: 2005 BMW M3 6-Speed ZCP Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic and equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. The car was first sold in Miami, Florida, and the seller acquired it on BaT in 2017. The 6-speed manual transmission features a UUC short-throw setup installed under current ownership, and the factory assembly is included. 124k miles are indicated on the odometer, approximately 8k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in black over Cinnamon Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. Features include the Premium Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, and aluminum interior trim. The seller purchased the car in 2017, and work in their care has included the fitment of Koni shocks, new brakes, a rebuilt driveshaft, and reinforcement of the subframe attachment points. The 3.2L DOHC S54 inline-six utilizes Double VANOS variable valve timing and is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission.
