title: Turbocharged 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: https://youtu.be/ox0OdOJqnkYThis 2003 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six that has been modified with a Maximum PSI turbo kit, which helped the car record 708 horsepower and 582 lb-ft of torque at the wheels on a chassis dynamometer. The engine is paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and additional modifications include a 3″ exhaust, Borla muffler, Ksport front coil-over suspension, braking upgrades, and more. Factory features include heated seats, stability control, and a glass sunroof. The seller acquired the car in late 2015 and conducted most of the modifications. Finished in Alpine White with a black leather interior and showing 90k miles, this E46 M3 is now offered with an accident-free Carfax report, dyno results, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The exterior is finished in Alpinweiss 3 (Alpine White, 300) and features an optional power glass sunroof, factory white turn-signal lights (S785A), and fog lights with Euro-style covers. Other exterior modifications include black kidney and fender grilles, Alpine White–painted bumper reflectors to match the exterior, and tinted side-marker lights. A CSL-style carbon diffuser frames the quad outlets of the 3″ Maximum PSI exhaust system and Borla muffler.

Factory 19-inch CSL wheels wear staggered Bridgestone Potenza RE-71R tires with 2015 date codes. Front and rear ECS brake rotors reportedly were fitted roughly four years ago along with Hawk Performance HPS brake pads and an Apex 75mm stud kit. A Maximum PSI subframe-reinforcement kit has been preemptively fitted, and a Ksport coil-over front suspension system is installed.

The factory gray Nappa leather interior parts have been swapped in favor of black upholstery, with the seats now manually operated. The door panels and seat bolsters show wear, which can be seen in detail in the photo gallery below.

An Alcantara-covered steering wheel, parking-brake handle and boot, and shifter boot replace the original pieces, and Perrin Performance gauge pods flank the steering column and house an AEM wide-band oxygen sensor and a Turbosmart e-Boost2 adjustable boost gauge. A black armrest-delete center console has been fitted along with BMW all-weather floor mats. A factory BMW auxiliary port is also featured. The digital odometer shows just under 90k miles, of which the seller has added approximately 11k.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new and is paired with a six-speed manual gearbox. A Maximum PSI turbo kit has been fitted, which features a Precision 6266 turbocharger, stainless piping, an intercooler, and more. A Beisan Vanos solenoid and seal kit have been installed along with a custom billet aluminum coil cover.

The results of a chassis dynamometer test are shown above, detailing peak outputs of 708 horsepower and 582 lb-ft of torque at the wheels while running on E85 fuel. The blue lines above depict a separate dyno pull using 93-octane gasoline, where the peaks were 480 horsepower and 381 lb-ft.

The six-speed manual transmission features a UUC Motorwerks Twin-disc Feramic clutch and flywheel as well as an ATI Performance Products harmonic damper from VAC Motorsports. The seller notes that the engine is slow to start on E85 fuel if it hasn’t been run in multiple days.

The Carfax report is free of accidents, and it shows ownership in New Mexico, Arizona, and Pennsylvania through May of 2017. Two open recalls for potentially defective Takata-sourced airbags are noted. Driving footage and a fly-around of this M3 can be seen in the first video below. The second video features additional driving footage with sound.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a 6-speed manual transmission and is finished in Titan Silver Metallic over a black leather interior. Options include a wind deflector, six-disc CD changer, a Harman Kardon sound system, fog lights, and xenon headlamps. The seller acquired it in August 2018, and work in their care included replacement of the rod bearings and the installation of a Beisan Systems VANOS oil pump disc. Now showing 70k miles, this E46 convertible is offered with a Carfax report, a May 2019 California emissions certificate, pre-purchase inspection report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Titan Silver Metallic and is equipped with a powered black soft top, fog lights, and xenon headlamps. A fender bender under previous ownership in 2003 resulted in a repaint of the front bumper and right quarter panel. The Carfax lists an accident in 2006 and a separate damage report in 2010, the later of which was repaired with a replacement rear bumper as per receipts in the gallery. Scrapes and rock chips are shown in the gallery as well.

18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires showing 2017 date codes. The May 2019 pre-purchase inspection notes that the front brakes have 40% of their life remaining while rear brakes require service.

The cabin features power-adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather. Amenities include automatic climate control and an optional wind deflector. The seller replaced the cup holders and rear ashtray with factory parts.

Tri-color BMW M stitching is featured on the leather-wrapped steering wheel. The BMW Business C43 CD head unit is equipped with a six-CD changer and is connected to a HiFi speaker system. 70k miles are shown on the odometer, 5k of which were added in nine months. The seller notes that the auto-dimming feature on the rear view mirror operates inconsistently.

The 3.2L S54B32 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual gearbox. The seller states that an Inspection II service was completed at 50k miles, and an invoice in the gallery details an August 2018 service at 65k miles including new rod bearings, an oil pan gasket, and a remanufactured VANOS disc from Beisan Systems.
The pre-purchase inspection notes a drip from the right differential side seal. Additional photos of the underside can be seen in the gallery below.

The included Carfax report lists the 2006 accident and 2010 damage entry. A May 2019 California emissions certificate can be seen in the gallery. The video below includes operation of the convertible roof, engine idle, and driving.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was sold new in South Carolina and subsequently resided in Texas and Colorado before coming to Illinois in 2016. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, and the car is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather. Modifications include an aftermarket intake and exhaust, a carbon fiber rear diffuser panel, and a set of 19″ Style 163 wheels with Continental Extreme Contact DW tires. This M3 is offered by the selling dealer with a factory owner’s manual, records since 2007, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

The bodywork is finished in Jet Black (668), and the included Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. An aftermarket carbon fiber rear diffuser panel has been added under the rear valence, and an optional lip spoiler is fitted to the trunk lid.

The staggered-width Style 163 wheels measure 19″ in diameter and are fitted with Continental ExtremeContact DW tires. The car is equipped with a power sunroof, foglights, xenon headlights, rain sensing wipers, and aftermarket window tint.

The cabin is upholstered in black Nappa leather (N5SW) with matching carpets and plastics. Equipment includes a Harman-Kardon stereo system, factory navigation, a multi-function M leather-wrapped steering wheel, and factory sport seats. A subwoofer has been added to the trunk, and the driver’s airbag recall was performed in April 2018.

Factory instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a fuel gauge, coolant temperature gauge, an oil temperature gauge, and a digital odometer showing approximately 106k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a factory M Variable Lock differential. The seller notes that both an aftermarket intake and exhaust system are fitted. More than 85 pages of records are included, with services including a new fuel pump in 2017, rear shocks and mounts in 2016, and a front crank seal, rear main seal, and a valve adjustment in 2014. The results of a PPI report are shown in the gallery.
A video showing the underside of the car is viewable above, and photos of the underside are viewable in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows ownership in Texas, Colorado, and Illinois. No accidents or other damage are shown.
A walk-around video is viewable above, and shows the finish and interior. An additional video showing the interior and start-up is viewable below.
A video showing sunroof operation is viewable below.

title: 26k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible was acquired in 2015 by the seller, who has since added approximately 2k of its 21k indicated miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG gearbox, and the car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather. Factory equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, xenon headlamps, Harman Kardon sound, 19″ wheels, and more. Modifications consist of an auxiliary audio input as well as clear protective film on the forward surfaces. The coolant expansion tank, brake fluid, trunk latch, and engine oil were replaced in 2018. This E46 M3 is offered with service records, a window sticker, factory literature, a Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

This convertible is finished in Titanium Silver with a black soft top and features bi-xenon headlamps as well as rear parking assist sensors. Clear protective film was applied to the forward surfaces under previous ownership, and detailed photos of the lenses, grilles, mirrors, door jambs, and paint can be reviewed in the gallery below.

Polished 19″ factory wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires all around. The brake fluid was flushed in 2018. The power-operated black soft top features a heated glass rear window and can be seen both raised and lowered.

The interior features sport seats upholstered in black leather and aluminum trim across the dash and doors. Front seat heaters and a ski pass-through are equipped as part of the Cold Weather Package. The trunk lock switch and latch assembly were replaced in 2018, and an auxiliary audio input has been fitted.

Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline, and an odometer showing just over 26k miles. Paddle shifters for the six-speed SMG automated sequential transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at peak output of 333 horsepower with 262 ft-lb of torque when new. A factory strut tower brace spans the engine bay. Service in 2016 included replacement of the drive belts as well as cabin and air filters, while the coolant expansion tank was replaced and the oil was changed in 2018.

Standard and optional equipment is shown on the window sticker, which lists an MSRP of $64,945 in 2005. Factory literature is also included in the sale along with service records which date from new, a selection of which is viewable in the gallery below.
The May 2019 Carfax report shows history with three previous owners through November 2018. Damage to the rear is reported in November 2013, with no other details given.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver over Imola Red Nappa leather and was sold new in Ohio. The car has resided in Virginia since 2003, and was recently acquired by the selling dealer. Power is provided by a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission, and the car is equipped with the Cold Weather Package, the Premium Package, xenon headlights, and a Harman Kardon stereo system. Service records are available since 2015. This M3 is offered by the selling dealer with factory literature, the window sticker, a clean Autocheck report, and a clean Virginia title.

The bodywork is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, and the car is equipped with optional xenon headlights, headlight washers, and park distance control. The seller notes some scuffs on the underside of the front bumper, and paint meter readings are provided from various parts of the car.
18″ Style 67 wheels were fitted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires in 2016, and tread depth readings are provided in the gallery below.

The cabin is upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather with black interior plastics and carpets. The car is equipped with a factory Harman Kardon sound system, as well as heated and powered seats, driver seat memory, rain sensing wipers, automatic headlight control, and a ski bag. A temperature reading from the air conditioning system is shown in the gallery below.
The car is equipped with an M multifunction steering wheel with tri-color stitching. 89k miles are shown on the digital odometer.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission and an M Differential lock.
A service breakdown from Intersport Performance is provided, and gives service details from new. Recent services include the following:
The window sticker is included, and shows the original equipment and $54,145 retail price.
Service invoices are available since 2015, with some records available from prior to that. Factory literature is included in a black leather portfolio.

The Autocheck report shows that the Takata airbag recall remains open, and shows ownership history in Ohio and Virginia. No accidents or other damage are noted, and a walk-around video is viewable below.

title: 43k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe shows 43k miles and was purchased by its current owner—the seller’s brother—in 2005. The car is finished in Jet Black over a black leather interior, and power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Factory features include heated front seats, Harman/Kardon audio, and xenon headlamps. Service performed in June 2019 reportedly included a new battery, a brake-fluid flush, a four-wheel alignment, a new differential pinion, and new axle seals. This E46 is now offered on behalf of the current owner with factory booklets, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Connecticut title in the seller’s brother’s name.

The body is finished in Jet Black (Schwarz 2, 668) and features a glass sunroof, white direction-indicator lights, and xenon headlamps with washers. The seller notes chips on the front and rear bumpers, above the hood and passenger headlamp, and a hairline scratch on the trunk lid. The accompanying Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

The 18” M wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 225/45 in the front, which are said to have been fitted at 40k miles, and 255/40 in the rear, which were mounted at 27k miles. Each wheel can be seen up close in the photo gallery below.

The interior is wrapped in black leather and features a multifunction M steering wheel, power-adjustable heated front seats with memory, a Harman/Kardon sound system, and an onboard computer. The seller notes pixelation issues in the gauge-cluster display, which can be seen in the gallery. The power-window regulators reportedly were replaced in April 2006.
The digital odometer shows just over 43k miles, approximately 35k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated to produce 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and an M differential lock. The car reportedly has been serviced only by BMW dealerships and included the following under current ownership:
The May 2019 Carfax report shows two owners, no accidents or other issues, and activity in Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, and Connecticut.

title: Original-Owner 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
exterior_color: Black Kidneys and Vents, Window Tint
interior_color: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Jet Black over Black Nappa Leather
Black Kidneys and Vents, Window Tint
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a black-on-black coupe which was purchased new by the seller in Florida and shows 51k miles. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and has been modified with black kidney grille surrounds and fender vents, aftermarket angel eyes, a window tint, BSW rear speakers, WeatherTech floor liners, and a radar detector. Maintenance in the last 10k miles is said to have included replacement of the tires, differential cover and mounts, front brakes, fluids, and more. This E46 M3 is offered with factory literature, a car cover, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and equipped with factory Xenon headlights and aftermarket Orion V2 Angel Eyes, black front kidney grille surrounds and fender vents, and Solar Gard Performance Series window tint. The seller notes chips in the front spoiler and hood as well as an aged right-side trim rail window gasket.

19″ Style 67 wheels were recently refinished according to the seller and are mounted with McGard wheel locks. New Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires, front brake rotors, pads, and sensors are said to have been installed at 43k miles, and the front control arm bushings were replaced at 49k. An accompanying BMW Emergency Spare Tire Kit includes an OEM BMW 17″ steel wheel and tire, jack and lug wrench.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather with brushed aluminum on the dash, center console, and doors. The factory Harmon Kardon sound system is said to have been upgraded with BSW rear mid-bass speakers, and black WeatherTech floor liners are fitted at the front and rear. A video depicting the operation of the sunroof can be seen here. The seller notes discoloration of the rearview mirror.

Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with illuminated markers showing a variable redline as the engine reaches operating temperature. The digital odometer indicates just under 51k miles. The glovebox houses a dealer-installed Apple iPod connector and iPod, and an Escort Passport 8500 X50 radar detector has been fitted according to the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and sends power to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission. Maintenance within the last 10k miles is said to have included replacement of the ignition coils, spark plugs, valve cover gasket, oil control valve, coolant expansion tank, hoses, belts, battery, and alternator as well as oil and brake fluid changes.
The rear differential cover and mounts were reportedly replaced at 50k miles. An email from the seller’s mechanic summarizing maintenance since 2009 is viewable in the gallery below.

The June 2019 Carfax report shows one owner in Florida and no history of accidents or other damage up to August 2018. An airbag recall is noted on the report, with the seller stating that the necessary work has been performed.

The car is supplied with the factory books and manuals, three keys, a black Covercraft HP Car cover, and a factory spare wheel. Walk-around and start-up videos are shown below, and a drive-by can be seen here.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was originally sold through McKenna Motors and has resided in Southern California from new. The car now has 73k miles and is a sunroof-delete model finished in Laguna Seca Blue over grey leather. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and modifications include Bilstein PSS10 coilovers, 18″ SSR wheels, headers, and an Active Autowerke exhaust. Over $15k in work was carried out by Oceanside Motorsports between May 2016 and February 2017, including reinforcing the rear subframe and installing a new radiator, thermostat, water pump, upgraded mounts, and more as described below. This E46 M3 is now offered by a dealer with records, a clean Carfax report, spare wheels, and a clean California title.

The Laguna Seca Blue paint is shown up close in the photo gallery below, and exterior alterations include smoked LED taillights and smoked front corner lenses. The car has been lowered on Bilstein PSS10 adjustable coilovers, and Ground Control front and rear strut mounts are also fitted. Note that the Active Autowerke exhaust system utilizes quad tips slightly larger than the factory setup. The recent Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

The 18″ SSR alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact front tires and Bridgestone Potenza rears. The seller has provided several photos of the car fitted with the included black 19″ factory wheels, which are mounted with Hankook tires. Braking is handled by drilled and ventilated rotors plus aftermarket stainless steel lines.

The car features manually-adjustable front seats and is not equipped with a sunroof. Additions consist of a ZHP shift knob, AutoSolutions short-shift kit, Alcantara emergency brake handle, a Kenwood head unit, metal pedal covers, and a carbon fiber instrument cluster surround, all of which are highlighted in the gallery. Some wear on the center armrest and trim is also shown.
Instrumentation includes a 9k-rpm tachometer and 180-mph speedometer. Approximately 73,300 miles are shown on the digital odometer.

Under the hood is a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, which has been fitted with headers, an Active Autowerke exhaust system, and an aFe air filter. Stock output was 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque from the factory. A six-speed manual transmission sends power to the rear wheels.
Additional underside photos are viewable in the gallery below.

Over $15k in maintenance records from Oceanside Motorsports accompany the sale. Work performed between May 2016 at 53,600 miles and February 2017 at 58,200 miles included a new radiator, water pump, thermostat, reinforced rear subframe and new polyurethane mounts, rear camber arm set, new engine mounts, an upgraded transmission mount, polyurethane rear differential mounts, power steering reservoir, and other smaller jobs. Comprehensive invoices are provided in the gallery.
The accident-free Carfax lists Southern California registration from new, along with a series of service history records and odometer readings.

title: 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black leather and is equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. The car was first sold in Connecticut before being sold by Tulley BMW in Nashua, New Hampshire as a Certified Pre-Owned vehicle. The seller acquired it three and a half years ago and has added approximately 10k of the 71k miles shown. Power is from a 3.2L inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and and servicing under current ownership included an Inspection II Service and valve adjustment in addition to regular maintenance performed in accordance with BMW’s recommended service guidelines. This E46 M3 is now offered with owner’s manuals, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

Interlagos Blue (A30) was offered exclusively on M3s equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. According to the seller, the front bumper was repainted to correct rock chips. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires sized 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back.

Black leather sport seats are contrasted by black carpets and titanium-finish trim. Options include a sunroof and a Harman Kardon audio system. Additional ZCP equipment included an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel featuring a button to engage M-Track Mode. Wear is noted on the steering wheel trim and shift knob.
Just under 71k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 10k of which have been added during the seller’s three and a half years of ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The seller had a pre-purchase inspection performed by BMW of Watertown, Connecticut prior to purchasing the car and a copy of the report can be viewed in the gallery. Immediately after taking delivery of the car, the seller performed a full Inspection II Service including a valve adjustment as well as an inspection at a local independent BMW shop. A copy of the invoices reflecting this work can be viewed in the gallery along with additional maintenance records. During his ownership, the seller has performed regular maintenance in accordance with BMW’s recommended service interval schedule.
Additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery.
The recent Carfax report lists no accidents and shows history in Connecticut, New Hampshire, and Massachusetts.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox and finished in Imola Red over matching Red leather. Factory options include heated front seats, xenon headlights, a sunroof, and Harman Kardon sound, while modifications consist of a GROM Audio Bluetooth module and a ZHP shift knob as well as black M3 emblems, kidney grille surrounds, and fender vents. The car was purchased by the seller through a July 2018 BaT auction and now shows just under 52k miles. This E46 M3 is offered with a maintenance summary, partial service records, factory literature, spare parts, a May 2019 PPI, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Imola Red (405), and the condition of the paintwork and trim is shown up close in the gallery below. Exterior modifications include black M3 emblems, kidney grille surrounds, and fender vents.
The car was optioned with xenon headlights and a sunroof from the factory. Stock 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza tires, two of which show 2012 date codes.

The cabin is trimmed in Imola Red leather over heated and power-adjustable sport seats with driver-side memory. Factory amenities include brushed aluminum accent trim, Harman Kardon sound, a ski bag, and a leather-wrapped steering wheel.

Gray M3-specific instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer shows just under 52k miles, 3,400 of which were added during the seller’s yearlong ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential.

Factory books and manuals, a May 2019 PPI report, and partial service records are included in the sale. A document from the seller detailing ownership and maintenance history is shown in the gallery below.
The July 2019 Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage with time on the East Coast as well as in the Midwest and Texas.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox. The car spent its first years in Ohio and the Northeast before moving to Florida in 2013, and the seller purchased it through a September 2018 BaT auction. Approximately 5k of its 71k indicated miles have since been added along with a new battery and WeatherTech floor mats. This E46 M3 is offered with factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features automatic headlights with washers as well as rain-sensing windshield wipers. The seller notes that it has been garage kept and not driven in winter conditions during his ownership.
Factory 19” wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact tires measuring 225/40 in the front and 255/35 in the rear. Dynamic Stability Control was standard on the E46 M3.

The interior is trimmed in Cinnamon leather (N5ZM) and features the Cold Weather Package, which adds heated seats and pass-through rear storage with a ski bag. A Harmon Kardon audio system with a six-disc CD changer and navigation is equipped, and a ZHP shift knob has been added.
The digital odometer shows 71k miles, approximately 5k of which have been added by the seller since his purchase in September 2018. WeatherTech floor mats were installed in April 2019.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower from the factory and is paired with a six-speed manual transmission. A production date of May 2004 places the car outside the date range of the S54 rod bearing service action campaign.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below. The seller will reportedly have an oil changed performed for the new owner.
The July 2019 Carfax report indicates an accident-free history with several owners through October 2018.

title: 16k-Mile 2003.5 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003.5 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over black and shows just over 16k miles. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox, and modifications consist of OEM CSL exterior components, Brembo brakes, JRZ RS1 coilovers, adjustable sway bars, 19″ RAC RG4 wheels, Recaro Sportster CS seats, a Beisan Systems VANOS unit, and Turner Motorsports subframe reinforcements. A BMW Inspection II was reportedly conducted at 14k miles in 2017, and the car was acquired by the seller in early 2019. This E46 M3 is offered with a Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue, with PPF clear protective film reportedly applied to all painted surfaces as well as the Lightwerkz quad projector headlamps and roof. Other alterations installed under previous ownership include OEM CSL components consisting of a trunk lid, carbon fiber roof panel, and rear diffuser, while other modifications include a European-spec front bumper and brake ducts. A ceramic window tint has also been added.

Forged 19″ RAC RG4 wheels were designed specifically for the E46 M3 and recently refurbished according to the seller. Suspension modifications include JRZ RS1 coilovers as well as Turner Motorsports adjustable sway bars. New bushings were reportedly fitted to the front control arms, rear trailing arms, subframe, and differential under previous ownership. Braking is handled by six-piston Brembo calipers with 380mm rotors up front and four-piston units with 355mm rotors out back.

The interior features are pair of leather-trimmed Recaro Sportster CS seats with heaters linked to the factory switchgear. Other upgrades include an AutoSolutions short shift kit and CSL door panels, which feature carbon fiber inserts covered in clear protective film. The odometer displays just over 16k miles, approximately 500 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Upgrades include a Beisan System VANOS unit, and power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential. Replacement mounts for the engine, transmission, and differential were installed under previous ownership, and the rear subframe was reportedly reinforced using Turner Motorsports plates. A valve adjustment and Inspection II were performed in 2017 while recent servicing included an oil and filter change approximately 30 miles ago.

The June 2019 Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage with owners in Indiana, North Carolina, and California through February 2019. An Inspection II was conducted in 2017 at 14k miles according to the seller. Walk-around and cold start videos can be seen below.
https://youtu.be/2xBP4F3Zndc

title: 2006 BMW M3 Dinan S3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe was sold new at Harloff BMW of Encinitas, California and is fitted with the Dinan S3 package, which adds a supercharger, a 3.91 limited-slip differential, upgraded engine software, a free-flow exhaust, and Stage 3 suspension. Finished in black over black leather, the car shows just under 36k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked to a six-speed manual transmission. Factory options include the Competition Package, heated seats, an electric sunroof, navigation, and a Harman Kardon stereo. This E46 M3 was purchased by the seller in 2018 and is now being offered for sale in San Diego, California with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black and features a rear spoiler and a glass sunroof, the latter of which is pictured both open and closed in the gallery below. Dinan badging has been added to the decklid, while an aftermarket tint has been applied to the windows. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

19” BBS wheels are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires that display 2012 date codes. Dinan Stage 3 suspension upgrades include lowering springs, adjustable dampers, camber plates, front and rear strut tower braces, and an adjustable 27mm front sway bar.

Black leather seats are heated, power-adjustable, and feature memory settings for the driver. Additional amenities include Dinan pedal pads, an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel with a “Track Mode” button, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. An area of dead pixels is evident on the display screen, and the seller notes a blemish on the steering wheel.
Instrumentation consists of a 190-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a digital odometer that indicates just under 36k miles, approximately 5k of which were added by the seller.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a Dinan supercharger, an intercooler, free-flow exhaust, and high-flow throttle bodies. The Dinan S3 plaque can be viewed in the gallery below.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission, and the 3.91 limited-slip differential was resealed earlier this year. Additional photos of the underbody are provided below.
The Carfax report shows no issues and lists regular maintenance at BMW of Encinitas. A walk-around and start-up video are viewable below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new at Rick Hendrick BMW in Charleston, South Carolina and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a gray leather interior. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and modifications consist of 19” Competition wheels, a UUC cat-back exhaust system, a BMW short shifter, and more. Service during the seller’s three-year ownership included replacement of the throttle position sensor, differential mount and seals, subframe bushings, VANOS housing seal plate, battery, cabin filter, and tires as well as an airbag recall. This E46 M3 shows 70k miles and is offered with a window sticker, delivery documentation, its removed stock exhaust system and wheels, factory tools and literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and the seller notes that the front bumper cover was repainted at Mike’s Auto Body in Malden, Massachusetts. Chips on the hood and several scratches can be seen in detail in the gallery below.

Features include a glass sunroof, clear corner markers, and xenon headlamps with washers. Factory 19” Competition wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measuring 225/45 in the front and 255/55 in the rear, which were installed under current ownership. Stock 18″ wheels with Continental tires are also included in the sale.
The interior is trimmed in gray leather and features a multi-function M steering wheel, heated and power-adjustable front seats with memory, a Harman Kardon sound system, and an onboard computer.

Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing 70k miles, approximately 18k of which have been added under current ownership. The seller notes stains in the trunk.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated to produce 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Service has reportedly been carried out by BMW dealers and independent specialists, with the following work taking place under current ownership:

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and an M differential lock. The rear subframe bushings were reportedly replaced during the seller’s ownership. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the photo gallery below.

The May 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, listing activity in South Carolina, Maryland, Virginia, and Massachusetts with five owners through November 2018. A review of the car from Matt Maran Motoring is viewable below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
interior_color: Blue Topaz Metallic over Gray Leather
listing_details: Blue Topaz Metallic over Gray Leather

Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox, and the car is finished in Blue Topaz Metallic over gray leather. Modifications include a K&N intake, clear side marker and turn signals lenses, and CSL-style carbon fiber splitters. The car received an oil and filter change in June 2019. This E46 M3 is now offered with partial service records, a Davis report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Wisconsin title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Blue Topaz Metallic (364), and the black soft top can be viewed in the raised position in the gallery below. After acquiring the car, the seller reportedly repainted the front bumper cover due to rock chips and other paint imperfections. CSL-style front splitters have been added, along with clear side marker and turn signal lenses.
A walk-around video is provided above. Factory 18″ wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires showing 2014 date codes. The seller reports changing the brake fluid during his ownership.

The interior features gray leather upholstery on the heated and powered front seats. Black M3 floor mats protect the carpets. The digital odometer shows just under 110k miles, approximately 12k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Maintenance performed during the seller’s ownership reportedly included replacement of the O2 sensors, coils, and spark plugs. An oil and filter change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Additional underbody photos showing the exhaust, suspension, and chassis are viewable below in the photo gallery.

The recent Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and registration history in North Carolina, South Carolina, Ohio, and Wisconsin. Factory literature, some service records, and a Davis report are included in the sale.
A start-up clip is shown above, and a driving video is provided below.
