title: Supercharged 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Schwarz over black leather and was sold new by VOB BMW in Rockville, Maryland. It is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six fitted with an Active Autowerke supercharger system and paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Additional modifications include Fabspeed headers, AP Racing front brakes, Ground Control coilovers with Koni shocks, an aftermarket exhaust, Apex wheels, and a CSL trunk lid. It now shows 100k miles and was reportedly serviced in June 2019 with a new radiator, water pump, thermostat, supercharger belt, and more as detailed below. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer in Rancho Cordova, California with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Nevada title.

The black paint recently received a color correction and ceramic coating process. A CSL trunk lid is equipped and was painted at the time of its installation. The selling dealer reports that the front bumper and hood were repainted to correct rock chips. Currently noted flaws include rock chips on the front and rear fenders near the tires, a ding on the driver’s door, and cracked weatherstripping below the passenger side-quarter window.

Black 18″ Apex wheels were reportedly fitted about six months ago and are mounted with 275/35 Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires all around. The AP Racing front brake kit uses multi-piston calipers around slotted and vented rotors. Adjustable Ground Control coilovers incorporating Koni shocks were fitted approximately six months ago. New rear trailing arm bushings were recently installed.
Inside, black leather upholstery is contrasted by aluminum trim on the door pulls, dashboard, and shifter surround. This M3 is optioned with a power sunroof.

A set of metal pedal covers are present, and the gear lever is fitted with a short shift kit. Just under 100k miles are indicated on the digital odometer, 4,500 of which were added by the selling dealer over the past year.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is fed by an Active Autowerke supercharger system linked to a front-mount intercooler. Fabspeed headers are also present. The car will not pass California emissions testing and as a result cannot be sold to a buyer who plans to register the car in California. Maintenance in June 2019 reportedly consisted of a new water pump, thermostat, radiator hoses, radiator, supercharger belt, A/C belt, alternator, valve cover gasket, spark plugs, ignition coils, and fluid changes.
A tune at 6 psi of boost was completed in 2014 and produced 401 wheel horsepower and 300 lb-ft of torque as shown on the dyno chart above.

The accident-free Carfax report lists at least one open recall, multiple owners, and previous registrations in Maryland, Illinois, Florida, and Nevada. An engine-start and exterior walk-around video can be viewed below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed ZCP
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is a black-on-black coupe that features the ZCP Competition Package including larger brakes, a quicker steering ratio, 19” wheels, and aluminum interior accents. The car was purchased new from BMW of Encinitas, California and has remained in the state since with three owners including the seller, who acquired it in 2015. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and additional options include Harman Kardon audio, navigation, a sunroof, and a dealer-installed short shifter. This E46 M3 shows 55k miles and is offered with a clean Carfax report, service records from 2008 onward, owner’s books, a window sticker, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in black (Schwarz 2 668), and the front bumper cover is protected with a clear protective film along with the forward sections of the hood and fenders. Chips can be seen on the nose as well as scuffs and a crack on the underside of the front air dam. The car features a motorized sunroof and xenon headlamps with washers.

The ZCP package fitted larger cross-drilled brake rotors and a revised steering rack with a quicker ratio when compared to the standard E46 M3, also including specific 19” wheels which are mounted with Continental tires here.

Alcantara dash and steering wheel accents came with the ZCP package, as did milled aluminum trim, a “Track Mode” button, and omission of cruise control. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable sport seats with driver’s memory settings, Harman Kardon audio, DVD navigation, a dealer-added short shifter, and a Bluetooth module installed by the seller. The odometer shows 55k miles, approximately 1,500 of which have been driven under current ownership.
The split folding rear bench seat features pass-through storage behind the center armrest. The trunk houses a bypassed CD changer, a navigation system DVD player, a tool tray, and a Mobility Kit.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower with 286 lb-ft of torque when new and pairs with a six-speed manual gearbox. The car was maintained by New Century BMW of Alhambra, California for much of its life, including replacement of the brakes and power steering pump in 2012 at 42k miles.
Additional underbody images are included in the gallery below. A California emissions inspection was last passed in April 2019.
Owner’s books, brochures, and the original window sticker are included in the sale along with the removed stock shifter and service records said to cover from 2008 onward.

The July 2019 Carfax report indicates an accident-free history and dealer service visits with three owners in California through April 2019. A readout of production data and equipment based on VIN data is shown in the gallery below.

title: 16k-Mile 2006 BMW M3
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was delivered new to VOB BMW of Rockville, Maryland and now shows just under 16k miles. Finished in Titanium Silver over black leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six backed by a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium packages, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, navigation, and a Harman Kardon stereo system. Service carried out in July 2019 included an air filter, A/C belt, tires, rear brakes, oil change, and more. The E46 M3 was recently acquired by the selling dealer from its original owner and is now offered in Maryland with factory literature, a window sticker, service records from new, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington, D.C. title.

The bodywork is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) with a rear spoiler, an electric glass sunroof, xenon headlights with washers, and Park Distance Control. The seller notes panels have been repainted to correct cosmetic damage, and the Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels were fitted with Yokohama ADVAN Sport A/S tires in July 2019. Service in July 2019 included replacement of the rear pads and rotors. The believed original set of Michelin Pilot Sport tires with 2005 date codes are included in the sale.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather with brushed aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a ski bag were included as factory options. The heated and powered front seats feature memory for the driver and power lumbar support.
Instrumentation includes a 190-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a digital odometer that indicates just under 16k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Shifting is through a six-speed manual transmission and variable locking differential. Service in July 2019 included new cabin and air filters, A/C belt, windshield wipers, and an oil and filter change.
Additional photos of the underbody are provided below.
The window sticker lists factory options and a total suggested retail price of $58,045.
Maintenance records, factory literature, two keys, LoJack books and installation certificate, and more are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows one owner in Washington, D.C. and no history of accidents or other damage.

title: 53k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was sold new in Georgia and remained in the state until 2012, when it briefly moved to Louisiana before coming to Ohio in 2013. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2019. The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior, and equipment includes navigation, heated seats, rear sunshades, and factory forged 19″ wheels. Power is provided by a 3.2L S54 inline-six backed by a 6-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable lock differential. This M3 is offered at no reserve by the selling dealer in Illinois with factory manuals, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and the included Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. The car retains factory valences, fender vents, a trunk spoiler, and a quad-outlet exhaust system.
The car is equipped with factory 19″ wheels (S792A) which are fitted with Kumho Ecsta tires. The car is also equipped with xenon headlights, clear front turn signals, and factory fog lights.

The cabin is upholstered in Black Nappa Leather (N5SW) with contrasting trim on the dash, doors, and center stack. Equipment includes automatic climate control, navigation, rear sunshades, heated front seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system with a factory CD changer.

Factory instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a fuel gauge, coolant temperature gauge, an oil temperature gauge, and a digital odometer showing approximately 53k miles. The Carfax report shows a mileage inconsistency in Ohio in 2016.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a factory M Variable Lock differential.
A video walk-through of the engine is viewable above. The seller reports that the Inspection II service has been performed, and a strut tower bar is fitted.
Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery below and show the floors and suspension components.
Factory manuals are included in a leather-bound portfolio carrying the BMW logo, and a selection of service records are provided from the previous owner.
The Carfax report shows ownership in Georgia, Louisiana, and Ohio, along with the aforementioned odometer discrepancy in 2016. No accidents or other damage are noted.
A drive video is viewable above.
A walk-around video is viewable above, and a cold-start video is below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 Coupe shows 73k miles and is finished in Oxford Green II Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather. It is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes xenon headlights, an electric sunroof, a navigation system, and automatic air conditioning. Modifications consist of powder-coated wheels, a Bluetooth stereo, Meisterschaft exhaust components, and rear subframe mount reinforcements. This E46 M3 was acquired by the selling dealer four months ago and is now offered with recent service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

Finished in Oxford Green II Metallic (430), the exterior features a rear lip spoiler, side air vents, xenon headlights, an electric sunroof, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists front damage in February 2019, and the selling dealer notes that the left-front fender, front bumper, and both rear quarter panels were repainted during previous ownership. Stone chips and other blemishes are noted on the hood and front bumper.

The 19″ alloy wheels were reportedly powder-coated silver and are fitted with Continental ExtremeContact tires measuring 245/35 up front and 255/35 out back. New Bilstein shocks and Zimmermann brake rotors were installed in 2019.

The cabin is upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather and features brushed aluminum trim on the dash, console, and door panels. The heated and powered seats are equipped with memory settings for the driver. Other amenities include a multi-function steering wheel, a navigation system, a leather-wrapped shift knob, automatic air conditioning, and cruise control. The selling dealer notes wear on the back of the front seats and a crack in the center A/C vent. An aftermarket stereo with Bluetooth has been added.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for temperature, oil, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 73k miles, approximately 400 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a six-speed manual transmission and produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The selling dealer reports that a Meisterschaft center exhaust section has been added. Service performed in preparation for the sale included changes of the oil, transmission fluid, coolant, and brake fluid.

The selling dealer notes that preventative subframe reinforcements have been added, and a crack in the subframe was found and addressed with welded structural supports before being sealed, primed, and painted. Additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.
The Carfax report lists the February 2019 damage report, at least one open recall, and ownership history in Wisconsin and Illinois. A driving video is provided below.

title: 13k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Coupe shows just over 13k miles and was acquired by the seller one year ago from the original owner. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over a gray leather interior, the car is equipped with xenon headlamps, powered seats, and Park Distance Control. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG transmission, and service performed in September 2018 included a new fuel pump, belts, tires, fluids, fuel-injector seals, and spark plugs. This E46 M3 is now offered with partial service records, factory literature, a Davis report, clean Carfax and AutoCheck reports, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

Laguna Seca Blue (448) was available on the E46 M3 from 2000 through 2004, and this example is not equipped with a sunroof. Features include xenon headlamps, Park Distance Control, and fog lights. The seller notes the car was paint corrected and ceramic coated in 2018. An indentation on the front fascia and rock chips are noted.
The 18″ Style 67 wheels were mounted with new Michelin Pilot Sport 4S in September 2018, and a brake fluid flush was performed at that time.
The cabin is upholstered in gray leather and is equipped with power windows, power-adjustable seats with memory for the driver, automatic air conditioning, and a CD stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features tri-color BMW M stitching. Instrumentation includes a 190-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a digital odometer that indicates just over 13k miles, 2k of which were added by the seller. Front airbag recalls were performed in 2018.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new and is mated to a six-speed SMG transmission. Maintenance completed in September 2018 included a new fuel pump and assembly, spark plugs, injector seals, drive belts, filters, a battery, and more as detailed on an invoice provided in the gallery. A start-up video is available here.
A video of the underside is presented above, and lift photos are provided in the gallery below.
Service records, factory literature, and a tool kit are included in the sale.
The May 2019 Carfax report lists registration in California since new and no accidents or other damage. A clean AutoCheck report can be viewed in the gallery.
An exterior walk-around video is provided above, and a video detailing the interior can be viewed below.

title: 28k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was sold new at Rallye BMW in Westbury, New York and was purchased by the Texas-based seller in December 2009. The odometer shows just under 28k miles, and the car is finished in Sterling Silver Metallic over black leather. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and factory equipment includes a cold-weather package, 19” wheels, navigation, and a Harman/Kardon sound system. This E46 is now offered with factory booklets and keys, a tool kit, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Sterling Silver Metallic (A08) with a black soft top and xenon headlights with washers. Clearshield paint protection reportedly has been added to the front end, and noted exterior imperfections include a paint blemish near the rear license plate and curb scuffs on the wheels. The condition of the paintwork can be seen up close in the photo gallery below.
Factory 19” wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires size 225/40 in the front and 255/35 at the rear. Each wheel is shown in detail in the gallery below.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather (N5SW) with brushed-aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Factory equipment includes an M leather steering wheel, heated power seats, navigation, a Harman/Kardon sound system, and a ski bag. The seller notes discoloration on the rearview mirror.
Instrumentation includes a 190-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer shows less than 28k miles, of which the seller reportedly has added nearly 26k.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm from the factory. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a variable locking differential.
The Carfax report lists no accidents or other issues and shows ownership history in New York and Texas with two registered owners.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Coupe was delivered new to Open Road BMW in Edison, New Jersey and is finished in Interlagos Blue over black leather. Power is from a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and additional factory options include the Competition Package, Cold Weather Package, Premium Package, xenon headlights, a glass moonroof, navigation, parking distance control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Maintenance carried out in July 2019 by Braman BMW West Palm Beach included a new battery and a mechanical inspection. Now showing just under 88k miles, this E46 M3 ZCP is offered with partial service records, a Davis report, factory books and manuals, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

Interlagos Blue (A30) was offered exclusively on M3s equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. According to the Carfax report, the car was involved in a rear end collision in September 2014 under previous ownership. In June 2018, the front bumper and right rear quarter panel were repainted, and a paintless dent removal procedure and paint correction were performed. The lower windshield cowl was also replaced along with the headlight lenses, seals, and trim, and the left tail light assembly.

The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack, and the larger cross-drilled brake rotors were replaced in June 2018 along with the pads and sensors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option and were refinished in June 2018. The Hankook Ventus V12 evo2 tires are size 225/40 up front and 265/35 out back.

Heated black leather sport seats are featured along with black carpets and titanium-finish trim. Options include a sunroof, navigation, and a Harman Kardon audio system. Additional ZCP equipment included an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel featuring a button to engage M-Track Mode. The auto-dimming rearview mirror was repaired in August 2018 by Radar-Mirror in Frisco, Texas. Wear is noted on the steering wheel trim and shift knob, and the rear seat leather has split that can be seen in the gallery below.
A cold-start video is shown above along with a digital odometer that displays just under 88k miles, approximately 18k of which have been added by the seller over the last four years.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and is linked to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The VANOS unit was rebuilt in August 2018 by Foreign Affairs Auto in West Palm Beach, Florida, and a new battery was installed and a mechanical inspection performed by Braman BMW West Palm Beach in July 2019.
Additional photos of the underbody, suspension, and exhaust are viewable below.
The July 2019 Carfax report notes the September 2014 accident along with previous registration in New Jersey and Florida through April 2019. A walk-around video can be seen below.

title: Single-Family-Owned 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: New Belt, Coil, Body Control Module
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is said to have been first purchased by the seller in 2003, sold to his son in 2010, and then reacquired by the seller in 2013. The car is finished in Alpine White over a black interior featuring cloth seat inserts, and power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications consist of a Borla cat-back exhaust system, 18″ SSR lightweight aluminum wheels, and more. Service under current ownership has included replacement of the accessory belt and pulley, an ignition coil, and a body control module as well as repair of the trunk lid actuator. This E46 M3 shows 98k miles and is offered with factory literature, service records, stock 18″ wheels, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Alpine White (Alpinweiss-3 300) with contrasting black shadowline window trim. The windshield and front bumper cover have reportedly been replaced. The seller notes nicks in the paint on the hood and bumper covers as well as an indentation in the trunk lid from a baseball.

Aftermarket SSR aluminum 18″ wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS tires showing 2012 date codes. Braking modifications include cross-drilled discs from Frozen Rotors up front, and the seller states that he used the car to participate in five track driving weekends early in its life.

The interior features Anthracite cloth seats with black leather bolsters, carpets, plastics, and floor mats as well as shadow brushed aluminum trim. Amenities include heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, a stock Harman Kardon stereo system with a CD player, and a ski bag pass-through from the trunk.

A multi-function sport steering wheel sits ahead of gray-faced instrumentation including a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 98k miles. The rearview mirror, right door latch, and trunk lid actuator have been replaced, while the left rear window motor is inoperable.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a variable-locking M Differential. An ignition coil was replaced at 96k miles and the body control module at 97k, while a new serpentine belt, tensioner, and pulley were installed at 98k miles.

An oil and filter change was also carried out in August 2019 at 98k miles. A Borla cat-back exhaust system has been fitted to the car. A noise is reported from the differential when making low-speed turns at full lock. Additional images of the underside can be viewed in the gallery below.

The April 2019 Carfax report shows history in Virginia and Florida, listing three owners and no accidents or other damage through March 2019. The seller states that he is the first and third owner noted on the report, while his son is the second.

The car is supplied with a set of stock 18″ wheels, with oxidation noted on two. Factory books and owner’s manuals and service records dating to 2003 are also included. A video depicting the exhaust note, a view of the engine while idling, and a ride-along is shown below.

title: 30k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was sold new by Kuni BMW in Beaverton, Oregon to an Idaho owner who kept the car for 18 years. The seller is the car’s second registered owner and purchased it in July 2019. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a Dinan cold-air intake and Stage 3 engine software. Service items have included a replacement connecting-rod bearing kit, new tires, inspections, fluid changes, and more. Now showing 30k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with its window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416). The seller states that a protective clear bra was installed in 2003 and was removed earlier this year. Features include optional xenon headlamps with washers. Close-up photos of exterior imperfections and paint-meter readings can be found in the gallery below.

Factory 18″ M Double Spoke alloy wheels are finished in satin chrome and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 225/45 in front and 255/40 in the rear and showing date codes from 2008. Curb rash is visible on the edges of the wheels, as shown in the gallery. The vehicle features four-wheel ventilated brake discs and comes with the factory ABS and Dynamic Brake Control (DBC) systems. The brake fluid was flushed in January 2014.

The black leather interior is outfitted with the Cold Weather Package and the Luxury Package, which bring features including heated power front seats with driver memory, a power glass moonroof, Nappa leather, and rain-sensing windshield wipers. An optional Harman/Kardon sound system also is equipped, and additional features include automatic climate control, heated side mirrors, and keyless entry.

Gray-faced M-badged instrumentation features a 180-mph speedometer and a variable-redline tachometer. The digital odometer reads just under 30k miles, of which the seller has added approximately 500. The leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching, and the airbag reportedly was replaced in December 2014 as part of a recall.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated to produce 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. The DOHC engine features VANOS variable valve timing and six individual butterfly throttles. A replacement connecting-rod bearing kit was installed in June 2005, and inspection 1 was performed in November 2008. The Dinan cold-air intake and meter kit was installed along with the Dinan Stage 3 engine software in June 2009 at Rasmussen BMW in Portland, Oregon, and an invoice for the work can be found in the gallery below. Additional service included a coolant flush in January 2014 and an oil change and replacement of the battery in July 2019.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and an M variable differential lock. The gearbox and differential lube reportedly was replaced in July 2001.
The window sticker shows factory options that include the Cold Weather Package, the Luxury Package, xenon headlamps, an AM/FM CD player, and Harman/Kardon audio. The original MSRP totaled $52,695.
Service records accompany the sale, and some individual invoices are presented in the photo gallery.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other issues and indicates two owners with registrations in Idaho and Montana. A failed Idaho emissions inspection is noted in June 2019.

title: 21k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Coupe was delivered new to BMW of San Francisco and was recently acquired from the original owner. The car is finished in Interlagos Blue over black leather, and additional factory options include the Competition Package, Premium Package, xenon headlights, a glass moonroof, navigation, parking distance control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Power is provided by a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed sequential transmission, and M3 CSL SMG software has been installed. Now showing just over 21k miles, this E46 M3 ZCP is now offered with service records from new, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

Interlagos Blue (A30) was offered exclusively on M3s equipped with the ZCP Competition Package. Xenon headlights along with shadowline rubber trim are also featured, and no prior-accidents or damage are indicated on the included Carfax report.
The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option and wear General tires on all four corners.

Powered and heated black leather sport seats are featured along with black carpets and titanium-finish trim. Options include a sunroof, navigation, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel also features a button to engage M-Track Mode. The seller notes missing pixels in the navigation screen, sagging of the A-Pillar and C-Pillar fabric, and wear on the steering wheel trim.
The digital odometer displays just over 21k miles, approximately 400 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. It is mated to a six-speed SMG electro-hydraulic transmission, featuring both automatic and manual shift modes. The seller states the TCU features E46 M3 CSL SMG software, and an Inspection I service was performed in February 2018 under previous ownership.
The June 2019 Carfax report shows California registration from new as well as no recorded accidents or other damage.

title: One-Owner 8k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
listing_details: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 was purchased new by the seller at Sharpe BMW of Grand Rapids, Michigan and now shows 8k miles on the odometer. It is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather and powered by a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Factory options include xenon headlights, aluminum interior trim, and Harman Kardon audio. The car has reportedly been serviced by Sharpe BMW since new, and in July 2018 an Inspection II service was performed. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records from new, a window sticker, factory books and manuals, an accident-free Carfax report, a BMW car cover, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

Finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), the exterior features a rear lip spoiler, LED taillights, side air vents, xenon headlights, and quad exhaust outlets. The finish and trim are shown up close in the photo gallery below. The accompanying Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels were recently fitted with a set of new Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. This example was specified without a sunroof, and the seller reports that the car has been hand washed and waxed with Zaino since new.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather with brushed-aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Other features include manually adjustable front seats, a split-folding rear seat, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control.
The factory multi-function steering wheel features tri-color stitching and fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer indicates 8k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a variable locking differential. An Inspection II service was performed by Sharpe BMW in July 2018.
Additional underbody photos are provided in the gallery below.
The window sticker lists factory options and standard features along with a suggested retail price of $51,445.
Maintenance records, factory literature, two keys, a BMW Dust Top car cover, and a BMW trunk mat are included in the sale.

The Carfax report shows one Michigan owner from new, services at Sharpe BMW, mileage accumulation consistent with the current odometer reading, and no history of accidents or other damage. The report notes two unaddressed recalls, dating from 2006 and 2009, pertaining to the OBD system.

title: Chiaretto Red 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Chiaretto Red over Cinnamon leather upholstery and was acquired by the seller in 2009. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential manual transmission, and the car has been modified with Ground Control coilovers, adjustable front camber plates and rear camber arms, Performance Friction brake rotors, and hardwiring for a Valentine V1 radar detector. The VANOS system was inspected and the valves were adjusted in July 2019 during a service which also included replacement of the spark plugs, accessory belts, left strut tower bracket, and right differential seal. This E46 M3 is offered with service records, a window sticker, factory literature, a Carfax report, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The previous owner reportedly used a contact in Germany to order the car in Chiaretto Red (894), a color normally reserved for the BMW 5-Series. The seller had National Auto Body in Rockville, Maryland replace the front bumper cover and repaint the hood as well as parts of the fenders in May 2018, reportedly to address chips and discoloration from previously-applied protective film.  The car is equipped with rear Park Distance Control sensors and xenon headlights.

Staggered-width factory wheels are shod in 18″ Toyo Proxes T1 Sport tires showing 2014 and 2015 date codes. Modifications under previous ownership include Ground Control coilovers and adjustable front camber plates installed at 11k miles in 2003. Performance Friction brake rotors were added at 20k miles in 2004, while adjustable rear camber arms from Turner Motorsport were fitted under current ownership in 2011 at 84k.

The interior features heated and power-adjustable sport seats upholstered in Cinnamon leather and featuring adjustable thigh support and side bolsters. Aluminum accents adorn the dash, doors, and center console. Equipment includes a CD player, Harman Kardon speakers, automatic climate control, and a power-operated sunroof that was recently lubricated according to the seller.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters for the SMG transmission. Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and an odometer showing 138k miles. Approximately 68k miles have been driven by the seller since 2009. The car has reportedly been hard-wired for an included Valentine V1 radar detector since new.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower when new and drives the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission. The SMG pump and connecting rod bearings are said to have been replaced at around 30k miles. A K&N air filter has been installed, while maintenance completed in anticipation of the sale reportedly included a valve adjustment and VANOS inspection as well as installation of new spark plugs and drive belts.
A new driver-side strut tower bracket and passenger-side differential seal were also reportedly installed during the October work, and the rear subframe is said to have been inspected.

The window sticker shows a $58,370 list price when new and lists options such as Special Paint, the Cold Weather and Premium packages, adjustable seat width and lumbar support, aluminum interior trim, and more.

The August 2019 Carfax report shows damage in May 2018 which is said to coincide with the aforementioned replacement of the front bumper cover. Registration history in North Carolina and Maryland is indicated between 2002 and 2019. The sale includes factory literature and a folder of service records.
Exterior and interior walk-around videos can be seen below:

title: 2004 BMW M3 Dinan S3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and was optioned with the Premium Package, heated front seats, and xenon headlights. The car was delivered new to Rasmussen BMW of Portland, Oregon and was upgraded in 2005 with Dinan’s S3 kit, including a supercharger, intercooler, ECU software, exhaust, suspension components, and more. The supercharged 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a six-speed manual transmission. This E46 M3 shows 31k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report, service records dating back to 2005, a window sticker, factory literature, and a clean Texas title.

The selling dealer states that he bought this car as his personal vehicle. Imola Red paint is showcased in the photo gallery below, and the included Carfax is free of accidents or other damage. A window tint has been added, along with a Dinan trunk lid badge as shown above. This car sits lower than stock on a Dinan suspension system, and Dinan front and rear strut tower bars have also been added. According to the selling dealer, a Wavetrac rear end is equipped and the subframe has been reinforced.

Three-piece 19″ HRE wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW Tuned tires. A Brembo GT big brake kit is installed and includes red-painted calipers clamping on drilled and vented rotors measuring 13.9″ up front and 13.6” at the rear.

The black leather cabin is equipped with heated and powered front seats with memory functions for the driver. Other equipment includes an electric sunroof, automatic climate control, and a hard-wired K40 radar detector and laser jammer.

Audio upgrades consist of a Kicker amplifier, a Kicker subwoofer, and Boston Acoustics component speakers. The digital odometer shows 31k miles, 500 of which were added by the selling dealer since acquiring this car a few months ago.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is fitted with a Dinan supercharger, intercooler, exhaust system, and ECU software. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. Photos of receipts for various Dinan upgrades are posted in the gallery, along with a maintenance sheet stating that the water pump, thermostat, and power steering intake were replaced in 2013.
A sticker in the engine bay denotes this particular car’s Dinan S3 package serial number.
An additional underside photo is displayed in the gallery.
The window sticker shows initial delivery to Rasmussen BMW of Portland, Oregon and a total suggested retail price of $53,970 including options.
The Carfax report is accident-free and lists three previous owners and a number of service history records.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: New Steering Rack, Sway Bar Links
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and finished in Carbon Black Metallic over gray leather. Features include factory 18″ wheels, a Harmon Kardon stereo system, and heated front seats. The selling dealer acquired the car in December 2018 and has since had several suspension and steering components replaced, performed an oil change, and detailed the exterior. This E46 M3 shows 103k miles and is offered with a clean Carfax report, a February 2019 PPI report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (Carbonschwarz Metallic 416) with black Shadowline window trim. The condition of the finish is shown close-up in the image gallery below, including a dent in the hood above the passenger-side kidney grille and paint chips on the front bumper cover.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 Evo tires showing 2013 date codes at the rear and mismatched Michelin and Falken rubber at the front.

The interior is trimmed in gray leather (N5TT) with matching carpets and plastics. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harmon Kardon sound system, a glass sunroof, and a ski bag pass-through to the trunk.

A multi-function sport steering wheel sits ahead of gray-faced instrumentation including a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 103k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The spark plugs, engine oil and filter have been changed by the selling dealer.

The steering rack, rear shocks and mounts, and sway bar links have been replaced, and an alignment has been performed. Additional images of the suspension and braking components can be viewed in the gallery below.

The February 2019 Carfax report shows five previous owners in New York, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey with no accidents or other damage up to December 2018. A PPI report from February 2019 is shown in the gallery below.

title: 36k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was sold new in California, where it remained with two private owners before its recent acquisition by the selling dealer. It now shows 36k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. It is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a gray Nappa leather interior and is optioned with the Premium Package, powered front seats, an electric sunroof, a Harman/Kardon sound system, and more. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer with factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and the selling dealer notes a blemish on the driver-side door and touched-up paint on the front and rear bumpers. Features include xenon headlights, a power sunroof, and rain-sensing windshield wipers.
18″ BMW Style 67 wheels wear Bridgestone Potenza S001 tires. The E46 M3 features four-wheel ventilated disc brakes and Dynamic Stability Control.

The gray interior is equipped with the Premium Package, which added Nappa leather upholstery, power-adjustable front seats with memory for the driver, and a moonroof. A Harman/Kardon sound system is also equipped, along with automatic climate control, cruise control, and keyless entry.

The multi-function M Sport steering wheel fronts factory instrumentation, including a 180-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and temperature. The digital odometer shows 36k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies, dual overhead camshafts, and VANOS variable valve timing and was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other issues and two owners in California.
The videos above have been provided by the seller.

title: 14k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 shows just under 14k miles and was purchased new by a US service member through Pentagon Car Sales in Germany. It was first registered in the US in 2005 and spent time in Colorado before moving to Kansas with the seller’s purchase in 2009. The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over black leather, and options include the Competition Package, Premium Package, heated seats, navigation, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Power is from a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and service carried out in June 2019 included a new battery, coolant and brake fluid flushes, and an engine oil change. This E46 M3 ZCP is now offered with service records from new, factory books and manuals, an order form, factory removed parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Kansas title in the seller’s name.

This M3 is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and features optional xenon headlights and Park Distance Control. Modifications include a keyhole delete, clear front reflectors, and European-spec mirror glass. Rock chips are noted on the front of the car, and no prior-accidents or damage are indicated on the included Carfax report.

The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires that were installed in 2014. Stainless steel brake lines were added under previous ownership, and a brake fluid flush was performed by Kansas City Autosport in Merriam, Kansas in June 2019.

The cabin features black leather heated sport seats and aluminum-finish trim along with an optional sunroof, navigation system, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features a button to engage M-Track Mode, and an Alcantara shift boot with ZHP knob and a European-spec center console tray have been added.
Just under 14k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 7k of which have been added during the seller’s 10 years of ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and is linked to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The clutch delay valve has been removed, and service performed by Kansas City Autosport in June 2019 included a new battery, coolant flush, and oil and filter change.
Additional underside images are included in the gallery below.
Service records said to cover from new are included in the sale along with owner’s books, brochures, an order form, BMW car cover, and more.
The August 2019 Carfax report shows an accident-free history and registration in Virginia, Colorado, and Kansas.

title: Supercharged 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue and has been modified under current ownership with a Cinnamon leather interior as well as an RMS Stage II supercharger for its 3.2-liter inline-six, an ECU tune from Kassel Performance, rear subframe reinforcements, aftermarket exterior trim, a Porsche 996 big brake kit, coilover suspension, Volk wheels, and more. The car features a six-speed manual transmission and was optioned with xenon headlamps, a Harman Kardon stereo, and a power sunroof from new. The seller is the owner of Mpartsworldwide in Midland Park, New Jersey and acquired the car in June 2016, since adding 15k of its 85k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is offered with an April 2019 dyno sheet showing 433 horsepower and 304 lb-ft of torque, a clean Carfax report, records from current ownership, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The seller had AMS Autowerks of Linden, New Jersey repaint the hood, front fenders, mirrors, rear quarter panels, trunk lid, bumper covers, and diffuser surround. Peeling clear coat on the roof is illustrated in the photo gallery below. Exterior alterations include gloss black trim on the kidney grilles, front fender strakes, CSL 2 front lip, fog lamp surrounds, and gutter trim. The car is also fitted with an OEM European front bumper, Laguna Seca Blue headlight inserts in black housings, a factory CSL trunk lid, a Status Gruppe diffuser, and LED taillights.

Gunmetal 18″ Volk Racing TE37 wheels are 9.5″ wide all around, mounted with 10mm spacers, and wear 265/35 Dunlop Direzza DII tires. The car sits on Status Gruppe coilovers installed approximately 4k miles ago and features an H&R front sway bar as well as a Mason Engineering strut brace. The Porsche 996 big brake kit includes powder-coated orange calipers, M3 CSL rotors, and stainless steel lines.

Manually-adjustable seats in Cinnamon leather were sourced from another car along with matching door panels and console trim. Further modifications include a leather- and Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel with custom flat top and bottom sections, an M Performance shift knob, an Alcantara shift boot, an M3 Competition emergency brake handle, a later navigation retrofit, auxiliary and Bluetooth inputs, rubber floor mats, and aluminum pedal covers.

The ECU is coded to remove the stock top speed limiter and provide one-click unlocking, an RPM light flash display, window closing using the key, and clutch-less engine starting. Factory equipment includes a power sunroof, automatic climate control, and piano black trim. The odometer shows 85k miles, approximately 15k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was fitted with an RMS Stage II supercharger by Autocouture Motoring of Fair Lawn, New Jersey approximately 15k miles ago. Additional performance upgrades are listed by the seller as a Kassel Performance ECU tune, OEM European headers, a dual-resonated Section 1 exhaust system with a Dinan muffler, a Bimmerworld VANOS accumulator line, and a Spal electric fan.

An April 2019 dyno sheet from Kassel Performance shows peaks of 433 horsepower and 304 lb-ft of torque at the rear wheels. The rod bearings, VANOS bolts and seals, engine mounts, exhaust manifold, and gaskets were replaced in 2017 according to the seller. A new valve cover gasket was fitted in 2018, and the water pump and thermostat were replaced earlier this year.

Power is sent rearward through a six-speed manual gearbox. The rear subframe has reportedly been reinforced by Autocouture Motoring. Additional pictures taken from underneath the car and inside the trunk are posted in the gallery.
The August 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage with six owners in Florida, Virginia, and New Jersey. A modification lists and records from 2016 onward are shown below.

title: 33k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Convertible was sold new in Florida and spent time in the Carolinas before being acquired by the seller in Ohio. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over a gray leather interior, the car is equipped with a black soft top, 19″ wheels, powered seats, navigation, Park Distance Control, and more. Power comes from a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG transmission, and service performed at 30k miles included new spark plugs, a valve adjustment, and a VANOS rebuild. The seller has added approximately 4k of the just over 33k miles shown during two years of ownership. This E46 M3 Convertible is now offered with factory books and manuals, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448), with a black soft top, and Park Distance Control. The condition of the paintwork can be seen up close in the photo gallery below, and no accidents or damage are shown on the Carfax report.
Factory 19” Style 67 wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires size 225/40 in the front and 255/35 at the rear. Each wheel is shown in detail in the gallery below.

The cabin is trimmed in grey leather (N5TT) with brushed-aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Factory equipment includes power seats, navigation, BMW HiFi stereo system, and more. The rear view mirror was replaced in 2017, and the seller notes discoloration on the navigation screen, that the chrome trim on the ash try door is missing, and wear is present on the driver’s seat side bolster.

Paddle shifters for the six-speed SMG automated sequential transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel. Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline, and an odometer showing just over 33k miles. The Takata airbag recall is noted to have been performed by BMW.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque when new. In July 2017 at 30k miles, Enthusiast Auto Group in Cincinnati, Ohio rebuilt the VANOS system with improved components, adjusted the valves, installed new sparks, and more as detailed on the invoices below. The seller states the rod bearing recall was completed by BMW under previous ownership.

The seller states the rear subframe was fitted with polyurethane bushings under previous ownership and no subframe issues were present during an inspection by Enthusiast Auto Group at 30k miles. The results of the inspection can be seen in the gallery below, along with additional underside photos.
The September 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Florida, North Carolina, and Ohio. A video of the top operation is view able below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 6-Speed
exterior_color: Titanium Grey II Metallic over Black
listing_details: Titanium Grey II Metallic over Black
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in special-order Titanium Grey II Metallic over black Nappa leather and shows just over 83k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a 6-speed manual transmission, and factory equipment includes Harman Kardon premium sound, an in-dash CD player, the Premium and Cold Weather Packages, Park Distance Control, xenon headlights, navigation, 19″ wheels, and a sunroof. Black kidney grilles have been fitted along with a new BMW roundel on the hood.

19″ factory wheels wear 225/40 BFGoodrich G-Force Sport tires from 2012 up front, and 255/35 Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires from 2014 in the rear. An M3 CSL-style front brake kit from ECS Tuning was installed in 2015 and can be seen with the wheels removed in the gallery below.

The seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and new interior pillar covers have been added along with a new rearview mirror. The seller notes that the driver’s seat belt has been replaced recently.

Features include a Harman Kardon sound system, an in-dash CD player, heated seats, a sunroof, ski bag, armrest, rain sensing wipers, and navigation. Per the seller, the steering wheel has recently been replaced.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and produced 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque when new. The rear subframe mounts were recently repaired and reinforced by European Auto in Oceanside, New York using a kit from Turner Motorsports, and the associated invoice and photos are provided in the gallery below. Replacement components installed since 2011 also include the following:
Records dating back to 2011 accompany the car and are displayed in more detail in the gallery.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over a black leather interior and is powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Features include 18″ wheels, a sunroof, power front seats, Koni adjustable struts, and more. Modifications include aluminum pedals and a short shift kit with an E60 shift lever. The stitching is noted as coming loose on the aftermarket steering wheel, and the seller states the factory wheel is included in the sale.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 185k miles, 500 of which have been driven under current ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. Work carried out since the seller’s recent acquisition included:
The September 2019 Carfax report shows previous owners in Florida, Connecticut, and North Carolina, with the aforementioned collision in September 2010.

title: 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed

title: 31k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Laguna Seca Blue Over Gray Nappa Leather
listing_details: Laguna Seca Blue Over Gray Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over a gray Nappa leather interior and has just over 31k miles. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and factory features include the Cold Weather and Luxury Packages, Harman Kardon audio, and xenon headlights. The car was first registered in Alabama and was acquired by the previous owner out of Ohio in 2011. Recent maintenance included a fluid service and airbag recall in June 2019. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a recent PPI, factory manuals, a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.

The body is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448), which was available on the E46 M3 from 2000 through 2004. The front and rear bumpers have reportedly been refinished due to cosmetic blemishes, and cracks are present on the underside of the front bumper cover as shown in the gallery. Replacement kidney grilles and fog lamps have been installed, and additional equipment includes optional xenon headlights with washers and clear corner lenses.

Factory 18” Style 67 wheels are wrapped in Continental ContiSportContact tires that display date codes from 2007 and 2012. Ventilated anti-lock disc brakes came as standard, along with Dynamic Brake Control (DBC), Dynamic Stability Control, and four-wheel independent sport suspension. The front brake pads, discs, and sensor were replaced approximately 4k miles ago.

Heated and power-adjustable sport seats are trimmed in gray Nappa leather and feature lumbar support as well as memory settings for the driver. Additional amenities include a Harman Kardon stereo, a power sunroof, and rain-sensing wipers. The selling dealer notes the presence of stains on the carpeting, and a set of matching floor mats is included.

Gauges include a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and a digital odometer that shows just over 31k miles. The multi-function M sport steering wheel is reportedly a replacement item, and the driver and passenger airbag recalls were addressed in June 2019. The original steering wheel is included in the sale, along with a new shift knob pattern sticker, ash tray cover, and upper console trim pieces.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features VANOS variable valve timing, individual throttle bodies, and dual overhead camshafts, producing 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. An Inspection I was performed in 2008, and a fluid service was completed in June 2019 by Kelly BMW of Columbus, Ohio.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission equipped with a factory M variable differential lock. The selling dealer reports that the rear subframe has not been reinforced, and its mounting points are shown in the gallery, and videos showing the underbody and rockers can be seen here and here.
The window sticker lists the factory options as well as a total suggested retail price of $52,720.

A recent Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and displays registration history in Alabama and Ohio. Walk-around, cold-start, and driving videos can be seen in the playlist provided below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was sold new in West Virginia and spent time with three subsequent owners in Virginia from 2007 through its acquisition by the selling dealer two years ago. Equipment includes xenon headlights, a sunroof, and navigation as well as a Dinan high-flow airbox, Stage 3 ECU tune, and free-flow exhaust system. Features include xenon headlights, fog lamps, clear corner lenses, and a small trunk lid spoiler. The selling dealer notes that the left front headlamp is going out. Polished factory 18″ wheels are fitted with 2019 Bridgestone Driveguard tires.

The cabin is upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats with memory settings for the driver, brushed aluminum trim, a multi-function steering wheel, a leather-wrapped shift knob, and automatic climate control.

title: 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over black leather and was sold new in California, where it has reportedly remained through the seller’s recent acquisition. Options include the Competition Package, heated seats, navigation, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The original SMG transmission has been converted to a six-speed manual gearbox, and power is from a 3.2L S54 inline-six. Maintenance in 2019 is said to have included Inspection I and Inspection II services, as well as new tires. Now showing 65k miles, this E46 M3 ZCP is offered with service records, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

This M3 is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and features optional xenon headlights and Park Distance Control. The seller states the front bumper was repainted under previous ownership, and the Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

The Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ cross-spoke wheels were also part of the ZCP option and wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport 4 S tires that were installed in September 2019. The hubs are fitted with 15mm spacers in the front and 10mm in the rear, and the seller states the front rotors and pads were replaced at the time of the transmission swap.

The cabin features black leather heated sport seats and aluminum-finish trim along with an optional sunroof, navigation system, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features a button to engage M-Track Mode, and was reportedly refinished under previous ownership. The seller notes the navigation screen shows missing pixels and the drivers seat squeaks intermittently.
Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and an odometer showing just over 65k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The factory SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual gearbox by E46 specialist Kevin “Kaiv” in San Diego, California under previous ownership. The seller states the Inspection I and Inspection II services were carried out in April 2019, and the CPV seal was replaced at the time of the transmission swap.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in California from new.

title: 37k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
interior_color: Topaz Blue Metallic over Black Leather
listing_details: Topaz Blue Metallic over Black Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new from BMW of Seattle by the seller’s brother-in-law, from whom it was acquired in 2015. The car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over black leather, and power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. An aftermarket stereo and ROAV driving camera have been added, while the VANOS variable valve timing system was rebuilt and fitted with a new solenoid pack in August 2019. This E46 M3 shows 37k miles and is offered with a clean Carfax report, service receipts, owner’s books, and a clean Washington State title in the seller’s name.

Body panels are finished in Topaz Blue Metallic (Topasblau 364), and blemishes including door dings, a handful of scratches on the sides, and a touch-up on the hood are shown in gallery close-ups below. The black convertible top features a heated glass backlight and is photographed in both its raised and lowered positions.

Style 67 wheels show areas of curb rash and are mounted with 18″ Federal tires from 2014. The motorized top stows beneath the bodywork as pictured above. Rain-sensing wipers and xenon headlamps were factory equipment.

Black leather covers power-adjustable sport seats with heating and driver’s memory settings. Titan Shadow trim accents the dash, which has been fitted with a Pioneer CD player in place of the factory stereo. The center stack storage compartment cover is scratched, and the seller notes a tear in the driver’s door panel upholstery.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames grey Motorsport gauges including a tachometer with a variable redline, a 180-mph speedometer, and a digital odometer showing just over 37k miles. Approximately 11k miles have been driven by the seller since 2015. A ROAV camera is mounted behind the rearview mirror.
The trunk houses the battery, a tool tray, a folding wind deflector, and a Mobility Kit with a tow hook and air compressor. Pictures showing the trunk floor can be seen in the gallery below.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six can be seen idling in the video above. The engine features four valves per cylinder and VANOS variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A six-speed manual transmission routes power to the rear wheels. The seller states that the car will come with a fresh oil change.

A receipt for an August 2019 VANOS rebuild and solenoid pack replacement is pictured above. Additional records document maintenance with Seattle-area BMW dealers and independent specialists, including DME reprogramming. The seller states that an airbag recall has been addressed.

The October 2019 Carfax report shows dealer visits at 15k and 30k miles as well as an accident-free history with two owners in Washington State. A readout of production data and factory equipment is included in the gallery. Owner’s books and spare keys are included in the sale.

title: 36k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
listing_details: KW Shocks w/ Adjustable Spring Perches
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows 35,700 miles, approximately 1,500 of which were driven by the seller since acquiring the car in July 2014. Modifications consist of KW shocks with adjustable spring perches, red-painted front bumper markers, black kidney grilles, and black front fender strakes. August 2019 service included fluid changes, a new battery, completion of an airbag recall, and compression and leakdown tests. This E46 M3 ZCP is now offered with service records, a spare wheel, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington title in the seller’s name.

Imola Red paint is showcased in a walk-around fashion in the photo gallery below. According to the seller, clear paint protection film is applied to the nose of the car, and a spot of the film on the hood was damaged by a rock. The red front bumper markers, black kidney grilles, and black side strakes are also pictured in the gallery, and the included Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This M3 sits lower than stock on KW shocks with adjustable spring perches. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels were also part of the package, and are mounted here with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires all around. A curb mark can be viewed on the passenger-side rear wheel in the gallery. A full-sized spare wheel without a tire is included.
The cabin is trimmed in black leather with silver accents. A black headliner was standard, and the power sunroof is pictured in the gallery. This car is also optioned with heated front seats.

An Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel was part of the Competition Package and features a button to engage M-Track mode. Other amenities include a Harman/Kardon stereo, rear parking sensors, automatic climate control, power accessories, and more. The digital odometer shows 35,700 miles, 1,500 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. An Inspection 1 was reportedly performed prior to the seller’s purchase in 2014. Maintenance records are said to date back to new, including electronic dealer records shown in the gallery, however, the previous owner reportedly performed his own servicing.

In August 2019 at 35,676 miles this M3 received an engine oil change, new differential and transmission fluids, a brake fluid flush, a new pinion seal, and compression and leakdown tests, with the results listed above. The battery was replaced separately in August 2019.
According to the seller, the rear subframe was recently inspected and has not been reinforced. Additional underside photos are displayed in the gallery.
The accident-free Carfax report lists no accidents or other issues and five owners, although the seller claims that he is the fourth.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual gearbox. Modifications include 19″ Style 163 wheels, Dinan springs, Koni shocks, Turner Motorsports sway bars, and a Bluetooth interface for the factory Harman Kardon sound system. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354), with the paintwork shown up close in the photo gallery below along with the lighting and other trim. The hood, bumper cover, windshield, and passenger-side fender were replaced by Foreign Auto Body in Boston, Massachusetts following an October 2014 accident according to the seller. Several dings and scratches are also said to have been removed by Dick’s Auto Body in Holden, Massachusetts.

Staggered-width 19″ Style 163 wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires all around. Suspension modifications include Dinan springs, Koni shocks, and Turner Motorsports sway bars. The brake pads and rotors were replaced at 93k miles according to the seller.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with ZHP silver cube trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Features include heated sport seats, a sunroof, and a Harman Kardon stereo system with an in-dash CD player and a Bluetooth interface from GROM Audio. The trim on the A-, B-, and C-pillars has been replaced along with the leather-wrapped steering wheel.

The odometer shows just over 100k miles, approximately 11k of which have been added by the seller over the last three years. A short-throw shifter with replacement bushings has also been fitted, and the air conditioning condenser is said to have been replaced during the bodywork in 2014.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox. A factory strut tower brace crosses the engine bay. A BMW Inspection II was reportedly carried out at 57k miles, and a new radiator was installed in 2014.
Additional underbody photographs are viewable in the gallery below.
The September 2019 Carfax report shows history in New England as well as the aforementioned October 2014 incident involving the front end. Cold-start and driving videos can be seen below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Dinan S3 Coupe SMG

A Brembo big brake kit was installed during the 2008 modifications and includes red six- and four-piston calipers. The cabin is trimmed in grey leather (N5TT) with brushed aluminum accents on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. The Cold Weather and Premium packages added Nappa leather upholstery, heaters, and power adjustments to the stock sport seats.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline, and an odometer showing 59k miles, approximately 6,500 of which have been added by the seller over three years. The car was also optioned with a Harman Kardon stereo and navigation. Paddle shifters for the transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is fitted with a Dinan supercharger, exhaust system, and ECU software. A sticker in the engine bay denotes the car’s Dinan S3 package serial number. Records indicate that service within the last 1,000 miles included an oil change, brake fluid and coolant flushes, and replacement of the following parts:

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Dinan-tuned six-speed SMG automated sequential transmission and a Dinan differential. Additional photos of the underbody, brakes, and suspension can be viewed in the gallery.
The window sticker shows initial delivery to Ralph Schomp BMW in Littleton, Colorado with a suggested retail price of $59,545 including options.
A binder containing service records dating from new is included in the sale, with the invoices for the Dinan modifications among those highlighted in the gallery.

The September 2019 Carfax report lists registration history in Colorado, Arizona, and Florida with no accidents or other damage. Assorted parts and fluids are included in the sale, as is an extra DME with a factory tune. A startup and driving video can be viewed below:

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is finished in Oxford Green Metallic II over a Cinnamon Nappa leather interior and has been modified with 19″ Competition wheels, a CSL-style carbon fiber rear diffuser, a CSL trunk lid, a short shift lever, and a Rogue Engineering El Diablo exhaust system. title: 2006 BMW M3 Dinan S3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was originally sold by Co’s BMW in Loveland, Colorado, and was modified with Dinan S3 components under original ownership before being acquired by its second owner in January 2019. This E46 M3 shows 107k miles and is offered with a Carfax report, recent parts receipts, and a South Carolina title in the seller’s name.

Black kidney grilles and side vents have been installed, and the side and rear windows have recently been tinted using 35% film.

Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measure 255/40-18 up front and 275/40 in the rear. Dinan lowering springs and Bilstein shocks have been fitted along with Dinan sway bars and stainless steel brake lines. Heated front sport seats feature power-adjustable side bolsters and lumbar support as well as driver-side memory. Additional options include a glass sunroof, a Harman Kardon sound system, and rain-sensing windshield wipers.

A non-intercooled Dinan supercharger and throttle bodies have been fitted to the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six along with a Dinan ECU flash, exhaust system, and a Status Gruppe mid pipe. The supercharger belt and filter, air conditioning compressor belt, and engine oil are said to have been changed.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The car is reportedly equipped with an upgraded clutch and a lightweight flywheel. Additional photos of the underside and suspension can be viewed in the gallery below.
