title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller six years ago from its second owner, and has since been driven approximately 65k of its 122k indicated miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual gearbox, and the car is finished in black over a red interior. Modifications consist of TC Kline coilovers, Apex ARC-8 wheels, AKG engine and transmission mounts, a Koyo radiator, an AKG shifter, and more. Welded subframe reinforcements and Beisan Systems VANOS components were installed under current ownership, and an Inspection II service was performed at 110k miles. This E46 M3 is offered with a clean Carfax report, partial service records, removed stock parts, an owner’s manual, a window sticker, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black and features a rear lip spoiler, LED taillights, fender vents, amber corner lights, and four exhaust outlets. The front end was repainted to alleviate chips under previous ownership according to the seller. The front reflectors have been painted over, and rust is noted on the driver-side mirror.

Apex ARC-8 wheels measure 18″x9.5″ front and 18″x10″ rear, and were mounted with new Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires approximately 500 miles ago according to the seller. The suspension is fitted with TC Kline SA coilovers.

The cabin is upholstered in red leather and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats with memory settings for the driver, a ZCP steering wheel, and a sunroof as well as an AKG Stage II shifter with a DTM selector rod. The stock stereo has been modified with a USA Spec PA12 iPod interface featuring Bluetooth.

Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and an odometer showing 122k miles. The seller has added approximately 65k miles over the last six years.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a variable locking differential. Modifications include a Koyo radiator with fan delete as well as AKG 75D engine and transmission mounts. An Inspection II service was reportedly performed at 110k miles, while other notable additions over the last six years included the following:

The September 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. The car last passed a California emissions test in spring 2019 according to the seller. Walk-around and driving footage can be seen below.

title: Estoril Blue 2005 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Estoril Blue over a black Nappa leather interior and was acquired by the seller as the second owner in 2008. Power is provided by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential manual transmission, and features include 19″ ZCP wheels, navigation, Park Distance Control, xenon headlights, power seats, and more. Approximately 79k of the 100k miles shown have been added by the seller, and service in August 2019 at Enthusiast Auto Group included a new air conditioning belt, power steering line, brake pressure sensors, a brake fluid flush, and an oil change. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records from new, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

Finished in Estoril Blue Metallic, the car was optioned without a sunroof and is one of a reported 81 North American E46 M3s delivered in this color. Additional options include Park Distance Control, rain sensing wipers, and automatic xenon headlights. The seller states the left rear quarter panel and bumper were scratched while parked in 2013 and subsequently repaired by Enthusiast Auto Group Auto Body in Cincinnati, Ohio. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage. The windshield was replaced at The BMW Store in Cincinnati, Ohio in 2013, and a walk-around video can be viewed here.

Forged BMW original equipment 19″ M cross-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport sized 245/35 front and 275/30 rear that show 2013 date codes. The brake pads and rotors were replaced at 89k miles, and a brake fluid flush was performed in August 2019, along with the fitment of new brake pressure sensors.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with contrasting aluminum trim on the dash and door panels. Features include powered front seats with memory and lumbar functions, air conditioning, Hi-Fi audio, and navigation. Nextzett leather care has been said to be applied to the seats regularly, and the driver and passenger airbags were replaced in 2014 and 2017.

Paddle shifters for the six-speed SMG automated sequential transmission are mounted behind the steering wheel. Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline, and an odometer showing just over 100k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The seller states the VANOS unit was replaced in in 2009 at 32k miles, and the Inspection II was carried out at 84k miles. The Enthusiast Auto Group recommended service schedule is said to have been followed under the seller’s ownership, and a service in August 2019 at EAG included a new air conditioner belt, power steering line, and an oil change. A cold-start and idle video are provided.
The accompanying service records are said to date to new, and a service log can be seen in the gallery below.

The October 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other issues and lists history in Indiana and Ohio. A start-up and drive video has been provided here, and additional driving videos are provided below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible was acquired by the selling dealer earlier this year and shows just under 46k miles. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic with a black convertible soft top over a black leather interior and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG automated manual gearbox. Equipment includes heated seats, xenon headlamps, quad exhaust outlets, 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels, brushed aluminum trim, automatic climate control, and paddle shifters. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered by the selling dealer with a Davis report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features a black convertible soft top, which is shown in its raised and lowered positions. Factory equipment includes xenon headlamps, fog lamps, white direction indicator lights, side air vents, and quad exhaust outlets. The selling dealer notes that the hood was refinished due to a dent between the kidney grilles, and a photo of the dent prior to it being repaired is included at the end of the photo gallery. The soft top is demonstrated opening in a video from the selling dealer.

Optional 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels are fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The wheels show curb rash, and a spare tire is mounted in the trunk. The seller reports that the Michelin tires were installed in preparation for the sale, and all four wheels were aligned. The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.

The cabin is upholstered in black leather and features brushed aluminum trim on the door panels, dashboard, and center console. Interior amenities include heated and power-adjustable seats with memory settings for the driver, automatic climate control, a multi-function steering wheel, Park Distance Control (PDC), a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The driver’s seat bolster has been repaired, with detailed photos viewable below.

Paddle shifters for the six-speed automated manual transmission are mounted behind the stock steering wheel. Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and water temperature. The digital odometer shows just under 46k miles, a handful of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque and is paired with a six-speed SMG automated manual gearbox. An Inspection I is said to have been completed by the selling dealer in September 2019.
Additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.

The Carfax report shows registration history in Illinois and Massachusetts and lists no accidents or other damage. A Davis report provided in the gallery shows dealer service records between 2005 and 2017.
A walk-around video is viewable above and a driving video is provided below.

title: Supercharged 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black leather and shows 72k miles. It is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and has been fitted with an Active Autowerke supercharger, front-mount intercooler, a methanol injection system, aftermarket header, Remus exhaust, a Brembo front brake kit, modified suspension, and more as described below. Factory equipment includes a sunroof and Harman Kardon stereo. This E46 M3 is now offered on behalf of the current owner with a Carfax report, service records, and a clean California title.

The Imola Red paint is shown up close photo gallery below, and the seller states that a non-original front air dam has been installed and painted. Imperfections include chips on forward facing surfaces along with damage and bending of the front bumper cover toward the lower-center. A black-finished intercooler can be seen through the central front bumper opening. The Carfax report lists a damage report affecting the front of the vehicle in January 2016, with no additional information provided.
This M3 sits lower than stock on aftermarket suspension components. A Brembo front brake kit includes red-painted calipers and drilled rotors. Factory 19″ wheels are mounted with Federal tires.
The cabin is trimmed in black leather and features gray dashboard trim. The seller has highlighted wear on various surfaces in the gallery, including the storage cover forward of the shifter.

An AC Schnitzer short shifter is equipped, and the knob can be seen above. The windshield washer system was removed to make room for the supercharger. Features include a Harman Kardon stereo, power glass moonroof, automatic climate control, Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), cruise control, power accessories, and more.

In stock form the 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, which is sent rearward through a six-speed manual transmission. Performance additions include an Active Autowerke supercharger, trunk-mounted methanol-injection system, an upgraded header, and a Remus exhaust. A California emissions test certificate from September 30, 2019 is shown in the gallery.
According to the seller, included maintenance records date back to new.
A driving video is attached above.
Additional underside photos are displayed in the gallery.

The Carfax report shows history in Texas and California, as well as the aforementioned January 2016 damage entry. According to the seller the current owner acquired this car in February 2016, and the California registration expired in August 2019. A cinematic-style video featuring this M3 can be viewed below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package SMG
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a Competition Package (ZCP) coupe that is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over a black leather interior and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG transmission. Modifications include KW coilovers, Brembo brakes with floating rotors, Supersprint mufflers, a CSL trunk lid, heated Recaro Sportster CS seats, an AFE stage 2 cold air intake, a flat-bottomed steering wheel, “angel eye” headlights, aftermarket trim, and more. The car was acquired by the seller from its first owner in 2019, and is said to have received a new battery and fluids within the last 2k miles. This E46 M3 shows 97k miles and is offered with a Carfax report, an October 2019 oil analysis, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in ZCP-exclusive Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and features a CSL trunk lid as well as Autotechnik LED angel eyes, gloss black kidney and fender grilles, and matching badges. Damage to the front end is noted on the Carfax report in June 2018, and the hood is said to have been replaced under prior ownership. Paint depth readings are shown in the image gallery below.

Staggered 19″ ZCP wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires manufactured in 2017. The brakes have been upgraded with yellow-painted Brembo calipers, two-piece floating rotors and stainless-steel lines from ECS Tuning, and Hawk street/track pads. The factory suspension has been replaced with KW V3 coilovers.

The interior is trimmed in black leather and features matching floor mats with custom yellow piping. The interior has been further modified with heated Recaro Sportster CS front sport seats, F80 ZCP-style seatbelts, an Alcantara CSL shifter boot, and an Alcantara handbrake boot and handle cover from Coby Wheel.

The flat-bottomed steering wheel is wrapped in leather and Alcantara, and retains an M Track Mode button. The car was equipped from the factory with a glass sunroof, a retractable rear sun blind, a Harman Kardon sound system, and navigation. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and an odometer showing 97k miles. A CSL carpet kit has been added to the trunk.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features an AFE Stage 2 cold air intake and a Turner Motorsport Power Pulley kit. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG automated sequential transmission. The battery, engine oil, transmission fluid, and coolant were reportedly replaced at 95k miles, and a California emissions inspection is said to have been passed in October 2019.
Supersprint section 2 and section 3 mufflers have been installed along with a carbon fiber rear diffuser. Additional underbody images are shown in the gallery below.

The September 2019 Carfax report shows one owner prior to the seller and lists history in California and Nevada. The car is supplied with recent service records and an October 2019 Blackstone Laboratories oil analysis which is shown in the gallery. Walk-around and driving videos are provided below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a red-on-red coupe which remained with its original owner in New York until 2015 and was purchased by the seller in Indiana from a friend in 2016. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and equipment includes 19″ wheels, factory navigation, and an Eisenmann exhaust system. Factory recalls have been addressed, a coolant flush performed, and replacement of the fan clutch carried out under current ownership. This E46 M3 shows 217k miles and is offered with a Carfax report, partial service records, and a clean Indiana title.

The car is finished in Imola Red (Imolarot 2 405), and is said to have been repainted while with the previous owner. The Carfax report lists accidents in 2009 and 2011, both of which resulted in damage to the rear end. Blemishes include chips in the nose, a crack in the front bumper cover, and misaligned kidney grille trim.

Optional 19″ wheels show etching and curb damage, and are mounted with Michelin and Continental rubber showing 2014 date codes all around. A walk-around video has been provided by the seller, who notes that the motorized sunroof is inoperable.

The cockpit is trimmed in Imola Red leather over power-adjustable sport seats with driver-side memory and a split rear bench which folds forward to increase cargo space. Carbon fiber-style vinyl has been been applied to the dash, doors, center console, and steering wheel. A ZHP shift knob and glovebox-mounted auxiliary audio input have also been added.

The multi-function M-Sport steering wheel frames grey gauges including a tachometer with a variable redline, a 180-mph speedometer, and a digital odometer showing 217k miles, 15k of which have been added by the seller since 2016. A factory navigation system remains mounted in the center stack. The driver’s airbag was replaced under recall in March 2018.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Oil changes and replacement of the cooling fan, fan clutch, and accessory belt have been performed under current ownership. Service records also document DME reprogramming in 2015 and a coolant flush in April 2018.

A six-speed manual transmission routes power through a limited-slip differential. An Eisenmann exhaust system was installed by the previous owner and currently rattles at cold operating temperatures according to the seller. The starter, brake pads and rotors, and an oil pressure line are said to have been replaced prior to the seller’s purchase.

The October 2019 Carfax report shows the aforementioned accidents in 2009 and 2011 as well as other events with three owners in New York and Indiana. The seller states that the title will be released by his credit union after final payment has been made on his current loan. A readout of factory equipment is included in the gallery, and cold start and driving videos can be viewed below.

title: 17k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller’s parents at BMW of West Springfield, Massachusetts, and shows 17k miles. The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a Cinnamon leather interior and was delivered from the factory with 19″ wheels, xenon headlights, the Cold Weather Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, and keyless entry. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. This E46 M3 convertible is offered in Connecticut with factory literature, a window sticker, some service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Hampshire title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbonschwarz Metallic (416), and the soft top is shown both raised and stowed in the photo gallery below. Xenon headlights were optioned from the factory and equipped with retractable washers as part of the Cold Weather Package.
Optional 19″ double-spoke wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW tires showing 2016 date codes. Photos show curb rash on the front passenger-side wheel.

The interior features heated sport seats and door inserts upholstered in Cinnamon leather, with black carpeting protected by embroidered floor mats. A Harman Kardon sound system was optioned from the factory, and paperwork from BMW West Springfield of Massachusetts shows that a recall for the driver- and passenger-side airbags was addressed in September 2019.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel sits ahead of a black dashboard with aluminum-look trim that extends around the shifter. Gray-faced instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing 17k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features dual overhead camshafts and Double VANOS variable valve timing, and was factory-rated at 338 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 269 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable limited-slip differential. Recent service reportedly included an oil change in the last 250 miles as well as an airbag recall in September 2019.

The October 2019 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. Registration is indicated in the seller’s state of New Hampshire, though the car has reportedly spent most of its time with his parents in Massachusetts.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Topaz Blue Metallic over Gray Leather
listing_details: Topaz Blue Metallic over Gray Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over gray leather and shows 60k miles, approximately 15k of which were added since the seller’s acquisition in late 2016. It is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and has been fitted with a Brembo Gran Turismo BBK brake Kit, 19″ multipiece BBS LM-R wheels, Meisterschaft stainless-steel exhaust, Bilstein PSS9 adjustable coil-overs, and a cold-air intake. Factory equipment includes a sunroof, xenon headlamps, and a Harman/Kardon stereo. This E46 M3 is now offered with two key fobs, WeatherTech floor mats, a clean Carfax report, service records, and a clean Missouri title.

The exterior is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic (364). The seller states that a key scratch along the passenger side of the car necessitated a repaint of the fender, door, and rear quarter panel, which was performed by Tanner’s Customs & Collision in Kansas City, Missouri. Other imperfections highlighted in the photo gallery include touch-up work on the driver-side quarter panel, a scratch on the hood, and stone chips on the front bumper. LED taillights found on post 2003.5 E46 M3s have been fitted.

Multi-piece 19″ BBS LM-R wheels were installed in 2008 and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires said to have been fitted new in 2016 and can be seen in detail in the gallery. Other modifications installed in 2008 under previous ownership include a Brembo Gran Turismo BBK brake kit with cross-drilled rotors and silver-painted calipers as well as a Bilstein PSS9  adjustable coil-over suspension. An April 2008 invoice from Autosound & More in Norwalk, Connecticut is provided in the photo gallery and documents this work.

The interior features gray leather seats with matching carpets plus a factory Harman/Kardon sound system and a sunroof. The seller notes wear on an interior door handle and an approximately ¼” seam separation on the rear seat, both of which are shown in the gallery. A full set of WeatherTech floor mats is included in the sale.
Anchoring the instrumentation is a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer reads just under 60k miles, approximately 15k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque and is paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a cold-air intake and a Meisterschaft stainless-steel exhaust system. A service performed in November 2019 includes an oil change, valve adjustment, oil pan gasket replacement, and rear subframe inspection and was performed at Blue Label Racing of Kansas City, Missouri.

The October 2019 Carfax report is free of accidents and other issues, and it documents registration history in Connecticut, Georgia, Massachusetts, and Missouri. The seller notes that a rod-bearing recall was performed in 2004 and an airbag recall was completed in 2017.

In November 2019, in preparation for sale, the seller commissioned Blue Label Racing of Kansas City, MO to perform an oil change, valve adjustment, oil pan gasket replacement, and rear subframe inspection. A copy of this recent invoice along with photographs of the rear subframe are included in the photo gallery

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and shows just under 93k miles. It is finished in Alpine White with a black convertible top over a black leather interior and is equipped with xenon headlamps, 19″ Style 67 alloy wheels, quad exhaust outlets, heated seats, aluminum trim, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 was recently acquired by the selling dealer and is now offered at no reserve with recent service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title.
The exterior is finished in Alpine White (300) and is equipped with a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights, fog lamps, white direction indicator lights, and quad exhaust outlets.
19″ Style 67 alloy wheels were equipped from the factory and are fitted with Westlake SA07 tires. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

The cabin features sport seats upholstered in black leather with matching door panels and brushed aluminum trim throughout. Interior amenities include heated and power-adjustable seats with memory settings for the driver, a multi-function steering wheel, a leather-wrapped shift knob and parking brake, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil temperature, water temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 93k miles, approximately 500 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque when new, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission.
The selling dealer notes that subframe reinforcement work has not been completed, and additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.

The Carfax report lists registration history in New York, Maryland, North Carolina, and Michigan and shows no accidents or other damage. Included service records indicate that the driver and passenger airbags were replaced in September 2017 due to a recall.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a black-on-black coupe which was registered in California until being acquired by the seller a year ago. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox, and equipment includes factory navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, a sunroof, and Park Distance Control. Modifications consist of BC Racing coilovers, 19″ VMR wheels, Cipher Auto seats, a CSL rear diffuser, an Active Autowerke ECU tune, and more. A valve adjustment was reportedly carried out 5k miles ago. This E46 M3 shows 78k miles and is offered with its removed stock 19″ wheels and seats, a Carfax report, and a clean Nevada title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black and features a rear lip spoiler, LED taillights, fog lights, fender vents, and four exhaust outlets. Modifications include a CSL rear diffuser, “angel eye” headlight rings, and tinted windows. The Carfax report lists a sideswipe accident without airbag deployment in December 2008. The seller notes scratches on the right door and hood as well as an imperfection on the left fender.

The ride height has been lowered using BC racing coilovers over replica 19″ VMR CSL wheels, which are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires showing 2018 date codes. Park Distance Control sensors are featured on the rear bumper cover.

Cipher Auto sport seats with harness passthroughs replace the stock versions, which will accompany the car separately. Other equipment includes a factory navigation system, an anthracite headliner, a Harman Kardon stereo, and aluminum trim.

The multi-function M-Sport steering wheel and shift knob are trimmed in Alcantara. Grey gauges include a tachometer with a variable redline, a 185-mph speedometer, and a digital odometer showing 78k miles, approximately 5k of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a variable locking differential. Modifications include an Active Autowerke ECU tune, a racing thermostat, and Supersprint exhaust system. A valve adjustment was performed at 73k miles according to the seller.

The October 2019 Carfax report shows the aforementioned December 2008 accident as well as registration in California and Nevada from new. A California emissions test was last passed in November 2018. A walk-around and driving video can be seen below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather interior and features 19″ wheels, the Cold Weather Package, Park Distance Control, xenon headlights, navigation, and Harman/Kardon audio. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and modifications are said to include an M-Performance strut bar, M-Tech front sway bar, and KW coilovers. The car was sold new from The BMW Store in Cincinnati, Ohio and spent time in Indiana, Michigan, Arizona, and California until being recently acquired by the selling dealer in Florida. Service in July 2019 included an oil and filter change along with an inspection. Now showing 42k miles, this E46 M3 Convertible is offered by the selling dealer in Florida with service records, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features a black convertible soft top. Factory equipment includes xenon headlamps, fog lamps, and a quad-outlet exhaust. A front splitter has been fitted, along with color-matched corner marker covers and black and white roundel badges. The selling dealer notes various scratches around the body, and the included Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

The factory alloys have been replaced with a set of black 19″ CSL-style wheels that are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires. The suspension is fitted with KW adjustable coilovers as well as M Tech front strut bar.

The cabin is upholstered in black leather and features brushed aluminum trim on the door panels, dashboard, and center console. Interior amenities include navigation, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and heated and power-adjustable seats with memory settings for the driver.
Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing just over 42k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six is paired with a six-speed manual gearbox and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a factory M Variable Lock differential. Per the seller, a July 2019 service at Checkered Flag BMW in Virginia Beach, Virginia included an oil and filter change along with an inspection.
Additional photos of the underbody, suspension, and exhaust are viewable below.
A copy of the equipment list shows the original colors, options, and a total retail price of $63,795.
The November 2019 Carfax report shows ownership in Indiana, Michigan, Arizona, and California, and lists no accidents or other damage. A walk-around video is provided below.

title: 47k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
listing_details: Stock Wheels w/Michelin Pilot Sport 4S Tires
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a Competition Package (ZCP) coupe which shows just under 47k miles and is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over an Imola Red interior. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and equipment includes xenon headlights, fog lights, a sunroof, automatic climate control, power-adjustable and heated sport seats, and Harman Kardon audio. The car was acquired by the seller in 2018, and a BMW Inspection II service with a valve adjustment and spark plug replacement was carried out under current ownership along with installation of a subframe reinforcement kit, Bilstein coilovers, a replacement fuel tank, fluid changes, new seat foam, and more. This E46 M3 is offered with manufacturer’s literature, recent service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Washington State title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silbergrau Metallic (A08) and features a rear lip spoiler, LED taillights, fender vents, xenon headlights, and quad exhaust outlets. Damage to the front end and roof is indicated on the Carfax report in 2017, which the seller describes as a result of an insurance claim being made under previous ownership to repaint the front bumper, hood, and fenders due to rock chips from a tractor-trailer. Philips 4300k HID headlight bulbs were installed in 2018.

Staggered-width 19″ ZCP wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were mounted in October 2018. Bilstein PSS10 coilovers have been fitted under current ownership along with new front control arms, rear camber arms, and stainless steel brake lines. A brake fluid flush has also been carried out. A Turner Motorsports rear subframe reinforcement kit has been welded in and painted to match the underbody.

The cabin features heated and power-adjustable sport seats which have been fitted with new lower left bolster padding and redyed in Imola Red. Amenities include automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD player with Harmon Kardon audio as well as electric windows, locks, and mirrors. Instrumentation is framed by an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel and includes an odometer showing 47k miles, of which 1,100 have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Maintenance performed in October 2018 included replacement of the fuel tank and filter, spark plugs, air filter, air conditioning belt, power steering hose, and engine undertray as well as a valve adjustment and oil change.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The transmission gear switch and the differential input seal were replaced, and the transmission and differential fluids were changed as part of the October 2018 service.

The November 2019 Carfax report lists the aforementioned 2017 damage as well as showing registration and maintenance history in New Jersey, Florida, Texas, and Washington State through September 2018.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was originally delivered to Joe Self BMW in Wichita, Kansas, and was purchased by the seller in 2019, reportedly from the son of the original owner. The car now shows 56k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. It is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over black Nappa leather, and factory equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium Packages, a sunroof, and a Harman/Kardon sound system. Recent service included replacement of the tires, pinion and differential seals, front brake pads and rotors, spark plugs, and windshield washer pump. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records from current ownership, factory literature, a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Kansas title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08), which was included as a $475 option. Additional options include xenon headlights, heated side mirrors, heated windshield washer jets, rain-sensing windshield wipers and headlights, and a power glass moonroof.
Staggered 19″ wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were mounted in 2019. The front brake pads and rotors were replaced in October 2019.

The interior is finished in black Nappa leather and features power-adjustable and heated seats. Amenities include a Harman/Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, and a ski bag. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features Double-VANOS variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The spark plugs were replaced in October 2019.

Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a 3.62:1 M-variable locking differential. The pinion seal, both axle seals, and the gear oil were replaced in April 2019.

title: 27k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

This E46 M3 shows 27k miles and is offered with a window sticker, sales documents, manufacturer’s literature, service records from new, removed factory parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

Staggered-width 19″ Savini wheels are 9″ wide up front and 10″ at the rear, with all wearing Continental ExtremeContact DW tires showing 2016 date codes. Six- and four-piston Brembo brakes have been added along with KW Variant 2 coilovers.

Matching door panels and carpets are accepted by a black upper dash pad and aluminum trim. title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible SMG
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible was purchased in 2016 by the seller, who has added 12k of the 70k miles shown. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered with its stock radio and navigation system, factory literature, recent service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The right-side Apex wheels were reportedly replaced in 2018, and worked performed since 2016 is said to have included the installation of replacement rear wheel bearings, Turner Motorsport stainless steel brake lines, Hawk ceramic brake pads, Koni Yellow shocks, ECS rear shock mount plates, and Powerflex rear trailing arm bushings.

The interior is trimmed in black leather with matching door panels, black carpets, and aluminum trim. Wear is present on the outer bolster of the driver’s seat, and equipment includes power-adjustable sports seats, driver’s seat memory, and automatic climate control.

Gray instruments include a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer, along with a digital odometer that shows 70k miles. The center stack houses an Android-based Erisin head unit, and the factory navigation radio is included in the sale.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The VANOS hydraulic unit and the SMG hydraulic pump were replaced in August 2012 by a previous owner. Modifications are said to include an Evolve ECU tune, Status Gruppe V3 exhaust headers, an aFe air intake, Corteco engine mounts, and a CPI air filter. A replacement battery was installed in October 2019.

title: 23k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was purchased new by the seller at Camelback BMW in Phoenix, Arizona and is finished in Jet Black over a black leather and M cloth interior. title: 2002 BMW M3 Dinan S3-R Convertible 6-Speed

A Dinan supercharger was fitted to the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six in 2005 at 37k miles by Concord Motorsport Service, a Dinan intercooler was fitted in 2007 by Ultimate Motorwerks, and all other Dinan components were installed in 2003 by C2 Design. A BMW Inspection II carried out in October 2019 by Dynamic Auto Tune in Charlotte, North Carolina included replacement of the alternator, battery, valve cover gasket, fan blade and clutch, and spark plugs as well as an oil change. An engine running video has been provided by the seller.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a Dinan 3.91:1 limited-slip differential. Changes of the differential and transmission fluid were performed as part of the October 2019 service.
A window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, three keys, and service records are included in the sale.

title: 22k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was sold new from BMW of Plano, Texas, and was acquired 11 months ago by the seller in Florida. The car is finished in Imola Red over a grey leather interior, and options include the Premium package, 19″ wheels, and a sunroof. Power comes from a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and work under the seller’s ownership is said to have included an Inspection II service, differential seal, axle seals, a timing chain tensioner gasket, and a fluid service. Now showing 22k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with service records, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork is finished in  Imolarot 2(405) and features fog lights, an integrated front lip, a sunroof, and quad tailpipes. The paintwork and exterior trim are shown in detail in the photo gallery below, along with paint meter readings. Scuffs are noted on the underside of the front bumper, along with rock chips on the front fascia. The included Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
Optional 19″ wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The seller states the brake fluid was recently flushed.

The cabin is trimmed in grey leather (N5TT) with brushed-aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Factory equipment includes power seats, with memory settings for the driver, automatic climate control, a multi-function steering wheel, BMW HiFi stereo, and more. The seller notes marks on the passenger transmission tunnel, sagging material on the A and C pillars, and scuffs on the cup holder plastic and the back of the driver’s seat.

M-branded instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline, and an odometer showing just under 22k miles. Just under 6k miles have been added by the current owner.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox and an M Variable limited-slip differential. The seller states an Inspection II service was performed, along with the fitment of a new timing chain tensioner gasket, and changing the coolant, transmission fluid, and oil.
New axle seals were also fitted, along with a differential seal and fluid. Additional photos of the underbody, suspension, and exhaust are viewable below.
The December 2019 Carfax report shows ownership in Texas and Florida, with no accidents or other damage shown.

title: 13k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was sold new at Rallye BMW in Westbury, New York and reportedly remained with its original owner before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2019. Finished in Imola Red II over a Cinnamon leather interior, the car shows just under 13k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Factory equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium packages as well as 19″ wheels, xenon headlights, and a Harman Kardon sound system. An April 2019 service included installation of a new battery, tires, and fresh fluids. This E46 M3 convertible is offered by the selling dealer with factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The exterior is finished in Imola Red II (405) and the black cloth soft top is shown both raised and stowed in the gallery. Xenon headlights with retractable washers were equipped as part of the Cold Weather Package. The selling dealer notes blemishes on the hood and bumpers as shown in the gallery.
Optional 19″ double-spoke wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact tires that were installed in April 2019. The brake fluid was flushed at this time according to the Carfax report.

The leather-wrapped M-Sport steering wheel contains controls for the Harman Kardon stereo and cruise control. Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing 13k miles. A K40 radar detector has been added, although the selling dealer is unsure of its functionality.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features dual overhead camshafts and a drive-by-wire throttle and was factory-rated at 338 horsepower and 269 lb-ft of torque. An April 2019 service included replacement of the battery and cables along with an oil change and coolant flush.
A Getrag 420G six-speed manual transmission sends power to the rear wheels through an M Variable limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the chassis can be viewed in the gallery.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed

This E46 M3 comes with a BMW watch, a service manual, car cover, a binder of service records, and the removed rod bearings. It is now offered on behalf of the current owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean California title.

The bodywork is finished in Interlagos Blue (A30) and features a rear boot lid spoiler, 3M window tint, and clear glass-guard on the windscreen. The seller notes that the roof and roof plastic rails have been repainted due to fade, and the hood was repainted due to a ding. Stone chips are shown on the front bumper, and the seller notes other marks in the finish and a ding on the left rear quarter panel.
Factory 19″ M Cross Spoke wheels are mounted with Pilot Sport 4S tires. Suspension modifications include adjustable Bilstein PSS10 coilovers and a set of Ground Control camber plates.

The interior is upholstered in Anthracite M Texture Alcantara and black Nappa leather with Milled-Effect Aluminum trim. The seller describes nail marks on the rubberized interior plastics, as well as wear on the Alcantara steering wheel rim. The current owner installed a rebuilt factory stereo in 2019.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 87k miles, 43k of which were added by the current owner.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential.
A log provided in the gallery shows maintenance under current ownership, with highlights including the following:
The car is fitted with a set of stainless steel brake lines, and additional underside photos are provided below.

A BMW watch, Bentley Publishing service manual, factory suspension components, the removed rod bearings, an extra set of brake rotors, and more are included. A three-ring binder with about 2″ of service records is shown in the gallery.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW E46 M3 convertible has under 64k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Finished in black over Cinnamon leather, the car was originally used as a manufacturer’s vehicle before being brought from Germany to the US in 2003 and sold at auction with approximately 1,200 miles. Features include a black convertible top, six-disc CD changer, automatic climate control, 18″ Style 67 wheels, xenon headlights, and heated seats. This E46 M3 was recently acquired by the selling dealer and is now being offered in Fredericksburg, Virginia with a clean Carfax report and a clean Maryland title.

The car is finished in Schwarz 2 (668) and features a black convertible top. Exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, heated sideview mirrors, quad exhaust outlets, parking sensors, and side grilles on the front quarter panels. The recent Carfax report indicates no history of accidents or other damage.
Style 67 wheels measure 18×8″ up front and 18×9″ out back and wear Michelin tires all around. The M3 model features flared wheel arches to accommodate 225/45 and 255/40 tire sizes.

The interior is equipped with heated and power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Cinnamon leather, along with matching rear seats, door panels and center armrest. The carpets and upper surfaces are a contrasting black, and the center console and dash are trimmed in burled wood as part of the optional Fine Wood Trim Package (S435A). Additional cabin features include automatic climate control, power windows/locks/mirrors, side airbags, and a BMW Business Radio with six-disc CD changer and HiFi speaker system.

A leather-wrapped, multi-function steering wheel frames the gauge cluster, which includes a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer shows under 64k miles, about 1k of which have been added by the selling dealer over the last few months. The radio display is said to have some missing pixels.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission in this car. The car passed a Virginia safety inspection in July of 2019.
Additional photos of the underside can be viewed in the gallery below.
The Carfax report indicates that the car spent time in Argentina and Germany before being sold to its first private owner in 2003. It was then registered in Maryland from 2003 until at least 2018.
Then video above depicts the car starting, and a walk-around.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

The car was sold new in Illinois and spent time in California before being acquired by the seller 11 years ago. It now shows 79k miles, and features include heated seats, 19″ M Double Spoke wheels, and automatic climate control. Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with 2015-production Hankook Ventus tires measuring 225/40 in the front and 255/35 in the rear. The seller states the convertible top motor was replaced in July 2015.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over grey leather and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car came equipped with the Cold Weather Premium packages from the factory, and modifications include an F60 gear lever, JVC stereo, subframe reinforcement, solid rear subframe mounts, polyurethane differential bushings, and LED taillights. The seller has added 33k of the 107k indicated miles during six years of ownership, and recent service consisted of a cooling system overhaul with a new radiator, water pump, and hoses, as well as replacement of the oil pan gasket, CVP O-ring, belts and tensioners, and sunroof shade clips. This E46 M3 comes with its window sticker, a space-saver spare tire, records, an AutoCheck report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354), and the condition of the paintwork is shown up close in the gallery below. The AutoCheck report lists a rear-end accident in 2006 which is said to have caused the scrapes shown on the rear bumper cover, and the seller notes several dings, chips, and scratches elsewhere on the body. An aftermarket tint has been added to the side and rear windows.

Replica 19″ CSL wheels from VMT are mounted with Nitto and Continental rubber, with the front tires due for replacement according to the seller. An unused space-saver spare wheel and tire combination from Bavauto is included in the sale. The brake rotors, pads, and wheel sensors were replaced under current ownership. The locking solenoid for the fuel filler door does not release and has been disconnected in its unlocked position.

The interior is upholstered in Grey Nappa leather with brushed aluminum trim and features the Cold Weather package with heated and power-adjustable sport seats and a pass-through ski bag. A JVC stereo has replaced the stock version, which is included in the sale. The steering wheel phone and audio controls do not work with the JVC head unit. The rearview mirror is said to have been repaired under previous ownership.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for fuel level, coolant and oil temperature. The digital odometer shows 107k miles, 33k of which were added by the seller. The sunroof shade clips were replaced, a short-throw F60 shifter added, and an airbag recall reportedly carried out under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A rod bearing recall has been performed according to the seller. The radiator, water pump, and hoses were replaced in preparation for the sale, including the heater hoses under the intake manifold. New belts, idlers, and tensioners were also fitted along with a replacement oil pan gasket and CVP O-ring. The alternator has also been rebuilt and the washer pump replaced. A new battery was fitted in 2018, and the seller has also replaced all six ignition coils.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The clutch line restrictor was removed at 75k miles, and the driveshaft flex disc and shifter bushings were also replaced under current ownership. The rear subframe is said to have been reinforced and fitted with solid aluminum mounts from Turner Motorsport, and polyurethane differential bushings have been installed. The seller notes a possible leaking power steering hose.
The original window sticker is included and displays the factory colors and equipment, as well as a new price of $54,445.
The January 2020 AutoCheck report indicates three previous owners and lists history in Texas from 2002 through the most recent update in March 2019.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package SMG
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was originally leased from Shelley BMW of Buena Park, California, was sold as a Certified Pre-Owned Vehicle in 2009, and spent time in Arkansas before being acquired by the selling dealer in North Carolina. Finished in Interlagos Blue over a Black Nappa leather interior, the car shows 87k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG transmission. It is factory-equipped with the Competition Package, while modifications include an aFe cold air intake, Ground Control lower control arms, Powerflex trailing arm and sway bar bushings, and more. The rear differential seals were recently replaced, along with the A/C belt, and brake pressure switches. This E46 M3 is offered by the selling dealer with factory manuals, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The body is finished in Interlagos Blue (A30), and no accidents or other damage is shown on the Carfax report. A CSL-style trunk with an integrated lip spoiler and a front bumper with a fog light delete have been added, along with black kidney grilles and side strakes.

Factory 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that display date codes from 2011 and 2012. The rear window rubber moldings are cracked, and replacement items are included in the sale.

The interior is upholstered in Black Nappa leather with milled-effect aluminum trim. An Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel was part of the Competition Package and features a button to engage M-Track mode. The seller states that the driver and passenger air bag recalls have been addressed, and larger machined alloy shift paddles have been added.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer reportedly shows 87k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed sequential gearbox and a factory M Variable lock differential. Modifications include an aFe Stage II cold air intake, Rouge Engineering under drive pulleys, and silicone radiator hoses. Maintenance in the last year is said to have consisted of an oil change and fluid flushes, as well as replacement of the A/C belt, rear differential seals, and brake pressure switches.

Ground Control lower control arms have been added, along with Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts, Powerflex trailing arm and sway bar bushings, and stainless steel brake lines. Additional photos of the underbody are provided in the gallery.

The December 2019 Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage and shows history in California, Arkansas, and North Carolina. Drive-by footage is viewable below, and a short in-car driving video can be seen here.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
