title: 2005 BMW M3 ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This BMW M3 is a Competition Package (ZCP) coupe that is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over a Cinnamon leather interior and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car was sold new in Florida and spent time in North Carolina and Virginia before being acquired by the seller from Enthusiast Auto Group of Cincinnati, Ohio in March 2019. Mechanical and cosmetic work performed by EAG in 2018 included an Inspection II, as well as the installation of new front control arm and rear trailing arm bushings, differential axle seals, refinished 19″ wheels, and more. This E46 M3 shows just under 64k miles and is offered with a receipt from the 2018 work, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The exterior is finished in Silbergrau Metallic (A08) and features a rear lip spoiler, fender vents, xenon headlights, and quad exhaust outlets. The October 2018 service included repainting the front bumper and installing a new windshield cowl, front turn signals, reflectors, side markers, and both front grill inserts.

Staggered-width 19″ wheels were refinished and mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires in October 2018. Additional work completed at this time included a rear subframe inspection and the installation of a new power steering pressure line, ABS pressure sensors, front control arm bushings, rear trailing arm bushings, and Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts.

Cinnamon leather is accented with Competition Package-specific aluminum trim along with a black dashboard, carpeting, and upper door panels. The October 2018 service included a new driver side armrest pad, upper center console support, a replacement navigation screen, and new A, B, and C pillar covers.

An Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel was part of the Competition Package and features a button to engage M-Track mode. Instrumentation includes an M-branded 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer shows 64k miles, 799 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. An Inspection II service and DME software upgrade were performed in October 2018, and the constant pressure valve o-ring, cooling system temperature sensor, and M engine badge were replaced.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock rear differential. Both differential axle seals were replaced by EAG, and a receipt from the October 2018 work is provided in the gallery, which also contains additional underside photos.

The recent Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, lists at least one open recall, and displays history in Florida, North Carolina, Virginia, Ohio, and Pennsylvania. There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP 6-Speed
listing_details: New CPV, PS Hose, Brakes, Sway Bar Bracket
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue over a black leather interior and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Features consist of the Competition, Cold Weather, and Premium packages as well as navigation and Harmon Kardon sound. The car spent most of its life in Washington State until the seller purchased it from its third owner and drove it home to California in July 2017. Service in fall 2019 included exterior and interior detailing as well as replacement of the constant pressure valve, power steering supply hose, brake rotors and pads, and right rear sway bar bracket. This E46 M3 shows 53k miles and comes with an owner’s manual, a navigation DVD, an electric air pump and other tools, a clean Carfax report, and California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and features xenon headlights and a sunroof. The lower left rear quarter panel and the center section of the rear bumper cover are said to have been repainted under previous ownership. The seller describes dings in both quarter panels and on the left side of the roof.

Staggered-width 19″ ZCP wheels are mounted with Continental ContiSportContact tires which need replacement due to wear. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors from the factory. The seller installed new stock front and rear brake rotors with Hawk HPS 5.0 pads in October 2019, also replacing a missing rear sway bar bracket. A subframe reinforcement kit has reportedly not been fitted.

The cabin is upholstered in black Nappa leather with patterned aluminum trim. The factory sport seats are heated as part of the Cold Weather Package, and the car is also equipped with the Premium Package as well as navigation and Harmon Kardon audio. The exterior and interior were recently steam-cleaned and detailed by Bay Area Detail of San Mateo, California according to the seller.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 53k miles, 6k of which were added by the seller. An airbag recall is said to have been performed at Stevens Creek BMW in 2018.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Recent service included replacement of the constant pressure valve as well as the power steering supply hose and fluid by Carbahn in September 2019. The engine bay and wheel wells were reportedly steam-cleaned by Bay Area Detail.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, listing registration with four owners in Washington and California including the seller.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible shows 51k miles and is finished in Alpine White III over a grey Nappa leather interior. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential gearbox. Factory equipment includes heated seats, automatic climate control, parking sensors, and xenon headlights. The selling dealer acquired the car in late 2019, and an engine oil change was reportedly performed within the last year. This E46 M3 is now offered with the owner’s booklet, records, two keys, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The bodywork is finished in Alpine White III (300), and the seller notes some rock chips that have been touched up. Features include xenon headlights, fog lights, white indicator lights, and parking sensors. The rear latches for the black soft top have been replaced, and a small tear is reported on the inside. The provided Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with Sailun rear and Federal front tires. Some curb rash is noted, and each wheel is shown individually in the gallery below.

The interior is upholstered in grey Nappa leather with brushed Aluminum Shadow trim. Features consists of heated and powered front seats, along with Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, and an auto-dimming rear view mirror.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 51k miles, 1,000 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. An oil change has reportedly been performed in the last year.
The car is accompanied by owner’s materials, two keys, and records from the previous owner.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. Registration history in Montana and Texas is listed, along with an open airbag recall.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package SMG
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was sold new in California and spent time in Nevada and Pennsylvania before returning to California with the seller’s purchase in August 2018. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior, and power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential transmission. Features consists of the Competition Package, Koni shocks, and an Avin head unit with wireless CarPlay. An Inspection II service was performed prior to the seller’s acquisition, and maintenance under current ownership has included a brake fluid flush, new tires, accessory belt tensioners, and more as described below. Now showing 66k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with service records, the factory head unit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features white indicator lights, park distance sensors, and aftermarket window tint. An inspection from August 2018 notes evidence of paintwork on the front and rear bumpers, and the provided Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

In December 2018 the car received new Koni shocks, front control arm bushings, rear trailing arm bushing shims, and a custom alignment. Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were installed in April 2019. A brake fluid flush was performed in December 2019, and an inspection from that same visit noted the brake pads measured 4mm in the front and 5mm in the rear.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather accented with Milled-Effect aluminum trim. Features include heated and powered front seats with driver-side memory, as well as a glass sunroof, automatic climate control, and an Avin head unit with wireless CarPlay. The factory head unit accompanies the car.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 66k miles, 10k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. An Inspection II service was performed in 2018 prior to the seller’s acquisition and included replacement of the spark plugs, engine air filter, transmission fluid, differential fluid, and the cabin filter. Under current ownership the VANOS system received a nut and bolt check, and the high pressure power steering hose, exhaust camshaft position sensor, and accessory belts and tensioners were replaced.

The accident-free Carfax report shows entries in California, Nevada, and Pennsylvania, along with an airbag recall that the seller states will be addressed prior to transfer of ownership. Included service records from the seller’s ownership are viewable in the gallery below.

title: 47k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was sold new at Sonnen BMW of San Rafael, California and is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and factory options include the ZCP Competition Package, power seats with width adjustment, a glass moonroof, xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, and Park Distance Control. The car remained with the original owner until last year and now shows 47k miles. It was then acquired by the seller last year, and recent work is said to have included a brake service, an oil and filter change, and new tires. This E46 M3 is now offered with its window sticker, factory books and manuals, new BMW floor mats, a BMW trunk carpet, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

2,410 US-market M3s with the Competition Package were built for 2005 and 2006, and this example was ordered new in Titanium Silver Metallic at an additional cost of $475. Other optional features include xenon headlights and Park Distance Control. The seller states that the front bumper was repainted under previous ownership, though the Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

Factory 19″ ZCP-spec wheels were recently refinished and are wrapped in Hankook Ventus V12 E2 tires. The Competition Package also added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. A service in July 2019 reportedly included fitment of new brake pads, rotors, and sensors, along with an alignment.

Black Nappa leather upholstery covers the M-Design front sport seats, which also feature memory for the driver and powered side-bolster width adjustment. Other equipment includes aluminum-milled trim along with an optional sunroof, a navigation system, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The seller notes that the navigation system is not functioning and the screen shows some blotching. The rear parcel shelf was recently recovered in Alcantara.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features a button to engage M-Track Mode, and instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer along with a 9k-rpm tachometer. A ZHP shift knob and Alcantara shift boot have been fitted, though the original shift knob and boot accompany the sale. A driver’s airbag recall was reportedly performed in 2018. The digital odometer shows under 47k miles, about 150 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. An oil and filter change was reportedly performed in July 2019.
Additional underbody photos are provided in the gallery below.
The window sticker shows factory colors, optional equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $61,140.
The Carfax report displays one California owner from new, and lists no damage or other issues.

title: Supercharged 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was acquired new by the seller and is powered by a supercharged 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car is finished in metallic grey over a red leather sport seats with a matching Euro dash and console, and additional modifications include individual throttle bodies, water-alcohol injection, Bilstein PSS9 coilovers, a Dinan exhaust system and differential, a carbon fiber hood and trunk lid, audio upgrades, and more. This supercharged E46 M3 shows 46k miles and has been maintained by BMW dealerships from new. It is offered in Nevada with removed factory parts, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Wyoming title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic (400) and has been fitted with a matching Vorsteiner carbon fiber hood and CSL-style trunk lid, with the latter featuring an etched race flag decal. A carbon fiber front spoiler, rear diffuser, and side grilles have also been fitted along with black kidney grille surrounds, clear turn signals, and silver accents in the xenon headlights. The seller notes blemishes including cracks in the carbon fiber panels and a scuff on the front end.

Staggered-width BBS RS-GT wheels are finished in Diamond Black and wrapped in 19″  Continental ExtremeContact rubber. Suspension modifications include Bilstein PSS9 coilovers and a Dinan strut bar, while braking is from factory calipers that have been powder-coated in red and are paired with slotted discs. The rear subframe has not been reinforced according to the seller, who also states that the car has never been raced or used on track.

The cockpit features factory sport seats in Imola Red leather with a matching lower dash and center console imported from Germany. Optioned equipment includes the Luxury Package with adjustable seat bolsters and lumbar support as well as Park Distance Control. The seller has added a shift knob and floor mats from AC Schnitzer.

Audio gear includes a widescreen head unit with navigation and a Sirius XM receiver as well as a CD changer, twin AlumaPro 12″ subwoofers, and a Bavarian Soundwerks Amplifier in the trunk. A set of Harman Kardon speakers is included but not installed, and the Bluetooth system does not work. Instrumentation includes aftermarket boost and air-fuel gauges as well as an odometer that shows 46k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with an Active Autowerke supercharger kit as well as supporting modifications including a water-alcohol injection system, Dinan throttle bodies, underdrive pulleys, and performance headers feeding a Dinan exhaust system. The most recent service reportedly included a new serpentine belt and radiator hoses as well as a fan clutch upgrade and oil change. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a Dinan rear end.

Service has been conducted largely by BMW dealers in Las Vegas and Loveland, Colorado. The seller notes that the factory connecting rod bearing recall has been performed, documentation for which is said to be included in the sale.
The window sticker lists standard and optional features as well as a suggested retail price of $54,445 from Desert BMW of Las Vegas.
The February 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration with one owner in Nevada from new.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 was sold new at Roadshow BMW in Cordova, Tennessee and was acquired by the seller in California in 2019. It is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior, and power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Work performed in the last year reportedly included rebuilding the VANOS system, replacing the rod bearings, suspension bushings, and transmission mounts, and paint correction with a Ceramic Pro coating. Modifications are said to include a CSL-style trunklid and 19″ wheels, a KW Variant 3 coilover suspension, a Turner Motorsports power pulley kit, and more. Now showing 89k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with some of its removed original parts, service records, a window sticker, factory literature, a clean Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

This example is one of 514 E46 M3 coupes imported to the US that were finished in Phoenixgelb metallic (445). Exterior modifications include a CSL-style trunk lid, carbon fiber front dive planes, and a Status Gruppe rear diffuser. Body-colored front reflector fillers have also been added, along with LED ‘Angel Eyes’ running lights, smoked corner lenses, and LED taillights. Noted issues include a repaired chip on the windshield, a discolored roof rack attachment point, and cracks in the front dive plane spoilers. The quarter window rubber seals also exhibit cracking, and replacement items are included.

ZCP/CSL-style 19″ wheels wear BMW center caps and Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires measuring 245/35 up front and 275/35 out back. Cool Carbon brake pads with new rotors were installed in 2019, and suspension modifications are said to include:

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather (N5SW) with matching carpets and brushed aluminum trim. The stereo system has been upgraded with a Dynavin OE-look head unit with Apple Carplay and Bavsound Stage 1 speakers, and the rear view mirror has been modified with a BlendMount power tap for a radar detector. The seller also installed an OEM ZHP weighted shift knob and Alcantara shift boot.
Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and a digital odometer that indicates 89k miles, approximately 2k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. The VANOS system was reportedly rebuilt with Beisan Systems parts, and modifications include a Turner Motorsport power pulley kit, Rogue Engineering transmission mounts, and an Epic Motorsports race tune. The rod bearings were replaced at 88k miles, while additional service in the last two years is said to have included refreshing the cooling system, replacing the engine mounts, filters, battery, high-pressure power steering line, and oil pan gasket.

The rear subframe is said to have been reinforced with a Redish Motorsport V2 plate kit in 2017, and an alignment, corner balancing, and brake fluid flush were performed. Additional underside photos are available in the gallery below.
The Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage, displays at least one open recall, and lists registration history in Tennessee and California.
A cold-start and walk-around video is viewable above, and a driving video is provided below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was first registered in Virginia and was purchased by the seller in 2015. It is finished in Alpine White over a black Nappa leather interior, and power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Options include the ZCP Competition Package, heated seats, and xenon headlights, and modifications are said to include Schrick camshafts, rear subframe reinforcement, a Ground Control coilover suspension, Hotchkis sway bars, and an Active Autowerke ECU tune. This E46 M3 now shows 82k miles and is offered with service records, factory literature, a Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Alpine White III (300). Body-color front reflector panels and aftermarket fog light bulbs are installed, and this example is not equipped with a sunroof. The Carfax report lists an accident in 2013 with “very minor” left side damage and an additional damage report with a note for a wheel request is listed in 2013. A damage report from 2016 is also shown, and the seller states it was the result of hitting a tire wall with the driver’s side of the car during a track day and that affected body panels were replaced.

19″ staggered-width BBS wheels were part of the Competition Package and measure 8″ in front and 9.5″ in back and wear Pirelli P Zero tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The suspension is reportedly modified with Ground Control single-adjustable coilovers, Hotchkis front and rear anti-roll bars, and subframe reinforcement. The ZCP package also included larger cross-drilled brakes compared to the standard M3, and the seller states that Performance Friction pads and brake cooling ducts with Bimmerworld backing plates are installed in the front.

The interior is trimmed in black leather with an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel. Amenities include automatic climate control, a Harman-Kardon sound system, heated seats, auto-dimming mirrors, power windows, and cruise control. An aftermarket Alpine stereo with a trunk-mounted amplifier and subwoofer is installed.

The seller states that the steering wheel was recovered by Coby Wheel and that the plastic trim on the steering wheel was recently replaced. The photo above was taken before the replacement trim was installed. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 82k miles, 23k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six featured double-VANOS variable valve timing to produce 333 horsepower when new, and it drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Recent maintenance includes a top-end engine refresh in September 2019 by Bimmer Performance Center in Raleigh, North Carolina. Modifications installed at that time are said to include Schrick 288/280 camshafts, Schrick DLC coated followers, VAC performance valve springs, and an Active Autowerke ECU tune. The seller states that the VANOS system was rebuilt during current ownership with Beisan Systems parts including their anti-rattle kit and oil pump disk. The seller has also replaced the spark plugs and ignition coils, and recent service is said to have included an oil change and brake fluid flush.
A maintenance log and factory literature are included in the sale.
Additional underside photos are viewable in the gallery below.

The Carfax report lists the 2013 accident, the 2013 and 2016 damage reports, and registration history in Virginia, Missouri, Florida, Texas, and North Carolina. An open recall is shown for the passenger-side front airbag, although the seller states that the recall was recently completed. A driving videos can be viewed below.

interior_color: Imola Red II over Black Nappa Leather
listing_details: Imola Red II over Black Nappa Leather

Factory 18″ M double-spoke wheels were reportedly replaced in 2016 and wear staggered-width Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires mounted in October 2019. The front wheel hubs and rear shock mounts were replaced and new shocks, brake pads, and rotors were installed in October 2017.

Power-adjustable and heated seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather (N5SW) and feature seatback width adjustment and driver-side memory settings. Shadow-brushed aluminum trim accents the dash, doors, and console. Amenities include Harman Kardon audio, navigation, automatic climate control, and an onboard computer. The seller notes that the CD player is inoperable and a defect is present in the display screen.

A leather-wrapped M sport steering wheel fronts gray instrumentation that includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable-redline, and a digital odometer that indicates approximately 201k miles. The replacement 3.2L S54 inline-six reportedly had 47k miles when it was installed in the vehicle in September 2011 at 90k miles. The Dinan supercharger was rebuilt in 2019, and the pulley and tensioner were replaced. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Differential Lock. Additional photos of the underbody are provided in the image gallery below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible shows 17k miles and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a Cinnamon Nappa leather interior. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and the car is equipped with 19″ wheels, heated sport seats, xenon headlights, and Harman Kardon audio. The current owner acquired this E46 M3 on BaT in November 2019, and it is now offered on consignment by the selling dealer in Newport Beach, California with factory literature, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
The bodywork is finished in Carbon Black Metallic and features xenon headlights with washers, rain-sensing wipers, fog lamps, and quad-exhaust outlets.
Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW Tuned tires. Additional photos of the blue soft top are provided in the image gallery below.

The interior is upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim and black carpets. Equipment includes power-adjustable heated seats with memory settings for the driver, as well as cruise control and a Harman-Kardon audio system.
Gray instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 17k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. An oil change was recently performed per the seller.
The Carfax report shows two owners, registration history in New Hampshire and Montana, and no accidents or other issues through its most recent entry in December 2019.

It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather interior, and factory equipment includes a power sunroof, heated seats, and xenon headlights. Factory M Double Spoke wheels wear Nitto Motivo and Sumitomo tires. title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was sold new from BMW of Bellevue and reportedly remained in Washington State with its original owner before being recently acquired by the selling dealer. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six and optioned with the Premium Package, power-adjustable seats, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The original SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual gearbox by the selling dealer, while recent service is said to have included a new battery, shocks, and a pre-purchase inspection. Now showing 56k miles, this E46 M3 is offered by the selling dealer with service records, factory books and manuals, a window sticker, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington title.
The body is finished in Carbon Black Metallic and features optional xenon headlights, a sunroof, and Park Distance Control. The provided Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires that show 2015 and 2016 date codes. The selling dealer states that new Sachs shocks were recently fitted.

Cinnamon Nappa leather sport seats are contrasted with black carpeting and brushed aluminum shadow trim. Factory equipment includes automatic climate control, a multi-function steering wheel, a Harman Kardon sound system, and more. A ZHP shift knob with an Alcantara shift boot has been added.

M-branded instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 56k miles.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over a black leather interior and powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential gearbox. The car was sold new from Advantage BMW Midtown in Houston, Texas, and remained in the area until being acquired by the seller in late 2019. It is equipped with automatic climate control, a power-operated top, parking sensors, and xenon headlights. The most recent service in January 2020 included an engine oil change, a new convertible top pump and engine splash panel, and an inspection. Now showing 47k miles, this E46 M3 convertible is offered with service records, factory manuals, a Davis report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork is finished in Silver Grey Metallic (A08), and the seller notes that the front bumper has been refinished and the windshield was replaced. Features include xenon headlights, fog lights, and parking sensors. The black cloth soft top is shown both raised and stowed in the gallery, and the convertible top pump was replaced in January 2020.
Factory Style 67 wheels measure 18×8″ up front and 18×9″ out back and wear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires all around. The seller recommends the rear tires be replaced soon.

Black Nappa leather sport seats are joined with black carpeting and brushed aluminum shadow trim. Equipment includes power-adjustable seats with memory settings for the driver, as well as cruise control, rain sensing wipers, and auto headlights. An aftermarket Kenwood Bluetooth head unit is fitted, and the factory navigation unit included in the sale. The seller notes the glove box can only be opened with the key.

M-branded instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 47k miles, 600 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. Additional photos of the underbody, suspension, and exhaust are viewable below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 is a black-on-black coupe that was titled to its original owner in Maryland through 2019 and shows just under 40k miles. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox, and equipment includes an M Sport steering wheel, heated seats, a sunroof, automatic climate control, and Harman Kardon audio. This E46 M3 was acquired by the selling dealer in January 2020 and is offered with a Carfax report and a Pennsylvania title.
The car is finished in Jet Black (668) with Shadowline window trim, and features a rear lip spoiler and clear turn signals as well as chrome kidney grilles and fender vents.

Additional equipment includes quad tailpipes, electric pop-out rear windows, a glass sunroof, xenon headlamps, and fog lights. Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with brushed aluminum trim and Motorsport floor mats. The car is equipped with heated and electrically-adjustable sport seats, a stock CD player, a Harman Kardon audio system, and a factory steering wheel with audio and cruise control buttons.
Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing just under 40k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory variable limited-slip differential.
Additional photos show the top of the trunk floor, spare tire, tools, air compressor, and trunk lights in the gallery below.
The February 2020 Carfax report lists one owner from new until the vehicle was abandoned in 2019 and subsequently retitled by the selling dealer.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
listing_details: Front and Rear Wheel Spacers Added
Heated M Sport Seats with Lumbar Supports
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic with a black soft top over a Gray Nappa leather interior and powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. The car was delivered new to International Autos of West Allis, Wisconsin, and optioned with the Cold Weather Package, power lumbar supports, xenon headlights, a Harman-Kardon audio system, and 19″ alloy wheels. Automatic climate control, an onboard computer, heated sport seats, and Dynamic Stability Control came standard. Modifications include the addition of front and rear wheel spacers, an F10 M5 illuminated shift knob and boot, and a sport antenna. An oil service was performed in July 2019. This E46 M3 convertible was acquired by the seller in December 2018 and is now offered with factory literature, the window sticker, service records, removed parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Iowa title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) and features a powered black fabric top with a heated glass rear window, as well as oval-design halogen fog lamps, xenon headlights, rain-sensing wipers, a sport antenna, and heated M-style mirrors, windshield washers, and door locks. The seller notes two worn spots on the top that are shown up close in the gallery below, along with cracks in the window weatherstrips where the top folds. A video showing the top being lowered and raised can be seen here.

Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels wear 225/40 Continental ExtremeContact DW tires showing 2012 date codes up front, and 255/35 Continental ExtremeContact DWS 06 tires showing 2016 date codes at the rear. A four-wheel alignment was performed in March 2019, following the addition of 10mm and 15mm wheel spacers at the front and rear respectively. Ventilated disc brakes with Dynamic Brake Control came standard, and the brake fluid was reportedly flushed in January 2019.

Heated M sport seats with power-adjustable thigh and lumbar supports are upholstered in Gray Nappa leather (N5TT) with a matching dash pad, door panels, carpets, and M3-embroidered floor mats. Amenities include the Cold Weather Package consisting of heated front seats, retractable headlight washers, and a ski bag, along with automatic climate control, seat memory settings, a tilting/telescoping steering, and a Harman-Kardon CD audio system. An F10 M5 illuminated shift knob and boot have been added.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a variable-redline tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 80k miles, approximately 2k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new, and drive is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. The engine bearing recall was reportedly performed at 7k miles in 2005, and the Vanos filter was replaced by the seller in January 2019. The seller notes the bank one 02 sensor is slow to respond, causing the check engine light to come on, but that service was deferred due to it being intermittent. An oil service was performed in July 2019, and the results of a subsequent oil analysis from Blackstone Laboratories can be viewed in the gallery. Videos showing a cold start and a look under the hood with the engine idling can be viewed here and here.
Additional photos of the underbody are provided in the gallery.
The window sticker shows factory colors and equipment, along with a total suggested retail price of $60,895.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in Wisconsin and Iowa. An open passenger-side airbag recall is shown for January 2020. A walk-around video with views of the exterior and interior is presented below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and finished in silver over grey leather. Options include 19″ wheels, xenon headlights, a sunroof, Harman Kardon sound, and heated seats. The car was sold new from Gebhardt BMW in Boulder, Colorado, and was recently acquired by the seller after time with two previous owners. Service in late 2019 and early 2020 included replacement of the tires, spark plugs, battery, an oxygen sensor, and more. This E46 M3 is offered with records from current ownership, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Kentucky title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-tipped exhaust outlets. The condition of the paint and trim is shown up close in the gallery below.
Staggered-width 19″ wheels wear Yokohama Advan Sport A/S tires that were mounted in October 2019. The car is equipped with xenon headlights and rain-sensing windshield wipers.

The interior is trimmed in Light Grey Nappa leather (N5TT) with brushed aluminum accents and features heated and power-adjustable sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system with a BMW auxiliary input, automatic climate control, and a ski bag.

Gray instrumentation includes a 180-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and a digital odometer showing 98k miles. Approximately 3k miles have been added under current ownership. The air conditioning system was cleaned and its belt replaced in 2020.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features Double VANOS variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm with 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. An oxygen sensor and DME relay were replaced in January 2020, while previous service in October 2019 included a valve adjustment and replacement of the following:

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox. Work in October 2019 included transmission and differential fluid changes, and a subframe inspection was recently performed by Bavarian Machine Specialties in Houston, Texas.
The February 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, listing registration and service events with three owners in Colorado, California and Texas.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
interior_color: Black Nappa Leather with Titan Shadow Trim
listing_details: Black Nappa Leather with Titan Shadow Trim
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible was first registered in Kansas and was relocated in 2005 to Florida, where it was acquired by the seller in 2018. It now shows 80k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG transmission. The car is finished in Alpine White over black Nappa leather and features a replacement black soft top, the Premium Package, a Harman Kardon sound system, heated front seats, and Park Distance Control. The transmission was replaced in July 2019, while the water pump, thermostat, and radiator were replaced in 2018. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered with a car cover, a toolkit, service records, factory literature, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Alpinweiss III (300) and features a replacement black soft top. The Carfax report notes rear-end damage in 2016, though further details are not provided. Aftermarket tint has been applied to the windows, the convertible top pump was reportedly replaced in 2018, and equipment includes xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and clear taillight lenses.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear M badges and are wrapped in Bridgestone Potenza tires showing 2018 date codes.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather and features Titan Shadow trim, heated front seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system with an in-dash CD changer. The seller notes that the driver’s door does not unlock with the keyless remote, and the interior C-pillar covers are torn as shown in the gallery.

A multi-function steering wheel that houses stereo controls fronts instrumentation including a a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer shows 80k miles, approximately 10k of which were added by the seller. A recall for the passenger-side airbag was recently addressed.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The alternator was replaced in 2019, while the water pump, thermostat, radiator, oil pan gasket, drive belt, and valve cover gasket were replaced in 2018.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed sequential gearbox and a limited slip differential. The transmission was replaced in July 2019 by Braman BMW in Miami, Florida.

The March 2020 Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage report in 2016 and displays registration history in Kansas and Florida. A car cover, two keys, a valet key, a toolkit, and service records are included in the sale.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package SMG
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 was first registered in Massachusetts and spent time in Michigan before being brought to California by the seller in 2013. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior, the car shows just 61k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG transmission and a limited-slip differential. Options include the ZCP Competition Package, the Cold Weather Package, heated power-adjustable seats, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and a sunroof. A KW V1 coilover suspension was installed by the seller, and additional work in the last year included replacing the tires, brake pads, and rotors. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records, factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and options include a glass sunroof, xenon headlights with a washing system, fog lights, Park Distance Control, and rain-sensing wipers. The driver’s front fender was repainted by Gava’s Auto Body of San Bruno, California in 2014 due to a rock chip, and the seller installed smoked front corner lenses.

Staggered-width 19″ BBS wheels wear Yokohama Advan Sport A/S tires that were mounted in October 2019 and measure 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. KW V1 coilovers were reportedly installed in 2018, and the right tie rod assembly was replaced at this same time. The ZCP package included larger cross-drilled brakes compared to the standard M3, and new rotors, pads, sensors, and fluid were fitted in September 2019.

The interior is trimmed in black leather with matching door panels and carpets along with milled-effect aluminum accents on the dash and center console. Amenities include an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel with an M Track Mode button, automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, heated and power-adjustable seats, auto-dimming mirrors, and cruise control. A Tranzit Bluetooth kit has been added.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 61k miles, approximately 16k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double-VANOS variable valve timing and was rated from the factory at 333 horsepower. Drive is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. The seller states that the chain tensioner gasket was replaced in March 2018 and the clutch master slave cylinder was replaced in January 2019.
Factory literature, service records, and two keys are included in the sale.

The Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage, shows at least one open recall, and displays registration history in Massachusetts, Michigan, and California through its most recent update in September 2019.
Start-up videos can be viewed above, and driving clips are shown below.

title: 23k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible shows 23k miles and was purchased by the seller in 2018. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a gray leather interior and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox. The car is factory equipped with a black soft top, 19″ wheels, heated sport seats, xenon headlights, and a Harman-Kardon audio system. This E46 is now offered with factory literature, a car cover, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.
The exterior is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic with a black soft top and features xenon headlights, rain-sensing wipers, fog lamps, and quad-exhaust outlets.
Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 225/40 on the front and 255/35 at the rear. The parking brake was tightened in 2018.

The interior is upholstered in gray leather with brushed aluminum shadow trim and gray carpets. Equipment includes power-adjustable heated front seats with lumbar support, as well as cruise control and a Harman-Kardon audio system. The seller states that the driver’s bolster shows dimpling and wear.

The instrumentation set behind the leather-wrapped M Sport steering wheel includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 23k miles, approximately 1,300 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The seller reports service performed in 2018 included a power steering fluid and an oil change.
Additional underbody photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents, at least one open recall, and registration history in Texas, Arizona, and New Jersey.

title: 40k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible was purchased in January 2020 by the selling dealer and shows 40k miles. The car is finished in Alpine White III with a blue soft top over a gray leather interior and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential gearbox. Factory options include xenon headlights, navigation, Harman-Kardon audio, heated front seats, and headlight washers. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered by the selling dealer with factory literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.
The car is finished in Alpine White III (300) with a power-retractable blue soft top. Features include xenon headlights with washers, rain-sensing wipers, fog lamps, and parking sensors.

Factory 19″ double-spoke wheels wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measuring 225/40 at the front and 255/35 at the rear. The selling dealer states that the brake wear sensor, front brake rotors, and the front brake pads were recently changed.

Heated sport seats with lumbar support are upholstered in gray leather (N5TT). Equipment includes M3-embroidered floor mats, carbon-fiber trim, navigation, and a Harman-Kardon CD stereo. The cabin air filter and a window switch were replaced by selling dealer.
Instrumentation features gray dials for the 185-mph speedometer, 9k-rpm tachometer, and oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level gauges. The digital odometer shows 40k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, and power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed Sequential Manual Gearbox (SMG) and an M Variable Lock differential. The selling dealer does not know whether the engine bearing recall has been performed. An oil change was performed by the selling dealer, and the oil filter, thermostat, and oil pump relief valve were also reportedly replaced.
The March 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and at least one open recall.
Soft-top operation footage can be viewed above. A walk-around and in-car driving video can be viewed below. An additional driving clip and walk-around video are also provided.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over a Cinnamon Nappa leather interior and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car previously resided in New York, Hawaii, and North Carolina before being acquired by the seller out of Virginia in 2016. Modifications include Redish Motorsport rear subframe reinforcements, adjustable Koni shocks, a Magnaflow Touring cat-back exhaust system, a short shift kit, and 19″ ZCP wheels. Approximately 20k of the 106k indicated miles have been added under current ownership, and service has included installing a rebuilt VANOS unit with upgraded lines, a new clutch and flywheel, new ignition components, and more. This E46 M3 coupe is offered at no reserve with records beginning in 2013, a service spreadsheet, factory literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and the car is equipped with a factory rear lip spoiler and sunroof. The seller has fitted a set of LED taillights from a later M3 and replaced the trunk emblem, rear quarter window trim, hood and bumper grilles, headlight lenses, and front turn signal lenses. A crack is noted in the paint on the rear bumper, and other finish imperfections are detailed in the image gallery below.

Staggered-width 19″ ZCP wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. Suspension modifications include Koni Yellow adjustable dampers and UUC Motorsports rear trailing arm bushings. Rear subframe reinforcement plates from Redish Motorsport were welded in by Bavarian Auto Group in August 2016, and the subframe bushings were also replaced at that time.

The cabin is upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather (N5ZM) with a black dashboard, carpets, headliner, and center console. The seller has replaced the piano black shifter surround and added a lighted ZHP shift knob along with an AutoSolutions short shift kit with a 20% throw reduction. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, and automatic climate control. The seller installed a factory CD stereo from a 2006 model which adds an AUX input, new floor mats were fitted in preparation for sale, and a factory sun shade was included. The Takata airbag recall was addressed by Gainesville BMW in June 2017.

A factory three-spoke steering wheel with M tri-color stitching fronts a suite of gray instrumentation which includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable-redline. Just over 106k miles are shown on the digital odometer, approximately 21k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is equipped with individual throttle bodies and was factory-rated to produce 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. A replacement VANOS unit was rebuilt by Beisan Systems in 2017 and installed with upgraded lines. A valve adjustment was subsequently performed, and the spark plugs, ignition coils, and plug gaskets were also replaced at that time. A new clutch, flywheel, throw-out bearing, and rear main seal were installed in 2018, and additional maintenance is outlined on a summary spreadsheet in the gallery, which also contains 43 pages of service records beginning in 2003. The underhood sound deadening pad has been removed, but is included.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and displays registration in New York, Hawaii, North Carolina, Virginia, Massachusetts, and Ohio.

title: Chiaretto Red 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is reportedly one of just five imported to North America in Chiaretto Red and was purchased by the seller on BaT in September 2019. The interior is trimmed in Cinnamon leather, and power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed sequential manual transmission. Equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium packages, xenon headlights, and aluminum interior trim. Modifications are said to include Ground Control coilovers, Turner Motorsport rear camber arms, and adjustable front camber plates. Maintenance performed under prior ownership is said to include a July 2019 valve adjustment and VANOS inspection, and the seller has since replaced the rear tires, front and rear brake rotors and pads, and the rearview mirror glass. Now showing 141k miles, this M3 is offered with factory literature, a window sticker, service receipts, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in special-order BMW Individual Chiaretto Red. Exterior options include rain-sensing wipers, xenon headlights with a washing system, and a glass sunroof. The front bumper cover was replaced and the hood was repainted in 2018 during prior ownership to correct flaws. The ‘3’ was removed from the rear badge, the windows are tinted, the driver-side mirror shows discoloration, and chips are noted in the gallery. The seller notes that the headlamp washer cover missing in the photos has since been replaced.

18″ Style 67 wheels wear 245/40 Toyo Proxes T1 Sport tires up front and 275/35 Proxes Sport tires out back. The front tires wear 2015 date codes, and the rears show 2019 date codes. Modifications to the suspension include Ground Control coilovers, Tuner Motorsport rear camber arms, and adjustable camber plates. The seller reportedly installed replacement Performance Friction front and rear slotted brake rotors and pads.

The interior is trimmed in Cinnamon leather with matching doors and black carpets. Aluminum trim accents the doors, dashboard, and center console. Amenities include auto-dimming mirrors, a Harman-Kardon sound system with a CD player, power-adjustable and heated seats, automatic climate control, M3-logo floor mats, and a leather-wrapped multi-function steering wheel with SMG control paddles. The seller replaced the auto-dimming mirror glass and notes that the trunk-mounted tire inflation kit is missing.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 141k miles, 2k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double-VANOS variable valve timing and was rated from the factory at 333 horsepower. It drives the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission. The SMG pump and rod bearings were reportedly replaced during previous ownership, and the spark plugs and drive belts are said to have been replaced prior to the seller’s purchase. A sheet detailing maintenance is provided by the seller in the gallery.
An additional underside photo is available in the gallery below.
The September 2019 Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage and shows registration history in North Carolina and Maryland through its most recent entry in August 2019.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and shows 61k miles. It is finished in Carbon Black over a black leather interior and is equipped with xenon headlamps, a sunroof, 18″ Style 67 wheels, quad exhaust outlets, Park Distance Control, and automatic climate control. The car was acquired in 2017 by the seller, who has since replaced the front suspensions bushings, rear trailing arm bushings, coolant sensors, fluids, and more. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black (416) and features xenon headlights, fog lights, a sunroof, side air vents, a decklid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint chips and imperfections are noted on the front bumper and hood. Damage to the front of the car is listed on the Carfax report in 2018, and the seller states that this was the result of the front bumper being repainted. The driver-side taillight and headlight lenses were replaced by the seller.

The 18″ Style 67 wheels are fitted with staggered Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control and Park Distance Control. The front suspension bushings and rear trailing arm bushings were replaced during the seller’s ownership.

The cockpit features sport seats upholstered in black leather with matching door panels and Titan Shadow trim throughout. Cabin amenities include power-adjustable seats with memory settings for the driver, a multi-function steering wheel, a leather-wrapped shift knob and parking brake handle, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo. The seller notes fading of the rearview mirror.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil temperature, water temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 61k miles, approximately 3,500 of which were added by the seller. An airbag recall was recently addressed.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque. Service during current ownership is said to include a replacement CPV O-ring, coolant sensor, air and fuel filters, engine oil, rear differential fluid, transmission fluid, brake fluid, and coolant. An uninstalled replacement flex disc is included in the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. Additional underbody photos are viewable in the gallery below.

The Carfax report lists registration history in Texas and at least one open recall. Front end damage is shown in March 2018, and the seller states this was a result of the front bumper being repainted in March 2018. There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.
A walk-around video is viewable above and a start-up clip is provided below.

title: Messing Metallic 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is reportedly one of just 14 examples imported to North America that were finished in Messing Metallic. The car was first registered in British Columbia before being brought to the US in 2016 and acquired by the seller last year. Power is supplied by a 3.2L S54 inline-six, and options include power-adjustable and heated seats, xenon headlights, a sunroof, Park Distance Control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The original SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual gearbox by the seller, who also replaced the pinion seal, changed the engine oil, and flushed the differential fluid and coolant. This E46 M3 shows 92k miles and is offered with service records, factory books and manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in special-order BMW Individual Messing Metallic (0490), and the seller states that the front bumper has been repainted due to rock chips. Features include optional xenon headlights, a sunroof, and Park Distance Control. The provided Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

Factory 19″ M Double Spoke wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact DWS Tuned tires, and the seller notes that the rear tires should be replaced soon. Ventilated disc brakes with Dynamic Brake Control came standard.

The cabin is trimmed in black leather (N5SW) with brushed-aluminum trim on the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Factory equipment includes power-adjustable and heated seats with memory settings for the driver as well as automatic climate control, a multi-function steering wheel, Harman Kardon sound system, and a ZHP shift knob with an Alcantara boot. Wear is noted on the steering wheel as shown in the gallery below.

Gray instrumentation includes an M-branded 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 92k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. The factory SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual gearbox by Performance Eurowerks of Buffalo Grove, Illinois in 2020, and photos documenting the process are provided in the gallery below. Service in June 2019 reportly included a new acceleration sensor, steering angle sensor, battery, starter inhibitor switch, and fuel cap. Additional work under the seller’s ownership included replacing the pinion seal, performing an oil change, and flushing the differential fluid and coolant.
The March 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents or other issues and shows registration in British Columbia, Michigan, and Illinois. A walk-around video is provided below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather and cloth interior and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car was ordered without a sunroof, and equipment includes staggered 19″ ZCP wheels, manually-adjustable front seats, Titanium Shadow interior trim, and a Harman Kardon sound system. It was previously registered in Pennsylvania and New Jersey before being recently acquired by the selling dealer. Now showing 70k miles, this E46 M3 coupe is offered in California with a toolkit, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a New Jersey title.
The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and is equipped with halogen headlights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-tipped exhaust outlets.
Staggered-width 19″ ZCP wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza Re970AS tires showing 2015 date codes.

The interior is trimmed in Black Nappa leather and Anthracite Impulse cloth with an Anthracite headliner and Titanium Shadow trim. Options include manually-adjustable front seats, a multi-function steering wheel, automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a premium Harman Kardon sound system.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows approximately 70k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The engine bearing recall has reportedly been addressed, and an oil change was performed at BMW of Springfield in New Jersey in November 2019.
The March 2020 Carfax report shows history in Pennsylvania and New Jersey and lists no accidents or other reported damage. A narrated driving video is shown below.

title: Supercharged 2006 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is an Imola Red coupe powered by a Dinan-supercharged 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox and a locking differential. Additional Dinan components installed under previous ownership include throttle bodies, an engine control unit flash, lowering springs, sway bars, an exhaust system, and more. The car was acquired by the seller through an October 2019 BaT auction, and subsequent work included resurfacing the flywheel as well as installation of a new clutch, a short shift kit, and a carbon fiber front splitter. This E46 M3 shows 109k miles and is offered with a Carfax report and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imolarot 2 (405) and features trunk lid and roof-mounted spoilers, LED taillights, and xenon headlights. Window tinting was added under previous ownership as well as black grilles and side vents, while a carbon fiber splitter was installed by the seller. The Carfax report lists a 2012 accident resulting in damage to multiple areas, and the front bumper cover and fenders have been repainted. Several broken bumper cover clips and a dent in the right rocker panel were noted in the previous listing as well as separation of the rear quarter window moldings.

Stock 18″ Style 67 wheels were refinished under previous ownership and measure 18″x9″ at each corner. Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires are fitted all around. Suspension modifications consist of Bilstein shock absorbers as well as Dinan lowering springs and sway bars. Stainless steel brake hoses have also been installed.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with the dashboard, shifter surround, and door panels featuring brushed aluminum accents. Amenities include heated sport seats with lumbar support and driver-side position memory as well as a sunroof, Harman Kardon sound system, and a Dinan short shift kit and pedal covers.

Gray instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 109k miles, approximately 2k of which have been added by the seller since November 2019.

A Dinan supercharger and throttle bodies have been fitted to the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six along with a Dinan ECU flash and exhaust system with a Status Gruppe mid-pipe. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a factory M Variable Lock differential. Work performed by BTR Racing in Northbrook, Illinois is said to have included installation of a South Bend Stage 3 clutch and resurfacing the flywheel as well as an oil change and general inspection.

The April 2020 Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident in March 2012 and additional history with three owners in Colorado, South Carolina, and Illinois. Cold-start and driving videos are viewable below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Titanium Silver Metallic over Black Leather
listing_details: Titanium Silver Metallic over Black Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver over a black Nappa leather interior, and power is supplied by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a square set of 18″ x 9″ Style 67 alloy wheels with rear spacers, Tein lowering springs, LED taillights, a 3M carbon-fiber wrap on the roof, and a Status Gruppe SCZA muffler. Factory features include a trunk spoiler, xenon headlamps, power-adjustable heated front seats, a sunroof, and a Harman Kardon stereo. The car has been registered in Missouri or Kansas since new, and the seller purchased it in 2014 and reportedly has added nearly 22k of its 132k indicated miles. The valve-cover gasket, front and rear brakes, sway-bar links, and struts and shocks are said to have been replaced under current ownership. This E46 M3 is offered with a factory tool kit, spare interior parts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Missouri title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features side moldings, a trunk-lip spoiler, front fender vents, a power sunroof, tinted windows, xenon headlamps, rain-sensing wipers, and fog lights. The seller notes a dime-sized rust spot below the trunk lid, which can be seen up close in the photo gallery below.

Factory 18″ x 9″ Style 67 alloy wheels have been fitted at all four corners in place of the original staggered set, and Apex 12mm spacers have been installed at the rear wheels. The mounted set of Sailun Atrezzo SVA1 tires show 2017 date codes. Additional aftermarket features include Tein lowering springs, a 3M dry carbon-fiber wrap applied on the roof, and LED taillights. The sway-bar links, Sachs struts and shocks, and the front and rear brakes are said to have been replaced under current ownership.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather (N5SW) and includes power-adjustable heated front seats that show wear. The seller will include spare vent-window switches as well as an illuminated shift knob and boot to replace the currently fitted worn items. Additional interior amenities include the Cold Weather Package, carpeted floor mats, a factory Harman Kardon stereo, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped M Sport multi-function steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with an illuminated variable redline. The digital odometer shows 132k miles, approximately 21,500 of which reportedly have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. Output was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The spark plugs and ignition coils reportedly were replaced under current ownership, and the rear differential and transmission were also serviced. The seller is said to have replaced the valve-cover gasket, changed the oil, and rotated the tires within the past twelve months.
A Status Gruppe SCZA rear muffler section has been fitted. Additional photos of the underbody are available in the gallery.

The March 2020 Carfax report is free of accidents and other damage, and it includes entries for service and registration in Missouri and Kansas over four owners. A Takata-related airbag recall was issued in January 2020.
An exterior walk-around video can be viewed above, and a cold-start video also has been provided.

title: 47k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe reportedly was purchased new by the seller’s neighbor from BMW of Murray, Utah and was acquired in 2009 by the seller, who has added 19k of its 47k miles. The car is finished in Alpine White III over a Cinnamon Nappa leather interior, and it is powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Factory options include the Cold Weather and Premium Packages, Park Distance Control, bi-xenon headlights, and Harman Kardon audio. Modifications include 19″ BBS CH wheels, an aFe air intake, a carbon-fiber strut brace, Borla exhaust, Ground Control suspension, and a Rogue Engineering short shift kit. This E46 M3 is now offered with removed factory parts, service records, factory manuals, its window sticker, BMW car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Utah title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300), and equipment includes xenon headlights with washers, a sunroof, rain-sensing wipers, fog lamps, and parking sensors. The seller states that the front air dam was replaced by the original owner, and the driver-side front fender was repaired and refinished after a raccoon knocked an object into it while parked in the garage. Clear film is applied behind the lower wheel arches, and the provided Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.

19″ BBS CH wheels are mounted with staggered Michelin Pilot Sport tires. A Ground Control suspension kit and a carbon-fiber front strut brace have been added, and braking is handled by slotted and ventilated rotors. The factory 18″ wheels are included in the sale along with the removed factory suspension components.

The cockpit features power-adjustable heated sport seats upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather (N5ZM) with matching door panels and contrasting black carpets and dashboard. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, the Premium Package, automatic climate control, Titanium Shadow trim, a ski bag, M3-branded floor mats, and a premium Harman Kardon sound system. The seller reports that the airbag recall was completed within the past year, the CD changer is inoperable, and the air-conditioning system requires service with refrigerant.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts instrumentation that features gray dials for the 185-mph speedometer, 9k-rpm tachometer, and other gauges. The digital odometer shows just under 47k miles, approximately 19k of which were added by the seller over the past 11 years.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Modifications include an aFe air intake, a Borla exhaust system, and a Rogue Engineering short shift kit. The removed factory parts are said to be included in the sale.
Additional photos of the underbody are viewable in the gallery below.
The window sticker lists production data, factory colors, optional equipment, and a total retail price of $53,670.
The April 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other issues along with two registered owners in Utah.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over a black Nappa leather interior and was acquired by the seller in 2018. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG transmission that has been modified with an SMG tune from Tuning Tech FS. The car is equipped with the Competition Package, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and heated seats. Service in 2019 included new rear tires and replacement of the air conditioning low pressure line. This E46 M3 shows 104k miles and is now offered with service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Wisconsin title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30), and options include a glass sunroof, xenon headlights with a washing system, fog lights, Park Distance Control, and rain-sensing wipers. The seller notes that the front bumper is in need of a repaint following a parking lot incident in 2019. The trunk was replaced following an accident in 2013 that is shown on the Carfax report, which also lists an additional front-end damage incident in 2014.

Factory 19″ M Cross Spoke wheels show some curb rash. Continental ExtremeContact tires are fitted up front, and the Achilles ATR Sport rear tires were mounted around 4k miles ago. The rear springs were reportedly replaced at 98k miles.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with a matching dash, door panels, and carpets, and WeatherTech floor mats are fitted. Amenities include automatic climate control, heated and power-adjustable seats, auto-dimming mirrors, and cruise control. The low pressure line for the air conditioning is said to have been replaced, and the system recharged. A Dynavin N6 head unit is installed in the factory position.

The three-spoke steering wheel has been re-covered and fitted with aftermarket shift paddles. Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 104k miles, about 14k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double-VANOS variable valve timing and was rated at 333 horsepower when new. Drive is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission said to be modified with a tune from Tuning Tech FS. The seller states the SMG adapdations have been reset, and that maintenance during his ownership included cleaning the throttle body and idle air control valve, as well as replacement of the starter, the “salmon” relay, the thermostat, a VANOS solenoid, and the spark plugs and coil packs.
The passenger side muffler hanger has also been replaced. Additional underbody and rear subframe photos can be viewed in the gallery.

The April 2020 Carfax report lists registration history in Tennessee, Georgia, North Carolina, Illinois, and Wisconsin, along with the previously mentioned damage reports in 2013 and 2014. A series of videos have been provided below.
