title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is finished in silver over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a replacement six-speed manual transmission. Additional modifications include 17″ APEX ARC-8 wheels, a CSL-style rear diffuser, Ground Control coilovers and camber plates, adjustable yellow Koni shocks, a TTFS ECU tune, a Mishimoto electric fan, a flex fuel kit, an aftermarket audio system, and more. This E46 M3 shows 119k miles and is offered by the selling dealer with a clean Carfax report and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features tinted windows, a CSL-style carbon fiber rear diffuser, xenon headlights, and smoked front turn signal lenses as well as black kidney grilles and fender vents. Blemishes include a scuff on the right front bumper cover, a scratch on the left rear quarter panel, and a broken side molding on the driver’s door.

Gunmetal 17″ APEX ARC-8 wheels wear BFGoodrich g-Force Comp-2 A/S tires in a square setup. The suspension has reportedly been modified with polyurethane bushings as well as Ground Control coilovers using yellow Koni Sport dampers and 440/550-lb. springs.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather with matching carpets and plastics. Appointments include power-adjustable sport seats, automatic climate control, and an aftermarket audio system consisting of an Alpine head unit and Type S speakers, JL Audio subwoofers, and two Rockford Fosgate Punch amplifiers.

A multi-function sport steering wheel frames gray-faced instrumentation that includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows approximately 119k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission that was reportedly installed under previous ownership to replace the factory SMG gearbox. The following items have been installed according to the selling dealer:
The November 2019 Carfax report shows six owners in several southern states and Arizona, listing no accidents or other damage from November 2002 to November 2019.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car was sold new at VOB Auto Sales in Rockville, Maryland, and moved to Virginia, Kentucky, and Texas prior to the seller’s acquisition in 2015. Modifications include Tein S-Tech lowering springs, Koni shocks, black kidney and side grilles, 19″ Style 163 wheels, ZCP brake rotors, and an AFE cold air intake. This E46 M3 now has 124k miles and is sold at no reserve with factory manuals, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The Titanium Silver Metallic paint is shown up close in gallery photographs below. A rear lip spoiler is affixed to the trunk lid, and the car features black kidney grilles and side grilles. Body-colored front bumper reflectors are fitted, though the driver-side item is broken. The Carfax report shows a rear impact in January 2007 that is described as resulting in minor to moderate damage.

This is a re-list after the car previously sold on BaT in December 2019 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with his commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the car. The winner has been banned from future participation on BaT, and his buyer’s fee was not refunded.

Factory 19″ Style 163 forged alloy wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires, which show date codes from 2016 up front and 2017 out back. Tein S-Tech lowering springs and Koni shocks have been installed, though the shocks are said to need replacement. ZCP brake rotors have also been installed.

Power-adjustable black leather sport seats feature driver’s memory and are complemented by high-gloss black trim on the dash and door panels. The car is also equipped with an electric sunroof, multi-function leather steering wheel, Business CD radio, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The seller reports that the rear portion of the headliner is sagging.
Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and 9k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer shows 124k miles, and the seller has added around 25k miles during four years of ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated for 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. An AFE cold air intake has been installed. A recent Blackstone Labs oil report has been provided by the seller and can be viewed in the gallery.
The inner trunk panels are shown above. The seller notes the yaw rate sensor for the DSC system was replaced following the previous auction.
Service records dating back to 2002 are included along with the factory manuals and the removed kidney and side grilles.
The Carfax report lists the previously mentioned accident in 2007 and shows entries in Maryland, Virginia, Kentucky, and Texas. Cold-start and driving videos are viewable below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was first registered in Maryland and was recently acquired out of Virginia by the Ohio-based selling dealer. The car is finished in black over a black Nappa leather interior and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual gearbox. Features include the Premium Package, the Cold Weather Package, a Harmon Kardon Premium sound system, xenon headlamps with washers, and 19″ APEX wheels. This E46 M3 now shows 145k miles and is offered at no reserve with two keys, service records, a copy of the window sticker, a Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.
The body is finished in Schwarz II and the Carfax report shows an accident in 2015 that resulted in damage to the rear of the car. Finish flaws captured in the gallery include scrapes and rock chips.
APEX 19″ EC-7 alloy wheels wear 235/35 Velozza ZXV4 front and 255/30 Sumitomo HTR ZII rear tires. Service in 2016 included replacement of the left front lower control arm and front shock absorbers.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with aluminum trim on the dashboard, door panels, and center console. Features include heated and power-adjustable front seats, a leather-wrapped steering wheel, an electric sunroof, and a Harmon Kardon Premium sound system. The passenger airbag was replaced in August 2015.

Instrumentation consists of an M-branded 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer shows 145k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new and routes power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The camshaft gears, VANOS adjuster assembly, and the timing chain tensioner were replaced in April 2012, and the fuel pump was replaced in November 2016. The selling dealer states that an oil change was performed and the oil level sensor was replaced in preparation for the sale.
Additional underside photos can be viewed in the gallery.
The April 2020 Carfax report shows the 2015 accident, at least one open recall, and registration history in Maryland and Virginia. A walk-around clip is provided below.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was purchased in February 2020 by the seller and shows 76k miles. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather interior, and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Factory options include Dynamic Stability Control, powered front seats, xenon headlights, an electric sunroof, and Harman-Kardon audio. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with service receipts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features xenon headlights, rain-sensing wipers, fog lamps, parking sensors, and a power sunroof. Paint chips and other imperfections are detailed in the gallery.
The 18″ double-spoke wheels wear General G-Max tires measuring 225/45 at the front and 255/40 at the rear. The finish on the rear wheels is peeling.

Powered sport seats with driver-side memory are upholstered in black Nappa leather. Equipment includes M3-embroidered floor mats, brushed aluminum trim, and a Harman-Kardon audio system. The sunroof screen is said to be inoperative, and the headliner is sagging.

Instrumentation features gray dials for the 185-mph speedometer, 9k-rpm tachometer, and oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level gauges. The digital odometer shows 76k miles, approximately 200 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Maintenance history includes a valve adjustment in 2018, and a replacement throttle control actuator in 2019. The engine bearing recall has reportedly been addressed.
The April 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and at least one open recall.

title: 14k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe shows 14k miles and is finished in Imola Red II over a black Nappa leather interior. The car was sold new from Vista Motor Company in Coconut Creek, Florida and was acquired by the seller in 2006. Power is provided by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and options include the ZCP Competition Package, power seats with memory, a glass moonroof, xenon headlights, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Work carried out in the past year is said to have included a new battery and an engine oil change. This ZCP M3 is now offered with service records from new, factory manuals, the window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

Just 2,410 US-market M3s were produced with the Competition Package for 2005 and 2006, and this example is finished in Imola Red II (405). A glass moonroof was optioned along with automatic xenon headlights. Paint meter readings are shown in the gallery below, and finish flaws are highlighted up close. The provided Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. Walk-around videos are provided here and here.

19″ Style 163 wheels were included with the Competition Package and were mounted in 2014 with Nitto Invo tires showing 2013 date codes. The ZCP option also added an upgraded steering rack along with larger cross-drilled brake rotors.

The cabin features aluminum-finish trim and power-adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather. Equipment includes an optional Harman Kardon audio system, M3-branded floor mats, a ZHP shift knob with an Alcantara shift boot, and an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel with a button to engage M-Track Mode. An interior video is provided here.

Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer shows just under 14k miles, 12k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Drive is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The seller states a new battery was recently fitted, and an oil change was carried out in May 2020. A video showing the engine running is available here.
Additional photos of the underbody, suspension, and exhaust are viewable below.
The window sticker lists production data, factory colors, optional equipment, and a total price of $59,265.
The April 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents and shows history in Florida and New Jersey. An airbag related recall notice is also listed. The below video provides an in-car ride along.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new at Nick Alexander BMW in Los Angeles, California and has remained with its original owner since. Power is from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and the car is finished in silver over black leather. Equipment includes 19″ wheels, a sunroof, xenon headlights, and aluminum interior trim as well as modifications said to include KW coilovers, an Eibach camber kit, and a CSL-style front lip spoiler. This E46 M3 is offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of its original owner with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features a CSL-style single-piece front lip spoiler as well as xenon headlights and black fender vents. The Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage.

Staggered-width 19″ factory wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires in the front and Michelin Pilot Sport rubber in the rear. Modifications reportedly include KW Clubsport coilovers and an Eibach camber kit.

Power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in Black Nappa leather (N5SW), and feature adjustable thigh support and side bolsters as well as driver’s position memory. Aluminum accents adorn the dash, doors, and center console. Equipment includes a Harman Kardon audio system, automatic climate control, and a power-operated sunroof.

A multi-function sport steering wheel frames gray-faced instrumentation consisting of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows approximately 55k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The water pump and gasket are said to have been replaced under current ownership.

The April 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage and shows one owner through its most recent entry in April 2016, which lists mileage higher than that currently shown on the odometer due to a clerical error according to the seller.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black and was acquired in 2019 by the seller, who has added 3k of the 140k miles shown. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and the car is equipped with a glass sunroof, automatic climate control, power-adjustable front seats, and Harman-Kardon audio, and modifications reportedly include an axle-back exhaust system and aftermarket taillights. This E46 M3 is now offered with removed parts, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Utah title.

The exterior is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic (445) and features an electric sunroof, fog lights, xenon headlights, a black grille, black fender vents, a decklid spoiler, aftermarket taillights, and quad-exhaust outlets. The stock grille, fender vents, and taillights are included in the sale. The included Carfax report lists damage to the front of the car in August 2014 and an accident in November 2015 involving the right rear of the car.

Factory 18″ M Double Spoke wheels wear Continental SureContact RX tires. A subframe reinforcement kit has been installed, and the car is reportedly equipped with Turner Motorsport front control arm bushings.

The seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather. Interior equipment includes power front seats, Harman-Kardon audio, automatic climate control, a replacement headliner, an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel, a short shifter, and a ZHP shift knob. The driver-side window switch is loose, and the speaker grille trim in the door panels is cracked.

The dashboard houses the climate controls and a BMW Business CD stereo connected to a trunk-mounted subwoofer. Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 140k miles, 3k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The seller states that the engine bearing recall has been performed, and work performed in July 2017 included the installation of a replacement VANOS pump disc and seals. More recent work is said to have included an oil change, fluid changes for the transmission and differential, and the installation of a replacement engine air filter.
Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery below.

The Carfax report shows five owners, at least one open recall, the damage report from August 2014, and the accident report from November 2015. There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

title: Original-Owner 18k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller from Rasmussen BMW in Portland, Oregon and now shows just under 18k miles. The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic with a black soft top over a black leather interior and is powered by a 3.2L S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential gearbox. Factory options include the Cold Weather Package, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, and Harman Kardon audio. An oil change and inspection were performed in March 2020. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered with service records, factory manuals, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Steel Grey Metallic (400) with a power-operated black soft top. Features include xenon headlights with washers, fog lamps, rain-sensing wipers, and Park Distance Control. The provided Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Sport Plus tires measuring 225/40 on the front and 255/35 at the rear.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim and matching carpets. Equipment includes power-adjustable heated front seats with lumbar support, as well as cruise control, automatic climate control, M3-branded floor mats, and a Harman Kardon audio system.

Gray instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 18k miles.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed Sequential Manual Gearbox (SMG) and an M Variable Lock differential. Maintenance in March 2020 by Flow BMW in Winston Salem, North Carolina included an oil change and an inspection.
The April 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents or other issues and shows history in Oregon, Ohio, and North Carolina.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in metallic black over  brown leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Additional equipment includes a factory limited-slip differential, a power-retractable soft top, xenon headlights, heated and power-adjustable sport seats, a Kenwood touchscreen stereo, a Gruppe M intake, and more. The car was recently acquired by the selling dealer with 119k indicated miles following time in the southern US and two Canadian provinces. This E46 M3 is offered at no reserve with a factory wind deflector, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington State title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features an aftermarket front splitter and side skirts, xenon headlights, fog lamps, and black grille surrounds as well as smoked taillights and turn signals. The power-retractable cloth top houses a heated glass window and can be seen both raised and lowered. Tint film has been applied to the rear and quarter glass.

Staggered-width 20″ wheels wear polished hardware, carbon fiber-style BMW roundels, and Achilles ATR Sport tires. The suspension has been lowered, and a strut tower brace with Motorsport-branded hardware caps is fitted underhood. Stopping power is provided by eight-piston Rotora front and factory rear brake calipers paired with cross-drilled and slotted rotors.

The cabin is upholstered in cinnamon leather with two-tone door panels and a black dash, while a gloss black coating covers the factory brushed aluminum trim. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable sport seats, automatic climate control, a Kenwood navigation system, touchscreen media players in each headrest, and a trunk-mounted enclosure with JL Audio W6 subwoofers.

Gray instrumentation framed by a multi-function steering wheel consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 119k miles. A factory wind deflector is included in the sale.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A Gruppe M carbon fiber ram air intake system and an aftermarket carbon fiber valve cover were installed under previous ownership.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M-Variable limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underbody are available in the gallery below.

The April 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration and service history in Ohio, Florida, Georgia, Quebec, and British Columbia. Driving and walk around videos can be viewed below.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was leased new in Medford, Oregon, where it remained registered with two owners through 2019 before coming to the Southeast. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and features include the Premium and Cold Weather packages, brushed aluminum trim, 19″ M Sport wheels with Michelin Pilot Sport 4 tires, and a factory stereo with Harman Kardon audio. Rod bearing and airbag recalls have been performed, while pre-purchase inspections were carried out at 83k and 94k miles.The car was acquired by the seller in early 2019 and has since been driven approximately 11k of its 94k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is offered in Georgia with service records, manufacturer’s literature, a window sticker, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) with Shadowline window trim. The front bumper cover and a side skirt are said to have been refinished prior to paint correction and ceramic coating, and the seller notes that the taillight bulb covers have been replaced along with the fender liners and side-view mirrors. The right headlight washer clip is missing along with a piece of one of the painted reflectors, and chips and other imperfections are detailed in the gallery below. Most recently,  the headlight trim was replaced and the side skirt fitment was corrected.

Features include xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and fog lamps as well as black kidney grille surrounds and fender vents. Staggered-width 19″ Competion Package wheels are powder-coated in Kaiser Silver and wear a set of Contisportcontact 5 SSR tires with 2017 and 2018 date codes. Tire rub was corrected with an alignment, while the differential fluid was recently changed with BMW fluid with friction modifier. A brake fluid flush was performed in the past 10k miles.

The interior was initially Dove Grey, but was swapped to black leather by the current owner. It features brushed aluminum trim and the Cold Weather and Premium packages with heated and power-adjustable sport seats, a ski pass-through, a glass sunroof, and other items. Wear is noted on the aluminum trim along with specks of blue paint on the driver’s seat. The F80 M5 shift knob that may disconnect when pushed into reverse, though a factory knob is included. The sunroof shade has been repaired and the rear window gaskets, C-pillar trim, and A-pillar airbag cover replaced.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 94k miles, approximately 11k of which were added by the seller since early 2019. Driver’s and passenger’s airbag recalls have been performed according to included records.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque and drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. A rod bearing recall was performed in 2004, while inspections conducted at 82k and 93k miles were followed by replacement of the valve cover gasket, intake and fuel filters, spark plugs, and air filter as well as transmission and differential fluid changes. Results from a June 2019 Blackstone oil analysis are provided in the gallery along with other records.
The window sticker records delivery to Medford BMW in Oregon along with standard and optional equipment for a total price of $55,760.
The April 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists three registered owners from new. Three videos are provided by the seller below.

title: 14k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible was delivered new to BMW of Beaumont, Texas and remained in the state with its original owner through 2018. Finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon leather, the car shows just 14k miles and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes bi-xenon headlights, heated front seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Services have been performed to address the rod bearing and airbag recalls, and the factory wheels were recently refinished. This E46 M3 is offered by the selling dealer in San Diego, California with the window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) with a black soft top that can be seen both raised and lowered in the photo gallery below. The front and rear bumpers have reportedly been repainted, and the selling dealer performed paintless dent repair around the driver-side rocker panel. Blemishes are pointed out by the seller in the gallery, which also contains several paint meter readings from around the body.
Factory 19” Style 67 alloy wheels were recently refinished and are mounted with Nitto tires measuring 225/40 in the front and 255/35 in the rear.
The interior is trimmed in Cinnamon leather (N5ZM) with a black dashboard and carpets. Amenities include heated front seats, brushed aluminum trim, and a Harman Kardon premium sound system.

Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, a digital odometer, and more. Approximately 14k miles are shown, around 300 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features variable valve timing and produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Shifting is through a Getrag six-speed manual transmission. The selling dealer notes that the rod bearing recall repair was performed in April 2014 at 13k miles, and the airbag recall was addressed in May 2020.
The seller notes areas of corrosion on the underbody, photos of which can be viewed in the gallery below.
The included window sticker shows factory options and an MSRP of $57,995.

The Carfax report shows services and inspections in Texas through 2018 and displays no accidents or other incidents of damage. Videos provided by the seller are presented below, and show the exterior and interior of the car.

title: Supercharged 2006 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 is an Imola Red coupe that was sold new in Colorado and modified with numerous Dinan components by its original owner, including a supercharger for the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six. Additional Dinan items include an ECU flash, throttle bodies, lowering springs, sway bars, an exhaust system, and more. The car is also equipped with a six-speed manual transmission and a locking differential, and it was acquired by the seller on BaT in October 2019. Subsequent maintenance included resurfacing the flywheel and installing a short shift kit, carbon fiber front splitter, and a new clutch. This E46 M3 now shows 109k miles and is offered with a Carfax report and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imolarot 2 (405) and features trunk lid and roof-mounted spoilers, as well as LED taillights and xenon headlights. Window tinting was added during previous ownership along with black grilles and side vents, while a carbon fiber splitter was installed by the seller. The Carfax report lists a 2012 accident that resulted in damage to multiple areas, and the front bumper cover and fenders have been repainted. Several broken bumper cover clips and a dent in the right rocker panel were noted in the previous listing, along with separation of the rear quarter window moldings.

This is a re-list after the car previously sold on BaT in April 2020 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with his commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the car. The winner has been banned from future participation on BaT, and his buyer’s fee was not refunded.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels measure 9″ in width all around and were refinished during previous ownership. They wear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. Suspension modifications include Dinan lowering springs and sway bars, as well as Bilstein shock absorbers. Stainless steel brake hoses have also been installed.

The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather and features brushed aluminum trim on the dashboard, shifter surround, and door panels. Amenities include heated sport seats with lumbar support and driver-side position memory, as well as a sunroof, Harman Kardon sound system, and a Dinan short shift kit and pedal covers.

Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer and tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 109k miles, approximately 2k of which have been added by the seller since November 2019.

A Dinan supercharger and throttle bodies have been fitted to the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six, along with a Dinan ECU flash and exhaust system with a Status Gruppe mid-pipe. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a factory M Variable Lock differential. Work performed by BTR Racing of Northbrook, Illinois in January 2020 included installing a South Bend Stage 3 clutch, resurfacing the flywheel, replacing the spark plugs, and changing the oil.
A Blackstone oil report from May 2020 has been provided by the seller, as shown above.

The April 2020 Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident in March 2012, as well as additional history with three owners in Colorado, South Carolina, and Illinois. Cold-start, engine idling, and driving videos are viewable below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Dinan S2 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was first delivered to Irvine BMW in California, and later spent time in Missouri before it was recently purchased by the seller and relocated to North Carolina. It now has 80k miles, and it is finished in triple black and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car features Dinan S2 performance upgrades to the engine and suspension, and additional equipment includes 19″ VMR wheels, navigation, as well as the Premium and Cold Weather packages. Service in 2018 included replacement of the rod bearings and the VANOS actuator. This Dinan-modified E46 is now offered with factory literature, service records, a Davis Report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Schwarz 2 (668) with a black soft top. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, tinted windows, a rear lip spoiler, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, a Euro short antenna, black front bumper reflectors, and M3 and Dinan badging.

VMR 19″ staggered-width wheels are black-finished and wear Bridgestone Potenza RE760 Sport tires measuring 245/35 up front and 275/30 out back. Dinan suspension modifications include Koni adjustable dampers as well as Dinan lowering springs, camber plates, front and rear strut tower braces, and an adjustable 27mm front sway bar. Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts and trailing arm bushings are also fitted.

The interior features black Nappa leather on the seats and door panels as well as black carpets. Brushed aluminum trim accents the dashboard, center console, and doors. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front seats, a Harman-Kardon sound system, navigation, automatic climate control, Dinan-logo floor mats, and a Dynavin double-DIN head unit. The seller states that the car is pre-wired for iPhone and Valentine One devices.

The leather-wrapped multi-function steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer shows 80k miles, approximately 1,300 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features Dinan modifications including a high-flow intake and air-mass meter, larger throttle bodies, a high-flow exhaust, removal of the speed limiter, and revised engine software. The seller states that a Rogue Engineering Rasp pipe and X-pipe are also fitted, and maintenance performed in November 2018 included replacement of the VANOS actuator, the rod bearings, the crankshaft seal, and the camshaft position sensor.
The Dinan S2 plaque on the radiator support carries serial number S20652.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and additional Dinan modifications include a 3.91 rear axle. Additional underside photos are available in the gallery below, and an Autosolutions 20% short shift kit and Rogue Engineering transmission mounts have been fitted.

Factory literature from BMW and Dinan, magazine reviews, service records, a Davis Report, and results from a recent inspection report from Hendrick BMW in Charlotte, North Carolina are also included in the sale.
The May 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage and shows registration in California, Missouri, and North Carolina.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe has been registered in California from new and was acquired by the seller in 2006. The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed sequential gearbox. Equipment includes 19″ wheels, a sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a factory CD player. This E46 M3 indicates 99k miles and is offered at no reserve with two keys with integrated remotes, a valet key, manufacturer’s literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) and features xenon headlights, fog lamps, LED taillights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, rear parking sensors, quad-exit exhaust outlets, and a decklid spoiler. Detailed photos of the finish, trim, and lenses can be viewed in the gallery below.
Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS tires all around. The front strut assemblies were replaced in November 2017. Curb rash is visible on all four wheels.

The cabin is upholstered in black Nappa leather with a matching dash, door panels, and carpets, the latter of which are protected by black and tan coco mats. Amenities include power-adjustable seats as well as automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a BMW Business CD player. The seller notes the trunk-mounted CD changer is inoperable.

Gray M-branded instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline as well as gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The odometer indicates just under 99k miles, of which approximately 78k have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is equipped with individual throttle bodies and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm. Drive is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential gearbox which was fitted with a replacement hydraulic pump in November 2017 at 92k miles. Service performed in 2018 included replacement of the oil pan and changes of the transmission and differential fluids.
Manufacturer’s literature is included in the sale.

The May 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists emissions testing, registration, and service history with three total owners in California. The airbag recalls were reportedly addressed at a BMW dealership in June 2020.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: The 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over black and is powered by a 3.2L inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car was first registered in California and later spent time in Hawaii before returning to California, where it was acquired by the seller one year ago. Modifications include a CSL front bumper and rear trunk lid, 18″ Apex ARC-8 wheels, Ground Control coilovers, and a Rogue Engineering exhaust, as well as a Dinan intake system, throttle body, front strut bar, pulley, and ECU software. The VANOS system has reportedly been rebuilt, and the rod bearings are said to have been replaced in the last year. Now showing 85k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with service records, factory manuals, removed factory parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue and is fitted with a CSL rear trunk lid and front bumper with a custom carbon fiber lip. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, tinted windows, and a Vorsteiner GTS3 lower rear diffuser. The seller states that the taillight assemblies, headlight lenses, and gaskets have been replaced, along with the front and side grilles. Rock chips are noted on the front fascia, and the factory front bumper and trunk lid are included in the sale.

Apex 18″ ARC-8 wheels are wrapped in Bridgestone Potenza RE-71R tires sized 265/35. Ground Control coilovers and a Dinan front strut bar have been added, and the front control arm bushings and steering rack coupling joints have reportedly been replaced. Braking is handled by gloss black calipers with cross-drilled rotors and stainless steel brake lines.

The original gray interior was swapped with black leather seats and matching door panels and carpets. The Premium package adds heated and power-adjustable sport seats, a ski pass-through, and a glass sunroof, while additional equipment includes piano black trim, an Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel, an Autosolutions Ultimate short shift kit, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The center console and armrest have been removed.

Gray instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 85k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the seller over the past year.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A Dinan air intake system, throttle body, pulley, and ECU software have reportedly been added, along with a Mishimoto aluminum radiator and electric fan. The clutch and shifter bushings were replaced at 81k miles by Edge Motorworks of Dublin, California in 2016. According to the seller, the rod bearings were replaced at 84k miles and the VANOS system was rebuilt by Beisan Systems during prior ownership.

Subframe reinforcement has been added, as has a Rogue Engineering Diablo exhaust system and a Custom Performance Innovations Rasp Terminator. A leak is noted on the rear axle seal, and additional photos of the underbody and suspension are viewable below.
Service records are included in the sale.
The June 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents and shows history in California and Hawaii. A walk-around video is provided below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 is finished in black over grey leather and was acquired by the selling dealer in May 2020 following time in New Jersey and Pennsylvania. The car is powered by 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and equipped with a power-operated black convertible top, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, automatic climate control, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. A rod bearing recall was completed in March 2017 and the valves were adjusted within the last year. This E46 M3 indicates 44k miles and is offered in New York with two keys, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a DCS report, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Schwarz 2 (668) and features xenon headlights, fog lamps, fender vents, four exhaust outlets, and a black power-retractable soft top that can be seen raised and lowered. Photos of paint meter readings from multiple panels can be viewed in the gallery below, and a a walk-around video has been provided by the selling dealer.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear 225/45 and 255/40 Toyo tires that show date codes from 2016 and 2020. The brake rotors, pads, and sensors at each corner were replaced in preparation for the sale along with completion of a fluid flush.

The cabin is trimmed in Grey Nappa leather (N5TT) with matching carpets, and the dash and door panels are accented with Titan Shadow trim. Amenities include power-adjustable front sport seats, automatic climate control, an onboard computer, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. The selling dealer has provided an underhood and interior tour video.

A three-spoke M Sport steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The odometer indicates 44k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower at 7,900 rpm and 262 lb-ft of torque at 4,900 rpm when new. A rod bearing factory recall was completed in March 2017 at 36k miles, and a valve adjustment was performed in 2019. An oil and filter change was carried out by the selling dealer shortly after their acquisition.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The transmission and differential fluids have also been replaced by the selling dealer. Additional underbody photos can be viewed below.

The June 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists emissions testing, registration and service history in New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Three open recall campaigns are also noted. A driving video has been provided below.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over cinnamon leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Additional equipment includes a factory limited-slip differential, a power-retractable soft top, xenon headlights, heated and power-adjustable sport seats, a Kenwood touchscreen stereo, a Gruppe M intake, and more. The car was recently acquired by the selling dealer with 119k indicated miles following time in the southern US and two Canadian provinces. This E46 M3 is offered at no reserve with a factory wind deflector, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington State title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features an aftermarket front splitter and side skirts, xenon headlights, fog lamps, red/white angel eye lights, and black grille surrounds, as well as smoked taillights and turn signals. The power-retractable cloth top houses a heated glass window and can be seen both raised and lowered. Tint film has been applied to the rear and quarter glass.

This is a re-list after the car previously sold on BaT in May 2020 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the car. The winner has been banned from future participation on BaT and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

Staggered-width 20″ iForged wheels wear polished hardware, carbon fiber-style BMW roundels, and Achilles ATR Sport tires. The suspension has been lowered using KW Variant 2 adjustable coilovers, and a strut tower brace with Motorsport-branded hardware caps is fitted underhood. Stopping power is provided by eight-piston Rotora front and factory rear brake calipers paired with cross-drilled and slotted rotors.

The cabin is upholstered in cinnamon leather with two-tone door panels and a black dash, while a gloss black coating covers the factory brushed aluminum trim. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable sport seats, automatic climate control, a Kenwood navigation system, touchscreen media players in each headrest, and a trunk-mounted enclosure with JL Audio W6 subwoofers. A factory wind deflector is included in the sale.

Gray instrumentation framed by a multi-function steering wheel consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 119k miles. The passenger side airbag was replaced under a factory recall in May 2020, with a record of the service provided in the gallery.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A Gruppe M carbon fiber ram air intake system and an aftermarket carbon fiber valve cover were installed under previous ownership. Servicing in the past 500 miles reportedly includes an oil and filter change, antifreeze replacement, and a new water pump, clutch, slave cylinder, and door actuator.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M-Variable limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underbody are available in the gallery.

The April 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration and service history in Ohio, Florida, Georgia, Quebec, and British Columbia. Driving and walk around videos can be viewed below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was purchased in 2008 by the seller, who is the second owner and has added approximately 36k of its 85k indicated miles. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Factory equipment includes a power sunroof, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic air conditioning. The seller has modified the car with an aftermarket front splitter, painted kidney grilles, Powerflex suspension bushings, a Beisan Systems VANOS rebuild, carbon-fiber-like interior trim, and more. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records from current ownership, a Covercraft car cover, spare parts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and has been modified by the seller with a body-color Hamann-style front splitter, painted kidney grilles, and Euro-style foglight surrounds. The seller reports that the front bumper was refinished in 2019 after a floor jack rolled into the bumper and damaged the splitter. Additionally, there is a dent on the right rear fender lip and an indentation in the plastic on the lower front bumper.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are wrapped in Bridgestone Potenza tires. Powerflex front lower control-arm bushings and rear trailing-arm bushings have been installed during the seller’s ownership. The exterior and wheels reportedly have been coated with CQuartz UK 3.0 ceramic coating in early 2020.

The interior is trimmed in black Nappa leather (N5SW) with matching door panels and carpeting, and seller-installed modifications include wrapped 3M carbon-fiber-like trim accents and a Bluetooth/auxiliary/USB input module. Factory amenities include power-adjustable heated front seats, automatic climate control, a power sunroof, and a Harman Kardon premium sound system.

An M Sport multifunction steering wheel frames gray factory instrumentation including a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer displays just under 85k miles, approximately 36k of which have been added by the seller. An airbag recall was performed at approximately 80k miles, and the seller had the GM5 module reconditioned in 2019 to address a relay issue with the power locks.

The 3.2-liter DOHC S54 inline-six features VANOS variable valve timing that had a Beisan Systems rebuild and a valve adjustment performed at 84k miles. An engine-bearing recall was conducted during the same service in August 2019 at York Automotive of Mount Airy, Maryland, documentation of which is included in the gallery. Other maintenance performed within the past 10k miles included replacement of the flex disc, front differential seal, fuel filter, differential bushings, shift bushings, and transmission bushings.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission. The seller states that the subframe was inspected when the car was serviced for rod bearings, VANOS, and rear trailing-arm bushings, and the shop concluded that a subframe reinforcement kit was not required. Additional photos of the underside can be viewed in the gallery below. A custom Covercraft car cover and assorted spare parts are included in the sale and depicted in the gallery.

The June 2020 Carfax report shows no history of accidents or damage, and it details events in Pennsylvania and Maryland from 2001 through 2020. Two unaddressed recalls are described: one for the ECM software in May 2009 and the second for the passenger-side airbag in January 2020.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray leather and was acquired by the seller in 2018. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and equipped with a dark blue power-retractable soft top, LED taillights, the Cold Weather package, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This E46 M3 convertible indicates just under 42k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records from current ownership, a Carfax report, an Autocheck report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features include a dark blue power-retractable soft top, LED taillights, and quad exit exhaust outlets. The seller notes the front bumper cover was resprayed once as a result of an accident, and a second time to correct blemishes. Paint chips are visible on the forward-facing surfaces.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels are wrapped in 225/45 and 255/40 Bridgestone Potenza S007A tires that show date codes from 2018. A video of the convertible top in operation has been provided by the seller.

The cabin is upholstered in gray Nappa leather (N5TT) with matching carpets and brushed aluminum shadow trim on the dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include power-adjustable and heated front seats, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The seller notes that the dimming function on the rear-view mirror is inoperable, some of the plastic buttons are indented, and the outer driver’s seat bolster shows signs of wear. A ZHP shift knob and a BMW windshield sun shade are included in the sale.

An M Sport multifunction steering wheel frames gray instrumentation consisting of a 185-mph speedometer and tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The odometer indicates just under 42k miles, of which approximately 5k have been added by the seller. An AutoSolutions short shift kit and a UUC Motorwerks clutch stop have been installed.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower with 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Service performed in July 2019 inlcuded replacement of a VANOS solenoid, a solenoid seal, and a pressure valve, while an oil and filter change was completed in May 2020. The accessory belts, ignition coils, air and cabin filters, and battery were replaced by a previous owner.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and and a factory M-Variable limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underbody can be viewed in the gallery below.
Manufacturer’s literature and service records from current ownership are included in the sale.
The June 2020 Carfax report shows an accident between 2002 and 2005 as well as a theft and recovery in summer 2003. A 2019 AutoCheck report listing a 2006 accident is available in the gallery below.
https://youtu.be/CTN6BlagWlA
A cold start video can be viewed above.

title: Original-Owner 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller from Bill Pearce BMW of Reno, Nevada and has since remained registered in the state. The car is finished in metallic sliver and powered by a replacement 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a GruppeM cold-air intake, H&R springs, bi-xenon headlights, heated front seats, rain-sensing windshield wipers, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This E46 M3 indicates 97k miles and is offered with a window sticker, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Nevada title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features bi-xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, fog lights, fender vents, and a power glass sunroof. The Carfax report indicates damage occurred to the left front of the vehicle in 2003 and 2013.

Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear 225/45 and 255/40 Michelin Pilot Sport tires that show date codes from 2014. H&R Springs have been fitted by the seller. Two spare wheels mounted with Michelin tires are included in the sale.

The cabin is trimmed in gray Nappa leather with matching carpets, while the dash and door panels are accented with brushed Aluminum Shadow trim. Amenities include an anthracite headliner, power-adjustable and heated sport seats with position memory for the driver, cruise control, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system.

A three-spoke M Sport steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The odometer indicates 97k miles.

A replacement 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was installed by Bill Pearce BMW in April 2003 due to damage caused by rod bearings that were a part of a manufacturer’s recall campaign. Modifications include a GruppeM carbon fiber cold air intake and a Shark Injector ECU flash. The VANOS system was replaced in 2008, and a new throttle actuator, throttle switch, and oil pan gasket were installed in 2015.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and M Variable Lock differential. Additional underbody photos can be viewed in the gallery.
The window sticker shows factory colors and options as well as an original MSRP of $53,295.
The June 2020 Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage and lists registration and service history with a single owner in Nevada. The seller states that the airbag recall has been addressed.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was delivered new to BMW of San Antonio, Texas and acquired by the seller in 2017. The car is finished in metallic silver over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes the Premium package, ST coilovers, Fabspeed exhaust headers, a Borla Exhaust system, a CSL-style trunk lid, automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and navigation. This E46 M3 indicates 95k miles and is offered at no reserve with a window sticker, service records, an accident-free AutoCheck report, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features black kidney grilles, fog lamps, a sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and an aftermarket CSL-style trunk lid. In May 2020, the front bumper cover was resprayed, and the windshield cowl, rear window moldings, and the left fog light were replaced. Paint chips are visible on the front fenders and hood, and blemishes can be seen on the rear bumper cover and near the trunk. The factory trunk lid is included in the sale.

Factory 19″ Style 67 wheels wear black BMW roundels and Firestone Firehawk Indy 500 tires. The suspension is fitted with ST coilovers along with Turner Motorsport front camber plates and a Racing Dynamics front strut tower brace. The brake rotors and pads were replaced, and stainless steel lines were installed in December 2018. Curb rash is evident on all four wheels.

The cabin is upholstered in black Nappa leather with a matching dash, door panels, and carpets. Amenities include aluminum trim, power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and navigation. Both window motors and regulators have been replaced during current ownership along with the right door looking mechanism and the general module five.

Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline as well as gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The odometer indicates 95k miles, of which approximately 20k have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Service in December 2018 included replacement of the valve cover gasket, while in July 2019 the oil pressure valve and various gaskets were replaced, an oil change was completed, and Turner Motorsport accessory pulleys were installed. Fabspeed exhaust headers and a Borla exhaust system replace the factory components. The connecting rod bearing recall is said to have been addressed.
The window sticker shows factory colors and options as well as an original MSRP of $53,695.

The May 2020 AutoCheck report shows no accidents or other damage and lists and shows history in Texas and Arizona. Mileage inconsistencies are noted in 2002 and 2010. The seller has a loan on the car, and their lender will need to be paid off before its title can be transferred into the new owners’s name. A walk-around video is provided below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Imola Red over black Nappa leather, and power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include the Cold Weather and Premium packages, as well as heated power-adjustable front seats, xenon headlights, and automatic climate control. Modifications include stainless steel headers, a Supersprint exhaust system, 18″ Apex ARC-8 wheels, an Evolve carbon-fiber air box, Kassel Performance CSL software, and more. This E46 M3 now shows 91k miles and is offered with removed factory parts, a spare set of 19″ factory wheels, accessories, service records, a DCS report, a Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork is finished in Imolarot 2 (405) and features front fog lights, a sunroof, quad tailpipes, and xenon headlights. A Status Gruppe CSL-style rear diffuser and black grilles were fitted, and the seller notes that a paint correction was recently performed and a paint sealant was applied at the same time. The Carfax report lists a damage report in July 2015, with no further information available, and the seller notes that the removed rear exhaust filler is included in the sale. The A-, B-, and C-pillar trim pieces are reportedly peeling, though replacement items are included in the sale.

Apex 18″ ARC-8 wheels are fitted with BMW center caps and wear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires measuring 245/40 up front and 275/35 out back that were installed in 2019. The removed factory 19″ forged wheels are also included in the sale and shown in the gallery below.

The interior is upholstered in Black Nappa leather (N5SW) with Titan Shadow trim. Factory equipment includes heated power-adjustable front seats with memory settings for the driver, automatic climate control, a multi-function steering wheel, and a Harman-Kardon premium sound system. A short shifter sourced from a 545i, an F10 illuminated shift knob, a European-specification center storage compartment, and an aftermarket sunshade were added. The seller notes that the steering wheel was recovered with perforated leather, and wear is visible on the door trim.

Gray instrument dials include a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, as well as gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 91k miles, less than 4k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Modifications include an Evolve carbon-fiber airbox and a Kassel Performance CSL software conversion. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox and an M Variable limited-slip differential. A March 2020 service included an oil change and replacement of the transmission and differential fluids.

Status Gruppe headers feed into a Supersprint exhaust system, and the removed factory exhaust system components are reportedly included in the sale. Additional photos of the underside are included in the gallery below.
Removed exhaust components, 19″ wheels, a car cover, replacement interior trim pieces, and additional removed and replacement parts are shown above and included in the sale.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned 2015 damage report and lists registration history in Kentucky, Pennsylvania, New York, Ohio, Massachusetts, and New Jersey through its most recent entry in November 2018. A walk-around video provided by the seller is presented below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 6-Speed

Power is transferred to the rear wheels by a six-speed manual transmission. title: 2006 BMW M3 Dinan S2 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible is finished in triple black and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It was first delivered to Irvine BMW in California, and later spent time in Missouri before it was recently purchased by the seller and relocated to North Carolina. It now has 80k miles, and service in 2018 included replacement of the rod bearings and the VANOS actuator. This Dinan-modified E46 was previously listed on BaT in June and is now offered again by the same seller at no reserve. The sale includes factory literature, service records, a Davis Report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Schwarz 2 (668) with a black soft top. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, tinted windows, a rear lip spoiler, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, a Euro short antenna, black front bumper reflectors, and M3 and Dinan badging.

Dinan suspension modifications include Koni adjustable dampers as well as Dinan lowering springs, camber plates, front and rear strut tower braces, and an adjustable 27mm front sway bar. Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts and trailing arm bushings are also fitted.

The interior features black Nappa leather on the seating surfaces and door panels, as well as black carpets protected by Dinan-logo floor mats. Brushed aluminum shadow trim accents the dashboard, center console, and doors. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front seats, a Harman-Kardon sound system, navigation, automatic climate control, and a Dynavin double-DIN head unit. Maintenance performed in November 2018 included replacement of the VANOS actuator, the rod bearings, the crankshaft seal, and the camshaft position sensor.
The Dinan S2 plaque on the radiator support carries serial number S20652.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and additional Dinan modifications include a 3.91 rear axle. The seller states that an Autosolutions 20% short shift kit and Rogue Engineering transmission mounts have been fitted, along with a Rogue Engineering Rasp pipe and X-pipe. Additional underside photos are available in the gallery below.

Factory literature from BMW and Dinan, magazine reviews, service records, a Davis Report, and results from a recent inspection report from Hendrick BMW in Charlotte, North Carolina are also included in the sale.
The May 2020 Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage and shows registration in California, Missouri, and North Carolina.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe

title: 18k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible resided with two owners in New Hampshire and Washington state before being acquired by the selling dealer in June 2020. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic with a black convertible soft top over black Nappa leather and is equipped with a removable color-matched hardtop, power-adjustable heated seats, navigation, and a premium Harman Kardon sound system. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip rear differential, and modifications include a short shift kit, adjustable Bilstein front coilovers, Bilstein rear springs, adjustable rear dampers, and a Supersprint exhaust system. This E46 M3 now shows 18k miles and is offered at no reserve by the selling dealer in Oregon with a fitted car cover, a removable wind deflector, a Carfax report, and a clean Washington title.

The cabin is trimmed in black Nappa leather with matching carpets and door panels. Amenities include power-adjustable and heated front seats, navigation, automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon premium sound, and an AM/FM cassette stereo with a trunk-mounted CD changer.

A three-spoke M Sport steering wheel frames factory instrumentation consisting of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The 3.2-liter inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The engine oil was changed in September 2019 at 16,650 miles.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over Cinnamon Nappa leather, and power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. The car was first registered in Florida and was previously featured on BaT in September 2019 prior to its purchase in 2020 by the seller, who subsequently added 1k of the 87k miles it now has. Previously installed modifications were removed, and the car features 19″ Competition Package staggered-width wheels, Tein lowering springs, and a European-specification front bumper. Additional equipment includes a power-operated sunroof, automatic climate control, and navigation, and service performed during current ownership included an oil change and replacement of oxygen sensors, oil pan gasket, oil filter housing seal, the valve cover gasket, power steering pump, starter, and throttle position sensors. This E46 M3 is now offered with partial service records, spare parts and accessories, factory literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (488) with high-gloss Shadowline trim, and equipment includes a rear spoiler and a European-specification front bumper cover. The hood, front fenders, side mirrors, rear quarter panels, deck lid, and front and rear bumper covers were refinished at ANS Autowerks of Linden, New Jersey before the previous listing on BaT in 2019. The previously mounted black-finished kidney grilles, CSL-style trunk lid, aftermarket front lip spoiler, and custom-painted headlights were removed and replaced with factory-specification parts. A car cover is included in the sale, a spot of clearcoat failure on the roof is noted, and additional exterior flaws are shown in the gallery below.

Competition Package 19″ silver-finished wheels were fitted and wear Toyo Proxes Sport A/S tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The previously mounted suspension, wheel, and brake modifications were removed, and the car rides on Tein lowering springs augmented by an H&R front sway bar. Braking is handled by black-finished factory-specification calipers with ventilated rotors, and spare performance brake parts accompany the sale. Curb marks are visible on the wheels, and service during current ownership included replacement of the wheel bearings and the power steering pump and reservoir.

The interior features Cinnamon Nappa leather that was fitted during prior ownership covering the seating surfaces, door panel inserts, and center armrest. Piano black trim adorns the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and additional modifications include manually-adjustable front seats, an Alcantara shift boot, an Competition-specification emergency brake handle, and a Turner Motorsport aluminum gas pedal cover. A power sunroof, automatic climate control, power windows, a navigation system, and cruise control are also equipped.

A three-spoke M Sport steering wheel frames factory instrumentation consisting of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer shows under 87k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. A previously-installed supercharger kit has been removed since the car was last featured on BaT in 2019, and maintenance performed in 2020 included an oil change and replacement of both upstream oxygen sensors as well as the throttle position potentiometers, oil filter housing seal, oil pan gasket, valve cover gaskets, Diagnostic Module Tank Leakage (DMTL) pump, and the starter. The rod bearings were reportedly replaced during prior ownership in 2017.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The rear subframe was reinforced in 2019 at Autocouture Motoring of Fair Lawn, New Jersey. Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in Florida, Virginia, and New Jersey. At least one open recall is shown.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 SMG
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe shows 56k miles and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather. Power comes from a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six that has been modified with a VF Engineering supercharger, and a six-speed sequential transmission sends power to the rear wheels. Other modifications include a Supersprint exhaust system, 18″ Apex wheels, and Swift springs, as well as Status Gruppe coilovers, a carbon-fiber front splitter, and a carbon-fiber rear diffuser. Factory features include a limited-slip differential, xenon headlights, power-adjustable heated front seats, a navigation system, a glass sunroof, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Work completed since the seller’s acquisition in spring 2020 includes the installation of rear subframe reinforcement, a differential reseal and service, a four-wheel alignment, and a BMW Inspection II service, along with replacement of the rear suspension and subframe bushings as well as the battery. This E46 M3 is offered with manufacturer’s literature, maintenance records, two master keys and one valet key, coilover adjustment wrenches, a Carfax report, and a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features xenon headlights, front fog lamps, black grille trim, black Shadowline trim, a sunroof, a rear lip spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. A Status Gruppe carbon-fiber front splitter and rear diffuser have been added along with amber-colored turn-signal lenses and LED taillights that have been substituted for the factory clear units. Front bumper reflectors have been color matched.

Apex ARC-8 wheels measuring 18×9″ at the front and 18×10″ rear are finished in Hyper Silver and mounted with 245/35 and 265/35 Hankook Ventus V12 Evo 2 tires. The ride height has been lowered with a Status Gruppe SRS coilover suspension kit, and it is complemented by Swift 8kg front springs, 9kg rear springs, and camber plates.

The cabin is finished in black with Nappa leather seat upholstery and an aftermarket suede parking-brake handle. Silver EAS carbon-fiber trim adorns the door panels, dashboard, and center console. An airbag recall was reportedly carried out in June 2020.

A leather-wrapped three-spoke steering wheel fronts AutoTecknic carbon-fiber shift paddles along with a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer indicates just under 56k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and VANOS variable camshaft timing, and it has been fitted with a VF Engineering 420 supercharger kit and a Supersprint stainless-steel exhaust. Work performed since spring 2020 reportedly included a battery replacement as well as a BMW Inspection II service consisting of a valve adjustment, an oil change, flushing transmission and differential fluids, and replacement of the spark plugs, fuel filter, engine air filter, and the cabin air filter.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. In May 2020, the rear subframe was removed and Turner Motorsport subframe reinforcements welded in and reportedly seam-sealed and undercoated using 3M products. An image showing the aforementioned area is provided in the gallery below. Additional work included resealing the differential and also installing Powerflex differential and subframe bushings, new rear trailing-arm bushings with ECS Tuning limiters, Turner Motorsport rear camber arms, front adjustable sway-bar end links, and new sway-bar bushings. A four-wheel alignment was subsequently carried out in June 2020.
Factory literature accompanies the car alongside maintenance records since new, two master keys, a valet key, coilover adjustment wrenches, and more.

The August 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and displays registration history in New York through its most recent entry in March 2020. A potential odometer rollback is noted in August 2008, and airbag recalls are noted in May 2013 and also in May 2015.
A walk-around video is above, and footage of the interior is below.

title: 49k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

listing_details: Schwarz II over Black Nappa Leather
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in Schwarz II over a black Nappa leather interior, and power is supplied by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a power-operated black convertible soft top, bi-xenon headlamps, LED taillights, power-adjustable heated front seats, a factory Harman Kardon sound system, and brushed-aluminum trim. The car spent time in Minnesota, Michigan, British Columbia, and New York before being acquired by the seller in California in April 2016. Now showing just under 49k miles, this E46 is offered with a partial tool kit, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Schwarz II (668) and features a power-operated black convertible soft top, which can be seen in operation here. Features include bi-xenon headlamps, LED taillights, Dynamic Stability Control, dual exhaust with quad outlets, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, and fender vents.

Factory 18″ M Double-Spoke alloy wheels are fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 225/45 at the front and 255/40 at the rear. The seller notes that the passenger-side wheels exhibit curb rash.

The power-adjustable heated front seats are trimmed in black Nappa leather, and brushed-aluminum trim accents the console, doors, and dash. Additional amenities include a factory Harman Kardon stereo, automatic climate control, and power locks and windows. The driver’s airbag was replaced in March 2017 by BMW of San Francisco, and the passenger airbag was reportedly replaced in August 2020. The seller notes that the trunk-mounted tool kit is missing tools.

A leather-wrapped multifunction M Sport steering wheel fronts gray instrumentation, which includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer indicates just under 49k miles, approximately 7k of which have been added during the seller’s ownership.
