Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery.

The August 2020 Carfax report is free of accidents and other damage, and it lists an open safety recall in January 2020 for the passenger airbag, which the seller reports has been addressed by a BMW dealer. It additionally chronicles service, registration, and emissions inspection events in Minnesota, Michigan, British Columbia, New York, and California from 2004 through August 2018.
An in-car driving video is provided above, and cold-start footage is below.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Alpine White over black leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. It is equipped with the Competition and Premium packages and has been fitted with a Euro-spec front bumper cover, a CSL trunk lid, a coilover suspension, a short shifter, an aftermarket head unit, and a Status Gruppe exhaust. The car was first delivered to BMW of Bayside in Douglaston, New York and was acquired by the seller out of Massachusetts in 2016. Subsequent work has reportedly included an overhaul of the VANOS, reinforcement of the rear subframe, refreshment of the brakes and cooling system, and more. This E46 M3 shows 123k miles and is offered with photos from the work, factory literature, a window sticker, spare parts, an accident-free Carfax report, service records, and a clean Rhode Island title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300) and features xenon headlights and a sunroof. The side skirts were refinished by the seller, who also added an OEM Euro-spec front bumper cover, an OEM CSL trunk lid, and a Streamline rear lower diffuser, along with amber turn signal lenses, Euro-spec side mirror glass, black kidney grilles, and a black F80 M3 Competition rear badge. The seller notes paint chips around the body as well as a dent in the passenger door.

Factory 19″ Style 163M wheels measure 8″ in width up front and 9.5″ out back and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires displaying 2016 date codes. Wheel spacers have been added, and the suspension has reportedly been modified with TC Kline coilovers with camber plates and polyurethane bushings. The ZCP package included larger cross-drilled brakes compared to the standard M3, and the seller states that the pads and rotors were recently replaced.

The interior is upholstered in Black Nappa leather with Alu-Tech trim and features a center-console armrest delete. Appointments include heated and power-adjustable seats, an RTD V4 carbon short shifter, and an Android-based Xtrons head unit. The trim on the the A, B, and C-pillars has been replaced along with the center console, and the soft-touch materials on the door armrests are said be peeling.

An Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 123k miles, approximately 15k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with Megan Racing headers and a Status Gruppe exhaust system. The seller reportedly overhauled the VANOS system with a Beisan Systems kit, and additional service performed during current ownership is said to have included a valve adjustment, servicing the transmission and differential, and replacing the water pump, thermostat, spark plugs, and exhaust gaskets. The rear main seal, flex disc, clutch, shift shaft seal, output shaft seal, and flywheel bolts were reportedly replaced during prior ownership, and photos documenting some of the seller’s work are viewable in the gallery.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The upper and lower rear subframe has been reinforced, and solid aluminum mounts from Turner Motorsport have been fitted. Polyurethane differential bushings, engine mounts, and transmission mounts have also been been installed, along with a replacement center support bearing. The seller notes a vibration at idle.

Service and parts receipts from the seller and previous owner are included in the sale, along with a window sticker, a Lang Racing Development rod bearing and bolt replacement kit, and a number of spare parts as shown in the gallery.

The August 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and displays history in New York, Massachusetts and Rhode Island from May 2005 to May 2020. An open manufacturer’s recall related to the passenger-side front airbag is noted on the report. The 13-minute video below includes a start-up, driving footage, and a walk-around.

title: 19k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 Convertible is finished in metallic grey over black and is powered by a 3.2L inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. The car spent time in New York and Pennsylvania before being acquired in 2019 by the seller, who has since added approximately 200 of the 19k indicated miles. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, power-adjustable front seats, a power-operated convertible top, and an aftermarket BAVSound audio system. This E46 M3 is now offered with factory manuals, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic (400) with a black soft top. Features include Xenon headlamps, integrated front fog lights, M-badged fender vents, and a quad-tip exhaust. The seller notes a scratch above the wheel arch on the right front fender as shown up close in the gallery below.
Factory 18″ M-sport double-spoke wheels are wrapped in Continental ExtremeContact tires.  The car came factory-equipped with four-wheel anti-lock brakes and BMW’s Dynamic Stability Control.

The interior features seats trimmed in black Nappa leather with M-sport embossed headrests, along with matching door panels and carpets. Brushed aluminum trim accents the dashboard, door panels, and center console. Equipment includes power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, a rear-seat windscreen, and an aftermarket BAVSound audio system with an amplifier.

A leather-wrapped M-sport steering wheel frames an instrument cluster featuring a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer with a variable redline and inset oil temperature gauge. The digital odometer shows 19k miles, approximately 200 of which have been added by the seller.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a factory M Variable Lock differential. The rod bearing recall was performed in May of 2003, a screenshot of the service history is available in the gallery below.
Additional underbody photos are available in the gallery below.

The July 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and displays five owners in New York, Pennsylvania, and California through the most recent update in October 2019. The report also lists an open recall for the passenger-side airbag, which the seller states was recently addressed. An exterior walk-around video is available below.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
listing_details: Carbon Black Metallic over Black Leather
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was acquired in 2014 by the seller, who added 25k of the 67k miles it now has. Power is from a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission, and it is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather. Equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium packages, while modifications consist of a K&N air intake, 19″ Competition Package wheels, a Fabspeed exhaust header, and a Borla exhaust system. During the past year, the seller rebuilt the VANOS system with Beisan System parts, fitted an AKG subframe reinforcement kit, performed an oil change, serviced the rear differential, and replaced the headliner, alternator, battery, passenger mirror motor, A-pillar trim, and a wheel bearing. This E46 M3 coupe is now offered with service records, factory literature, a window sticker, a clean AutoCheck and Carfax reports, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features aftermarket HID fog lights, xenon headlights with washers, an electric sunroof, window tint, a decklid spoiler, and quad-exhaust outlets. The front bumper was refinished by the seller to correct rock chips, and additional work performed during current ownership included replacement of the right-side mirror motor, windshield washer motor, windshield cowling, clear indicator lamps, and badges. Stone chips are present on the hood, there is a chip in the windshield, and a ding is noted in the left-side quarter panel.

Competition Package-specification 19″ staggered-width wheels were fitted by the seller and wear Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back, which show 2016 and 2018 date codes respectively. Recent service included a replacement wheel bearing and installation of polyurethane suspension bushings.

The interior features seats trimmed in black Nappa leather with matching door panels and carpeting, while Titan Shadow trim accents the doors, center console, and dashboard. Amenities include power-adjustable and heated front seats with lumbar support, automatic climate control, navigation, Harman-Kardon audio system, Bluetooth phone connectivity, a Homelink garage opener, and the Cold Weather and Premium packages. Thinkware F-200 cameras are mounted in front and out back, and all weather floor mats are fitted both in the cabin and the trunk. The seller states that the cabin mats show wear and require replacement, and the sale includes factory floor mats. The A-pillar trim, armrests, rear ashtray, right-rear window seal, and headliner were replaced during current ownership, and a scratch is present in the rear driver-side seat.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The seller notes missing pixels in the central infotainment screen. The digital odometer shows 67k miles, approximately 25k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six delivers power to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Modification include a K&N air filter, a strut tower brace, a Fabspeed exhaust header, and a Borla exhaust system, and work performed within the last year included an oil change, a rebuild of the VANOS system utilizing Beisan Systems components, and the replacement of the battery and alternator. The seller states that the rod bearing recall has been performed.
Photos showing the installation of an AKG rear subframe reinforcement kit are provided in the gallery, and the seller states that the differential was recently serviced.
The sale includes service records, factory literature, and two keys.
The window sticker shows initial delivery to BMW Gallery in Norwood, Massachusetts, equipment and colors, and a total suggested retail price of $55,595.
The August 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Florida through its most recent entry in April 2020.

title: 41k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over Grey Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes 19″ Competition Package wheels, Dynamic Stability Control, a power-retractable soft top, and a Harman Kardon stereo. The car spent time in Missouri before being acquired by the seller from its second owner in 2015. This E46 M3 now shows 41k miles and is offered with service manuals, partial records, a recent PPI, factory keys, a wind deflector, a battery charger, a car cover, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features xenon headlamps, M-specific grills on the front fenders, quad exhaust outlets, and tinted windows. Noted flaws include rock chips across the front fascia and hood as well as scrapes along the driver’s side skirt and below the front spoiler. 19″ BBS ZCP Competition Package wheels are wrapped in General G Max tires. The suspension and braking systems are aided by Dynamic Stability Control, and the front rotors and pads are said to have been replaced in 2018.

The interior features heated and power-adjustable Grey Nappa leather seats with matching carpeting, door panels, and floor mats. High Gloss Black (434) trim accents the dashboard, and amenities include the Cold Weather Package, Smoker’s Package, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. The right front window regular was replaced and the rear view mirror repaired earlier this year. The seller indicates wear along the arm rests and the driver’s seat side bolster. The passenger-side soft top C-pillar cover has reportedly been replaced, though a tear is noted on the headliner fabric as shown in the gallery.

A multifunction three-spoke steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer shows under 41k miles, approximately 3k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and VANOS variable valve timing and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The engine rod bearing recall was performed in 2005, and a receipt from the work is provided in the gallery. The seller states that the spark plugs were replaced in 2017, along with the drive belts, A/C belt tensioner, and pulley.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. Leaks from the oil pan gasket and power steering pressure hose are noted on the June 2020 PPI report viewable in the gallery, which also indicates “no visible damage” to the body at the rear subframe mounts.

The June 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, lists at least one open recall, and displays history in Missouri and Colorado through its most recent entry in January 2020. Driving and walk-around videos are available below:

title: 33k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 Coupe is a non-sunroof US-spec example that was purchased new through Pentagon Car Sales while the first owners were stationed abroad in Heidelberg, Germany. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features front fog lights, fender vents, a factory rear badge delete, and quad exhaust outlets. The right side mirror is said to have been repainted to correct a scratch.
Factory 18″ Style 67 wheels wear 235/40 and 255/40 Yokohama Advan tires that show date codes from 2015. Curb rash is present on the right front wheel.

Coco mats protect the black carpeting, and additional amenities include manually-adjustable front sport seats, cruise control, automatic climate control, a cassette stereo with a US radio tuner and a trunk-mounted CD changer.

A three-spoke multifunction Motorsport steering wheel frames gray instrumentation consisting of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline. The odometer indicates 33k miles, of which approximately 2k have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque from the factory, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over gray leather. Equipment includes 18″ Style 67 wheels, CSL-style front floating rotors, a power-operated glass sunroof, a Harman-Kardon audio system, automatic climate control, and power-adjustable front seats. The seller purchased the car in 2011, and added 37k of the under 67k miles it now has. Recent service included repair of the rear subframe and installation of a reinforcement kit, an oil change, a coolant flush, and replacement of the air filters and the valve cover gasket. This E46 M3 is offered now with partial service records, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features quadruple exhaust outlets, front fog lights, and side fender vents. The front bumper was repainted in July 2020, the rear bumper shows scratches, and a rock chip in the windshield has been repaired but remains visible. Photos of paint meter readings from around the car are presented in the gallery below.

Factory 18″ M Double Spoke Style 67 wheels wear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires measuring 245/40 at the front and 255/40 in the rear, which the seller states were installed in December 2019. ECS Tuning front ‘CSL’ floating-style cross-drilled and slotted rotors were fitted up front and the brake fluid was flushed in July 2018, and the rear slotted rotors and brake pads were replaced in July 2019. H&R sway bars were fitted during prior ownership, and curb marks are visible on the wheels.

The seats are trimmed in gray Nappa leather with matching door panels and carpets, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door pulls. Amenities include automatic climate control, a power-operated glass sunroof, cruise control, power-adjustable front seats, and a Harman-Kardon stereo with a CD player along with an add-on iPhone and Bluetooth adapter. Both airbag recalls were completed, and the climate control cabin air filter was replaced in July 2020.

The leather-wrapped multi-function steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer displays under 67k miles, 37k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Service performed during 2020 included a coolant flush, an oil change, and replacement of the air filter and valve cover gasket. An upper front strut bar from a post-LCI M3 is fitted, and the seller states that the rod bearing recall was performed. The seller notes an oil leak said to be from the oil pan gasket.

The six-speed manual transmission sends power to the rear wheels through a differential with a 4.10:1 gear set installed during prior ownership. The car received a subframe reinforcement kit in 2020, with additional photos of the installation and mounting point repairs available in the gallery.

The August 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and registration history in California, and the car most recently passed a California emissions test in September 2020. Driving and cold-start videos are presented below.

title: 38k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
interior_color: Jet Black over Cinnamon Nappa Leather

This is a re-list after the car previously sold on BaT in September 2020 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the car. The winner has been banned from future participation on BaT and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.
Optional forged 19″ M Double Spoke wheels wear General G-Max AS-05 tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back that were installed by the selling dealer.

The cabin features seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, along with matching carpets and high-gloss black trim accents the dash and door panels. The multi-function M-branded steering wheel frames gray instrument dials consisting of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates under 48k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six produced 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. An oil and filter change was performed by the selling dealer in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through an SMG II six-speed sequential manual transmission. Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.

The July 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history with a single previous owner in California through its most recent entry in March 2020. An airbag recall from January 2020 is also noted. A walk-around video with driving footage is provided below.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Jet Black over Cinnamon leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission. The car was first registered in Missouri and spent time in New York and New Jersey before being acquired by the seller in 2016. Modifications include aftermarket 19″ wheels, a Dinan ECU tune, Koni adjustable dampers, H&R springs, and larger brake rotors. Work performed during current ownership consisted of replacing the transmission mounts, driveshaft center support bearing, flex disc, differential side cover and pinion seals, throttle position sensor, and a high-pressure power steering line. This E46 M3 indicates just over 95k miles and is offered with two keys, manufacturer’s literature, service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features carbon fiber chin spoilers, xenon headlamps with aftermarket LED accents, clear corner lenses, fog lights, a power sunroof, a decklid spoiler, a carbon fiber rear diffuser, and quad exhaust outlets. The reflectors have been painted body color, aftermarket tint film has been added to the rear and side windows, the M3 badges have been removed, and the key hole on the left door has been covered. Paint chips are noted on the front fascia, the front bumper cover has been touched up, and a scuff is present on the right quarter panel. A ceramic coating is said to have been applied to the paintwork.

Aftermarket 19″ Morr VS8 forged wheels wear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. Braking and suspension modifications consist of Koni adjustable dampers, H&R springs, and larger front and rear brake rotors with Textar pads. Work performed during current ownership included replacement of the rear tires, a high pressure power steering line, and parking brake components.

The cabin features seating upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather with matching door panel inserts, black carpeting, and brushed aluminum shadow trim on the dash, center console, and doors. Amenities include power-adjustable and heated front sport seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, rain sensing windshield wipers, a short shifter with a ZHP-style shift knob, Harman Kardon audio, and all-weather floor mats. The hazard light switch and A-pillar trim have been replaced. The stock floor mats are included in the sale. The seller states that the batteries in the key fobs require replacement, and the clutch pedal squeaks when depressed.

A multifunction steering wheel wears an aftermarket BMW badge and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The odometer indicates just over 95k miles, of which approximately 9k have been added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with a Dinan Stage 1 ECU tune, and a Motorsport-braded strut tower brace has also been added. The throttle position sensor and idle control valve were replaced during current ownership, and an oil and filter change was last carried out approximately 100 miles ago.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional service performed during the seller’s ownership consisted of installation of a new driveshaft center support bearing, flex disc, differential side seals, and pinion seal.
Service records from 2010 onward are included in the sale along with manufacturer’s literature and two keys.

The August 2020 Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Missouri, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania through the most recent entry in September 2019. Two open recalls for the front airbags are also noted.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe ZCP 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe has 52K miles and was acquired by the current owner on BaT in August 2018. The car is finished in Schwarz II over Cinnamon leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include a sunroof, a Harman Kardon audio system, and the Competition Package, which added 19″ BBS wheels, cross-drilled brake rotors, revised Dynamic Stability Control programing, and unique interior trim. This E46 M3 is now offered on behalf of the current owner with service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The exterior is finished in Schwarz II and features xenon headlights, M3-branded fender vents, and quad exhaust outlets. The trunk lid was replaced in July 2007, and the hood, front valance, and right headlamp were replaced in June 2013. Paintless dent removal was performed in February 2019, followed by a paint correction and ceramic coating. The headlight-level sensor link and one foglight were replaced in August 2020. Close-up photos of the paint and trim can be viewed in the gallery.

Factory 19″ BBS wheels wear 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S showing 2019 and 2020 date codes. Competition Package features include cross-drilled brake rotors, a quicker-than-standard steering ratio, and revised Dynamic Stability Control programming. The seller states that new ZCP rotors, ceramic brake pads, and stainless steel braided hoses were installed in July 2020. An August 2020 inspection notes that the left front and right rear wheels are bent on the inner lip, and the invoice indicates that the bend did not affect balancing.

The cabin features Cinnamon Nappa leather on the door panels and heated front seats as well as textured aluminum trim throughout. Amenities include automatic climate control, Cold Weather package with ski bag, and a Harman Kardon stereo with factory navigation.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer, as well as gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer has 52k miles, approximately 200 of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features double-VANOS variable valve timing and was factory rated for 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The VANOS system was rebuilt under warranty by BMW of Warwick, Rhode Island following a failure at approximately 30k miles. An Inspection II service was performed in August 2020 and included changing the oil as well as replacing the engine and cabin air filters, spark plugs, and valve cover gasket.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock rear differential. The transmission fluid and differential gear oil were changed in August 2020, and the results of a subframe inspection can be viewed in the gallery.
The August 2020 Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage and shows at least one open recall. Registration history is shown in Connecticut, Massachusetts, and Georgia.
A walk-around video featuring start-up footage can be viewed above, and a pair of driving videos are provided below. A video demonstrating the parking sensors can be viewed here.

title: 46k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather with M cloth and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car is not equipped with a sunroof, and features include the Competition Package, 19″ wheels, xenon headlights, automatic climate control, and a Harman-Kardon sound system. The car was delivered new to BMW of the Hamptons in Southhampton, New York, moved to California in 2012, and was acquired by the seller in December 2019. Subsequent service has included refinishing the front and rear bumpers, replacing the connecting rod bearings, and refurbishing the VANOS system. This E46 M3 has 46k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, removed parts, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and is not equipped with a sunroof. Features include xenon headlights, white indicator lights, fog lights, front fender vents, and quad exhaust outlets. International Autobody in San Bruno, California, repainted the front and rear bumpers in June 2020 to correct stone chips and paint imperfections. The cowl grille, the A- and B-pillar covers, and the kidney grilles are also said to have been replaced at that time. Photos of the painting process are provided in the gallery, and the seller states that the taillight seals have also been replaced.

Factory 19″ M Cross-Spoke wheels are wrapped in 235/35 front and 255/35 rear Hankook Ventus V12 tires that were mounted in June 2019. The Competition Package included larger cross-drilled front brake rotors and a quicker steering ratio than the standard M3. It also added an “M Track Mode” setting to the Dynamic Stability Control system.

The cabin features black Nappa leather M sport seats with Anthracite Impulse cloth inserts. Amenities include milled-effect aluminum trim, automatic climate control, a Harman-Kardon sound system with a six-disc CD changer, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and split-folding rear seats. The driver’s door lock assembly was replaced in August 2020.

The three-spoke M steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer has 46k miles, and the steering wheel and center console trim are said to have been refinished in 2020.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is equipped with double-VANOS variable valve timing and was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 ft-lb of torque. Maintenance performed in 2020 included adjusting the valves, refurbishing the VANOS system, installing new connecting rod bearings, and replacing the exhaust-side rocker arms for the number-six cylinder. The removed rod bearings, rocker arms, and VANOS parts are included in the sale and pictured in the gallery below.
Additional underbody photos are available in the gallery below.
The window sticker shows delivery to BMW of the Hamptons and a total suggested retail price of $54,845.

The Carfax report lists airbag and emissions system recalls and shows history in New York and California. The report also contains a September 16, 2019 entry noting “minor damage” to the front and rear of the car. Communication with International Autobody indicates that an estimate to refinish the front and rear bumpers was generated around that date, and a photo of the email can be viewed in the gallery.

title: 31k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A 30k-mile inspection and oil change were performed at German Motor Works in Wichita, Kansas in June 2020, and the differential was also serviced in 2020.
Additional photos of the underside are available in the gallery below.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe

The auto-dimming rear-view mirror was reportedly replaced within the last year, and an airbag recall service was addressed.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel has been fitted with CSL paddle shifters and frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer has 61k miles, approximately 60k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. The battery was reportedly replaced in September 2020, and other recent service includes an oil change.
The factory window sticker shows standard features, options, and a total suggested retail price of $59,490.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in California from new through the most recent entry in May 2020.

title: 10k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 was delivered new to Park Avenue BMW in Rochelle Park, New Jersey and also resided in New York and Pennsylvania prior to the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2020. Finished in red over a black Nappa leather interior, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed sequential transmission. Features include 18″ M Double Spoke wheels, a limited-slip differential, Dynamic Stability Control, Park Distance Control, xenon headlamps, a glass sunroof, heated front seats with position memory for the driver, aluminum interior trim, automatic climate control, an on-board computer, and a HiFi sound system. The car was featured on BaT in October 2016, and the selling dealer reports that the oil was changed in 2020. This E46 M3 shows 10k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer in Florida with its window sticker, factory literature, a tool kit, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The body is finished in Imola Red II (405) and features a glass sunroof, a rear lip spoiler, xenon headlamps, fog lights, rain-sensing wipers, M-specific vents on the fenders, rear parking sensors, and quad exhaust outlets.

Silver 18″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Continental ContiSportContact tires that show 2003 and 2004 date codes. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control and Dynamic Brake Control.

The cabin features seats and door panels upholstered in black Nappa leather along with Brushed Aluminum Shadow inserts accenting the dashboard, console, and doors. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front seats with position memory for the driver, an anthracite headliner, automatic climate control, an on-board computer, and a factory HiFi sound system with a CD player.
The multifunction steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline. The digital odometer has 10k miles, a handful of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features VANOS variable valve timing and independent throttle bodies and was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and an M Variable Lock differential.
The window sticker lists factory colors and equipment along with a total suggested retail price of $55,995 when new.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and lists history and registrations in New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania. A manufacturer’s recall related to the passenger-side airbag is noted in 2020.

title: 2JZ-GTE–Powered 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe has been fitted with a 3.0-liter Toyota 2JZ-GTE inline-six and a BMW six-speed manual gearbox. The engine has been converted to a single-turbocharger system, and equipment includes a front-mount intercooler, a custom exhaust system, a front strut tower brace, and a PureTech rear X brace. The car is finished in Jet Black over Black Nappa leather, and BMW features include a limited-slip differential, the Competition Package, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2022 and they report that the fluids were changed in preparation for the sale. This Toyota-powered BMW is now offered at no reserve in California with a clean Massachusetts title.

The car is finished in Jet Black and features Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The selling dealer states that the paint was graphene coated in preparation for the sale. The Carfax report notes that the car was involved in a rear-end collision in 2013 and a single-vehicle collision in 2015. Close-up photos of the body panels, glass, and lenses can be viewed in the gallery.

Staggered-width 19″ M cross-spoke wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 275/30 rear Hankook Ventus V12 evo² tires. The Competition Package added a quicker-ratio steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors than the standard M3.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, navigation, driver-seat position memory settings, and Harman Kardon audio. The Competition Package added Alcantara trim to the handbrake as well as Alu Tec aluminum trim to the dashboard and door panels.

The steering wheel has been retrimmed in microsuede with M-color stitching, and instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 160k miles.

The 3.0L Toyota 2JZ-GTE was installed using TireDeathRacing adapter mounts and a Wiring Specialties wiring harness. It has been fitted with a single BorgWarner turbocharger, exhaust headers, a RadiumAuto fuel rail, and a front-mount intercooler. The selling dealer reports that the fluids were changed in preparation for the sale.

Originally an SMG model, the car was fitted with a BMW six-speed manual transmission using a PMC Motorsport Stage 1 adaptor and clutch kit as well as Condor Speed Shop transmission mounts. The BMW limited-slip differential remains in place, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2020. The selling dealer notes that the underside was dry-ice blasted in preparation for sale.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned accidents and lists history in Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York.
The car cannot pass a California emissions test and cannot be sold to an in-state private-party buyer.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2L inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car was optioned without a sunroof, and additional equipment includes BBS CH-R wheels, Supersprint exhaust components, manually adjustable front sport seats, xenon headlights, an aftermarket steering wheel, a Nakamichi stereo head unit, a HiFi sound system, and automatic climate control. Modifications under previous ownership included the installation of Bilstein PSS10 coilovers and Ground Control camber plates along with reinforcing the front and rear subframes. The car remained registered in California until it was sold on BaT in July 2019, and it was subsequently acquired by the current owner in December 2022. This E46 M3 has 101k miles and is now offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of the owner with a Carfax report and a clean Washington title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and exterior equipment includes Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, LED taillights, tinted windows, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists damage to the rear of the vehicle in February 2020, damage to the left side in February 2021, and damage to the front of the vehicle in June 2022. The report indicates that the car was declared a “total loss”  by an insurance company in August 2022. A color variation is visible in the right-front fender, and the seller reports that the rear bumper cover has been repainted.

The staggered-width BBS CH-R wheels are finished in satin black and are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Modifications between 2016 and 2017 included the installation of Bilstein PSS10 adjustable coilovers, Ground Control camber plates, and rear camber arms.

The cabin features manually adjustable front sport seats upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a Nakamichi stereo head unit, and a HiFi sound system. The seller reports that the headliner was replaced in February 2023. Wear is noted on the left-front seating surfaces and on the door in front of the shifter.

An aftermarket carbon-fiber and microsuede-trimmed steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles. Aftermarket carbon-fiber instrument cluster trim has been installed.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque and is equipped with Supersprint exhaust components. An aluminum radiator and urethane engine mounts were installed and the thermostat, water pump, and radiator hoses were replaced in 2017.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A front subframe reinforcement kit and replacement transmission mounts were installed in 2016, and service in 2017 included replacing the driveshaft flex disc along with repairing and reinforcing the rear subframe.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage reports and lists registration history in California and Washington.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the E46 BMW M3 coupe when it was new? Click here to check out their December 2001 First Drive.

title: 45k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible is finished in white over black leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 18″ wheels, a power-operated black soft top, xenon headlights, fog lights, automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The car was first delivered to Murray Motor Imports in Denver, Colorado, and spent much of its life in the state before it was acquired by the seller in September 2019 and relocated to Utah in October 2021. This E46 M3 has 46k miles and is now offered in Utah with a window sticker, service records, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White (300) and equipped with a power-operated black soft top, xenon headlights, fog lights, and fender vents. The front lip was touched up in preparation for the sale, and the seller states that there are scratches on the driver’s door and lower portion of the front air dam as well as a crack on the driver-side fog lamp, all pictured in the gallery below.

Staggered-width 18″ M Double Spoke wheels are wrapped in 225/45 from and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires, which were mounted in January 2019. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated anti-lock disc brakes.

The power-adjustable front seats and rear bench are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and equipment includes cruise control, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo with a Harman Kardon audio system. An F10 M5-style illuminated shift knob and boot were installed under current ownership. The driver-side door lock actuator was replaced in October 2017, and recalls related to the airbags were completed in 2015 and 2017. The seller states that the C-pillar covers for the convertible top were replaced in preparation for the sale, and wear on the passenger-side roof liner is noted by the seller. A replacement set of floor mats is included in the sale.

The multifunction steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 46k miles, approximately 2k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The valve cover gaskets and PCV valve were replaced in 2019, and a warranty repair related to the rod bearings was performed in July 2005.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underbody are presented in the gallery.
The window sticker lists colors, standard and optional equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $56,420.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Colorado, California, and Utah.
